Reviews.Content: We're just back from a whirlwind trip to Southern California and stayed here our first night. This was our "splurge" hotel for the trip. We wanted to do all of the touristy things in Hollywood without having to worry about what neighborhood we were staying in with 2 kids. In a word, this place was FABULOUS! The location cannot be beat, and was the main reason we chose it - nowhere else can you go down the elevator and be at the Kodak Theater and right in the heart of Hollywood and Highland. My advice when booking is to do your research - We booked a package that included parking and breakfast at Twist, which was an expansive buffet since it was a Sunday morning, for only $30 more than the AAA rate. The parking alone made the package worth it and the breakfast was delicious. The room was clean and had a "city view" which if you looked to the left included the Hollywood Hills and the Hollywood sign. The beds and pillows were very comfy, and the room was bigger than I would have expected it to be for a hotel in the heart of the city. Now lets face it - we are a suburban family that included 2 kids vacationing in the heart of Hollywood, and I was a little concerned about how comfortable I would feel staying in the heart of glamorous Hollywood. The staff there is either very well trained, or are just really nice people - from the front desk to the valet guys they could not have been any nicer, more helpful, or pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “lovely!”
Reviews.Author: 27emzy57
Reviews.Content: Really like this hotel it was clean and smart and in a fantastic location for shops, restaurants, bars and the tourist bus tours. would def stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly very very good”
Reviews.Author: jennyfury
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in October 2011 for a work conference. I got a great deal and was surprised at how spacious and clean the room and bathroom were, and how well stocked the mini bar was. The bed was huge and very comfortable and the TV was also large. I had a view of the hollywood hills which was so great, it made all the difference. I found the staff very hospitable and although i didnt eat at the cafe, i heard that Blue Ribbon were setting the menu and i like Blue Ribbon menu's. The room had a bath, it was small but it was welcome after 3 previous hotels in NYC did not have them. Its not the most flash hotel, the corridor carpet made me feel like i was in Vegas, but i found it pretty faultless at on the things that really count. Also the location was right in the heart of Hollywood and next to a shopping centre to easy to get a quick retail fix. I recommend Loteria for Mexican dinner which is just down the road. I haven't stayed anywhere else in LA so cant give a comparison, but i would stay here again definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced hotel that has good location in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: abitoheaven
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in November 2011 for a conference. My gripe was that internet access was $12.95 per day and staying multiple nights, that adds up. I stayed at the Holiday Inn at Lax the night before with larger room and free wifi for less than half the price I paid here. The check in process was smooth and they were able to let me check in early at 11 am instead of 4 pm. The lady at the desk was nice and smiled. The bell man was prompt in storing my bags and getting them on the first day. Overall, the staff was friendly and helpful. The location is really what you are paying for at this hotel with the walk of fame with the stars a block away from the hotel. My room had a view of the Hollywood sign on the 16th floor. It has shopping mall right outside and the Cirque de solie Iris right next door. So, great location! I was less impressed by the size of the room but it has all the comforts that I would expect from the hotel. Comfy bed, soft pillows. I was not impressed by the room since there was a dirty patch on the carpet that seemed like it was not cleaned and there was some funky green stuff growing on the right sink handle. I really didn't like the eco save toliets- maybe because I'm used to the lever to push down to flush instead of a button to press down. It didn't flush very well unless you press the button all the way down. The pool is smaller than it looks in the pictures. I didn't really get to enjoy the pool because I was busy with the conference. LA is colder than I thought it would be this time of year with lows in the 40s. The pool was nice that it was heated but still too cold to enjoy since it was outside. The food at the conference was good- I loved their desserts and their cheese snacks. The sandwiches were not as impressive. I liked their chimes as they reminded participants to go back to the sessions. Temperature was comfortable at the conference. Overall, conference services were good. (except lack of internet) I had the bell man store my bags again because the conference did not end until 5 pm and check out is at 11 am. It took me 20 min to get the bellman to get my bags. A lady who worked at the hotel kept on telling me it would a few more minutes because they were busy. The two bellman mainly ignored me until I was able to flag one of them down and request he get my bag. The only one good thing was that there were free M&Ms near the bell station to calm my ire. Also for your info, taxi from hotel to lax runs around $60 with tip. You may be better off doing the flat rates if you go at traffic times. There is lots of traffic in LA.... (traffic at 6:30 am when I arrived at hotel!)

Reviews.Title: “A great location to see Hollywood etc but a bit expensive.”
Reviews.Author: petsaloz
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night in transit back to Australia. We have not stayed in Los Angeles on previous trips into and out of USA and we were right to avoid it. Hollywood is a bit of a dump overall! The hotel is very well placed to see the sights and is a well appointed and modern hotel. It seems to be oriented towards business guests rather than tourists. There were several conferences on when we stayed. The rooms are good with sufficient space and the facilities satisfactory. There is no fridge (mini bar occupies this space and it is a "move it and you own it" version). A fridge is available at request and additional cost. The cost issues were the negative. WiFi was $12.95 per 24 hr period. This is mean when the room price is already up there! However, our cost was refunded following my objection. The staff were mixed in performance. Our initial reaction was very negative when the driveway attendant slammed the shuttle bus door in my wife's face. No help with luggage or any assistance through the door! A similar reaction to the front counter person who was detached and, I felt, a bit officious. I did not mention the driveway incident as I felt it would be a wasted complaint. Other staff were excellent. The Navigator counter staff were pleasant and very helpful and the front counter person on checkout was equally pleasant and concerned about our experience. Unfortunately she received the complaint about earlier poor performance and the WiFi charge. She responded well. We left our bags after checkout and collected them later when heading for the airport. Again a good experience with helpful staff. Maybe the only poorly trained staff were working when we arrived! Unlikely to return to Los Angeles but would consider this hotel if the situation arises. Not the best introduction to Marriott Rewards Program.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be deceived!”
Reviews.Author: fattmatt08atrcs
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a long term business trip. At first I was impressed by the fancy look of the building. Upon checking in, they place a $500 hold on your card, not telling you how much it is going to be. We get to the room only to find that the internet access that was supposed to be part of our package is something like $12 a day! I was there two weeks and am enrolled in online classes. This would have taken a vast amount of money paying by day. After two conversations with management, I was told both times that they would waive the charges since I was staying long term. The first time, the code I was given lasted only one day. The second time, it was for good, but they charged me for it!!!!! Everyone I talked to at the front desk and management were completely rude! Also, the breakfast that was supposed to be included, something like $8 a meal. There was a charge for using the computers in the business center as well. This place is not worth the money or the time!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good :)”
Reviews.Author: worldtour2000
Reviews.Content: Pretty good experience staying here. I was in town for a conference, though, which took up the majority of my time, so I can't really evaluate the hotel independently. I'll just say that the hotel was modern, clean, and comfortable, and there were no noticeable issues. I think you'll be fine if you stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Second time lucky”
Reviews.Author: Julie S
Reviews.Content: After a bad experience booking a 2-star hotel we found this one by luck: the guy in the airport shuttle had got off there and we were impressed with the service stright away. Valets and other hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are quiet and very clean. Great bed linen and comfy mattress. The hotel navigator very helpful and lknowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great”
Reviews.Author: czardas
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay and booked purely for location. The hotel is ok but I have two gripes, the first is that I can't see why you get charged for wifi when paying these rates, when Starbucks can offer free wifi. This hotel is $12.95 for 24 hours. The other is that if you want to watch tv, then you will be charged and there aren't any free channels besides a lame travel promotion channel. Catching up with world news is impossible, as there aren't any news channels on offer, charged or otherwise. I prefer booking a city view room, why pay extra for the sign when you can see it for photos at the mall? We checked in early and knew we wouldn't get our rooms, so we instructed them we would return at 4pm, when we finally came back at 6pm, they still didn't have our rooms ready. Not too happy about that, as I had booked connecting rooms and ended up with rooms apart.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, some staff nice but others rude and unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: TimBrooksbank
Reviews.Content: I was here for a conference, the rooms are ok, spacious and pleasant but nothing special given the price. Bar is hideously expensive but service good and friendly. The bad points - enormous walk with bags from the parking garage. Rude and unhelpful staff outside front door and gormless on front desk. This is my second year staying at this hotel, would I go back? Maybe if I had to for a conference, but not by choice.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Ali24
Reviews.Content: We thought when we booked this hotel that it would be in a great location - and it is if you want to be in a very busy, mad, noisy crazy part of town that is like that 24 hours a day! But we didnt - so after 3 days we moved hotel! However the views of the Hollywood sign are cute and it is right in a shoppping mall with food outlets and great shops and is right on the Hollywood walk of fame and next to the Kodak Theatre - but once you have seen them its enough. So good for a 2 - 3 days stay but that it. The bathrooms need updating and were poor - I like a shower cubicle and dont expect to have to stand in a bath with a shower curtain and water spraying on the floor in a modern city like LA and in a good chain like the Renaissance. But the staff were nice and helpful. However when we arrived I did have to dust the room myself as the cleaner was not tall enough to clean the pictures on the wall and they were thick with dust, which wasnt very pleasant! So I asked her for a cloth and did it myself!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: kalenacole
Reviews.Content: I stayed in September for a combo work/Birthday weekend. The Renaissance is pricey, but an excellent hotel that is right next to Hollywood and Highland and the Kodak Theatre. You walk out one door and your in Hollywood & Highland and multi-level outdoor mall/trendy tourist spot in Hollywood. It's also a part of the Kodak Theatre (The Oscars & now Cirque's Iris). While there we took advantage of Spa Luce. Comfortable and relaxing in a cave like setting. On Sunday morning we went to Twist, the hotel restaurant where they host the Jazz Sunday Brunch. Wonderful music and good food. Great experience in Hollywood (and that's from a former resident).

Reviews.Title: “Overall Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: dmishesq
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this property for an awards event that I was attending. Stayed on the "concierge" level and assumed that there was a lounge or some other benefit to staying on that floor. Other than having to insert a key into the elevator in order to get to the floor, I could not ascertain any difference for the extra nightly fee that I paid. The hotel is in a great location and the service was very attentive and professional. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mlesznar
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful! The location is awesome - within walking distance to a lot of the main attractions of Hollywood. The staff is very friendly and helpful. They answered all of our questions regarding sightseeing, etc. There is a "mall" attached to the hotel, and plenty of places to choose from to eat while staying at the hotel. The room was clean and spacious - we could see the famous Hollywood sign from our hotel. The rooftop pool was nice as well. We would stay here again if visiting Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Centre of it all...”
Reviews.Author: florriemay06
Reviews.Content: This is a big corporate hotel but very pleasant despite that. It really is right in the centre of everything in Hollywood, something we needed as we were here for only two nights (27 and 28 September). The room was plenty big enough with a very comfy bed, didn't realise what a great view we had of the Hollywood sign until the mist cleared later in the day! Also a mention must be made of the wonderful buffet breakfast on offer. Masses of choice with a chef ready to cook your eggs any which way you desire, plus the best cup of tea I've ever had in the USA, all in all a great start to any day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: sun4oz
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on first leg of USA trip. Arrived at the hotel before 9am and they gave us a room staright away which we were very thankful for after travelling for 14 hours. You could see the Hollywood sign from our room which the kids loved.The room was perfect for what we needed. Central location for what we were doing. Breakfast was really good as it set us up for the whole day. Loved the shops and restauants around the Highland Centre. Great way to just spend an evening after sightseeing during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: babygemini
Reviews.Content: why we recommend this hotel. First, for the good and accessible location. it's just beside the kodak and Chinese theater, hollywood walk of fame, mall, restaurants, subway ride to universal studios.Second, they have a cozy and comfortable lobby , they even have a refreshing welcome fusion drink! Third, they have excellent service. we even got a free upgrade to a suite and a fruit basket to make our honeymoon more memorable! =) Fourth, the rooms are well maintained, so nice with a breathtaking view especially at night. =) Fifth, the price is reasonable =) thank you for a wonderful experience! =)

Reviews.Title: “Good Hollywood location”
Reviews.Author: MC-7
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Hollywood and having enjoyed the location previously, this time we chose the Renaissance. The room itself was quite nice, but the bathroom was very old and outdated and really should be upgraded. This isn't really a hotel for a lengthy stay because it is your typical business-oriented hotel. The location was great, being connected to the Hollywood Highland Centre which is great for shopping and casual restaurants. Hollywood Boulevard is only a minute away, so too is the Metro for easy access to Universal Studios. This hotel is fine if you want a couple of days to see the really touristy spots of LA, but there are probably cheaper options in the vicinity. If you want a relaxing break in a not so busy area, head for Santa Monica instead.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood in a Minute”
Reviews.Author: Deborahsister
Reviews.Content: My only disappointment was that we did not get the Hollywood hills view that we requested - they had over-sold those rooms. Other than that, all was really great. We had water issues the first day but they fixed it right away. Breakfast at Twist was yummy, best huevos rancheros ever. We didn't use the pool or spa, too busy seeing the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon hotel - stop 6”
Reviews.Author: Fats25
Reviews.Content: Firstly a review about LA. We were told before we went that LA was not that great, but we wanted to see it, and gave ourselves two nights, and two days here. We ended up staying in one of the nights, and left early on the 2nd day. West Hollywood/Sunset Bvld is really like a rubbish Leicester Square. Very touristy (as expected), but even within this, not much to see. LA seems very spread out, and I suspect you need to know where to go. Unlike other places we stayed, where there were lots of bars and restaurants in a small area, outside of the tacky tourist spots, there was no congregation of areas to go. I suspect a bit like London you need to know where to go. So onto the hotel. Not much really to write for me here. We have between us stayed in lots of Marriott hotels over the years, and actually redeemed points to stay here, rather than spend on another couple of nights accomodation. We considered 3 nights here, but so glad we decided to spend a night at Hermosa Beach (read other review). It was standard Marriott fare. Clean, large, and comfortable. Points I can add:- Check in lady was very polite, and helpful. Bell boys/car valet were very polite and helpful Concierge did not seem to know much more than a good bar/restaurant within the local area despite us being willing to travel further to find something we were looking for. Car parking was $10 a day, or over triple that for valet. Park the car yourself - is cheaper and not very difficult! There are three platforms to take a photo of the Hollywood sign from - in the outdoor part of the shopping complex. Marriott guests can go to the third floor, but are not allowed to stand on the walkway to take a photo, they are only allowed to access the Spa and Pool (which looked nice, but we did not use). No idea if this is Marriott or building management stopping you, but seemed a bit petty. A bottle of water from your room was $6.50 Nothing wrong with the hotel, it is Standard Marriott fare. It just felt too much like a business trip to me, and nothing special. If you were there on business in West Hollywood, and did not fancy doing much in the evening is worth a 4 rating. For a holiday/honeymoon - I would look for an alternative area in LA, and just visit here for a morning to do the tourist bits.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for visiting Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: ChrisH3040
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located at the Hollywood and Highland shopping center, in the same area as the Kodak theater (where Iris is currently playing) and Graumann's Chinese theater. It makes an ideal location for visitors who are interested in staying near the heart of Hollywood. Many attractions are within walking distance. It was nice to arrive and have our car valet parked (for a fee) and not need it again until check out. The hotel itself is very clean and modern. It seems that many people stay overnight while seeing Cirque du Soleil's Iris. The rooms away from the elevators were quiet and some have views of the famous Hollywood sign. A breakfast buffet is offered for $24 per person.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Ozlover1023
Reviews.Content: We have stayed on the executive floor for two nights. As the window front was all glass we had a magnificant view over Hollywood. Awesome! The room was very spacy, nice and clean. The location is perfectly close to everything around Hollywood: Walk of fame (shocking worn down - apparently always has been) Hollywood, Sunset Blvd, Beverly Hills and the Universal Studios. It is quite a big place but nevertheless the service is very good. There is a very nice pool area we did not use though. Overall we can really recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ElectronicHolland
Reviews.Content: The location is simply excellent and cannot be better in Hollywood. Rooms are spacious and comfortable and there are some great restaurants next door in the Hollywood & Highland Center. Attractions are all well within range and due to public transport opportunities affordable to get there. The only thing these hotels should change is to start offering free Wifi to its hotel guests. It's unbelievable that you do not get this service for the money you have to pay for a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: travellingisus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights as part of our 3 week holiday to the US. We chose this hotel as we wanted to be in the heart of Hollywood and not in downtown LA or Beverley Hills. We were not disappointed, we stayed in an executive room which was huge along with a great view of the famous Hollywood sign on the hill. The hotels location is next door to the Hollywood Highlands shopping centre where you can shop and choose from an array of dining options. The heated swimming pool is great and has private cabanas, nice area to chill out. We would choose this hotel again for the location, clean and big rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay for a native or tourist!”
Reviews.Author: Next3Planned
Reviews.Content: Since I'm a native California, I haven't visited many of the traditional tourist spots in Hollywood. This hotel is an incredible location if you want to see a lot of famous spots in a short amount of time. I live in San Diego and stayed here for 2 days and still felt like I was on vacation. The location is entertaining, but you still feel very safe if you are squemish about "LA." We had tickets to an event at the Hollywood Bowl and were able to walk there from the hotel, which saved us a lot of money. It is always helpful to be attached to a huge shopping and dining shopping center. I am still gushing about our getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic weekend”
Reviews.Author: Fifegal
Reviews.Content: Delightful hotel. Being adjacent to the Kodak Theatre (Cirque de Soleil's "Iris" is there at the the moment, which is brilliant) makes it a perfect choice for a fun weekend getaway. The rooms on the upper floors have fabulous views of LA and are very comfortable. My Mother is in a wheelchair and staff could not have been kinder or more helpful. We look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: n0rwegians
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location. Walk of fame, Kodak Theater, Chinese Theater super close. You can see the Hollywood sign from the hotel. Very nice rooms- clean, spacious, and comfortable. Modern style. The hotel lies in the same building as a shoppingcenter, so it's no problem finding food and other things. The pool is not extremely big, but there is not so many people, so it is big enough. I didn't try the spa, but it looked OK. You don't have to wait long for an elevator either, because they were not crowdy. Next time I go to Hollywood, I will definately stay here again :)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing property, fun lounge, friendly staff, great vibe!”
Reviews.Author: SoCalSiren
Reviews.Content: In the heart of Hollywood, walking distance to nearly everything. Very modern, fun lounge, beautiful views, and clean, quiet rooms. Room service was surprisingly speedy, and staff, attendants were beyond friendly, helpful, and attentive. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VM68
Reviews.Content: I think that this is an ideal place if you are looking to stay in Hollywood. You are situated right on the Highland Centre which is where the Kodak Theatre is. There are plenty of shops and resturants within this complex and would recommened you eat at The Grill, little pricey but the food is so good. There is live entertainment most nights in the hotel bar and the staff are very friendly. The pool is a good size and each time we wanted to lay out we were always able to get a sun lounger.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Hollywood without a doubt!”
Reviews.Author: singh15king
Reviews.Content: Myself and three other guests stayed at this hotel from Mon 12th Sep - 15th Sep 2011. Walked in with a great a very friendly reception and they even gave us a third bed in the room for free!!! Which definitely put a smile on our faces. The hotels facilities such as the pool and gym were amazing also as it wasn't to busy at all. The hotel actually integrates with a shopping centre with clothes shops, restaurants, and even a cinema. As for location it isn't too bad if you have your own rental if your looking to go and see the Hollywood sign up close. But for the Hollywood walk of Fame it is literally next to your hotel with all the hustle and bustle which is nice too as you would expect it. Great room, very comfortable stay and brilliant staff would definitely come back again any time.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Hollywood!!!”
Reviews.Author: somy_forever
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance is in the heart of Hollywood, close to all the main Hollywood Blvd attractions and only a $14.00 taxi ride to Universal Studios. Ask for higher floor for a view of the Hollywood sign. The door men are very friendly and always around to help with any questions!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location!”
Reviews.Author: ahmlaw
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in last November 2010 seemed newly renovated, had modern furnishings, very comfortable, with a great view of Hollywood, including a view of the Hollywood sign on a clear day! If you want to be just a 3-minute walk to all of Hollywood’s famous attractions, this is the place to stay. Location, location, location: THAT is the Renaissance. One of the best located hotels in the Hollywood area. A very good breakfast spread, as well, to start you off on a long day touring the sights. One negative point: it was unfortunate that the renovations did not extend to the bathroom, which had old fixtures, and cheap, stained tiles. The bathroom could use a major face-lift, as it jarred with the modern feel of the bedroom area. But if just for the location? We would definitely stay here on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel, would stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: W_SimonP
Reviews.Content: We stayed in LA for for four nights as the last part of our honeymoon trip. The location of the hotel is very good and easily accessible from the airport with a hire car. Our room was a deluxe room with a view of the Hollywood sign which was nice. Room was adequate with a very comfortable bed and good TV. We needed to use the 'complimentary business centre' whilst we were there to access the internet which we assumed from the literature in our room was free. However be warned when they say 'complimentary' it means your room key gets you access to the room, that is it. However the internet charges were reasonable so we spent around 5mins checking out some areas in LA online that we were going to visit. Upon logging off we were charged $199 for the session!!! We immediately reported this to reception who gave the attitude that they didn't really care and it wasn't there problem as the internet is provided by a third party and they have nothing to do with it. We spent the rest of our holiday spending some time each day trying to rectify this problem. Numerous visits to the hotel reception seemed pointless as no one seemed to care. In the end the whole problem was left for us to sort out and we both found the attitude and service from the hotel staff pretty disgusting for a top end hotel. We had stayed at three other hotels leading up to this one as part of our trip and couldn't fault any of them. In particular the service we received. I would never stay at this hotel again purely based on this experience. When you are on holiday/honeymoon something like this is disappointing and you don't expect it to happen. Apart from the hotel we enjoyed LA. Would highly reccommend a trip to Porto's Bakery, there are about three in LA, you will be amazed!!! Also visit Griffith Observatory for the best views of the Hollywood sign and if you are interested in space/stars etc the observatory is brilliant. Finally I would say get a hire car for getting around, it was invaluable. Also visit Santa Monica, very nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Laurel113
Reviews.Content: This hotel could not be in a better location. Easy walking distance to everything Hollywood. The staff is super friendly and helpful and the room was HUGE! We were scheduled to arrive on Friday and stay 3 nights. However, our drive down from San Simeon took some scenic detours and we decided to spend Friday night in Santa Barbara. Called the hotel and they were very nice, no problem, see you tomorrow. Arrived around 1 on Saturday. Reservation was for standard room with 2 queen beds and a roll away. I am a silver Marriott member and asked for upgrade. They said we could have larger room or Hollywood sign view. My sister and I debated for a few minutes and then the lady said, if you don't mind waiting we can get you both. We were fine with that so we went out to see some sights and came back a few hours. 13th floor room with amazing view of Hollywood sign and it was HUGE!!! We had 1 king bed and a roll away. The bathoom was equally huge, with a dressing area and a shower/toilet area. This was perfect for 3 ladies traveling together. The concierge was very friendly and helpful when we asked for a tour suggestion. We ended up on 2 hour, small, open top Hollywood sign/Beverly Hills/star's homes tour which was great! Also, the valet parkers were very nice, helpful and prompt. Attached to the hotel is a Mall which has lots of shopping and restaurants. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location for Kodak Theatre”
Reviews.Author: travelernottourist
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Our room had a great view and was contemporary yet comfortable. It was nice to be able to walk from the hotel to the shopping area connected with Kodak. Lively atmosphere in bar and lots of tourists from around the world staying at this hotel which was interesting. Pool area is somewhat small so there was a bit of angling to get two lounge chairs together. Convenient cafe/bar nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it”
Reviews.Author: David_LGW
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 6th Sept to 13th Sept. Clean modern hotel. Polite staff, clean room. Only used the Twist Restaurant once (for breakfast), tasty food. Had room service when we arrived after a long flight from Gatwick. Fast service, hot food, reasonably priced. Excellent view (could see the Hollywood sign). Close to all tourist locations.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Location”
Reviews.Author: HaggisnNeeps
Reviews.Content: This hotel really is amazing.Its bang in the heart of Hollywood. We had a fabulous room overlooking the Hollywood sign and that alone was just fantastic! Staff are lovely and room was spotless. We were out from first thing in the morning to last thing at night so never eat at the hotel but we did use the pool. That pool is lovely! I have lovely photos of my son at the edge of the pool with the Hollywood sign just above it - amazing! We were going onto a cruise afterwards and rather than pay the OTT taxi fare - we paid $6 for an all day transport ticket. Boarded the train two mins away from the hotel - changed twice - and it was soooooooooooo easy!! Felt perfectly safe and was great to see some of the views en route as well - saved us a lot of money. When we arrived near Long Beach it was then a free bus that took us straight to the ship!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel if you have to stay in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: DrTToronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property because my husband had a conference there. The property itself is pretty nice. Main features reviewed below: Rooms - good size with comfy bed. In room mini-bar fridge has a small area for your own items (a good idea since everything in it is expensive!) Amenities - no free in-room Wifi which seems to be a theme in this area. Why they continue to get away with it when this is becoming a basic requirement escapes me. The outdoor pool area is lovely. It was never that busy during the weekdays while I was there. I didn't use the spa, but apparently it's highly rated. If you get a room on the club floor (19th), there is included breakfast and snacks. Service - very friendly, from front desk to bell staff to housekeeping. Room cards kept getting deactivated which was annoying. Location - steps from Hollywood Blvd (Kodak Theatre, Chinese theatre, etc) if you are going to see a show or something. Other than that, Hollywood isn't somewhere that I would personally choose to stay as there isn't much around, and it's kind of kitschy. And if you didn't know LA like me before getting here, getting around this city is a bit of a nightmare because of traffic. Taxis are generally expensive. I didn't try transit because I was travelling with a stroller. Food - ordered room service once. Nothing special, although it's called Wolfgang Puck catering. Kino sushi on Hollywood Blvd was pretty good though!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vickie6233
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful experience in this hotel. They accommodated our request for an early check in since we were going to the theater. Our room was beautiful and looked out of huge windows to a view of Hollywood and downtown Los Angeles. It was very convenient to the Kodak Theater and shopping complex which is right next door and can be accessed right from the Mezzanine floor of the hotel. We were surprised by a special treat awaiting us since I mentioned that it was my husband's birthday. I received two e mails from the hotel before our arrival asking if there were any special arrangements that I would like to request. Everyone was very helpful. Our room was spacious and well appointed. We had breakfast in their dining room where the servings were VERY generous!!! In all it was a lovely stay. We were even allowed a late check out and so we enjoyed the pool too!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel because of the location....”
Reviews.Author: mnewshan
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to all major attractions. Concierge is the only thing that I can find fault with as they really werent as knowledgeable as most. Gym was great and also had access to the concierge lounge.......snacks and appetizers each evening were good as the breakfast was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Spend a little money on towels...”
Reviews.Author: ChrisTocino
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Hollywood is not a bad conference hotel. It has a nice a pool area, a decent restaurant, and pretty good rooms with nice views. The service is also pretty good. And yet, over and over again, I heard conference attendees talk about one thing: the towels. It is a small thing, I know, but everyone seemed to notice the fact that each room had only two very worn towels. Come on guys. For $280 a night, you could afford placing four relatively new towels in each room. Yes, it is true that people will not generally notice the plush towels that you have purchased for your hotel. But if you fail to provide them, people will notice.

Reviews.Title: “An improvement for the area”
Reviews.Author: kph
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night and it was really worthwhile. The rooms are fantastic and executive rooms, huge! You are right next to Highland Shopping, Kodak Theatre, Grauman's Chinese Theatre -- Hollywood at it's best! We would easily stay again. Staff are not up to par with other Renaissance hotels, but it's LA. Close also to the Japanese restaurant with a phenomenal view over Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Good Standard Hotel with excellent large rooms……”
Reviews.Author: Huglum
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night after landing at LAX mid-afternoon before travelling next day to Yosemite National Park. The Hotel although slightly pricey for a 4 star Hotel is a good base in Hollywood. The room we had was a large suite room which was pleasant with a nice view of the Hollywood Sign and hills. The bed was very comfy and the room had all the amenities that you would expect from a Marriott Group chain hotel. The hotel was and is a very busy mainly due to its proximity to Central Hollywood and therefore a magnet for tourists. There was valet car parking available and not to expensive although one of the drivers did scrape the driver side front bumper corner on our rental car. Not a huge issue as we had full insurance cover but was slightly disappointed that the car http://c1.tacdn.com/img2/tamgfooter/mobile/ftrMobile.pnghttp://c1.tacdn.com/img2/tamgfooter/mobile/ftrMobile.pngparking team did not mention this until we noticed after leaving http://c1.tacdn.com/img2/tamgfooter/mobile/ftrMobile.pngthe Hotel. We did not use the pool facility or other leisure facilities at the hotel so therefore unable to comment but in general was pleased with the level of service and in particular the reception staff who even with such a busy volume of guests to process were very polite and welcoming. All in all a good experience and would stay again mainly due to the room comfort factor……

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great service, but expensive.”
Reviews.Author: BertDC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance for a recent conference. The property is in the heart of Hollywood and attached to an outdoor mall close to Grauman's Chinese Theater. The service was fantastic. Everyone was very friendly. The valets cleaned my car window and offered me bottled water when I was checking out. I paid a little extra for late check-out, and the front desk added two additional hours complementary. The room was very nice, and I had a great view of the Hollywood sign. I'd definitely recommend this hotel. My only caution might be expense: I paid about $350, including one night, late check out, and valet service. Normally I would seek cheaper options, but it's a nice splurge. The Hollywood neighborhood itself is still run down and a bit seedy, although there has been recent contruction (like the outdoor mall) to improve the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: PanaramaRidgeCouple
Reviews.Content: We were here for conference. The room price was a liitle high for a conference but the room was large, had a very comfortable king size bed and was well equipped for my electronics. The view was stunning, from the hollywood sign in one direction to the downtown sky line in the other. It is close to the Kodak Theater, Grohman's Chinese and Mels diner along with quite a number of entertainment museums. The only downside was the poor quality of the pillows and the fact that they charge so much for Internet access.

Reviews.Title: “All the comforts of home and more.”
Reviews.Author: onetheroad
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Renaissance from September 4-6 and found everything to be A1. The staff was very attentive, didn't eat any meals on the premises so can't comment on that, but there is a great coffee shop in the lobby. If you are driving in as we did, there is a $29 per day valet fee - but let me add I think you can also self park (although I'm not sure where the self-park lot is) for less. Just a note about driving in LA, it is as crowded as people say, very crowded, very, very crowded - and sometimes it doesn't move at all. It was a lovely hotel, with big, comfortable delicious beds that make you want to order one as soon as you get home! For comfort you can't beat a Marriott Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “THE PERFECT HOTEL! FEEL LIKE A *HOLLYWOOD* CELEB!”
Reviews.Author: NoirTraveler
Reviews.Content: -As soon as I pulled up to the Hotel I was IMMEDIATELY treated like a "KING". The valet drivers open your car door as you arrive & from then? they go above & beyond for there tip *$* (which they deserved). The Hotel lobby has a Five Star top $helf Bar to the right as soon as you walk-in. The hotel lobby has beautiful art decor which lets you know that this is NOT your AVERAGE hotel. My hotel suite had an AWESOME view of the HOLLYWOOD sign! the room itself is luxurious with a flat-screen HDTV, comfortable bed, nice furniture and a sexy bathroom. The ROOFTOP *HEATED* yes *HEATED* pool! was also a major PLUS for the hotel! The pool area also had a TOP $helf bar soo you can drink alcohol & enjoy the view. The pool area also had private cabanas that was open to anyone to sneak away in ;) The ONLY thing this hotel was missing which makes made give it a *4 Star rating* is that it did NOT have a HOT TUB/JACUZZI :( ...OVERALL this Hotel is your best bet to stay at in Hollywood. Its located in the center of it all! I'm defintely returning back to this romantic, classy, and luxurious hotel anytime I visit Hollywood. :)

Reviews.Title: “Next to everything”
Reviews.Author: bremt06
Reviews.Content: This hotel is steps from the Kodak Theatre, Muddam Toussads, Grauman's Chinese Theatre, Walk of Fame, Ripley's Believe it or Not, and much more! We only needed a taxi to get to the Jay Leno show 15 min away! Fitness room looked top notch. Only things that annoyed me were the internet charges, expensive breakfast buffet and steep daily parking charge -but hey its vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Dawn_MK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last year and was looking forward to the hotel stay. We splashed out a little more than normal to stay here and boy are we glad we did! Staff were so lovely they even gave us a room upgrade - must of been the polite British accent! Room was lovely and over looked the Hollywood sign. The concierge helped us book our trips to make the most of our stay. The pool area was really relaxing and plenty of sunbeds, great for a few chilled out hours. Location was great for what we wanted. A great choice of shops and restaurants literally 2 minutes walk. I recommend California pizza kitchen, they did some amazing salads. Hotel was also a great place to explore more of LA. Not to far from Universal Studios, Santa Monica or the Hollywood Hills. I would recommend this hotel and stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed every minute of our stay.........”
Reviews.Author: JB1962
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Renaissance before, albeit 5 years ago and chose it once more due to the location. Happy to say we were just as pleased this time round with our choice Arrived at the hotel just after 6.00pm after a flight across the US from New York The Good Check-in > asked for a high-floor room with a view of the Hollywood sign and Downtown and got it straight away The Room - Looked like it had just been re-fitted, clean, modern and very comfortable The Bed - Very comfortable The View - Spectacular The Pool - Great little oasis when you fancy some relaxation time The Staff - All very helpful and friendly The Lifts - No wait at all even at peak times Coffee - Nice to have a coffee machine in the room The Location - Fantastic - 3 minute walk from the Chinese Theatre, shops, restaurants and red line metro The Bad....... Thought long and hard about this........ Nothing Would stay here again without any hesitation

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: ladcol
Reviews.Content: In the middle of a lot of action, short walk to many resturants, shops and sites. Clean, big rooms, with good beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Visiting LA and Hollywood!”
Reviews.Author: wywk
Reviews.Content: We only had 3 days in LA and wanted to make the most of it...we picked this hotel based on its location and reviews I read on here. And I am glad that we did! We went on a few hop on/off tours which starts from the Chinese theatre and this hotel is only 2 mins walk away! It is right on Hollywood Blvd which was very convenient for us. We also took a taxi to The Grove and it was only about 15mins away and taxi was not too expensive. The room was very nice and spacious, with 2 double beds which were comfy and fantastic view of the Hollywood Hills. There was a minibar as well but you need to ask for the key at the reception. We had a good view of the Hollywood sign which was awesome. The bathroom was standard with shower/tub combined. Room service was good and the food was not too bad. We had breakfast at the hotel every morning, while the variety of food was great, the service was a bit disappointing. The staff were friendly but they took a long time to take our plates away or bring our drinks. We also experienced poor service during check-in, the lady at the reception was very nice and friendly but the bell guy who took our bags just left them on a trolley and never came back, we had to wait a while to get help with our bag and we probably could've gotten them up to our rooms faster ourselves. The hotel is connected to the Hollywood and Highland Mall with plenty of shops with a variety of places to eat and drink so it was very convenient. We mostly ate elsewhere, so can't comment on the restaurant at the hotel itself except for breakfast. Overall it was a good stay, if anything else, we loved the location for visiting LA!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and great beds make for wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: ramonaloewe
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here and had plenty of time to notice the details. What remains most strongly in my memory is the exceptional caring and service attitude of the staff, from the bellman and concierge and front desks to the housekeeping staff and parking valets. These folks are geared to making your visit a comfortable and pleasant one and their kindness never ceases. The rooms are slightly small but very well kept and the beds are a miracle, as others here have noted. I stayed on the club or concierge floor and the hospitality room was a great help in making my visit more pleasant-the staff there is also great and it's very convenient to have a hot breakfast available right on your floor, as well as hors d'oeuvres and drinks at day's end-well worth the extra fee. The fitness center is terrific and is manned again by a great staffer in a suit and tie ready to serve-they even delivered complimentary headphones to my room so that I could use the treadmill in style. Hotel is attached to an indoor mall with several restaurants that can come in handy if you don't want to brave evening traffic to eat out in LA. Interesting views from all sides-you may even get to see a three story tall billboard of Paris Hilton as I did-what more could you ask? Not a great neighborhood but everything inside is top notch and compensates nicely for the rough edges of Hollywood and Vine. Highly recommended for both business and leisure travelers-have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: ChiffChiff
Reviews.Content: Me and my three friends stayed at this hotel for four nights. We transferred to this hotel a night earlier and the hotel staff were wonderful with helping us with this. We got offered a upgraded room for $75 for the first night and free for the remaining so we took this and we are so glad we did. The room was large and beautiful, we had a view of the Hollywood sign which we didn't even request! All up the staff around the hotel including the bell boys, cleaners & reception staff were a pleasure to deal with! Hotel has perfect location and will definitely stay here again if I ever get back to Hollywood!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Trip With Friends”
Reviews.Author: Passport-Kid
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend getaway with the boys in Oct 2010. The location is ideal. It is literally in the heart of hollywood located behind the chinese theater and walk of fame. The nightlife within the area is great. All the bars and crowd are located on the main strip around this hotel. It is a clean hotel with comfy beds and great views of the hills. If you are looking to stay near the hollywood strip and enjoy the sights / night life this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location..service can be better”
Reviews.Author: kai-jun
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in August...complimentary upgrade to executive floor (9th floor) as they were unable to provide us a deluxe room with 2 queen beds despite prior request (anyway, can try requesting for it when checking in as i overheard a couple of other guests requested and granted). View from room - facing the pool area and not much city view due to lower floor. Room size - its not huge but sufficient for our family of 2 adults and 2 children. Breakfast buffet spread and service was great! Guest relations service can be better (esp the conceirge..only one staff to handle guests' enquiries during our 3-nite stay). Lobby area is small (compared to the size of the hotel) and can get very noisy if there are events going on. Easy access to the avenue of stars, hard rock cafe, tourist attractions and dozens of restaurants and shops along the street. Tram station and bus stations are conveniently located nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Excellent Service and brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: KO2500
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as it was my first time in LA and i was desperate to be near the 'hollywood' sign. I requested a room facing the hills and non smoking. Upon arrival the hotel staff were wonderful, valet took our rented car and ensured it was available as soon as we left our room. The check in staff made it very simple and the concierge were brilliant. Within the 5minutes we had checked in and made it up the lift they were already waiting there for us. Absolutly magical. The staff made sure that our stay felt like our home away from home and i really appreciated this as we had been away from home for about 3 weeks already. I have to say i was quite the difficult customer at this hotel and the staff were wonderful with me. The first room we checked into did not have a view of the hollywood sign so i asked to change, and they accomodated this, the second room, whilst had a view of the sign, smelt like someone had thrown a million used asktrays in there (and it was a non smoking room) the concierge said that it wasn't acceptable - i agreed and asked to change rooms again. The hotel was very accommodating and again moved us - to the exact room i wanted - all moves happened within 15mins. We were very impressed. The beds were SUPER comfortable and totally luxurious - the rooms are a little on the small side, but that's ok cause you only sleep there in the end. The location of the hotel is great too. Grumans, kodak theatre, hollywood walk of fame, rosevlet hotel wall within 5 mins walking. Universal stuidos is about a 15 min drive away. Overall i was super happy with this hotel. Would recommend to any traveller with a bigger budget to splurge. It's well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, little more attention to detail and this would have been perfect.”
Reviews.Author: NYTraveler817
Reviews.Content: I arrived on business at the H&H Renaissance Hotel on 8/17 for 8 nights. Was very early as our flight landed at 9:30am, however, a room was available and we were able to check in immediately. Waited just minutes for a front desk attendant and was on our way to or room on the 12th floor. I requested a room with a view of the hills and that is exactly what we got. Could not see the Hollywood sign from our room, but that was not as important to us as it is to some. We were able to see it just fine from the walkway on the third level of the Hollywood and Highland Center. The room itself was a little small but adequate for our needs. I was traveling on business, but I did bring my significant other with me. So there were two of us in a room with a king bed, just as requested. The bathroom was spacious. Clean towels were provided daily. The only complaint we would have in regards to housekeeping is that the sheets were to be changed after the third night and they were not. We simply laid out the card on the bed to request a change of sheets the next day and they were changed then. In regards to the room itself, there was no "do not disturb" card in the room. We had to request one. Also, the door to the room was not inline with the jamb. So it was not possible to lock the deadbolt at night. Being from NYC, we like the idea of locking our doors at night. We used the latch instead. Also, our room was right outside the elevator bank and we never heard anything more than minor foot traffic from the hallway. We did have the opportunity to use the gym and pool area. Both were wonderful. In addition, we had the great fortune of utilizing SpaLuce. We booked a couples massage. I am not a massage enthusiast, however, Passion, my masseuse, was out of this world. She did such an outstanding job. Although I had to work all day, our evenings were fun filled due to the location. This is a prime spot if you are visiting Hollywood. It is definitely the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located steps from”
Reviews.Author: SAFARIMAN80
Reviews.Content: Literally steps away from the world famous Chinese Theatre and the historic Hollywood forecourt - featuring handprints of iconic celebrities, major movie premieres, events , makes this Renaissance a no brainer in terms of location location location, when visiting Hollywood. It's also close to Universal Studios and well located just off 101. Rooms are superb

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: JJF1101
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights - everything was wonderful. Centrally located for sightseeing, especially the Hollywood sights which are practically next door. Staff was superb from Valets to bell staff - everyone so friendly and helpful. Hostess in restaurant was especially nice. While Hollywood is still a little dirty, this hotel made visit enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel and charge you for things that you didn't purchase”
Reviews.Author: SUBMANHQ
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the final leg of a month traveling through the USA. Hotel service and amenities were very poor and totally over priced. When I checked out I enquired that the account was settled as this was pre paid. When I returned home I found that the hotel had charged my credit card for a small unauthorized charge, I reported this to my financial institution and they dealt with them. I will never stay with this hotel chain again just on principle.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: lonelyapart
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel for two nights. It's very good for visiting Hollywood Boulevard (Kodak Theatre), Universal Studio (10 minutes ride), Griffin Observatory (20 minutes ride), 6 Flags Mountain Park (30 minutes ride). We arrived at 6 o'clock in the morning and had early check-in. The room reserved (with one king bed) was unavailable and we got room with two beds. The only problem we had - with valet parking - at this early time we couldn't find "parking-guy" and stay our car in the parking at our expense. So we doubled our parking expenses as in the evening we used hotel valet parking. The room was nothing special - simple ascetic design. The only misfortune - they do not provide bath with gel-douche - only soap available. We need to buy it at the next door shop. Check-out was fast and simple. This hotel is good for short stay but NOT for romance.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and convenient !!!”
Reviews.Author: Majito
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. The rooms are very confortable... A little small if you ask me, but ok. The pool is very nice and they offer food and drinks there. Try to get a pool view room. You can easily walk to the Hollywood Bowl for concerts like it was my case. The subway is like 5 minutes walk too and the shops and restaurants of Hollywood Av. too... You will enjoy your stay. The only problem is that I never could log in into their wifi service, but the business center did the trick.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay.”
Reviews.Author: BlackyTheTravelhound
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for six nights in August 2011. The employees were helpful and friendly. The hotel is conveniently located within walking distance of lots of good restaurants and a Fresh and Easy market. Room 1237 was clean and well appointed. The view was great - I could see downtown LA, the Hollywood sign and the Capitol Records building from my window. The bed was very confortable. I loved the Aveda products in the bathroom. There is an excellent bar near the lobby with great entertainment. I truly enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood from inside !”
Reviews.Author: adalo79
Reviews.Content: Excelent location (there is NO walking distance towards walk of fame and theatres because you are actualy in there already) Very clean and modern

Reviews.Title: “beautiful views”
Reviews.Author: wlcaruk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August 2011 and this was my first time to California. We picked the hotel because of the location. No complaints at all. The rooms were clean and bright and we had a great view of the hollywood sign. I must say the bed was one of the best hotel beds i've slept on, they are very comfortable!!! My stay was short so I didn't get a chance to eat in the restaurant or check out the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: nikkigfoster
Reviews.Content: I stayed early August at The Renaissance Hollywood Hotel for The Teen Choice Awards and it was in the perfect location for everything I needed. The staff was incredibly hospitable and many thanks go to Kate and Dominique for block-booking my rooms for our stay. The room service breakfast is very good and filling. The portion sizes are big so you can really split by two. I stayed in an executive suite with a Hollywood sign view and it was superb! The hotel was very quiet and he beds were very comfortable. Room service was timely as well and did I mention LOCATION?!?!?! It's in walking distance to many shops and restaurants on Hollywood Blvd. It's also a short taxi ride away to Hollywood Bowl and Universal City Walk (less than $20 ride for one way). I would definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: maggie1030
Reviews.Content: My goddaughter and I just arrived from a 4-day vacation trip to L.A./Hollywood. We stayed at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel and we had a great room: we had a terrific view of the "Hollywood" sign; the beds were comfy; the bathroom had great water pressure too! We ate breakfast at Twist Restaurant - terrific food. The hotel is conveniently located by the Hollywood & Highland Center (restaurants & shopping compex). Since we didn't rent a car, when we went to Universal Studios Hollywood, we took the Metro Rail red line (which was located at the Hollywood & Highland Center) and we got off the next stop and conveniently hopped on the Universal Studios shuttle, which took us directly to the entrance. We also purchased the Hollywood CityPass which we thought was terrific because we were able to go on the 2-hour tour of the movie stars' home (Beverly Hills & Hollywood Hills), which also includes driving through West Hollywood and Rodeo Drive; Madame Tussaud's Museum; the Kodak Theatre Guided Tour (that is a must-see!). We also took the VIP Warner Brothers Studio Tour; although this was not included in the Hollywood CityPass, that was okay with us because we enjoyed the tour immensely and would recommend it to anyonel!Overall, we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “good but expensive for just a view...some poor service”
Reviews.Author: swisstourist81
Reviews.Content: Part of a USA trip, we wanted to stay at an exceptional place in LA and have a cool view. 400USD for a night is a lot, but we hoped worth it. The hotel is very well located on Hollywood Blvd and adjacent to the kodak theatre. We had a simple Impala rental and the valets did not consider us, only after we got out and asked for parking did they just tell to go park in the public parking (same building), other cars outside were lamborghinis, guess a rented impala is not good enough for valet service at the Renaissance. After coming back up with all our luggage, no direct access for the hotel from parking, you have to go through shops (short distance though), we were checked in and got a low floor handicapped room....although we paid more for "a view", which was of the parking lot... Going back down the receptionist offered another room and came up with us, we gut a higher floor, above the pool and a nice view. Guess that if you do not look rich and are not famous, well you're nothing in LA, even if you pay for :). Room was pretty small, big tv, clean, very basic bathroom (like in a cheaper hotel). Good reception and concierge information about locations. Breakfast was very good, and very expensive :) Small but nice fitness, some weights, nice pool, very clean. All in all a good hotel, but not worth the extra money if you're not rich or famous, you can get real luxury in Vegas (Palazzo) for less than 200 a night ! I cant help wonder why a guest in a previous review keeps going back there with all these problems...

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT!!!”
Reviews.Author: pandedrew
Reviews.Content: Third stay at the Hollywood Renaissance and will definately return. Great location. Clean rooms and helpful, friendly, on-the-ball staff. Love the Hollywood Renaissance!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location shame about the service "”
Reviews.Author: Tbuzzi
Reviews.Content: Regular guest at this hotel and not once have I had a problem free stay! The rooms are immaculate and spacious. However for the price I would expect so. Nothing about this hotel is inexpensive. The problems I have encountered are as follows: Disorganized poorly managed check in process Overcharged by $300 for a breakfast brunch Despite being notified of a food allergy when placing orders, in room Dining would continually send food with the offensive strawberry on every plate . This is EVERY order at EVERY stay (8 times in 6 months) Billed twice to the same credit card on more than one occasion. Parking is very expensive and no concessions apply. Internet wi-fi low signal and very expensive should be included in club rooms. Actually sent my ldriver away because they could not accommodate his car!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel In Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: AnnieL79
Reviews.Content: Large comfortable room. Great location in Hollywood and near subway Wonderful view from bedroom window of Hollywood sign Lovely rooftop pool

Reviews.Title: “In the Middle of the Action”
Reviews.Author: TooColdinChitown
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel because of its location at Hollywood and Highland and because it's a Marriott - which implies a certain level of quality and service. The hotel did not disappoint us - the rooms were nice and clean and the service was first rate! And the locaiton was right in the middle of the action - everything is within walking distance. A lot of action and noise but yet the room was super quiet...i forgot to ask if their was special soundproffing when it was built. If you can afford it, use the hotel parking valet.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive”
Reviews.Author: mariale20031
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights, and the price was too high. The attention was not so good, the valet parking very expensive and so did the breakfast. I had booked a package, but if not it would be very expensive. The best I liked was the attention at the restaurant in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location... Great Hotel... Check-in Process Needs Work... Attention to Detail Needs Work”
Reviews.Author: hikerlv76
Reviews.Content: Come to Hollywood and stayed at the Renaissance for a conference for 3 days. Arrived at the end of the night and upon arriving I found the valets, doorman, bellman and lobby to all be inviting. I had an immediate great first impression. I then went to checkin and there was a line at 10:30 on a Wednesday night. After a 20 minute wait to speak with a front desk clerk it took almost 30 minutes to check me in because they had to call someone to have rooms released - despite the conference and reservation being made for months the apparently didn't have a good room count for needs. Once checked in and in my room I discovered that I was in a room with 2 double beds rather than the King reserved. Despite this... the room was great. The view was phenomenal - while looking out the windowed wall I could the Hollywood sign to the left, the Capital Records Building directly in front of me and the LA skyline to the right beyond the CNN Building. The next day I had a call to take for work and came to the room to use the desk phone to find that it was missing its cord and not working correctly. The bedside phone had all of its cords but the speaker phone quality was abysmal and I ultimately had to shift to my cell phone speaker phone which functioned better than the hotel phone. Despite all of this the hotel was comfortable, food in the restaurant was good, drinks at the bar were good. The decor was awesome and certainly fit what I would expect to find of a quality Hollywood Hotel. I can't say I would want to come back to this hotel on a business trip... but would stay here again for person reasons if ever the opportunity arose.

Reviews.Title: “stay there”
Reviews.Author: sausagepoo
Reviews.Content: From the time we booked in with problem thanks to virgin holidays , solved by manager very quickly , to when we left we enjoyed our stay . The view from room , room itself , all staff ( though it took a little while to get used to " the mob " running the parking out front , great at their job as they were ) food in the restaurant , service in the bar , location were as good as you can expect from a very well run hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to the Jungle”
Reviews.Author: PacificAndyLa
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel. Nothing to exciting. Staff is actually very friendly and helpful and the rooms are fairly nice. Small bathrooms thou. Its close to everything while in Hollywood and just steps from the Hollywood and Vine Complex. Worth the stay. It is party centeral on the weekends since its Hollywood. Loud parties on different floors for reunions, bachlor parties etc, going on till 3 or 4 am. Walls are paper thin. After the 4 am party ended I was awoken by the screaming, door slamming kids next door at 6 am. People there are others in the hotel!!! Hollywood is still dirty and full of bums so be prepared.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel & will be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: tennisgirlOrlando
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the middle of everything.. Public transportation was 1 block away and very easy to use. We requested a roll away & refrigerator in our room, when we arrived it was in our room.. We traveled with our teenage boys and it was a great experience.. I would highly recommend this hotel!!!! One recommendation do not take a taxi to the hotel.. we were quoted 52.00 and ended up paying 75.00 this was after the driver turn the meter off.. The Yellow Cab taxi service was horrible.....

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Bowl Concert”
Reviews.Author: xpat46
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel because of its proximity to HB, thinking we'd take the HB Shuttle from the Hotel.... went down to lobby 1-1/2 Hours before the Concert to find the line for Shuttle was around the block..... so we walked and it was very easy and way quicker than the Shuttle line. Hotel itself is very modern , excellent Elite Members Lounge and very courteous staff. It is priced accordingly of course.

Reviews.Title: “great location in Hollywood but a bit disappointed with the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gasser1961
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location for visiting Hollywood. you can go everywhere by foot. Park in the Highland centre just next door which is much cheaper than the valet parking. When I checked in, the hotel proposed to put me on the 18th floor if I paid a 20 dollar upgrade per night which I did. At midnight on the first night, I had to go down to reception and ask to change rooms as the room was right next to the lifts and it was like having a train next to you all the time ! they said they were full but I was so annoyed I told them to put me in the basement. they found me a room on the 7th floor but on my bill I was still charged the 20 dollars upgrade which I found extremely inefficient for a hotel of this standing.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of it all.”
Reviews.Author: HermanG
Reviews.Content: If you're staying in LAX, stay at this hotel which is a half block off the Hollywood strip. Great rooms, great view of the Hollywood sign, and a great breakfast buffet. Sign up for the Capitan package where you get 2 free tix to the latest movie playing at the EL Capitan theatre, and free valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised by this stylish hotel in the heart of Hollywood's tourist center”
Reviews.Author: IslandsR4Me
Reviews.Content: My sister and I booked an overnight stay when we booked two back-to-back events at the Hollywood Bowl. We didn't have high expectations - just wanted a nice room at a hotel nearby that had room service. We were both surprised by how great the service and the rooms were at this location. We received warm greetings from both the valet and the reception staff. Our room, located on the 17th floor, was clean, well furnished and quiet. We had expected to hear a lot of noise as the property is adjacent to the Hollywood & Highland entertainment complex, but we both had a great night's sleep on a very comfortable bed. We didn't eat in the restaurant, but ordered room service for breakfast. The food arrived on time and was still hot. We would definitely return to this hotel and would recommend it to anyone who is considering staying in the heart of Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “By the far the best place to stay on Hollywood Blvd.”
Reviews.Author: petekaak
Reviews.Content: Great location, good breakfast, very good service, goods rooms, average value. We enjoyed the three nights with our two boys and in particular the surrounding mall. If I was going to be critical it would be the following.. self parking too far from hotel, asked for a hillside view and ended up looking downtown, entrance to mall felt as though it was through a side door.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with a touch of the hollywood glitz”
Reviews.Author: orangeyellow
Reviews.Content: I must say, the moment I walked into this hotel, I have a feeling that either I became a movie star or all the other stayers all seemed to be someone walked out from some studios near by. Yes, the rooms are very well maintained hotel rooms. The service is great and this hotel is right in the heart of the Chinese Theater shopping/entertainment district. From here, you can join all sorts of tours to tour around LA. Many good restaurants are near by. I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody who want to tour around LA area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & service”
Reviews.Author: DevTaylorLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a tour across america. I had been driving over 6 hours from San Fran to LA and when I got to the hotel I was glad to see no queues and people there to help straight away. Check in was quick and easy and the lady was very chatty and helpful. When we got to our room it was a twin bed room, we asked for a king double. Not a problem though, a quick call to reception and we were moved to a larger room and had a view of the hollywood sign. I even asked for a fridge for the room to store some bought items and they provided one in no time. Had a great time in LA and the hotel helped that. The hotel is situated just off the boulevard so great location.Parking wasn't a major issue for us but be aware it costs $10 a day in the car park next door. Also it gets lively in the evening in the bar area, this is situated next to the check in so be prepared if you don't like noise. However I was in the bar making some of the noise!! Very pleasant stay and will go back if i'm in LA again

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you are doing the Hollywood Blvd and Hollywood Sign Tour”
Reviews.Author: lalotp
Reviews.Content: This hotel is GREAT! Excellent service and atmosphere. We arrived on a Friday night and there were people in the lobby dressed in costumes for a party in the penthouse levels. Great looking people. The hotel has a great bar scene. I definitely recommend you take advantage of their valet parking. Hollywood Blvd is just around the corner. This place is great as a starting point to visit Universal Studios, the beach, Santa Monica, Sunset Blvd, Hollywood Sign, Flea Markets downtown LA, etc... If you have a choice, make sure you ask for a high floor room facing west. There is some great views. This hotel can be good for a single business traveler, young couples, or even families with teens or young kids. We did not have time to check out the pool. Not sure if there is one.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: SyntheticMilk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from the 23rd - 27th, arriving from Australia at around 9am. Check in is 4pm, and while we were initially promised they'd put a rush on our room (we'd paid for one with a view), it just took way too long for us. 11am rolled around and it was 4am our time, so we were dead on our feet. We asked for a room - any room, and were given something on a lower level. Perfect. Front desk was okay, but they seemed a bit snooty. Everybody else there was fabulous. Doormen & women, bag holding, etc. Everyone was lovely. The room was your standard 2 double bed, but it was clean and pretty with a view of the Hollywood sign. Twist was a great restaurant option for breakfast (they do lunch too, though we didn't attend) - but weirdly they only served dinner meals in the lobby bar. The room service menu was a little lacking, unfortunately. I have to mention the elevators are plentiful and quick! Overall, and comparing to most other places in Hollywood, this is a great option if you want to visit the direct area. Clean and safe. The only downside - it's fairly expensive considering the area!

Reviews.Title: “Uk tourist point of view”
Reviews.Author: ALISTER54
Reviews.Content: I write this as a tourist from the UK. The hotel is good but certainly not great. Four star facilities but with a three star American hotel feel. Our corridor was filled with left over food and drink daily from our neighbours rooms, now I know this is an American thing to do but I was tripping up over this mess 24 hours a day. The location was perfect for the Kodak and Chinese theatres but beware the Hollywood boulevard to VIne street is possibly the worst area of " TOURIST" L.A. I do not mean dangerous , I just mean it's all tattoo shops,smoke shops,transvestite clothes shops and low class bars. I personally would have preferred to stay in other areas such as the Grove near the farmers market, the Sunset strip, Brentwood or Beverley hills. You will have a good time here, your hotel will be good but in my experience I would look elsewhere first.

Reviews.Title: “Top Rate Service!”
Reviews.Author: 1124sunshine
Reviews.Content: I was so impressed with the service at this hotel!! My friend and I were dying for a snack and went to the complimentary room not realizing that they were closed for the day. A person who worked at the hotel saw us trying to use our card to get into the room and asked if he could help. He let us into the room to see if there were any snacks left. There were only drinks (which he graciously allowed us to have). We mentioned that we were looking for the cupcakes that were there yesterday. He asked for our room number and several minutes later he brought cupcakes to our room!!!! Everyone there was so gracious. So glad we chose this hotel!!! Great vacation partly in thanks to the little things that this hotel does to recognize it's marriott rewards members.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Leighlittleton
Reviews.Content: This Marriott is convenient for all that Hollywood has to offer. It has easy access to shops and restaurants and is just steps away from all of the tourist attractions on the boulevard. It is safe (important in Hollywood) and the staff is very helpful! I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “If you want over priced and snobby this is your place!”
Reviews.Author: blckhze
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at our share of good and bad hotels. This is the first trip where we can say the hotel staff made the stay bad. Upon checking in, you would think I spoke in a different language when I asked the woman if there was a resturant upstairs to have lunch in-this set the tone of the trip. The concigier was NEVER there! When there was someone manning the desk, they had no suggestions, didn't book any dinners for us, and handed us an attraction pamphlet. Room service took over an hour - for a ridiculous priced burger and salad. We were unaware of the need to have a car to get around. The hotel has a car but what a pain in the butt that process was, mainly because of the attitude of those people! I'm paying them and they act as if they can't be bothered to have my business. AND they even have the nerve to charge you to park their rental in the hotel. The rental car people were so vague with everything and it was a huge hassle. The hotel offers a hotel shuttle, for a charge of course, to and from the airport. Parking is outrageously priced. The room and hotel were clean. There is a pool and workout room-both very small. The location is good for Hollywood attractions-all a short walk away. But to get to all the movie studios, rent a car because cabs are expensive. Again, NO ONE here will help you so if you want good customer service, I wouldn't recommend this place. We asked for change for a dollar-the hotel desk "doesn't carry change," the consigier not present, and the coffee shop in lobby doesn't give change without a purchase-even for hotel guests. Beware of "room with a Hollywood hills view" its an obstructed, not so great view. To end our stay we visited their spa. They were very accommodating and even took us a half hour earlier than their scheduled opening. But massages were almost $300 for the two of us so we paid well to have good service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - for sightseeing and shopping!”
Reviews.Author: allorganised
Reviews.Content: My family had 15 hours/one night in LA before catching a connecting flight to the east coast so I booked the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel. The location is great if you want to see the Kodak Theatre, Walk of Fame and Hollywood Blvd and the Hollywood sign. It's also attached to the Hollywood Highland Shopping centre which as lots of places to eat and shop! We had a room with two double beds - it was was very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Can't get much better than this!”
Reviews.Author: travelingus1975
