Reviews.Content: I travel for my job so we stayed at this hotel for a little over 3 weeks. Overall I would rate my stay as exceptional. Our first room was on the 5th floor and quite small. It also had an obstructed view. However, just a few days later we were upgraded to a corner studio suite with amazing views of the city, and pool area. I found the location to be quite busy but close to everything! Service at this hotel was also 1st rate! The pool area was gorgeous and well maintained. However, Some days were quite busy and loud. If I ever have to stay in LA again I hope it is at this hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for me”
Reviews.Author: kimke
Reviews.Content: I arrived around noon on Friday and wanted to check in early. There was not a room available so the check-in woman asked for my phone # and said they would call. WIthin an hour a room was available. I used that hour to check out the scenery nearby the hotel while they kept my bag for me. The room was large, clean and lovely. I had the "city" view which is the non-desired view. I thought about asked for a room with a better view but decided it really didn't matter THAT much to me. There is a viewing area outside where you can see the Hollywood sign. Apparently, some of the people I traveled with did have "rooms with a view" and had trouble with rooms being smelly and lack of towels and hair dryers. The staff was nice. We had a banquet meal catered by Wolfgang Puck on the premises and the food was amazing. The banquet style breakfasts were typical hotel quality, nothing special. The area is VERY crowded and right on Hollywood Blvd. It was a bit fun but I worried alot about the crime.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of fun to stay right in Hollywood!”
Reviews.Author: catsaresmarter
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights in this hotel exploring Hollywood and the nearby communities in LA. It was comfortable and you could not beat the location. We had a view of the Hollywood sign and could walk to lots of tourist spots and restaurants. They do charge for parking and for internet. We ate in nearby restaurants. I loved the decor - modern and glitzy. Fun and comfortable lobby and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel- Great Staff and An Even Better View”
Reviews.Author: ajowen91
Reviews.Content: Simply one of the best hotels, I have personally ever stayed in. I usually live up in Beverly Hills, but our house was being revamped and was unliveable, so we decided to stay at various hotels within the Los Angeles and Orange County area. From the moment we arrived the staff were friendly and helpful. The bellman who showed us up to our 13th floor room, showed us where everything was, and turned on the AC and even went to fetch us some ice. So we were off to a great start. The location is incredible right on Hollywood Boulevard and easy to get to many locations around like Santa Monica and other beachs like Huntington, Newport, Laguna and Venice. I would recomend this hotel to anyone. Brilliant from start to finish!!! Great restaurants nearby just out on the boulevard. Only one problem, the pool was closed often for private events and functions.

Reviews.Title: “great stay!”
Reviews.Author: aussieisabella
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights at the start of a trip around America, it was fantastic. The staff at the front desk were incredibly helpful and were able to put us into a room right away as my brother had got travel sickness from the flight over and then later moved us into a room on the floor we originally requested when a room became available. The room had a great view overlooking the hollywood hills and hollywood sign. The rooms were comfortable and clean. The hotel is in a great location, right in hollywood and next to the hollywood and highland shopping center so it is great for sightseeing in hollywood. Also a tip - visit the lounge on the 19th floor they serve breakfast there and also have complimentary wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel/HORRIBLE Guest Services”
Reviews.Author: His2ryteacher
Reviews.Content: Stayed this past week for a conference and while the hotel is beautiful and located in the heart of all things touristy in Hollywood the customer service is awful. My colleague and I reserved and paid in advance for a room with two double beds but upon checking in at 2pm was told that they were out of rooms with double beds. The solution they offered us was to deliver a roll-away bed to the room. We were there for three days and the roll-away bed was never delivered after repeated calls to guest services. Our male colleagues encountered the same situation but were offered a suite upgrade...lame! At one point during the conference (in the hotel ballrooms) the electricity went out and stayed out for quite awhile with no explanation from the hotel. My last criticism of this hotel deals with the continental breakfast provided for conference participants...it was really bad! I guess my overall opinion of this hotel is that the hotel staff really don't care about customer service. NOT WORTH THE EXPENSIVE ROOM RATES!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location...”
Reviews.Author: kycoltsfan
Reviews.Content: Being our first trip to LA, we chose this hotel due to the central location for seeing some of the most famous landmarks. As others have mentioned, many of these are within walking distance of the hotel or just a short drive away (Beverly Hills, Rodeo Drive, beaches, Warner Bros and Universal studios, etc). We also enjoyed the convenience of having a mall attached with restaurants, eateries and shopping, not to mention the Kodak Theatre. Not all rooms have great city views as ours faced a side street with a view of the hills and the Hollywood sign. However, our room was clean, comfortable, and quiet. The major room problem we had was with housekeeping. Being early risers, we were out of our room by 9am and usually returned by 1-2pm for a short rest. Both days this meant that housekeeping skipped our room. The first evening we were able to get it cleaned after 5pm by request. The second afternoon we left at 4pm and were assured by housekeeping, who were in the hallway, that they would get to the room before they left. Of course when we returned the room had not been cleaned. Needing towels to shower early the next day before we left, we called down to the desk to request towels that were never delivered. We noticed an unlocked housekeeping door next to the ice machine and took matters into our own hands and helped ourselves to the towels. Additionally, since the room had not been cleaned for two days we were out of Kleenex, low on toilet tissue and trash cans were overflowing. Not what I would expect for over $300/night. We enjoyed the pool during our stay as the weather was beautiful and the pool heated. The tile floor of the pool could use a good scrubbing but the rest of the area was clean. The cabanas available were a plus for the pool but the small pool deck resulted in a lack of enough lounge chairs for everyone and many people ended up having to use the regular chairs from tables in the eating area. There was a bar open but you had to serve yourself. It seemed a little odd to me that a hotel this nice wouldn't offer cocktail service around the pool. There is also a small menu to order food at the pool. We found this service to be slow and disorganized. Almost everyone who ordered didn't receive the correct food and by the time they brought out what was missing, you were done with the rest of your food. We took advantage of the valet service which we found to be quick and courteous. They always had the car available and were ready to help with any directions we needed. With "carmageddon" clearing the streets for us, we actually drove out to also explore some of the beaches that were within a one hour drive from the hotel. In summary, the hotel served as a great home base for the sightseeing we wanted to do and I would recommend it to others who wish to do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like a movie star”
Reviews.Author: KAC255333
Reviews.Content: This hotel was similarly priced to others offered by our travel agent, but the location was the stand out. It is situated right at Kodak theatre, there is even a hotel door that walks you straight through to the shopping area. Very convenient. We travelled for 14 hours on aeroplane prior to arrival and it was a hotel worthy of the Hollywood name, We ( 2 chn and 2 adults) felt like movie stars. The room was huge, sofa bed and rollaway and still plenty of floor space. A huge bathroom as well, One could imagine Hollywood stars getting ready to walk the red carpets for the Grammies. The kids loved a quick dip in the hotel pool and we jumped on the red bus for a tour. It was only a one night stopover but it was a great place to stay in when in LA. Oh and did I mention we had a huge window and first class view of the Hollywood sign

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: AussieGirls4
Reviews.Content: This is a great location for anyone who is staying in Hollywood for the first time. Close to shopping, food and Hollywood Blvd. Very clean room and bathroom. Checked in early which was great. Double Beds are a little small for 4 people but fixed that very quickly by ordering a roll away bed at no extra cost. Staff were very helpful with planning sightseeing trips. Pool area was nice with great views of the city. Could not drink alcohol around the pool area unless is was brought from the hotel. We got told by security guard that we could not drink our own drinks we had to buy them at the bar. Bar price for a rum and cola was $10.00. Only disappointing thing.

Reviews.Title: “Celebrity spotting”
Reviews.Author: Thegangs
Reviews.Content: great location. check in was alright. We had to look for the club lounge as the lady that checked us in didn't inform us. one guy at the concierge looked grumpy but overall we find hotel staff helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: africanviolet69
Reviews.Content: The customer service was great. When we arrived we didn't like the view of the first room we were assigned. They immediately changed us to a city view room on a higher floor with a view of the Hollywood sign. The location of this hotel cannot be beat. It's attached to a small shopping mall and some great restaurants. It's also a central location to Beverly Hills, the beaches and downtown LA. The Metro is right at the hotel also. I wish they had a hot tub/jacuzzi is the only downfall I saw. All of our needs were met promptly by the hotel staff. The beds were comfy too.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaNo1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Hotel in Hollywood after investigating many hotels in hollywood on line. It was a bit pricey but well worth the price due to the Hotels location right beside shops and the Kodak theatre, walk of fame, Madame Tussards, and the Chinese theatre. The Hotel is typical 4 star and our room on the 18th floor had views to Los Angeles and of the Hollywood sign. We couldn't have asked for a more central location on our first trip to Los Angeles. The hop on hop off bus stop is virtually in front of the building. We travelled through Rodeo drive and onto Santa Monica. You can get off the bus at any of the famous locations.

Reviews.Title: “great base for exploring LA”
Reviews.Author: emu711
Reviews.Content: my first time here, my boyfriend's third. pros: the renaissance is in a great location, right at the corner of holywood and highland, next to a very nice shopping center. there's a large parking garage under the hotel/mall complex, and parking is no more than $10 per day (which i think is a great deal). the room was large and comfortable. cons: aside from general hotel decor not to my style (pretty gaudy), the room wasn't spotless. the curtain in the bathtub was dirty, the swimming pool floor was dirty, and the floor, some furniture, and the draperies were spotted. the housekeeper didn't empty our (overflowing) trash bin for at least three days, and we never had enough towels - one day we had one bath sheet and one hand towel, i think. i had to borrow from the housekeeping cart. this is definately a convention hotel, but it suited us as a base for exploration just fine, since we were really central to everything (plus, we had a rental car). we didn't valet the car because even us jaded new yorkers weren't paying $29 when we could simply take two elevators. major points for having aveda bathroom products! but, no body wash, only tiny bars of soap. bars are fine for the sink, but you want something better for the shower!

Reviews.Title: “Location, views, shopping!”
Reviews.Author: Klte11
Reviews.Content: We had three wonderful days here. Well located to everything you need and staff polite and helpful to the extreme although reception staff need to be a bit more attentive to requests and not be asked three times. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Renaissance succeeds to impress against significant odds !”
Reviews.Author: SirNorman
Reviews.Content: I have a soft spot for Renaissance Hotels. My experience is the Marriott group's hotels have all been good (especially TEDA). As I have remarked in another review of another hotel; the circumstances surrounding ones arrival at a hotel has much to do with first impressions. In my case I was returning from Hawaii full of good feelings. My better half was thrilled to find that we could see the Hollywood sign from out room and was busy consulting the hotel information book for a stretched limo to take her and my daughter on the 'must do' tour of the homes of the stars. This she found at a great price. Me, this gave me time to explore. First I must avert to my arrival at Los Angeles Airport where I encountered a rude security officer who opted not to speak but rely on aggressive hand gestures to their hyper sensitive security screen alarming as in I entered. Efforts to get a response to my question in English only got more frantic wrist flapping. The Taxi ride was silent and as eventually emerged direct and not overcharging. Welcome to L.A ! So it came to the Renaissance to be welcoming. The reception is brightly decorated with colourful abstract paintings and looks inviting. We got text book functionality and competent assistance at the desk. The entreaty to 'have a nice day' though seemed to be used as a period, or full-stop as we might describe, to indicate an end to the transaction. On the positive side I must mention that it was 7.30 am and we got our room immediately. As I write I realise that I have never written a critical review of a hotel and this is not one either. It is reviewed in the context of matters surrounding that results in my disposition. So to the Hotel. The standard of this hotel was well in line with those of others in the group. The room was top class for a standard room. Breakfast was particularly good memorable for treats such as delightful fresh strawberries and other fresh fruit among the elaborate fayre. The hotel location is very central, particularly for my better half, as I referred, and to her celebrity curiosity. The complex that adjoins and incorporates the hotel includes a big Shopping Mall that included umpteen shops and eateries. Exit to Highway Bvd leads you to the street frontage of the Kodak Theatre and the famous Walk of Fame. My wife would be in her element I thought as I explored while she and daughter number two explored the Hollywood Hills. As I explored in the direction from Hotel through the Mall I met my next security officer, a female, who told me where I could not go. Why is it that the word 'Sir' is used in such a pejorative tone that suggest the opposite to deferential?. I ignored the interception. On exit to Highway I saw that preparation for an event at the Kodak was in progress. Standing on the side-walk surveying the activity I was approached by a black suited security type person who again told me where I could not be. Our 'conversation' about it being a public footpath and his absence of jurisdiction unless he could convince me that he was a police officer did stop him in his tracks. Speaking into the walkie talkie he was soon joined by an even bigger suited colleague with whom I had the same conversation. About this time my senses alerted me of remember things such as the Agency for Homeland Security exist, so I advised them that I was returning to my room in the Renaissance via the route I arrived. They said nothing. I choose to think they had difficulty understanding my Irish accent. Our pleasant evening meal in the Mall was in a restaurant whose name alludes me but it had a reciprocal arrangement with the hotel so that I could charge my meal should I choose. Clever marketing I thought. My stay as I said was en route from Hawaii to Ireland so this was a two day stop over to break the journey. Departing we asked the hotel to order a Taxi to the airport, which they willingly did. The Russian taxi driver was talkative that is until I pointed out that his meter was already registering higher than the first Taxi charge and we were nowhere near the airport. He fluffed about the meter only recently being calibrated bla bla bla and made a querying phone call to base or somewhere else. I took out my phone and asked for the number of the hotel so that I could discuss this matter with them. The meter was immediately turned off. We arrived at L.A airport to be assisted en route to our departure from the United States by two more abrupt and rude airport staff. Against this backdrop the Renaissance Hollywood became for me L.A's only shining light.

Reviews.Title: “Expected More”
Reviews.Author: TheWard
Reviews.Content: It's a great location if you want to be in the thick of the tourist part of town and the amount of restaurants near by suited me. So nothing to complain about the location. It's just the hotel itself. I e-mailed ahead to organise for a few particular things to be available to me upon my arrival, received a confirmation back and when I arrived found out they weren't done. The front desk staff need a little extra training in being helpful and also having a few more staff at busy times would probably make checking in and out easier. There is no kettle in the rooms for boiling water, so you have to ring room service. This would be OK I guess, but one night I waited over an hour and had to ring twice. And a few days into my stay I realised they were using coffee pots to put hot water in, so the hot water tasted like coffee! Not great when you're making herbal tea. There were no bathrobes in my room nor a shower cap. I don't know if this is usual for an LA hotel. And I'm not sure if they have any rooms that are NOT adjoining - the noise between rooms is very loud and clear, even just the TV and opening and closing drawers. Don't worry about the view, just get a quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “10 out of 10 - would stay here again :D”
Reviews.Author: Rhonstr
Reviews.Content: I've just returned after a 6 night stay at the Renaissance and i can assure you it is fabulous. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left the staff were very friendly and helpful. Room was excellent, modern, spacious and above all spotless. Hotel is in a great position for exploring Hollywood and Los Angeles. Pool area is ideal for chillaxing and it has a great view of the Hollywood sign. I liked how the hotel was connected to the Hollywood & Highland complex so you were never far away from anything. If i return to Los Angeles i would stay here again. :D

Reviews.Title: “Great introduction to LA”
Reviews.Author: Runbot
Reviews.Content: In terms of location, the Renaissance pretty much has it covered. Being first time visitors to LA we found this hotel very well situated as it was walking distance to the common popular attractions ( eg 5 min to The Chinese Theatre ). The adjacent Hollywood Highland Mall has a good variety of retail shops and restaurants. It meant that we could come and go easily from the hotel if we had forgotten something or needed to rest in the afternoon. Our room on the 18th floor looked out over the pool and mall - makes for interesting entertainment if you get tired of watching TV. There are the usual burgers/ dessert chains but also several less unhealthy options. Tip for vegetarians, most burger chains will have a vege burger option but failing that there are several pizza and Mexican places around that have good non-meat options of a decent quality and serving size! Or you can, as we also did , walk 10min to the Fresh and Easy supermarket to buy something. The in house restaurant Twist provides a good breakfast selection with lots of fresh fruit and omelettes made to order, plus there is a very good carrot/celery juice. There were small potted plants on each table as decorations which we actually real ! Gym facilities are very good. Several treadmills, cross trainers and bikes. There is free water and fresh Granny Smith apples. The weights are outside in a marquee overlooking the pool. Our room had plenty of space with a safe , writing desk and plenty of storage space. There are 5 separate mirrors (!). Bathroom has the bath/shower combo which , oddly,in this day and age of water conservation, only gave you the option of having the water on at full blast - or nothing at all. The other negative aspect was having to pay $12 / day for wireless internet. Our room was clean and well maintained. Bed had more than enough pillows and the linen was soft ( I mention this as some hotels over starch their sheets/towels). We sometimes heard people talking in the corridors but there was no noise from adjacent rooms. Staff were all polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: andytdevonuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as the first stop of our honeymoon, so were a little dissapointed that when we mentioned this fact it was not even acknowledged by the check in staff.. no upgrades etc offered. Overall a good holel, large clean room with a comfy bed. Good access to the walk of fame and restraunts, bars and shops. The hotel arranged a shuttle for us back to LAX which saved us $40 over a cab which was useful. Nice experience but some of the staff could have been a little more freindly.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel.....would stay here again......great location”
Reviews.Author: GCPicnic
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the middle of the action. Awesome service from hotel staff - very good with our kids. We booked the club level room (2 doubles) for ourselves and 2 small children (4 & 7 yrs old). Club room offers lounge for breakfast, free wifi and nightly savouries and desserts - drinks at reasonable prices. Hollywood is a must see - probably wouldn't come back (not beacuse of the hotel) it's just that once you've done it......you've done it. Hotel backs onto Kodak Theatre with great shopping and food options all around the area. Took a hop-on-hop-off tour - terrible service on old buses ('starline tour'). Bad staff as well. Anyway - hotel is awesome and a great place to get away from the hustle an bustle - a true sanctuary....try to time your trip with a Dodgers game - was a great night out !! (Hint: eat before hand if you can - long lines.......)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place in Hollywood - Central Location”
Reviews.Author: adavici
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located in the center of Hollywood, and therefore all of greater LA. We were more or less convenient to Malibu, Glendale, Downtown, Wilshire and very close to Hollywood attractions and a short cab to the Sunset Strip. The hotel is new, clean and nicely laid out. The lobby and rooms have a new, modern feel. The room was spacious and well appointed, overlooking the Hollywood hills - and barely to the extreme right we could see the Hollywood sign. Attached to the hotel is a nice outdoor mall with some chain stores and restaurants. The parking garage is beneath this mall. Many business int he mall will validate your parking which will save you a couple bucks, but they will expect you to buy something, so we usually got abottle of water or a coffe or something. We had a nice late night dinner at The Grill in the mall, which might not be the best place in LA, but it was convenient and really quite good! No major complaints about this place, but a couple of things to consider. With parking beneath the mall, and the distance to get to your car, then up the garage and out to the streets, you really need to add 1/2 hour to any excusions. The walk there isn't too bad, but figure in the elevators, the walk, the light onto the street, etc and it quickly adds up! We'd certainly stay here again if we wanted to be in Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Annual boys Night at the Hollywood Bowl”
Reviews.Author: HummerDad
Reviews.Content: So every year we plan a trip to the Bowl to see a band and have some fun with friends. We stayed at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel and Spa and we were not disspointed. The gave us connecting rooms so we could all hang together. Rooms were clean, comfortable, free internet was awesome. Parking is a bit on the steep side, but you are in a tourist city, but the valet attendants were all friendly and took great care of us... the bottle of water in my car on check out was great as I was alittle under the weather from a night out...lol We didnt eat in the restaurant, but did eat and drink in the lobby bar, great service, food was good, drinks were perfect. This Hotel is right in heart of Hollywood in the Hollywood and Highland retail complex, plenty of shopping, restaurants, movies and sightseeing... No Movie star sightings this trip, but we were told Courtney Cox was there the night before and we saw band members there from the show we saw at the Bowl. Great value considering the location and all the things you can see or do within walking distance. Staff was super nice from check in to departure. Got thumbs up from all the boys who attended this year... Hope I get to stay here soon with my family

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: My2Kitties2
Reviews.Content: friendly staff, great beds, convenient location, enjoyed our stay...there is a parking fee but oh so worth it...the valet was there with our car with water bottles for us when we were leaving...and we were right there on Hollywood Blvd by walking thru the mall...could not hear neighbors even with adjoining door...thank you staff for a great stay in LA

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: liked_copper
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights over Halloween and it was fantastic (if your going to LA for Halloween then dress up for sure!). If you only have a short stay in LA this is the perfect location. You are right in the heart of the action of all the main tourist sites and its set in a fab shopping centre. You are a couple of train stops away from Universal Studios (which I'd highly recommend getting the front of the line tickets for, saves you time queing). The room we had was really spacious, clean and had tea/coffee facilities and a fab view of LA. Great hotel would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and safe from the Hollywood craziness nextdoor”
Reviews.Author: RiotPelaaja
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Hollywood is right in the heart of Hollywood next to Grauman's Chinese theatre. There's basically one block of sightseeing worth doing and then the area is pretty rubbish especially at night. However inside the Renaissance you dont feel that as the hotel feels quiet (bar the loud lobby bar) and safe even though it's linked the Highland shopping mall, which has some excellent food options. You can get directly to the Highland via one of the hotel floors, which is great. The complex has a California Pizza Kitchen, Starbucks, Quizno's, Rolling Stone and several other restaurants and stores. The hotel lobby bar is okay and has a cafe. The gym is pretty small, but has a nice view and half a dozen cycle-type machines, which is far more than your average hotel. The weights are outside next to the pool, which is a bit of a bummer as it can be pretty cold outside (yes, even in LA). Valet service was fast, though parking is expensive at 29$ a day, which is a hotel norm. I recommend just parking next-door at the Highland complex for less money. The hotel room, I stayed in a double, is pretty standard, but had great, comfortable beds and a good work desk. There also was a couch and a small table, which brings a nice ambience and gives the room a bit more "chilled" athmospere. The closet space is okay and shower pretty standard in terms of size, but there's definitely enough space for your toiletries. While the hotel provides the usual body lotion, shampoo and conditioner, it doesnt provide body wash/shampoo which was a bit weird. There are bars of soap though. Now while I said it was quiet, our room had a door to another room and one night through that, the neighbors were up chatting until 5am and I could pretty much hear every word and laughter, which was very annoying. Still, I enjoyed my stay. There's good food options right next door, movies and also Metro access in the same building.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: tbdbitlbuckeye
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from Wednesday-Sunday for a work conference. The hotel itself was very nice and clean, the staff seemed friendly. There were some cosmetic issues in the room, but nothing major, just some chipped paint or scratches. The best thing this hotel had going for it was location. It was connected to Hollywood and Highland Center, so access to shops, restaurants, and the surrounding Hollywood area was perfect. The pool is small, but the location and sitting area is beautiful, it was a perfect place to lounge. It's a great place for both business and pleasure, so if you're staying in the Hollywood, don't hesitate to stay at the Renaissance.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location!!”
Reviews.Author: lmullins2047
Reviews.Content: If you plan to be in the Hollywood area and are interested in tourist activities, there is NOT a better place to stay. The Renaissance Hollywood is in the heart of everything happening (with great views) and walking distance from a ton of stuff to do and great restaurants. The hotel is beautiful and extremely clean. Most importantly, ever staff member I encountered was wonderfully hospitable and friendly. I had a small issue with my Marriott Rewards account and received a follow-up call from Frederick, a manager, and he was unbelievably helpful and went well above my expectations of resolving the issue. I will definitely be visiting this hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the location and staff”
Reviews.Author: bpjon
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay from the moment we arrived until left. The staff greets you at the door to check you in. The view was spectacular....could see the Hollywood sign. The hotel is connected to the outdoor mall and Grumman's Theatre. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful with a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: mike89t
Reviews.Content: My family took a trip to hollywood for a wedding at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel. I'm a Marriot Gold Member so we got to stay on the Club Level (19th floor). Had an amazing view of downtown LA and the Hollywood sign. My kids spent hours on end just looking out the window at everything there was to see. The room was beautiful and well kept. Beds were very comfortable. The Toiletries were all top notch Aveda products. Service was great. Parking was expensive ($29 per day for Valet) but that is pretty much expected for the location. The Hotel is located smack dab in the heart of Hollywood. Everything is pretty much within walking distance. Pool was small but clean and it was heated. Kids had a blast swiming there.

Reviews.Title: “Liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: withkidstravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for four nights last week. I had a room facing the Hollywood Hills, a sort of executive suite, with a couch and a few chairs, etc. Large bathroom with changing room. It was very nice. Saw a couple of amazing suites on the top floor. They were breathtaking and the views were superb. The hotel is well-situated at Hollywood and Highland, adjacent to the Kodak Theater, home of the Oscars. It is intertwined with a multistory mall with many shops and restaurant. It is also a few hundred feet from Graumann's with the hand/foot prints of Hollywood stars. It is at a Metro stop. The room was comfortable and clean. Modern style, HD flat screen TV, fifth floor outdoor pool. It is a big, sprawling place, but the staff was helpful and responsive in every way. I would stay there again, certainly. I liked it.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: chk1
Reviews.Content: I agree with other reviewers. This hotel has the best location for touring around the city both on foot and in a car (if you can deal with the traffic). The room was very nicely appointed with great toiletries and linens. We were given extra pillows upon request and an 11th floor room (we requested a high up room), the concierge was helpful and the valet staff was very nice and friendly. The downside: the walls are PAPER THIN. We could hear the neighbors child talking next door. Add to that, a fraternity conference or some such thing and you have a cocktail for all day and all night noise. The boys were in the hall during the day, drinking and yelling up and down the halls, then they went out and I guess it was quiet. We went out, too. However at 2:15 in the morning when the bars closed the boys were back and louder than ever in the halls an in the room on the other side of us. We were pretty glad we were only staying overnight. If we'd had to stay a whole weekend in the frat house, I'm not sure we would have left with as good a feeling as we have. Also, the $29 parking fee was a little steep for overnight. I think the garage next door was $18 (but I'm not sure). We'd still stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for checking out old Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: tectonicgirlWPB
Reviews.Content: Loved it here: valets and concierge were wonderfully helpful, room had a great view of the hills. We didn't do anything touristy on our two day visit; had some amazing hikes at Runyon Canyon and just enjoyed the time away. I highly recommend this hotel whether it's a tourist vacation or just a getaway for some local fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dohl
Reviews.Content: So we came to Hollywood on Memorial Day weekend for my cousin's bachelorette party. We finally settled on the Renaissence Hotel. I managed to get a deal using my AAA membership, which was awesome. We arrived at the hotel and the lobby was full. Think there was an event for a fraternity going on in the hotel coz the lobby and pool area were really rowdy. At check-in, Frederick was awesome. He immediately upgraded us to a view room since that was the only set of adjoining rooms with double beds left. With my Marriott rewards membership, we weren't charged for the upgrade! Yay! I had also requested extra foam pillows and extra towels for the room. Frederick noticed that on the reservation and said that since we changed our rooms, he would need to send up those requested items after we get to the room. And true enough, those pillows and towels arrived in the room shortly after we got in. I was truly impressed. Our rooms were awesome and large. Great view of the Hollywood sign if you leaned close to the window. One of our rooms was the handicapped accessible room, which came with an extra large bathroom! Great when you have girls getting ready for a night out. Before going out, we decided to get some shopping done at the Hollywood and Highland Center which is right next to the hotel. We had a great time and I highly recommend this hotel. TIP: To save on the $29 valet charge, if you're just going to take a cab everywhere, then park at the Hollywood and Highland center where it's $10 a day!

Reviews.Title: “For a true Hollywood experience, stay at the Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: SusieP814
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my 2 daughters, 12 & 16, and another 16 year old. Perfect location if you want to get the full Hollywood experience. The Hollywood & Highland complex feels safe enough that my kids could roam around shopping and I didn't worry about them. We were within walking distance or metro to almost everything. Besides location, the hotel itself was fantastic. The staff was friendly and helpful. Bring plenty of 1's and 5's; it seems like there's someone to tip around every corner! But you also feel pampered and well taken care of while you're there. The room service food was out of this world delicious! (And I'm a very picky eater.) We also paid for club services which included daily breakfast, evening appetizers, and dessert, all in the club lounge on the 19th floor. At $30/day, if was a great deal for 4 people. The pool is kept at a comfortable temperature. We had a couple of chilly days, but the pool is kept warm enough that the outside temp doesn't make a difference. All in all, a wonderful stay. I'd definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: TaurusSaurus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance at the suggestion of a colleague. We were originally going to stay out near the airport, which he described as 'Depressing' and immediately saw he was correct. The location of this hotel is unreal. Its attached to the Hollywood/Highland Mall, as well as the Kodak Theatre, and Chinese Theatres.So you're just a stones throw from the heart of Hollywood. We were given a room on the 17th Floor, overlooking downtown LA, and the Hollywood sign. I like to think its b/c of my Silver Elite status, but it was probably just chance. The room was very modern, as clean as could be, and quite big. It boasted floor to ceiling windows, which was really neat and made for great views of downtown and Hollywood. Our first night, we simply just had a few drinks and enjoyed the view with the lights off. While I really have to reach to find someting to complain about, it would be the connection doors in our hotel room. They were paper thin, and you could hear the children next door almost like they were in our room. I also resent the fact that you have to pay $13/day for internet at a hotel that costs ~$200/night. Seems pretty stupid since I can go down the street to a crappy Days Inn or a McDonalds and get free wi/fi. We also visited the pool during our first night. The temperature was in the 50s that night, but the pool water was probably in the high-80s and was very comfortable. Its quite a pool, with a great view of Highland Ave, the hollywood hills, downtown LA, as well as the mall. The pool was very large, and could serve the casual wader, as well as a lap swimmer. There were plenty of lounge chairs for sunbathers (and you could get some great sun there!), and were also a handful of private cabanas as well. There is also a cafe that appeared to have served food and beverages, but was closed during our evening swim. Parking -- I would recommend pulling up to the front, unloading your luggage, and then moving the car yourself to the Hollywood/Highland Parking Deck, which is attached to the building. Its $10/day vs the $25/day valet. We were fools and made the mistake of just parking the car, and ended up carting the luggage through the very busy mall until we found our way-- not fun.

Reviews.Title: “Book it! Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: emmieBournemouth
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but praise for this hotel. The rooms were bright, welcoming and well-maintained. We had full buffet breakfast every morning and this consisted of a splendid selection of fruits, cereals, muffins, bagels, bacon, eggs, smoked salmon etc and the excellent chef would cook steaks, pancakes and virtually anything else you wished. On Sundays they have a huge brunch buffet with lots of champagne and a jazz group to entertain the diners. It was Johnny Polanco and his band when we were there and they played some great latin jazz. There was a lovely swimming pool on the roof with lots of sunbeds and plenty of towels! A bar providing good food is also available there. All the staff were very professional and efficient (with smiles) and our bedroom and the communal areas were spotless. The waiting staff were lovely (especially Lily)! The hotel is in a great position adjoining the Highland Centre where there are numerous shops and restaurants. It also links to the Kodak Theatre (Oscars) and the Chinese Theatre. I would not stay anywhere else on my next visit to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: krissiejade
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights over Easter this year. The location is perfect. You are right in the hub of Hollywood with the walk of fame on your doorstep. The metro station is also in the same complex and only 1 stop from Universal. The rooms were very comfortable and clean. We had a very large king room which looked out to the Hollywood sign. Seperate bathroom and a walk in robe with a dressing area. Only problem was the mini bar uses sensors so you can't take things out of the fridge and put your own things in. The hotel can be a bit pricey but if want to stay in the heart of Hollywood I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: suejacken
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth trip to California. I stayed in Beverly Hills one time and the other two times at the hotel across the street from the Chinese Theater. I was actually booked at that hotel but changed to the Renaissance about three weeks before my trip based on a friend's recommendation. My party absolutely loved the Renaissance. We had a great view of the Hollywood sign. Very friendly staff, good breakfast buffet, and very convenient access to the shopping center. The onsite car rental was great too because we just wanted a car for one day to go to the beach. My nephew loved the fact that there were three red carpet events during our stay. He got to meet several of his favorite actors and actresses. Hotel location is great. I am definitely staying at the Renaissance the next time I go to Hollywood,

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel right in the heart of it all!”
Reviews.Author: cburn79
Reviews.Content: This hotel was picked for us so we didn't really have a choice...but if I had a choice, I would have picked this hotel in a heart beat. It sits right in the midst of it all. You can walk around and see many of the important Hollywood sights including the Chinese Theater and the Hollywood Walk of Fame. It has a great rooftop pool and nice exercise room too. The staff was wonderful too. We are coming back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel/great hollywood location”
Reviews.Author: lsnyder
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights during spring break. Excellent location for the attactions that we wanted to see (walk of stars, Hollywood sign - it was great to hike up to!, Wax museum, Beverly Hills, etc.) The room was updated but definitely on the small side for the 4 of us (we had 2 doubles - queen beds would have been better but there isn't room!). Got a good rate for the location because I prepaid our stay. Nice city view out the big window - with a slight view of the Hollywood sign. The bathroom was large. The pool area was very busy and a bit small for a large hotel. The guys are the pool bar were very friendly. While we didn't use it, the fitness room looked more than adequate and the spa looked very nice. The concierge was very friendly and helpful with recommendations on where to go/see during our short stay. There is a Starbucks in the attached shopping gallery which was convenient for our morning coffee. The biggest kudos go out to the valet staff out in front of the hotel. They were on the ball - always opening the door for us, extremely efficient getting/taking our car when we drove up - just great! We ate dinner at Taste (short drive away) which was excellent. Traffic in the general LA area is busy - driving around Beverly HIlls was the hi-light for me - Santa Monica didn't impress me. Worth the short stay during our CA trip but I don't need to return to that area - there are so many nicer places in CA to see!

Reviews.Title: “Top class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gemmalips
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a recent trip around the USA and I have to say its the best hotel I have ever stayed in. The location is superb just mins from all the attractions and the subway station. We were made to feel so important and special by the lovley staff and even got upgraded to a Hollywood sign view as it was my birthday. The bar is lovely and friendly and not expensive considering the standard of the hotel. We will definately return and stay here again and highly recommend it. Real top class accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Chicken Strips served raw at the pool!”
Reviews.Author: Nacn022
Reviews.Content: I am a Marriott Reward Platinum member who was there on business. I decided since it is Spring Break I will bring the family with me so they can enjoy the scenery of Hollywood and go to Universal. While I was working, my wife and kids ordered lunch at the pool and my daughter was served chicken strips that were raw in the middle. This is just unacceptable to me. Nothing from management only an apology from the waiter. Service by the pool was not very friendly. They acted like you were bothering them. Yes, they were taken off the bill...umm thank you. We will not be back. Not to mention we tipped housekeeping every day and yet they failed to complete our housekeeping by taking away all of our towels and saying they would be back......we called and called never came back. Also asked for a wine opener. That came about two hours later. Very unimpressed and we are Marriott lovers but when it comes to this property, I am sorry but they would have to really change the way they treat their dedicated Marriott travelers. Oh, and we also own a very expensive Marriott timeshare in Poipu, Kauai. Travel here at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, central location”
Reviews.Author: katiey424
Reviews.Content: A quick stay, but a great one and the staff really made it all! We arrived early and had asked for early check in, which was granted. High floor, club level access with several food presentations during the day. The room was a suite, we were upgraded on status. A huge space with a king bed, large bathroom with dual sink and huge mirror, plus separate room for shower/toilet. Aveda bathroom products and surprisingly soft towels! The club lounge has great (weekday) breakfast with hot items: eggs, sausage, bacon plus regular continental breakfast selections. A large fridge holds water and soft drinks and is accessible all day. The location is perfect- near Kodak Theater, tons of shopping and restaurants, plus a Starbucks right outside the front door. Only issue, a bad bottle of wine ordered from IRD, was quickly replaced and removed from bill after many apologies.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: tognir
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on a recent trip to the USA and booked based on the good reviews on this site. We wanted to be close to all the touristy bits and the location is excellent, right next to the Walk of Fame, Chinese theatre, Hollywood sign and sightseeing bus. All the members of staff were friendly and helpful, our room was nice with a good view, bed very comfy! The weather was good so we spent some of our time by the pool and also used the fitness gym. The hotel is right next to a shopping centre with restaurants like Hard Rock which was handy. We did the sightseeing tour to Rodeo drive and Venice beach, well worth taking a day to see everything. We were too tired to venture out any further than the restaurants next door in the evening so can't comment on the nightlife. Would definately recommend staying here for a few nights and would return if we visit Hollywood again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the worst customer service of any hotel I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: ConstanTraveler77
Reviews.Content: The good first. The location is central to everything LA. The property is located in the heart of Hollywood and the two blocks of tourist friendly vendors that it has to offer. The rooms are large and some have an excellent view. The neighborhood is very rough at night and not for the faint at heart and certainly not for young children. I would NOT consider this to be a family friendly location. Just a metro train station away, or a short drive (10 min) are the Universal Hilton and Sheraton, these properties are much more children friendly. Now for my humble opinion on the service level that guests will receive for their traveling dollars. I travel an average of 50 nights a year, and have stayed at this property a number of times. Each time I have stayed here I have encounter, lazy, unhappy and useless employees. I have been enticed back on several occassions by promisses of a perfect experience and a new attitude. However, each time I receive increasingly bad customer service and a management team that should be running a resort in Syberia. Resident Manager Sean Steenson is absolutely to blame or the poor quality of service at this property. Coupled with his partner Fredrick, this dynamic-duo of poor customer service dish-up absolutely the worst experience that this frequent traveler has ever received. I will always give a place a second, and in this case a number more chances, however, this time my duty is to you the consumer. I encourage you to avoid the Renaissanc e Hollywood Hotel & Spa at all cost. If you want to stay in this area, stay at one of the properties previously mentioned, or maybe the historical Roosevelt Hotel directly south of this horrible hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: Amyksholiday
Reviews.Content: My friends and I thouroughly enjoyed our stay at Renaissance Hollywood Hotel. The staff were a stand out at this hotel and made our stay memorable. They were always ready to help, from the bell staff to the conceirge. The only negative was that a few times when we rung reception we weren't greeted with the same enthusiasm & friendliness unfotunately. The rooms were very clean and comfortable and we had a nice view of the Hollywood sign, which was great. One thing that we weren't happy with was that it cost $12 for use of wifi per day, which we did not think was very good, as some hotels we have stayed at offer this for free. However, we were able to connect to free wifi at Starbucks, which is part of the hotel complex and very close to the rooms. The hotel is in a great location for tours and sight seeing, and it is so close to the subway, buses and rental cars. There are restaurants and great shops in the complex too. However, if you want to go to sunset boulevard, rodeo drive or classy eating places and clubs you would need to catch a taxi. And if you want a really late snack (after 11pm) you won't find many places open around the hotel during the week. There isn't much nightlife near the hotel on a weeknight. Overall, we enjoyed our stay (mainly due to the service) and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location very Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: fergie n
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location right next to the hollywood walk of fame and about 5 mins from sunset boulevard, youve got all the tourist bits and the luxury of hollywood at your door step.there is may resturants and excursions aboout the hotel. the hotel is very luxury the rooms are very nice but would excpect nice for the amount of money you pay! it doesnt seem like a crazy busy hotel. but if you want the best from hollywood i would defenetly recomend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood gets it right.”
Reviews.Author: Antony T
Reviews.Content: OK; so when the first person you see when you are waiting for the elevator is Ryan Seacrest then you probably get a good picture already. The lobby is spacious; the bar is fully loaded and not a complete rip off. The service is a bit look down the nose style but the rooms are fantastic. Art deco/ modern combination; just stunning. The immediate area has everything; Kodak theatre, Mann's chinese theatre, walk of fame, a little mall/food court, clubs etc. Step a few blocks further on though and the area becomes very seedy. There is a great outdoor pool on the deck and great shots can be taken of the Hollywood sign from the bridge leading from the hotel. A little overpriced. But good for a one night stay if you can afford it. We continued to see about 4 other C-list celebs whilst drinking in the bar. Fortunately none were Snooki. I will say if you are in town for the beaches, it is a long drive. But it is close to freeways so generally quite quick to get elsewhere. Recommended. Enough within touching distance to keep you occupied for a night/day. Maybe combine with a couple of days at a hotel near the coast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jartmacias
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, clean rooms, great location, chic, young, fun... The gentleman at the desk was very nice and courteous as well as informative and helpful, I believe his name is Marcus (front desk). Although I think the hotel does a very good job, I had two challenges with the property... 1. The A/C went off at times, some others it was quite loud... 2. Early in the morning (perhaps around 8:00 AM) we heard someone trying to open the door... it was the cleaning services! I understand their job is critical as they have to turn rooms over for the next arrivals, however, they did not say anything as far as "housekeeping" ... after that first time, my partner when ahead and secure the door, they cleaning services returned 4 TIMES MORE between 8 AM and 10 AM (we checked out around 10:30 AM) doing the same think, trying to open the door without saying anything whatsoever... Aside from those challenges, I would recommend this hotel, right on the heart of Hollywood, close to WH and BH... Nice price for the product! -Jartmacias

Reviews.Title: “Superb Group Coordinator”
Reviews.Author: rxk71
Reviews.Content: Writing in regards: KENDALL WOLFE EVENT & GROUP HOUSING COORDINATOR at Renaissance Hollywood Hotel and Spa. She was very professional, helpful and patient with our requests/needs. During the whole process she was very conversant, polite, and prompt with assisting our group. Ms. Wolfe holds the finest traits of being great group coordinator and beyond doubt an asset to Renaissance Hollywood Hotel and Spa and to the hospitality industry. Simply the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great location , not the best service '”
Reviews.Author: TheGirls17
Reviews.Content: My parter and i were on our 7 week wedding/honeymoon and this was our first destination. After a 14 hour flight from melbourne we really wanted to just go to sleep .. We arrived at 8am in the morning , we have paid for the hotel room for the night before so we would be able to check in straight away , we requested a king size bed. When we got there to check in they said that there was no king size beds available till midday after the rooms had been cleaned. I was clearly less than impressed since we had paid the extra night so we could check in straight away .. So we checked into our room ( a double) slept for a few hours and then went down in the afternoon to get our king size room . We were statying at the hotel for 10 days, we asked how much a suit would be and it was only $50 dollars extra a night to upgrade so we did . The room was great nice and big . The hotel is in a great location , and easy to acess all of the tourist stuff.. We never ate in the hotel as felt that it was far to expensive and there are too many options around that was better value for money . The front door staff where great , reception staff not that welcoming or willing to help, room service was great . We would suggest hiring a car to get around really .. we did that for the last 4 days of our time in LA and enjoyed getting around like a local after we figured out how to drive on the wrong side of the road hehe ! The internet is overpriced and not that fast . .... i suggest going to the near by starbucks and hopping on ot there free wifi ! would i stay here again , yeah i would comfy and great location .. dont take to much notice to the staff u dont have to have that much to do with them !

Reviews.Title: “superb rooms in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Carolnkatie
Reviews.Content: My 8 year old daughter and I decided to stay here as part of a trip travelling through canada and the US.For us this was by far teh most expensive of our hotels but was worth every dollar. we wanted to be central to the Hollywood "buzz" and this certainly was the right place. We were very happy with our room. a later checking meant that the room we were supposed to have was already filled so we were upgraded. The rooms were clean and tidy. The check in process was swift and easy, staff were available to help if required. we chose to rise early and get out and about before the crowds which i was pleased to do. it was great to have a supermarket close by to stock up on fresh produce. our only real disappointment was the fact that the pool was too cold to swim in. whilst the website does not say whether it is heated or not, the expectation is that it is available all year round and it certainly was too cold for my daughter to swim in (a huge disappointment for her) In a hotel this size free wi-fi should really be available to guests. I was also a little surprised to be greeted with a bill for the mini frdige which, given the prices I did not chose to use as the items were all available at a much more reasonable price in the supermarket nearby. nonetheless the charges were reversed, but if i hadn't queried the extra costs it would have automatically been charged to my credit card. to end on a positive note.. the area this hotel is in is fantastic for seeing the Hoillywood sights. we opted to also go to Warner Brothers studio which was 1 minutes away by cab and in my view a highlight of our stay in Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Good service”
Reviews.Author: grovertravels
Reviews.Content: To start: My husband is a Platinum Premier member at Marriott so we stay at Marriott properties all over the country. This was our first stay at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel. We were traveling with my brother and his partner, staying in LA for a night before departing on a cruise. My brother/BIL had never been to LA before so we wanted to stay someplace near all the famous sights. This hotel is an awesome location. We had a beautiful room on the 20th floor overlooking the shopping area below. We had a lovely view of the city/hills and can't complain at all about it. Clean room, comfortable beds, excellent service and exactly the treatment I'd expect from a high-end Marriott property. No problem getting a cab, or problem with valet parking. Will stay here again the next time we visit LA.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, modern hotel in a fabulous tourist spot”
Reviews.Author: Wembleygal
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed when I was met in the lobby by a hotel representative, who presented me with my key, even before I had a chance to check in. I’ve never seen that perk as a Gold Elite member before, and it really made me feel special. I was told that the concierge lounge is closed over the weekend. I found out that it was open the following morning, when I stopped by to see if I could get a bottle of water – I was told that due to a big meeting in-house, it would be open all weekend. Breakfast in the lounge was very good and it had fantastic views of the Hollywood Hills. I had a huge executive suite room on the 16th floor. The bathroom was massive and contained good quality shampoo, conditioner and moisturiser. Shower pressure was okay for a LA hotel. There was a separate vanity area, where you can spread out. I slept like a rock. The pool and gym were excellent and I couldn’t fault the weather during the January heat-wave. The service was of the highest standard, from the doorman to the front desk. You really can’t ask for more while on holiday or business. I would certainly stay at this property again, if I could find a good rate. 4 and a half out of 5 stars. I deserve to be spoilt !

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Pink_bear19
Reviews.Content: The location of the Renaissance is amazing - right next to the Hollywood Highland Centre and with all the attractions of Hollywood on the doorstep. The view from our room was of the hills including the Hollywood sign. Very quiet room and exceptionally comfortable bed. Very friendly and helpful staff. Highly recommend this hotel to others, especially if you want a good location within walking distance of the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel - Great Location- Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: dcdewhurst
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms for a one night stay on December 19, 2010. We were celebrateing my daughters 16th Birthday. It was myself , and 5 teenagers. We had a great time! The rooms are spacious, comfortable and clean. The location is perfect! Next door to Graumanns Chinese, and the Hollywood walk of fame(Stars, names, hand/foot prints) , Kodak Theater and outdoor shopping center. It is in the heart of Hollywood. The hotel is also, close to everything you might want to see while in Los Angeles. Venice Beach, Santa Monica Pier, The Grove Shooping Center/Farmers Market! The hotel was GREAT! I called a head of time to confirm stay and rooms. Everything went as planned. We will definately be back. If you are vacationing in Los Angeles, the Renaissance Hollywood is the BEST hotel to stay in!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and center of everything”
Reviews.Author: shaninew
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my 21st birthday and it was my first time in l.a I went with my best friend. We didn't have to rent a car or anything cuz it was the center of everything. Shopping. Clubs. Everything front desk was amazing if I want to go somewhere they found many way for me to get there. It was crazy pack because it was Halloween but that made it even better. It's a major must book.::)

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in the heart of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: superalpi
Reviews.Content: Good location - it is adjustened to the famous Kodak theatre were Oscar award ceremonies are held. We did not know before coming there that all the Oscar award winners use a special passage to enter this hotel where they give their interviews after they take the award. That is why the hotel itself is a point of interest. It is in the center of Hollywood, next to a shopping center. If you use public transportation it is convenient that the subway station and public bus stop are just around the corner. So you can easily get to downtown LA or Beverly Hills or Santa Monica. The hotel is in good condition though it's far from new. The room we had was not big and the bathroom was tiny. The room style was nothing special. I liked that there were coffee making facilities in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zeus30167
Reviews.Content: Stayed from the 4th January to 8th January, we enjoyed our stay at this hotel, it has everything needed and is very clean and very friendly. A few issues that we picked up were that the restaurant does not open for Dinner only Breakfast and Lunch. The hotel has only one bar and on Thursday nights they have Inde night which live bands play and you cant have a relaxing drink after walking around all day unless you like loud live music, we left the bar and had quiet drinks across the road. The rooms are good very spacious and clean, the bathroom does not have an exhaust fan so any unwanted bathroom smells tend to linger in the room. The hotel is located next door to the Kodak theatre and Hollywood Boulevarde and it is in a great location for tourists. We would stay here again and I would recommend this hotel to my friends. Just one more tip if catching a taxi in LA look for the Taxi emblem on the door of the Taxi if they dont have one on the door they are a pirate taxi and they will rip you off. We found this out the hard way but perhaps the hotel should have a handout given to guests when they check in to explain this and other facts in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as other Renaissance properties I have stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: Jules034
Reviews.Content: Everything was clean, the bed was very comfortable, and the room was vey quiet. Perfect location to take in Hollywood sights. However, the room was smaller than those at the Chicago Renaissance, and the bathroom was pretty pedestrian for this type of property. And the towels were not as plush as they should be. And the only way to get free wifi was to buy something at the lobby cafe. Most good hotels offer free wifi in the lobby, and this one should do the same.

Reviews.Title: “THE hotel for a Hollywood stay-location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoBusyWoman
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at this hotel during the week before Christmas while on a family vacation to Hollywood. There were 6 of us, including 3 children, so we stayed in 2 rooms on an upper floor. The hotel itself is part of the Hollywood and Highland center which includes the Kodak Theater (site of academy awards), restaurants, shopping, and a Metrorail station. The center is also right across the street from Disney's El Capitain Theater. This location added a great deal to the enjoyment of our visit as there were major rainstorms during our stay and we were able to avoid using our car entirely during our stay. Universal Studios (and Universal Citywalk) is easily accessible and just one stop away on the Metrorail. Other Hollywood and downtown locations such as Union Station are also very easily accessible -- not at all typical for LA. We enjoyed dining at the California Pizza Kitchen that is in the Hollywood and Highland Center. While in the hotel, we had access to the "executive club" and found that the breakfast was great. It offered h'or d'oervres and desserts at different times week day evenings and the desserts were great. The staff in the morning was quiet, but friendly but the staff in the seemed to do his best to avoid any acknowledgement of the guests' presence (a simple "good evening" or "welcome" would go a long way). The hotel itself is very large, well run, and quite clean. The beds, though, particularly the "king" size bed, seemed smaller than standard and it was difficult to see how 2 adults could fit in the "double" in our other room. The The pool is beautiful, but it was raining and cold that week and there was no jacuzzi available. The Spa is prominently featured, but my mother-in-law was disappointed when she went there to investigate and was told that they had steam but also no jacuzzi. I was warned by Marriott reservations about the $29 daily valet parking charge, and, when we arrived, they were very clear about specifying that it would be $29 and we'd have to self park in the center lot to try to avoid this. I am not clear on how much that would be, but it wasn't that close and we were in the midst of a major rainstorm, so I was fine with paying the $29/day and considered myself fairly warned. Hollywood has come a long way in recent years, but there's still an underlying grittiness and seediness in the areas surrounding the major attractions. We tried using tripadvisor's recommended restaurants nearby and found ourselves in a place with reasonable pizza that was also attracting a local non-paying population that families with small children really don't want to be walking amidst.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expected and more!”
Reviews.Author: AnaRandyGallant
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night, Dec, 1,2010, on our way back from our honeymoon in Fiji. We did alot of research on here. We almost booked a few times with other hotels but then were discouraged by poor reviews. Thank god we did our research cause the Renaissance did not disappoint! The location is prime in the heart of hollywood. The room was very stylish. We had a view of the hollywood sign. The staff were friendly. The concierge was extremely helpful. They recommended the Geisha house for supper. The food was fantastic! There was a food tasting party in the hotel lounge. I swear we saw the music producer,Timberland, sitting there. We would highly recommend the Renaissance Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and comfortable accomodation”
Reviews.Author: bjsully
Reviews.Content: Being in the heart of Hollywood and being able to access all attractions. This was clean and well appointed hotel, that met all the requirements for our family. It was central for transport to all attractions, food and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Red Carpet Treatment - Exceeded all Expectations”
Reviews.Author: ktraveler2
Reviews.Content: Before we arrived they sent an email saying they were getting ready to give us the Red Carpet Treatment. At the time I thought it was clever but they far exceeded that. The location alone is enough reason to stay here but the staff is fantastic. They really are exceptional. Mario checked us in, gave us coupons for free lattes and got us upgraded. Staying here was a highlight of our vacation!!****Highly Recommended****

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: ASWh
Reviews.Content: Our second stay in Hollywood at the Renaissance and another great trip. The hotel is in a fantastic location right next to the Kodak Theatre so great for sightseeing. Paid a nominal fee for an upgrade to a suite with a separate living room and a brilliant view across the city. Would be happy to recommend and will definitely stay here again on the next trip. Not quite warm enough for a swim but the rooftop pool must have one of the best views in the world. Great gym too, very well equipped. Only disappointment was the restaurant which had a slightly complicated menu (same things offered at two different prices) with zero atmosphere. Other better options nearby. Excellent and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy - again”
Reviews.Author: JulesOZBrisbane
Reviews.Content: I originally stayed at this hotel in 2007 and returned for a 4 night stay in early December 2010. I chose this hotel for the location and it really is awesome! In the middle of Hollywood, everything is nearby with close access to the Metro (train and bus) and a Hertz office on-site. I found the service to be great and the restaurant staff to be excellent (as was the food). I stayed my two teenage sons (17 & 19) and will do so again when we next visit LA.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: SCSubSpouse
Reviews.Content: Rooms are not quiet. When we checked in the person at the counter said she would upgrade us to a city view, no charge. When we got to our room we were "not" in a city view and there was a constant rolling sound coming from the service elevator. We asked to have our room changed and they said they had no other rooms available but for $50.00 we could upgrade. We suffered all night with the sounds of the elevator, the people in the hall, the rooms next door. Awful.

Reviews.Title: “location location location....and service:)”
Reviews.Author: trip-together
Reviews.Content: We are a couple in our mid 40's Our stay was from Nov 26-27th...one night. We arrived in our Hertz rental car .....from Temecula and San Diego Calif....at around 12 noon. an aside....Doing some research...we discovered that Hertz had a rental place withing the hotel...so dropping the car would be most convenient hiring with them....we had wonderful service form LA airport to San Diego rental with Hertz...we have never rented with them prior....we had upgrades on both rentals and good service...we normally rent with Avis...we will rent with Hertz again...make sure you join as a privelege member...it is free...and worth it:) At check in....this is what either makes a property a 5 or 4 star to me.....the service was incredible. Friendly, efficient....and just plain wonderful. We were offered an upgrade to a higher room....we have points saved with Marriot...part of this chain...and a member card...again free...not sure if this made a difference...but the room....offered a special view of the Hollywood sign...very memorable. the room we received...a king as requested....was extremely spacious....but were told so when we received th upgrade. The furnishings were a bit basic...and could have been better....but the size and views of the room made up for it. The bathroom in this particular room had a make-up/dressing area and then bathroom....bathroom had basic white subway tiling...bath was very ordinary...but clean. We did a tour here recommended by the concierge...LA tours...guide was very informative...as we were just in Hollywood for 1 day....we wanted to see as much as we could in a very short time.... I am a lover of old Hollywood...the 30's, 40's....not much here to see/learn about unfortunately...they have not much left to salute those who made Hollywood...sad.... The hotel is attached to Kodak theatre...where the Academy Awards are held....and you literally walk outside a block and turn...and you are in the middle of it all....Walk of Fame, Hollywood Museum...(Max Factor Building)...which we toured...did have some old Hollywood pics and memorabilia...did the Tussand's Wax Museum...great time for a cheesey thing to do:) we walked into Musso and Frank's ....an original restaurant of old Hollywood still left...but the street here was getting seedy...and if was a bit stuffy inside...in terms of breathing I mean...had a hard time breathing...have asthma....the menu was not our cup of tea either...and pricing high...but seemed friendly...and cool to think the stars dined here... We decided to venture to the original Hotel where the Academy Awards were first held. The Roosevelt...which was actually recommended by someone here on trip advisor...it also has an amazing location. It is an old Hotel with lots of History.... older decor...very decadent...The restaurant (which was recommended by our tour guide) is known for its Hamburgers and wine. This was our second restaurant that had this idea on our trip to California....:)....so...we indulged.... The Sweet Potato fries were perfect...not soggy...and full of flavour...the hamburger was great...very big ...a bit too big to finish...but great....service was happy and friendly...we sat in read leather booths...the little restaurant was jam packed...decor...dark red walls and painted red tin ceiling...very cool...felt like I was transported back in time... We walked though the hotel...it is supposed to be haunted on the 9th floor we were told...and there was a Marilyn Munro mirror that hung here that was supposedly haunted...it is now in a museum...but....they do keep Marilyn's room...where she used to stay...we were very priviledged to see it....felt very strange once inside of it....very neat room...kind of eerie...but what a memory!!!!! We then went back to our hotel and walked through the lobby to the adjoin to see where the red carpet area is..(Academy awards) .there is a shopping mall here with plenty of take out restaurant choices ....seeing where the Academy Awards are held was very memorable... Back at our hotel at about 10pm....the concierge asked if we enjoyed our day....so friendly...:) the next morning we were flying home...as we are with Air Canada...and they offer no meals what so ever unless you pay $10 for a sandwich etc...we decided to order room service....It was prompt...and again the fellow was very friendly. The meal was very good...eggs perfectly cooked, as was the bacon ...the juice was lovely and coffee good...pricey...but good. We booked a shuttle to the airport here....save $$$ by not taking a cab.... down to the lobby...again...friendly....bigger lobby area...with a starbucks at the entrance.... I would say if you are staying for a short stay...this is your hotel...clean, updated, friendly....and at $189.00 per night....CAA rate...we think this is good value for the location.... Valet parking here is $29.00 Parts of the Hollywood area are quite seedy...and we did not feel comfortable by 9pm walking to the end of ....where the stars' plaques on the sidewalk were ( to read the names)...during the day...I felt fine. There is a lot of plastic here...faces, bodies...this was shocking...even though I expected it....but just FYI...in the Beverly Hills area....etc...

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for Evian Water scam”
Reviews.Author: scuterboy5
Reviews.Content: Two attempts by hotel staff to replace water that we did not drink - water was knocked on floor by housekeeping (unopened). Front desk was notified and assured us that we would not be charged for bottled water priced at $6+ per bottle. Upon check out verified that we would not be charged for water. Credit card bill statement included water purchase for 2 days. Seems a bit shady... The food/room service was wonderful, especially pizza. Location good. You can avoid the $29 daily valet parking charge by self parking for $10 per day at garage next door.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Scorpionsholidays
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on stop-over back to UK. Very modern, clean hotel. More of a business hotel but everything was fine. Room was very nice overlooking swimming pool. Staff friendly and helpful. Metro station 5 mins away so ideal for getting around.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service.”
Reviews.Author: shafet
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights and had a fantastic experience. The hotel is very modern with a great pool area for Hollywood. The service at this place was great, and the spa there is wonderful! (pricey, but wonderful). It s close to hollywood blvd -about a block or two away.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: guitar9504
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect location for many activities. It is in the heart of Hollywood. You can walk a few hundred feet to the Kodak Theatre. It is only minutes to downtown L.A. The staff was very helpful and the Hotel was very clean. It will be my Hotel of choice for future trips to Southern California.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lonaldp78
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a number of Marriott's over the years and this has to be one of the tops,The room was clean, up-to-date and the views let me look over to Hollywood Blvd and Los Angeles. I was greeted with a complimentary upgraded suite, which was a nice suprise. All the staff are willing to help you out with any questions you might have about the general area. The Chinese Theatre is within a 3 minute walk as well a number of other sights. All in all I think the that hotel is a decent value and would probably be more enjoyable if I was traveling on vacation rather than work

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in hollywood”
Reviews.Author: atontao
