My one complaint is that we had to pay $30 dollars a day for valet parking and tip the guys every time we took the car out and brought it back. It certainly adds up! However, the parking attendants were such nice guys that we it did not change our feelings about being at this wonderful hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting the full Hollywood vibe!

Reviews.Title: “perfect!”
Reviews.Author: rubissaphir
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 12 day holiday in California and this hotel was really the best (much better then the Bellagio, Las Vegas for example). We booked two classical rooms and we got an enormous room with a connecting classical room for the children. For that big room we were probably uprated but they didn't say anything at check in. (So I'm not sure about that) When I say big I mean really huge. Very quiet also and very comfortable beds. Location is great as other reviews say, that we knew. We rented a car and we used the parking next door, much cheaper then valet parking. This hotel is just perfect if you're looking for a great, easy hotel to visit Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Terpsfan72
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Renaissance for first time on a to Hollywood in July. I had stayed at Roosevelt on every trip I've taken to LA/Hollywood area (5 times before) and while I've enjoyed most stays there I have to stay the Renaissance blows it out of the water as far as rooms and service. Maybe not as "hip" as the Roosevelt, but had a great three night stay at a alright price (your gonna overpay for anything in area of course). Stayed in a 622 square foot suite and room had nice decor and was very clean and room service was great as well. Also cool to stay there since it's a 5 minute elevator trip and walk to Hollywood and Highland for shopping and food. If you need info on anything in the area the front desk staff were incredibly helpful as well. Also have rental car right there in the hotel, was nice and easy to set up. Have a really cool pool area too. Had a great stay and would highly recommend the hotel for your next or first trip to LA/Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “This was awesome”
Reviews.Author: love2travel0714
Reviews.Content: We went to California for the Rose Bowl. We are not huge fans of big cities and we really didn't know anything about the hotel we were booking but we got the recommendation from some friends. This hotel was awesome!!! We had such a blast. It was right next door to the Kodak Theater and all of the fun. Their service was so great. Any little thing we asked for we got right away. We just had the best time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!...”
Reviews.Author: Spillthemoment
Reviews.Content: but if you are staying here for a certain type of atmosphere, look somewhere else. The location is great!, right off of Hollywood Blvd in the Kodak Theatre complex. This is the place to be if you want to experience that side of Hollywood. The rooms though, left a little to be desired. Cleanliness could have been at a much higher level (I would expect this at a Renaissance).. and the rooms, although the decor and furnishings are designed to be sleek and modern.. felt a bit boring and uninspired. Quite bland. So I would definitely recommend this hotel for its location but if you are looking to be wowed by your room, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for visiting Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: LynnDB
Reviews.Content: I debated where to stay in Los Angeles; Beverly Hills, Santa Monica, or Hollywood? We made the right decision when we chose the Renaissance Hotel. My husband, our 3 kids (ages 10,12,14) were upgraded to an executive suite (room 901) that overlooked the Hollywood sign. The suite had 2 king beds and one sleeper sofa. It was huge! The service was amazing and the breakfast buffet was excellent. They had everything imaginable at the buffet, including a person standing there making fresh carrot juice. You are right in the middle of all the action and still close to Beverly Hills and Santa Monica. Being in Hollywood is like being at Times Square in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, great room, great shopping, great eateries”
Reviews.Author: Alioopo18
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the best location for Hollywood. Very close to MRT station to get to Universal Studios. Local buses and sightseeing buses stop just in front of Graumans Chinese Theatre, right next to the hotel. The shops in Hollywood and Highland are great as are the restaurants. Our room was really nice, had a great view of the Hollywood sign and was very quiet. We felt quite safe walking around at night, I had my 70 year old Mother travelling with us and she felt quite OK to walk back to the Hotel on her own when she was getting tired. We thoroughly enjoy staying here and if had the chance would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Breathing on recycled air”
Reviews.Author: VWT
Reviews.Content: What we liked: location, rooms size, restaurant service (spot on), breakfast buffet (excellent), room service, view, pool area; it is a quiet hotel working on 10% not more capacity mon-wed, gets a bit busy at the weekend; sound-proofed rooms What we did not like: car park prices, wifi prices, YOU CANNOT OPEN THE WINDOWS and you can end up breathing air coming from other people's toilets, bathroom fans do not work (although you will be told you are wrong) ; you cannot pay for all the meals in advance because they expect their daily tips of 15-20%; pool water: COLD! Advice for UK travellers: book your car hire online as local prices are a rip-off; exchange your money prior to arrival otherwise you will find only one or two places that exchange and will rip you off FOR SURE!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: see-more-do-more
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is wonderful. Luxurious rooms (I stayed with my two teenagers in an Executive room which had 2 beds and a pull out sofa bed). The staff are amazing. The location is perfect for all sight seeing, restaurants, shows etc. They helped with tour bookings, restaurant bookings, maps/directions etc. All services were superb and surprising well priced (laundry/room service etc). I would definitely stay there again and with my teenagers. It is a long way from Disneyland and from Magic Mountain. About 45 - 90 minutes depending on traffic. Cab fare would be $130 or more. There are no public transport services to either destination easily accessible for a day to either theme park. The Doorman (not the concierge) is the go to guy. He negotiated a Town car (chauffeur) for the day for us cheaper than a cab. We ended up hiring the guy twice and we created our own private tours of everything for about the same price as standard tourist operator. It is safe to walk around the neighbourhood. You can see the Hollywood sign from your hotel room. The Hollywood bowl is one block. The Kodak theatre is part of the hotel and Stars walk of Fame is around the corner as are all the major Hollywood attractions. Universal studios is one 10 minute subway ride away for $1.25 and perfectly safe and clean. And if you are that way inclined you will be able to see a few celebrities at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Don't get Adjoining Room”
Reviews.Author: lcat77
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was decent, great location and the staff was AMAZING. The concierge had great restaurant recommendations! The gym was amazing - 5 treadmills with tv's, bikes, elliptical machines, water, towels, weights, apples! My only complaint - I agree with the reviewer that mentioned not to get an adjoining room. We had one and we found our neighbors VERY loud.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location and Exceptional Staff!”
Reviews.Author: SeaTravelTime
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in November and enjoyed every bit of it. The hotel's location is the best. You can walk to everything and/or take a quick cab. The staff was always attentive and professional and made sure everything was taken care of from the Housekeepers, Housemen, to the Front Desk and Valet staff. Way to go! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance Hollywood Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChrisCall
Reviews.Content: Great location, great service from the moment we arrived and fantastic rooms! The first place I'd stay if I returned to LA / Hollywood!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location...pity about the noisy air-conditioning”
Reviews.Author: md200910
Reviews.Content: I recently picked this Hotel due to its location. After 4 days in Vegas and about 2 hours sleep I was looking forward to relaxing in LA for 3 days at the end of my holiday. I booked on line at US $150 a night and arriving in the evening was given a room on Level 3. After trying to go sleep I soon found out that the A/C plant and equipment was directly located outside my window and noise so loud it was like trying to sleep on a 747 airplane! After an hour of this I asked reception to change me to another room and after telling them I was on Level 3, was immediately given another room (obviously I wasn't the first person to do this). I was given a room on level 20, larger room, cleaner and quieter! Whilst this is listed as "4 star hotel" has pool & gym, the rooms don't really live up to a 4 star rating. For one the air-conditioning is thru a wall vent that runs up the middle of building not ducted ceiling a/c which made the room a/c rather noisy. The bathrooms are average (white tiled floor and combined bathtub/shower). The one plus is the widescreen HD TV. The Hotel charged $174 to my credit card which I have asked them to remove (I did not use any additional facilities) just another anoying thing - I am yet to receive a response. Overall except for its location, this Hotel was somewhat of a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay at the Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: KBaldemi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during Thanksgiving weekend. The rooms were tidy and service was good too. The only thing I didn't like was the flashing in-room smoke detector and the sound of the elevators nearby. Earplugs can drown out the elevator sounds, but he flashing smoke detector was like having a flashing beacon in your bedroom - yikes. The flashing wasn't apparent during daylight hours, but as soon as you turned off the lights for bedtime the light show would begin. The location is awesome too , walking distance to the El Capitan Theatre, historical Roosevelt Hotel, Mann's Chinese Theatre, Kodak Theatre, Jimmy Kimmel Live Studios, Madame Tussaud's Wax Musuem and the shops and restaurants of the Highland and Hollywood Complex.

Reviews.Title: “Great tourist location; be sure not to get an adjoining room”
Reviews.Author: ABtraveller
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location for the Walk of Fame, Grauman's Chinese Theatre, and to see Jimmy Kimmel Live taping. The check in experience was a wow. Even walked me to the elevator. Room has a cool 2 piece desk - the lower portion on rollers - and good quality desk chair (even the arms adjusted). Great light fixtures. LG flat panel TV. Attractive large art prints on the walls. Gold tones throughout the room - with a darker gold accent wall. I had a fabulous view of the Hollywood sign. A bar-fridge is free upon request (and there's a bit of room to put your own stuff). Hot water was an issue both at night and the next morning. The metal garbage cans once filled with ice make great coolers - although there is a neat ice bucket. Side tables have room under the glass to store your items. My disappointment is the sound from my neighbours. I could hear the actual conversations; I forgot to request a non adjoining room - as suggested in other reviews here. The 24 hour fitness room has 4 each of elliptical, bike, and treadmills. The best built in TVs ever. And the treadmills have built in fans. Just outside - in a tented area - is other cardio equipment. The outdoor heated pool is a good depth; I had it to myself at 5pm. There's a "Fresh & Easy" grocery store about 4 blocks away. Hertz onsite is open 7 days a week. The attached mall is very modern with an emphasis on the outdoors.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: julietanne
Reviews.Content: Pretty touristy location and unremarkable hotel. I stayed here because it was only two metro stops to my office in LA, but what I saved on cabs staying in hotels elsewhere in the city, I spent on the internet access in the room. $13 a day, which feels a little unrealistic these days. Also, I fail to understand why the hotel's website has rooms decked out in funky, bright colours. No pictures posted here, nor the room I stayed in, has decor in anything but white and cream. Where are these rooms?? If you want to be in the thick of Hollywood - Walk of Fame, touristy shops everywhere you look, right next to a mall etc - this is for you. As a business hotel, I'm not sure it makes the grade next to other places I've stayed in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: tommypee1
Reviews.Content: Were here for five days and nothing bad to say. Everything went fine, staff was amazing and location is the best there is. Rooms were clean and everything in the room seem to be renewed. Breakfast was good too. Absolutely nothing bad to say. Two thumbs up. Rented a car at the hotel (Hertz) and there is a Hollywood Highlands parking lot just a few steps away, if you don't want to use vallet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location!”
Reviews.Author: NixNix
Reviews.Content: Location just right to see everything easlily, many trips leave from Chinese Theatre nearby. We had view of Hollywood sign from room & the Walk of fame is just a few steps away. The Metro to get to Universal is also very close by. The shopping centre has restraunts too so lots of places to eat. The Hotel is large & very modern. The rooms comfortable but the double beds in triple room were too small, 4 feet perhaps? Ok for one person, not 2. (And we are not big!) The pool area is small but clean and pleasant. Could see someone famous as they do stay here, we saw the Village People going off to Hollywood Bowl from here!

Reviews.Title: “Location was the selling point”
Reviews.Author: czardas
Reviews.Content: You just can't beat the location when travelling and aren't hiring a car. You literally have the Hollywood walk of fame on your doorstep, Gruemans Chinese Theatre and Kodak theatre, not to mention being attatched to the Highland shopping complex. Our room was large, with a city view which personally gave your more to look at, views of the Hollywood sign can be seen from the Highland Mall for free, so why pay more for it with your room. The bathroom was clean and the beds soft with excellent linen. Although I didnt' use it, the pool area looked large and was buzzing with people on a Sunday afternoon. Looked like all the "in" crowd were gathered there. The price is a little steep but in the end I couldn't of come up with a better hotel for the location. Would definatley stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but pricey”
Reviews.Author: phdtravel
Reviews.Content: Connected to Hollywood & Highland. So great location for Hollywood sightseeing or attending a Kodak function. Bit pricey. Simply elegant rooms and bathrooms but not very lux. Restaurant expensive but a lot of dining next door. If you need to save money but be in that area there is a Holiday Inn a 5 min walk up the road which is basic but cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location and Style!”
Reviews.Author: Louis B
Reviews.Content: This is my second time at this hotel! It is a pleasure to come back to the Renaissance property! What a great location! Right by all the Hollywood attractions! Great for sightseeing and shopping! Great dinning around! I recommend lemon soufle pancakes for breakfast! The rooms are stylish, and all have amazing views of hollywood! The pool on the roof is the best, with great view of the hollywood sign!

Reviews.Title: “This is what you get for $300 a night?”
Reviews.Author: TravlnMan
Reviews.Content: First, the pluses... The location is great if you want to explore Hollywood. The hotel is literally half a block off Hollywood Boulevard. Everything you could ever need is within walking distance. The place was mostly spotless, and I certainly have no complaints in regards to cleanliness. Where I can complain is in the service department. While folks were nice enough, the competence level was lacking. The hotel could not find my reservation (which was made over a month in advance) and did not want to give me the government rate for which the room was reserved. They wanted to charge me the full $299 rate for the same room. The guy working the desk seemed to have difficulty understanding that I didn't think I should have to pay full price since I was there for a conference being held in the very same hotel, and I had reserved well in advance at the lower rate. Eventually the matter was resolved, after I had already been charged for the full price, and the difference was refunded to my credit card. When I got to my assigned room, I could not believe they actually charged $300 a night for THAT. The room was little more than a standard hotel room, with a bed, a desk, a television and a bathroom. I have had one bedroom suites, with full amenities included, for one third of the $300 nightly rate for this room. Granted, they were not in Hollywood, but is Hollywood really an excuse for such exorbitant rates? The view from my room was also horrid. The window looks out onto the roof, and all of the air conditioning equipment for the third floor. My view was of the hotel wall and a roof access door, with several soggy cardboard boxes strewn about. Someone obviously didn't consider that the area could be seen from the room windows. Also, the flea-bag motel next door had me concerned that I might be witness to a crime if I watched long enough. The fact that the hotel charges $13 a day for high speed internet access, which most hotels I have stayed in provide for free these days, was just an added insult. It seems that this hotel caters to people who have plenty of money and don't mind parting with it quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: LawsonsScotland
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel,the rooms,staff and location were all perfect,the only bad thing i could say is having to pay $12 for use of the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance Hollywood Needs New Management”
Reviews.Author: LovetoTravelAdvisor
Reviews.Content: Amazing location -- poor follow through and management. Renaissance dissapointed us by: - Not sending bellman even requested 3 times when parking valet and arriving in a wheel chair with 3 children. - Taking 1 hour to check in because the reservation was lost in their computer system. They eventually found it after helping several other customers 'over my head' due to my wheel chair status. - Only having 1 person work the front desk on a Saturday night at 100% occupancy - No room service after 11 pm? - No room service in the morning after 11 am -- sleep in on a Sunday and want breakfast? No eggs for you! - No water in the room -- no mini bar -- no way to buy water due to room service closed after 11 pm and tap water tasting like minerals - Not having an ADA complaint room due to computer error -- is okay. Saying we normally have a room ready for 'you people' -- not okay. - Pulling up the car from valet and putting our luggage in it then taking it BACK and parking it on check out and then losing the car for 20 minutes. Not okay. - Maids opening the door and coming in the room 3 times in the early morning to clean when DND sign is up .... really not okay. We put the high lock on and they still kept coming and banging into it -- isn't once enough to know we are sleeping? - Not enough pillows, towels, etc. We used to love this hotel. Not sure if it is the bad economy or bad management...but why cut of revenue streams like room service...bottled water in the room (any easy $5)...and limiting valets, door men, etc. who will work for tips? Sad because this is a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Shaz_2206
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful in every way. Friendly staff, luxurious and clean rooms, superb location, great shopping precinct, nearby restaurants were fantastic, there really isn't anything that I can fault it on. It is a little expensive, but then you are in Hollywood. If I get back to Hollywood I will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Renaissance standards.”
Reviews.Author: JB2go
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in several Marriott Renaissance hotels in the UK and have consistently been delighted. These hotels felt like true luxury accomodations. The staffs, rooms, restaurants and surroundings made us feel really special. The Renaissance Marriott fell far short of what we have come to expect -- and enjoy -- in this class of hotel. Where to begin? The rooms were fine. the service was fine. But this is the point. It was all 'fine,' but never exceptional. Some particulars: - the rooms lacked any information about what the hotel offered, how to obtain needed services, what the neighborhood had in store, local maps, etc. - the hotel charged a $29!!! daily fee for 'valet' parking, which was the only type of parking available. This meant a delay every time we needed the car (a 'must' in LA) and also required a tip every time we wanted to drive somehwere. - you'd think that a luxury accomodation would offer some, er, luxuries. But everything -- from Internet access to daily newspapers to parking (see above) cost extra. Bottom line: the hotel is fine, but not a Marriott Renaissance. We expect better from this class of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointingly average for the price - service lousy”
Reviews.Author: mountaineermom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. Location is good if you need to be in the heart of Hollywood. Highland Center gets old after a few days, and the neighborhood around it would be scary if I was alone at night (I went places with a group of people). I was not in the room much, thank goodness. Every day I had to call and request washcloths--none in the room--and wait 90+ minutes for them to arrive. It became like a game to see if I'd get any after my room was cleaned or not. Several days the trash was not emptied--I ended up setting it out in the hall and someone took care of it. The bartender at the ppol had a foul mouth and talked loudly. Several families were at the pool and if I had my family there, I would have been offended. I had to stay at this hotel for a conference, but would try somewhere else for more charm and courtest. Not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great central location”
Reviews.Author: flowerpower78
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week with my husband in May. Excellent hotel attached to Hollywood and Highland centre and Kodak theatre. Our room was massive with great views over the Hollywood hills & Hollywood sign. Lovely roof top pool and good gym. Staff were very pleasant and helpful. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance. Easy access to Universal Studios- one stop on the underground, station beside hotel. We hired a car for 2 days to visit friend in Newport Beach but if you didn't want to drive this hotel gave easy access to all the sites by public transport and the open top tour buses are round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “once again, good stay”
Reviews.Author: fizzengland
Reviews.Content: this is our second stay here, first in 2006, once again, a good stay, no wait at check in, very polite, infact our checkin clerk took us over to the elevators, called the lift for us and pressed the button for our floor!! how is that for service, we were only staying in a regular room this time, not club!! room good, very bright and new, large well equiped bathrom, nice to see new ,very large flat screen tv, but the location cannot be beaten in this area, ajoins the large shopping mall, everything you want there, good food etc, direct access on to hollywood blvd, walk of stars, Graumans chinese theatre, a few mins to hollywood bowl, griffith park, santa monica mountains, Mullhulland av, lv this area, pleas e feel free to contact me privatley as we have extensive knowledge of this area regarding things to do, luv to help

Reviews.Title: “Very Overrated!”
Reviews.Author: Canadian_Beach_Baby
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed here for 4 nights last month. Hotel is in a great location..very close to all the "touristy stuff". With the amount of money we're paying for the stay, I can't believe we were charged $ 13 for WIFI and $ 29 for valet parking every night! And also, when we booked our room on Marriott.com, we are suppose to get $50 credit towards a spa service @ Spa Luce but we never got a voucher! Front Desk didn't know about the promotion. And on the day that we're checking out, the hotel was super busy because Lebron James and his entourage were staying there. But the usually efficient valet service came to a halt for regular hotel guests! We waited almost an hour to get our car after check out because the valet attendants were busy attending to high profile guest. very disappointing!!!! I wonder if this is in their "Marriott Policy"!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, room and location”
Reviews.Author: cindybelm
Reviews.Content: Great location for exploring Hollywood or traveling to other parts of LA. Bus and metro right around the corner. Kodak Theater, Graumann's Chinese and shops and restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Pampered and Pleased!”
Reviews.Author: TravelJem
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for our 20th Anniversary trip and couldn't have been more pleased. We didn't want stuffy but we wanted excellence and found it here. To start off, the staff was delightful. We were able to get the King bed that we had asked for. The room faced the Hollywood sign. I realize that they consider the rooms that have a "city view" to be their better rooms but we were thrilled with the view. We were able to leave the curtains open and wake up in the morning to the sun shining on the hills. The location was perfect for site seeing and great for shopping. Several restaurants are in the Hollywood and Highland Shopping center that is connected to the hotel. Right next to Graumann's Chinese Theater and across the street from Jimmy Kimmel Live! We were able to jump in the standby line and see the show. The bed was comfy and everything was clean. The restaurant was great for breakfast. We found the breakfast buffet to be simple but very good. Both the valet and bell staffs were conscientious and polite. John the concierge was extremely helpful. We want to come back and enjoy this great find! I had a small issue with the turn-down service on the last night and it was taken care of quickly and appropriately. I was very impressed that they were quick to correct any mistake no matter how small.

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance Hollywood Very Over-Rated!”
Reviews.Author: dmdifalco
Reviews.Content: In the heart of Tinsel Town lies the very over-rated Renaissance Hollywood Hotel. It was ok but I wasn't thrilled with anything about it. The only thing I found that was an asset about staying there is that it is within walking distance of many of Hollywood's main attractions. The building is old and the decor is very plain. If you are a smoker...you have to ride the elevator down and go outside. Nothing plush or very exciting about the hotel. Hard to believe that actors and actresses flock here for the Oscar's. Maybe I expected too much?

Reviews.Title: “Connections...”
Reviews.Author: TC1968
Reviews.Content: On the positive side: this hotel enjoys a great location, just on the corner of North Highland and Hollywood Boulevard, right where all the look-alikes hang around doing their stuff. The windows are pretty well soundproofed, so the 24 hour traffic isn’t an issue. Rooms on the north side of the hotel enjoy a great view of the Hollywood sign. The rooms are quite sizeable and well appointed with flat screen TVs with a very handy gizmo that allows you to easily play portable DVDs/laptops/MP3, through it, if you can’t find anything better to do with yourself, in Hollywood. So, why so few stars? Well, the room that I was in had connecting doors, which afforded absolutely no sound insulation. Now I hate these. If you are staying with family members, and they’re in the next room you can get hold of them fairly easily, via the corridor. Connecting doors aren’t used by 99% of guests, but mean that you can hear what next door are ordering from room service. Sadly, my next door neighbours were highly excitable (and loud) fratboys and some hired “friends” on an LA weekend, which made life a bit of a misery. My other half put in a call to security and they showed up pretty quickly and asked our neighbours to move the part-ay out. Sadly, and possibly predictably, this made them worse and they started trying to knock the connecting door in. By now it’s about 3:30am. I went down to reception and they put us into another room, we just left our stuff in our old room – planning to return and pack (we were flying back to the UK the next morning). I reckon in a one star Hollywood flop-house you’d be kicked out if you tried to attack a fellow guest’s room, having already had a warning from security. Not here, though. When we got back to our original room our friendly neighbours were still bellowing banal rubbish at one another. Not a massive issue as we were packing up and leaving, but I would question whether they really know how to run a hotel. I always think you can tell a lot about a hotel by taking a look at the lobby in the middle of the night. In this place there were parties of squealing girls running around with bottles. In the lobby itself there were a few guys crashed out on the sofas. I guess it’s Hollywood so they think it’s OK, but it’s not a place that I’ll be back to.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: Samax
Reviews.Content: we just returned from our trip in the USA and one of the Hotel we enjoyed mostly was the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel. The location is just perfect for a short stay like our one was in L.A. Just attached at the Kodak Theatre, the Walk of Fame and the hustle und bustle of Hollywood. Rooms are pretty large, very clean, though the bathroom is a little bit small fot the category. As usual, on higher level Hotel (and cannot understand why) you have to pay for the Wifi in room around 13$ per day (from noon to noon) or at the business center it cost you 0,30$ per minute. You can get a very good service in the lobby, right at the concierge desk, where there is a Computer which gives you the opportunity (free of charge) to check you flight, make on lone chek in and print the boarding passes. Guest service at the Hotel is outstanding: really great, and not only because they gave us a late check out unitl 3pm free of charge. As well we arrived quite early (at 10 am) and they gave us the room immediatly. Valvet parking is 29$ per night , at least not cheap but not expensive as well. Excellent service, car was there immediatly when requested. Very easy to reach and easy to go to the main attraction of LA (Beverly Hills, Universal, Santa Monica), must say an excellent choice for the city.

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional and untrained staff”
Reviews.Author: onechase
Reviews.Content: I am one irate customer. I stayed at this hotel for convenience because I needed to pick up a family member with a late arrival at Burbank airport. Around 1:30 a.m., my brother left our room's door slightly ajar to go downstairs to purchase something to drink. While I was sleeping, hotel security entered my room, woke me up and announced that because dogs were not permitted at the hotel, I would need to leave immediately or I would be escorted out by the police. My dog is a service animal whose access to public accommodation is protected by federal law. I said this to the staff, and they demanded that they see paperwork, despite the fact that I had shown the paperwork upon check-in, and that it was close to 2 a.m. and I was half-sleeping and wearing only my underwear. I have never been treated with such utter disrespect at any hotel, anywhere in the world. The staff were self-righteous, unapologetic and had apparently never heard of the Americans With Disabilities Act. Shame on Marriott for allowing their hotel to be run by such untrained and unprofessional staff. I cannot recommend a hotel that permits such blatant invasion of privacy and disrespect for disabled people. I simply cannot believe that such a reputable chain of hotels could permit this to happen.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of Hollywood: if you want to be a tourist, this Hotel is for you.”
Reviews.Author: JillDerry
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 4 person room. Positives: spacious comfortable room. Great view right over Hollywood with a clear view of the Hollywood sign from the large windows along one wall. No fridge but provided one free on request. Very central: in most of the tourist tours take you round places/exibits within 300m of the Hotel! Near the Pantages, the El Capitan Theater, Mann's Chinese, the walk of fame etc. Free gym, with apple provided each visit. Negatives: None really, except cost of taxi to airport- $70- from Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Everything we needed for one night on business”
Reviews.Author: TrueBlueGin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance last weekend on a quick one night business trip. We got it on Priceline for $125, which we thought was a fair price. This hotel had everything we required, including efficient (although cold) check in service at the front desk, nicely appointed lobby, lobby bar and a rather expensive, not very good restaurant. The service in the bar, the restaurant and the room service were all friendly and fast, however the food at the restaurant was left wanting. The lobby is, as others have pointed out, more posh than the rooms, and especially the hallways, but once in the room it was adequate, with excellent sound proofing, very comfortable bed and linens, nice new flat screen TV, in room wireless internet (for a fee). The parking was easier with the valet, for only $5 more it was worth it, and we found it friendly and efficient. I saw a business center but never went into it as we had internet in our room. It was only a few minutes to the beach in Santa Monica which wasn’t as crowded as we thought it would be so all in all we had a great stay and didn’t break the bank.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Fun with Teenagers”
Reviews.Author: NLockwood
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Renaissance Hollywood several times. I love the hotel and the location. Great views of the Hollywood sign. Near a mall, the Pantages, the El Capitan Theater, Mann's Chinese, the walk of fame, etc. Hollywood is a lot of fun with teenagers; the double-decker hop-on, hop-off bus picks up right next door at the Chinese Theater. A very safe adventure for my 17 year old daughter and her friend. They went all over and never asked to use the car! My sisters and I took a Movie Star Home Tour, which is unusual for local Orange County people, but it was well worth the 2.5 hours and $39.00 price tag. If you are a local, and have never done the tour DO IT! It picks up near the Double Decker. Helter Skelter fans would love the Dearly Departed Helter Skelter tour too. I am disappointed to read such negative comments about Hollywood being dirty, etc....It's a big city, and although it may not be the cleanest city in the area, if you are at all star struck, it is a blast!!

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff”
Reviews.Author: texasgirl59
Reviews.Content: I picked the Renaissance because of the location - centrally located - easy access to local attractions - 1 st glance - great hotel , beautiful - we stayed 3 days - on 2 nd day - room service / staff cleaned however they left part of the food trays outside my door until I left - not sure why the cleaning staff didn't get this along with the other food trays. Hotel Bar - the rudest person I have ever encountered - never spoke - went into the back after he saw us sit down at the bar - stayed back there 5 minutes - came out - threw a menu at us - still never speaking - finally got us a glass of wine - ask for check - he still never spoke - RUDE RUDE RUDE - Will never stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gggpack
Reviews.Content: Booked through Priceline and could not have found a better hotel and location. The staff treated us very well even though we booked through a 3rd party. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “The Best !”
Reviews.Author: Asphaltkid
Reviews.Content: From the front door in....you're treated like royalty. Beautiful lobby. And the room WOW We splurged and went for a coner suite. Just beautiful. Tenth floor over looking the Kodak Center and the hotel's pool. The king sized bed was like sleeping on a cloud. Down comforter and pillows and plenty of the later. We had a relative who lived in the area and he showed us the town. So much to see. Get a guide book and pick your favorites. We took in a musical, "Legally Blond", went to the Planitarium, the Queen Mary, Venus Beach, Chinatown, Little Mexico and more. And the restaurants are to die for. Such variety. All personal are top notch. I know that when we plan an event the Renaissance will be tops on our list.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location, on the Mall”
Reviews.Author: water7996
Reviews.Content: My 18 y.o. daughter and I stayed here for three nights, our last hurrah before she leaves for college. I was a little apprehensive at first; Hollywood Blvd is SO sleazy and this area is really rough. However, the hotel is very nice; the rooms were nice and the service was pretty good - the only problem we had was that they said they didn't have the double room I requested, but after I insisted we needed two beds they magically found us a room. Valet parking is expensive, but worth it because the fee includes unlimited in and out, and they bring your car in a jiffy. Graumann's Chinese (Kodak?) Theatre is right next door and the location is in the heart of the Hollywood Blvd stroll. It's attached to a four-story mall with decent shopping and restaurants (the Grill on Hollywood was excellent), which was very nice for us because we came to shop! We spent a day bicycling around Santa Monica and Venice (fun!!) and did the VIP tour at Universal Studios (expensive but worth it), also went to Rodeo Drive (fun to look, but who would buy that stuff??) and cruised Beverley Hills, Brentwood, Malibu, etc. A great trip, and this was a good central location for us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: canadiancruejunkie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance Hotel with my 2 teenagers. It is definitely in the heart of hollywood. Our room had a great view of the hollywood sign. The hotel is convenient to the Highland and Hollywood Plaza so many choices available for lunch/dinner. The hotel breakfast was outrageously expensive $25 per person when you could go out the hotel and across the street to Mel's diner for an amazing and affordable breakfast! The rooms were great, very very clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Would recommend to anyone looking to get into the heart of the action in Hollywood. NOTE: Didn't find the Walk of Fame area all that scary or dangerous at night. Just alot of hustlers trying to make a buck getting your picture taken.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveller305
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for Hollywood and has a shopping mall next door. On our arrival the reception staff claimed that there was no record of our booking. However we do not haave any evidence who is at blame here - the hotel or the tour company. My complaint with the hotel is the attitude of the reception staff during this incident. Their solution was to put 4 adults in a double room to share beds stating that the hotel was fully booked! I therefore telephoned the tour company to note my extreme concern and following this we were upgraded for no extra charge to a suite with sufficient beds for all. Not bad for a hotel that was fully booked!!! The room that we were finally given was clean, large in size and even had a view of the Hollywood sign. We also spent time in the pool area which was lovely. Following an upseting arrival at the hotel, an excellent time was had by all.

Reviews.Title: “great location / nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mpn7330
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for an evening with my teen daughter. Location was fantastic, just around the corner from Kodak Theatre, and Grauman Theatre. Right on Hollywood Blvd. Nice place, great staff. Very attentive. Metro ( subway ) is just outside and makes travel to Staples ( Pico stop) very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place to center yourself in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: MichaelInSF
Reviews.Content: For the July 4th holiday, we decided to "keep it local" and flew down to Southern California for a three day holiday. For the Renaissance, we combined two different packages for two separate days. Our first impression upon arrival was a little mixed. When we walked into the lobby, there was a band in the lounge area playing exceptionally amplified music to an adoring crowd. But the concierge (or "customer wrangler"?) was there to guide us to the front desk, where both the desk person and I had to pretty much shout in order to talk over the loud band. Most likely your arrival won't be nearly as loud, though. One of our package deals included room service "pizza, two soft drinks" (10" turned out to be just the right size for two people to share), an in-room movie and breakfast. The other packaged included a 50 minute spa treatment (upgrading to an 80 minute massage would've only cost another $40 or so) and lunch. Both deals included valet parking, which was quite a relief not having to worry about hunting for parking or paying extra fees for stashing the car in self parking. The front desk provided me with a discount card (typical discount was 10%) for a number of the eateries and shops in the mall between the hotel and the Kodak theater. Right now, new reservations at Renaissance also come with a $50 discount off any Spa Treatment…. which my girl ended up using on a pedicure she was happy with. In the room, there was no minibar, no room fridge and no room safe (which I would have loved to have had, since I like to lock up un-needed credit cards from my wallet or my computer or passports or whatever). Closet holds an iron and ironing board and also plastic laundry bags. There's a complimentary overnight shoe shine service but the first night I called for the bell guy to pick up my shoes and he never dropped by. They did a fabulous job on my shoes the second night, tho! Room had a flat screen TV and an interesting box next to the TV where one can plug in various cables (like a stereo connector cable from an iPod, a VGA import port from your laptop), presumably so you can stream music or movies into the flat screen TV. In room movies were included in one package, but the audio / video quality of this in demand service were remarkably terrible for the big screen TV (the first screen you'll see of any movie is "This movie has been edited for size" screen; big screen TV's don't matter much when the resolution being displayed is bad). Twist restaurant is open only for breakfast and not for lunch or dinner. Sandwiches and salads are catered by Wolfgang Puck's kitchen and are available at lunchtime by the pool. Don't worry about dinner options within the hotel. If you're not up for doing room service, just walk next door to the mall and there are a number of semi-formal and informal places to dine. The fitness center (next to the Spa, just indoors from the 4th floor outdoor pool) has a very nice collection of equipment. One neat little feature is that you can plug your iPod into a number of the exercise machines and watch full screen movies or stream music from your iPod through the machine. Internet is available via either WiFi or Ethernet cables within the room but once you buy it, you'll be set for 24 hours and it'll also enables unlimited domestic Long Distance on the phone so you can keep in touch with family/friends via a cordless landline instead of relying on your cell provider. All in all, we were really happy with how our Renaissance stay turned out and we felt the $620 we spent (inclusive, for the two packages on two separate days) came out to be a relatively good value for all that we enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok - shame they didn't do something special in this location”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Big_Apple
Reviews.Content: CHECK-IN: ok, just watch out for parking. There is no guest car park!!! This is in the country where having a car is like having a pair of shoes! So, I parked in the Hollywood and Highland mall - cost me 10 dollars every time I exited. Valet parking is 30, so you can do the mathematics. ROOM: ok, we were on 13th floor (unusual for a US hotel?). Slightly funny smell and you cannot open the windows to refresh the air. Great tv. Huge room. Hollywood sign view. We were upgraded at check-in which was nice. Bathroom very ordinary. Big, but pathetic little bathtub. Toilet seat was broken. Room cleaner said she would send somebody to fix it, but he/she never turned up. LOCATION: good if you're into Hollywood stuff. You can walk to the Hollywood bowl from hotel too. POOL: lame. As one guy in the elevator put it: "I've seen pools six times bigger in cheap-*** hotels!". Very small. Your chances of getting a deck-chair are limited. Also on Saurday afternoon, the hotel hosted some kind of pool party with deafening music. I wish they had warned us. We went driving on Sat morning, intending to relax by the pool on Sat afternoon. There was no space for us by the pool and we felt excluded and unwelcome at the pool party. We did go on Sunday morning - got to the pool at around nine - and were lucky to get two spaces. Badly planned for a 20 floor hotel. ROOM SERVICE: We tried on Sat afternoon, but room service only starts at 5PM!! Strange. Ate at the Highland mall - some good choices. STAFF: friendly and helpful, but didn't want to know about our pool problems. BREAKFAST: usual buffet. Fine. Around 20 per person. PRICE: I used points. I would say that you should not pay much over 150$. It's pretty basic really. REOMMEND THIS HOTEL?: it depends. I think its for young cool people who want to be in this location. Maybe a place to be seen. I'm 38 and will avoid it in future. I felt unwanted there. Too cool. Too trendy. Overcroweded street outside (H'wood walk of fame...) + touristy rubbish on sale all around hotel. You might like it. Great location for crowd of 20 year olds travelling together perhaps. No worries about getting back to hotel from venues.

Reviews.Title: “No better location in L.A. !!”
Reviews.Author: Honestly-2-U
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay if you want a location. Everything you need is within walking distance. The beaches are a short drive away as is Beverly Hills and Rodeo Drive etc. Park in the shopping center to save the valet charges, it really is no big deal to do. (cost is $10 a day if self parking, valet is $30) If less than 4 hours have the ticket stamped at one of te stores and it is just $2. There is a great coffe shop accross the street from the main entrance for baking and food, really good and reasonable prices. (Highland Coffe and Donuts ??) Great pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jrsungrules
Reviews.Content: I wanted to travel close to home for some R&R and I decided on a two night stay at the Hollywood Renaissance Hotel. The location of this hotel is amazing in terms to the close proximity to the famous Hollywood landmarks. Plus, the hotel is connected to the Hollywood and Highland center with lots of restaurants and shops with the grand Kodak Theatre connected right next door. However, the hotel itself is lacking customer service and basic full service. I am a young traveler and the hotel staff gave me a lower standard of service compared with older/business guests. I believe, I deserve the same quality of service in terms of greetings and manners as other guests since im paying for the same service if not more. The room went through a renovation with the usual flat screen tv and a new bed, but its old Hollywood themed furniture/sofa does not match with the new interiors. The size of the rooms/bathroom are normal Marriott standards. The highlight of the hotel was the extremely helpful/friendly housekeeping staff at this hotel. They are terrific~!!!! HOwever, i would only recommend this hotel to older clientel rather than a younger crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to see Hollywood, Rodeo Dr., Beverly Hills, Walk of Stars, etc.”
Reviews.Author: YborJoe
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in an exceptional good location for our family vacation stop in Hollywood. Located very close to Grauman's theater, walk of stars, etc. Also connected to outstanding shopping mall with good restaurant choices. Above all, the service was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “just ok, nothing spectacular”
Reviews.Author: fairybread71
Reviews.Content: we came all the way from australia to see disneyland. Our first few days were in hollywood. What a dirty trashy place! The hotel ok but nothing to write home about. Stayed in much better for alot less money in australia. Smallish room and bathroom. Had the sight of hollywood sign but so what. The whole complex was nice however as soon as you hit the walk of fame it turns dirty. I would not have liked to walk around with my kids at night , luckly we were all in bed. The wax museum ripleys etc were all average. I love the movie stars tour and universal studios. There must be better places around to stay.

Reviews.Title: “It's Hollywood, baby!”
Reviews.Author: Parsky
Reviews.Content: My son and I traveled together and wanted to be in the center of Hollywood even though we are not really big celebrity watchers. This really fit the bill. All of the sights of Hollywood are right outside the hotel, and many big name celebrities frequent this hotel. With a little prodding, we could have stayed much longer. The pool is fantastic, super views, but many locals try to crash the party, and security has to clear them out. I did not find the hotel's restaurant worthwhile for the exorbitant price with so many alternatives at the mall nearby. You need a car in LA, without a doubt, and the self park for $10 was really a bargain. San Francisco parking is three or four times the price easily. My only complaint--we were promised a room overlooking the Hollywood sign, and that promise was never delivered, but our view of the El Capitan theatre with its nightly premieres was probably better anyway. I learned that the Hollywood sign is not lit up at night. So, a definite thumbs up for this celebrity mecca Renaissance hotel, a definite cut above and I will definitely be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: selrahc1967
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 night here in May 2009. Hotel Connects with Graumans Theater and a small mall type shopping area and is also adjacent to the Hollywood Walk of fame and the Kodak theater. I tend to always stay with Marriott as I am never displeased. The rooms are nice, typical Marriott setup but as always clean and comfortable. Valet is typical for a large city at $25 a day + tip, there is a parking garage next door that you can park at for $10 a night but this is not a good idea if you plan on taking your car out as after 120mins it is $10 to get out and then you have another $10 price after another 2 hrs if you want to remove the car. Price was decent but it can get pricey at peak or weekend times for the location. The lobby was nice, the staff was pleasant and they leave your bill in a awesome envelope with movies quotes. I loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: NYTravelingAddict
Reviews.Content: I LOVED THIS HOTEL! From the moment we walked in, I knew it would be great. The valet was friendly and nice, our bags were taken care of right away, and the bellhop gave us a tour and explained about the area and hotel all the way into the room. The view of the city and pool was amazing and the room in general was so roomy, extremely clean and comfortable. We never heard our neighbors. Everyone was just so nice. The only regret I have is not being able to use the pool. If I were ever in LA again, I'd definitely stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel in Hollywood!”
Reviews.Author: RonboNJ
Reviews.Content: I am in my mid 40s, own my own business, and travel mainly to Los Angeles and other cities several times a year. I have found through my experiences that you can't go wrong with the Marriott brand. They certainly don't fall into the low-budget category and they are probably far from the top tier hotels. However, I find when staying at a Marriott, wherever it may be located, I get room and service that feels very close to what I would expect from the best hotels. This is the second time I have stayed at the Renaissance Hollywood in the past two years. The first time was for a press function held by the studios. I enjoyed staying at the hotel so much that I was quick to book it again for my recent business trip. I booked two rooms this time out, one for myself and my colleague. In advance of the reservation I made some special requests through the "Virtual Concierge" function on their website. I asked for a rooms on upper floors and for a view of the Hollywood sign. Upon arrival I didn't even reach the front desk before I had keys to both rooms in my hand. I was approached by the Concierge who had a list in his hand, asked my name, and then handed me my room keys. It was the most incredible check-in I had ever experienced. To top it off, I got the rooms in the location that I wanted. The rooms themselves are very spacious, well designed, and quite comfortable. I was pleased to find that there was a cordless phone in the room along with a port to plug in my laptop or a video camera so you could watch it on their flat screen TV. Very nice clock radio in the room along with a coffee maker for which I easily made myself two cups of coffee from every morning. The bed was to die for -- so entirely comfortable that one just sinks into it and falls immediately asleep. One of the most comfortable beds I have been in next to those at the MGM GRAND in Las Vegas. Some nice added touches in the lobby including ice cold water that has been flavored with fresh fruit soaking within and a huge M&M dispenser for those of you with a sweet tooth. There is also complimentary computer access at the Concierge desk for the sole purpose of printing your boarding pass. Internet is $12 a day. This is one of the few Marriott hotels that I found that actually charges for Internet access (WiFi or Wired). Would be a nice perk if they didn't have to charge. There is a restaurant called TWIST that we ate breakfast at every morning. They have a buffet that costs about $23 per person. We tried that the first day, but found it a bit lacking for the price. There were eggs, bacon, french toast, fresh fruit, yogurt, cereal and oatmeal. There was a chef making fresh omelets and waffles. I mean, the food was top-notch quality but easily, the price could have been lowered to $15. The rest of the stay we opted for cheaper fare that included fresh fruit bowls and pancakes that were simply AWESOME! You should try the chocolate chip pancakes. Well worth the price (which was about $10). We didn't even attempt to eat dinner there, opting to eat at the IN-N-OUT burger around the corner (easily in 10-minute walking distance and a MUST EAT) or one of the eateries on the Mall adjacent to the hotel. Now with every great review comes a few gripes, and mind you, these gripes are minor but noteworthy.... Firstly, as you can tell from reading this review I am somewhat budget minded when it comes to traveling. The hotel was a bit of a splurge (I have a government discount) and I try to save money whenever possible -- especially since my business is paying for the trip. To valet park at the hotel, expect to pay just under $30 a day. You know what? Not worth it for me even though the alternative was a bit of a hassle. Adjacent to the hotel is garage parking. The cost is something around $4 an hour or $10 a day. There are several problems with the parking with the least of it being the cost (which is fine). First, since the garage is essentially general parking for the mall and the Hollywood tourists, it always packed. Expect to go down a few levels, in a conga line of cars, trying to find a spot. Finding a spot is not impossible, it just gets frustrating if you are in and out of the hotel several times a day. Next, there is no direct access from the garage into the hotel. You have to go lug your luggage across the garage to the elevator, up to the THIRD FLOOR, which turns out to be the mall itself. You then have a short walk around a corner or two to the entrance of the Renaissance Hotel. If you do this feat during the day, you have to dodge all the teenagers who inhabit this "loudfest" area with all your luggage in tow. And, since this Mall is always heavily populated, the elevators from parking garage to the third floor of the mall are often crowded, noisy, and certainly not the most welcoming way to access the hotel. This is what you get for going the cheap route when it comes to Parking. I will say, the Marriott Convention Center Hotel at the Burbank Airport charges $14 for onsite parking (no garage) so I still find the $10 charge to be a bargain, and thus, you have to accept the fact that it's not red-carpet service. You really can't go wrong with this hotel. It really is first-rate for service and comfort. It is situated squarely in the heart of tourist Hollywood only a few feet away from the Kodak Theater, Graumans Chinese Theater, The Hollywood Walk of Fame, El Capitan movie theater and the Hollywood Museum. There is a mall directly outside of the hotel filled with eateries, shopping and night activity. It's probably the most crowded area in the city, so be aware you are at ground zero of the Hollywood hub. I hope all of you enjoy your stay at the hotel as much as I did and will continue to have.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Service and Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: joslync
Reviews.Content: We booked a room here and knew about the price, but we paid for the location. You are in a perfect setting, close to all the night life and shopping. When we arrived the hotel staff was very courtesy, assisting us with luggage and even asking my husband if they could get him a drink. We got to our room and it was nicely decorated, very stylish, until we got to the bathroom. My husband was about to take a shower, when the faucet exploded from the wall and water was every where. I have to admit I was a little pissed since we paid so much for the room and to have this happen. I immediately went to the lobby and got the manager's assistance. The manager was calm and did everything to assist me. He was perfect, even upgrading our room to a deluxe room for our troubles. I know many would say that because of the incident why would I give them a high rating. It was because of the immediate service I got that calmed me down and actually made a great weekend out of it. I would definately recommend staying here because of the great service we got.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: donalmca
Reviews.Content: My trip to LA was for a conference but I was joined by my wife for the last couple of days and I needed somewhere that suited both a business and tourist itinerary, The really good thing that I would say is that the location is excellent for the buzz of Hollywood. If you stay in Downtown areas they can be a bit quiet but just a stones throw away from the hotel you have all the sights and sounds of the famous Grumman Theatre etc. Also, a lot of the tours of Movie stars homes etc start in this area so it is very convenient. Another big plus is the metro station which is located just beside the hotel and links you directly to the Downtown and conference area as well as being just one stop away from Universal studios. The cost of hotels in LA is not cheap so my gripe is not specifically directed at this hotel which is clean, modern and efficient. The staff were accomodating and professional and as someone who travels a lot I can say that I could not find any fault with service provided.

Reviews.Title: “This is a fantastic hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: susieOldham
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great, it is expensive, but worth it. The hotel is in a fantastic location with many bars and shops in the complex. I would definately recommend paying extra to stay here as it is the best hotel in hollywood

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: RetiredCokeTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at Renaissance Hollywood and loved the place. Everyone was extremely helpful and friendly. I have problems walking and was able to get a complimentary wheelchair for use at the complex. This hotel is very convenient to shopping, Walk of Fame, Grauman's Chinese Theater, Kodak Theater and tours. It was definitely a fun area to visit. There are some pricey restaurants close by in the shopping center, but there are also food court choices as well as Mel's Diner just a block away. We had breakfast buffet each morning at Twist and loved it. Ask the chef for a blueberry waffle and enjoy the fresh blueberries piled on top - yum!

Reviews.Title: “Meh...”
Reviews.Author: juliet83
Reviews.Content: Pretty touristy location and unremarkable hotel. I stayed here because it was only two metro stops to my office in LA, but what I saved on cabs staying in hotels elsewhere in the city, I spent on the internet access in the room. $13 a day, which feels a little unrealistic these days. Also, I fail to understand why the hotel's website has rooms decked out in funky, bright colours. No pictures posted here, nor the room I stayed in, has decor in anything but white and cream. Where are these rooms?? If you want to be in the thick of Hollywood - Walk of Fame, touristy shops everywhere you look, right next to a mall etc - this is for you. As a business hotel, I'm not sure it makes the grade next to other places I've stayed in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location for Walk of Fame!”
Reviews.Author: dawnso
Reviews.Content: Had initial problem when we arrived, due to our travel agent not advising hotel of room upgrade that we had paid for but thankfully hotel honoured upgrade and gave us a lovely suite on 13th floor, which had great view over the city. Room was really clean, apart from large men's underpants that had been left in dressing room. Location of hotel is great for a base to explore the city, right next to subway and also stop for city tour buses. We did private cadillac tour, which took us all over city up into hills and down to Santa Monica/Venice Beach, tho didn't get to spend much time at these places. Hotel is built above Hollywood & Highland complex, which has great range of shops & few restaurants. Highly recommend Johnny Rockets for an amazing burger and the California Pizza place, which does take-out too. No mini-bar in the room, but there is a liquor store at the back of the hotel. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, we initially requested room facing Hollywood sign, but ended up with room overlooking city, which was more impressive especially at night.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the thick of Hollywood!”
Reviews.Author: Kerrin820
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the middle of the action - next door to the Kodak Theatre and steps away from the Walk of Fame. It's a short drive to Universal and the WB studios, to Beverly Hills and Rodeo Drive, or to the Santa Monica pier. However, it is very very busy in the surrounding area! Valet parking isn't worth the cost - park in the Hollywood & Highland parking garage to the left of the front of the hotel and it's a $10 max (you can leave your car overnight!). Rooms were clean, spacious. Request a room facing the Hollywood sign - it's a great view! The 24-hour gym is small but nice. Overall, a great hotel for the Hollywood area.

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance Was Great! I'll Be Staying Here Again”
Reviews.Author: AEbunny
Reviews.Content: Recently my girlfriends and I planned a trip to LA and booked a horrible hotel room that was a block away from the Renaissance. On our way to the hotel we originally planned to stay at we pulled in here by accident and were impressed by how nice it was. So, when we check out of the previous hotel after a 1 night stay b/c it was so lousy, we decided to pay up and stay here. This was a decision that I did not regret. The Renaissance was a wonderful hotel. People are obviously drawn to the fact that the hotel is basically attached to the Hollywood and Highland shopping center. It's also on the same block as the Mann's Chinese Theatre. In fact Hollywood Blvd was closed off for the Star Trek premiere when we stayed there (although I did not get a chance to crash in on the fun). Right when you pull in the bell hop and valets are so friendly and courteous. It's exactly what I expected from the Renaissance chain... excellent customer service. Everyone was so helpful and efficient. When I requested extra sets of towels they came to my room right away. The valet always brought up the car very quickly. If I just needed to go in and out (not wanting to hassle going in the self-park lot) they'd look after my car. Let's just say that I spent a fair amount of money tipping the employees here and they deserved it. The room itself was well appointed, contemporary furnishings and very clean. Each room has a nice multi-level office desk which works great since I had a laptop with me. The bed was very comfortable w/soft sheets and many pillows. There was a nice 42" flat panel TV as well as an iPod/iPhone charging dock which was a great touch. In the bathroom they provided Lather products which I absolutely love. They also allow late check-out until 3pm which is practically unheard of. One thing I couldn't quite put my head around was the fact that the only towel rack in the bathroom was a small one that was INSIDE the shower. I can see where they were going with this concept but with 2 people staying in the room it was hard to find places to let our towels dry (as we wanted to help conserve water and not wash the towels after one use). Next time I'm looking to stay in Hollywood I'm definitely coming back to the Renaissance. It's money well spent. :)

Reviews.Title: “Boom with a view”
Reviews.Author: MartyMcfly1985
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Renaissance in early April after previously staying here in 2007. I asked at check-in if they had any rooms with a view of the Hollywood sign available, which they did. The view was great - unfortunately this was almost immediately spoiled by the blaring noise coming from the other side of the adjoining door. After being kept awake by this dance "music" on the first night, the receptionist offered to relocate us. I explained, after 20 hours traveling, we did not want to move, just for them to stop the noise. When this continued on the second night, the same receptionist explained that because we had refused the offer to move on the previous night this was no longer an option and instead offered us coffee vouchers! Again I hadn’t asked to be moved, or for any sort of compensation, only for something to be done about the noise. Eventually a security guard did visit the room and the last two nights passed without incident. It seems the compensation culture is so embedded that it gets in the way of a simple resolution. Despite the noise issues, the room was a good size (1 x king bed) and clean. There was no in room safe but complimentary boxes available behind reception. It was also my fiancée’s birthday on the third day and the concierge arranged a cake to be waiting in the room. The hotel was a perfect base for the Hollywood attractions. It is part of the Hollywood & Highland complex with the Kodak Theatre, Walk of Fame, Chinese Theatre and Starline Tours all on the doorstep. Universal and Warner Bros are only short cab rides away (10-15 mins) with Sony Pictures around 30 mins away. Based on the location, we would definitely stop here again, only asking for a room without an adjoining door next time!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: al_kennedy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel for 3 nights in December 2008. I chose the hotel based on its proximity to where I was doing business. If I was going on vacation, I probably would not stay in the Hollywood area. Check in was fast and friendly. I asked about a late check out and was told that for a small fee I could check out as late as 6:00. I can't remember what the cost was but it was reasonable. The hotel itself is very well maintained and the room was in excellent condition. There was no peeling wallpaper or disturbing stains on the carpet. Everything looked very new and well kept. Both the bathroom and room were immaculate - I even tried to look for dust but I couldn't find any. Everything in the room worked, the bed was comfortable and it was extremely quiet. The security at the hotel seems to be good. As soon as I walked in I was greeted by a staff member asking if I needed anything. While walking to the gift shop I was stopped by someone who I'm sure was just checking to make sure I was a guest. The only concern I would have is that the hotel is connected to a shopping mall and from what I could see anyone could walk off the street and into the mall right to the 2nd floor elevator lobby. The area is fine during the day and I felt very safe walking around. At night you need to be a little more guarded. I didn't have any trouble, but there are fewer people on the streets. There are some good places to eat within walking distance too. Just west of the hotel on the south side is a place called something like "Burgers & Wine". One of the best burgers I've had in a very long time. For snacks, you can walk across the street to a liquor store that has everything you will probably need. I'd be more than happy to stay at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location!”
Reviews.Author: ajcph
Reviews.Content: A very location, and pool was nice.. Concierge was very very helpful and friendly to us and I was impressed he could remember us the next day and asked us how was our trip to Beverly Hills.. The rooms were unique but the curtain wasn't drawing well.. Plus the windows need to be cleaned. Overall I am very pleased with this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Los Angeles Hotel for a family of four!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler 300
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Hollywood for 4 nights from April 5-9 with our two children (ages 10 and 13) We chose the RH because it received good reviews from Trip Advisor and also because of it’s prime location and proximity next to a mall. ROOMS The rooms were average size rooms and had two double beds. They put a soft pillow topper on their beds which makes the beds much softer and very nice to sleep on. Like most hotels, all of their bedding is white and they don’t have spreads. We love this, as they are able to wash the duvet covers and we aren’t as squeamish about germs. The room was clean when we checked in. There were a few tiny smears on the desk chair fabric, wish that could have been cleaned. The rooms had a large flat screen TV and allowed a DVD hookup with an module they include which includes the ports right on it. We hooked up our DVD player and were able to watch a couple movies as a family. There is no mini bar or fridge in the room. But they were more than happy to provide us with a mini fridge when we asked for one, with no extra charge. We loved having a fridge for drinks and fruit. As always, there is internet in the rooms, but you have to pay for it. It was about $13 dollars. This is very standard. We had two laptops and used them the entire time. BATHROOM The bathroom is average size with a granite counter and the swing out shower rod for the tub/shower. They have a single sink, but with plenty of room on either side for items. I especially like that the bathroom has lots of light and you don’t feel like you’re in a hole. Be careful as we slipped on the wet floor and slick white tile when the floor got wet from the shower. LOCATION Loved the location of being right at the Kodak Theatre, Hollywood walk of stars, the Groman Chinese Theatre, and the Highland Center Mall. This is a very touristy part of town and I don’t think I would normally stay in this area if it were just my husband and I, but our kids had never seen Hollywood and they got a kick out of it. This is a very central location for going to the beach (20 mins), Universal studios (7 mins) and China town. We liked having a mall attached to the RH so that we could take advantage of a quick bite for our kids (Quiznos, Steak and Potato, Johnny Rockets, Kabob place, Crepe place, Coldstone, Pizza place). They also have some nicer restaurants and my husband and I slipped out and had dinner at “The Grill” while the kids had room service. PARKING For $36 per day you can have valet parking. You can come and go as many times as you please. You do need to tip the attendant a few dollars each time you come in and out, but the service is really really fast. We’d call down as we were leaving the room and the car would be sitting there already. They “RUN” when you call them. If you plan on walking or using public transportation, you can arrive at the hotel and park for just $10 a day at the Highland Center Mall which is right next door. Basically the Highland Center charges you $10 a day (if you leave your car there many days at a time) or each time you exit the parking facility they charge you $10. The Valet at the hotel gives you both options. HOTEL In GENERAL The hotel has a small but very nice pool with cabanas that you can sit in to shade you from the sun. The pool’s max depth is 4’6” so no diving allowed. I can imagine that during the summer the pool area can be very crowded as it is quite small, but during April with cooler temps, there wasn’t anyone there. There is NO hot tub, just the pool. The hotel has room service which we tried once with our children and it was good, pretty standard and came on time. I thought their prices were fair, not exorbitant. The one thing I would not use again is the hotel’s Valet Laundery Service. We use this service at many hotels we stay at as we pack super light. My husband’s dress pants got a stain on them and I sent them in by 9am and they were returned by 6pm promptly. The cost was $9.75 (which is a little on the high side, normally $7-8) Then they tacked on an extra $3.50 for a service charge. His pants ended up costing us $13.25! I thought this was quite high. Most hotels don’t tack on the extra service charge. There is a dry cleaning place just caddy corner to the hotel and I should have used that place instead. As we were on a 9 day trip, I also found that there is a fluff and dry place right down a few blocks at 7359 Sunset Blvd called Le Superwash. They were willing to come to the hotel and pick up our laundry, wash, dry and fold it and then deliver back to the hotel for only $1.25 per pound, with a minimum of 20 lbs. It was great! We had about 18 pounds of laundry (4 days worth for a family of four) and got our laundry back all washed and folded. Once again, I only brought enough clothes for 4 days and then had it washed and therefore we could travel light. I really liked the hotel and it’s location. The hotel was clean and it was very quiet considering it was in a busy section of town. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alan151
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights. Facilities excellent. Great views. Excellent location. Parking a bit pricey but otherwise recommended for a Hollywood stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal through Priceline”
Reviews.Author: phidias1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel the night before through Priceline and paid $150/night including fees/taxes. It was a great deal for this price. We stayed two nights. The hotel is clean and convenient for the Hollywood and Highland Center (a random and unpreposing spread out group of stores/shops. You feel as though you are walking in the subway, very unattractive. However there is a Starbucks and CPK there which are great if you have kids and want a quick and affordable meal. The hotel also has a coffee bar which serves excellent if pricey coffee and pastries and a restaurant which we didn't try. The staff are helpful and friendly. You basically have to use the valet parking ($28/day). They have a ridiculous system of having to bring the car up for you to get one item from inside. I just wanted to go down and get it from the car, instead spent twenty minutes waiting for them to bring the car up. Of course they expect a tip for this.... Our room on the 8th floor overlooking pool, compact and clean. Comfy beds, nice duvets. Two small towels only. Had to ask for more. Room was noisy due to elevator noise but heard no noise from other guests at all. Ask for a room away from the elevator. It is a surprisingly intrusive 'whooshy' sound! Breakfast was very expensive and not worth it (room service). Go to the coffee bar or Starbucks. The pool was cool and there is no hot tub (disappointing). The pool is also only 4 feet deep. Lots of beds though and plenty of towels. They are a bit slow cleaning up though. We were there to visit American Girl, La Brea Tar Pits and teh mission our daughter is studying. Convenient for all three (though my GPS didn't recognize 'The Grove' as an address...) One major problem which was resolved: I was waiting to ask the concierge about a place to eat. The people in front were asking about "Mam Mia' tickets. I thought I had somehow missed that this show was in town. When my turn, asked if there were tickets available for tonight. 'Yes' said the concierge and proceeded to book them through Ticketmaster. She printed out and as I walked upstairs I noticed they were for 2 weeks away. Went back down, concierge was gone. Explained problem to another. He said he would 'look into it'. Half an hour alter he appeared at our door with $190 in hand. Said his colleague had made a mistake and the show didn't open until the following week. Apologized and gave me the money. I wouldn't hestitate to stay here again at this price. By the way, the area gets pretty seedy within a few blocks. Yet another hotel which charges for internet ($12.95/day) Outrageous. If you sit on the terrace by the pool you can pick up Starbucks internet free if you have the Starbucks code (buy a card for coffee and it comes with it). Business center charges $3 for ten minutes internet.

Reviews.Title: “What! No hot water?”
Reviews.Author: AnonLincolnshire
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very modern, spacious with excellent facilities. Its located right next door to the Kodak Theatre and Graumans Chinese Theatre on Hollywood Boulevard in the Highland Centre. I must say that all the staff were very helpful and attentive. I must single out the Concierges for particular praise. However, during my stay, the only place I could get any hot water at any time of day or night was the shower.
