I could have left both taps in the basin running for minutes and one would be stone cold and the other barely any warmer. Be warned!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and wonderful concierge service”
Reviews.Author: FritzTO
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance hotel in Hollywood for a week and loved the Renaissance hotel. The location is very convenient near the Kodak theater, Hollywood hills, Universal Studio, the Grumman’s Chinese Theatre and many more. The room have an art deco style and are very funky looking, clean and new. We had a room overlooking the Hollywood hills and really enjoyed the view. The service was impeccable and especially the concierge (Mary Denison) was very helpful in giving us the right directions.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - less than average rooms”
Reviews.Author: MelD0202
Reviews.Content: I was most disappointed with this hotel. For what we paid I expected more. Firstly there was a mix up with our reservation however after much wrangling this was resolved and we were offered room service by way of apology. Secondly the bathroom was very grubby. Tiles needed grouting and the towels were no longer white but grey and fraying. There was no fridge or mini bar in the room and you had to pay for internet access. The only good thing about the hotel is its location. From the hotel we had a clear view of the Hollywood sign and at night the Hollywood hills looked amazing all light up. The shops, Chinese and Kodak theatre are literally round the corner. We were going to hire a car but it was not really necessary as buses and the Metro Rail were close by. Also we thought it unreasonable to charge $30 a day to park the car.

Reviews.Title: “Cost too much for a mediocre hotel.”
Reviews.Author: skopit
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a nice hotel. It wasn't great and it wasn't terrible. It was mediocre. The placement of the hotel is the best part- it's right next to the walk of fame and the Kodak Theater. Just don't try to find a working soda machine in this hotel. Also, there is no continental breakfast. I had to go to the attached mall and get a outrageously priced sandwich. Everything here is very expensive. You even have to pay for the in-room internet. $12.95 a night at the time of my stay. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable, but I've had both of those things in much better priced hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.....would recommend to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: TravelThom
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a Friday evening and was treated like a celebrity. When I checked in I was upgraded to an Exec. Suite based on my platinum status. The room was spacious and overlooked the Hollywood Hills and the HOLLYWOOD SIGN. The entire hotel is tastefully decorated and staff is very outgoing. The internet is for a fee, but $12.95 gets you unlimited long distance as well as internet access. All in all it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “A ++ When you dont mind the $$$ ..”
Reviews.Author: drunky_krol
Reviews.Content: LOVED: -I loved everything about this hotel, the location was handy everything close the famous Hollywood Blvd. was right there, intersting restaurants accross, the kodak centre were the oscars take place was next door!, and all the stars with the artists name, the hands printed in concrete were the main streets really close to the hotel, overall great experience, the service was great. -the restaurant in the hotel had great food! -the stores connected to the hotel as an open area not a mall it was a great plus in case you were bored, though at a high retail price. designers store and some other famous names. HATED: -i hated the machine inside the room with chips and chocolate that was charged automatically if you eat them or even touched them, cuz they did charge us i dont know why some and we didnt take them, though with NO problem at all was reducted from our fees. -phone calls super expensive, rate of room was expensive BUT WORTH IT, dont regret this hotel at all, all luxury and nice customer service accordin to price of course. - and also Internet fee expensive but fast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: danidagirl
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in Feb. I went with my parents and siblings. Since we didn't hv a car we wanted to find a place easier to travel. Oh boy wasn't this the best place!!?! It had the perfect location! Because the Kodak theatre is literally right next to the hotel, you don't even hv to get out of the hotel to get there. There is indoor pathway and I mean you can go there 24/7 even at night time! My family was honestly very pleased with the hotel. The service wasn't bad but when we wanted to book for another night they could not help cuz they only do "online booking". So the ppl at the reception could not even look up whether they had any rooms or not! We had to make a call to do that which I thought was really dumb to be honest (cuz they charge you for making that phone call!). Overall this is the best location if you are new to LA and want to visit the kodak/chinese theatre and wax museum etc. Oh it's very close to universal studio as well! I highly recommend it. It totally made our trip 10 times easier.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Honey4u2dip
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for the Academy Awards. The hotel is very pretty. The front desk ishelpful and they treat everyone like a celebrity. Be prepared to tip. I stayed on the 18th floor in room 1840. The room was big and beautiful. 1840 is located in the front of the hotel. I could see the Hollywood sign from my room. The beds are soft and comfy. I did not get a chance to use the pool, but it was very pretty to look at. The hotel is attached to a mall the mall has plenty of places to choose from if you are feeling hungry. I had room service one night, I think I waited about 15 min for my dinner. They are very fast. The grilled chicken club was very good. I don't have any complaints. Very clean too!

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay for an ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: cestella
Reviews.Content: Positives • Room was spacious filled with modern furniture. • Prime location direct access to Kodak theatre. The Metro line is also just under the theatre and all buses stops and pick up passengers in front or near by the theatre. • Can see Hollywood sign from room • Information booth in front of Kodak theatre therefore could also organise tours and access maps of area • Close to clubs, restaurants and tourist place of interest • 24hr access to their gym • Coffee machine available in room to make your own coffee. Rooms were replenished with instant coffee every day • Room was serviced every day • Internet service available in rooms at a fee • We booked room through expedia therefore paid for room in advance. When my husband checked his credit card a few days later Renaissance charged him again so my husband called to clarify the charge. Person he spoke to did not have the authority to rectify his query and said someone will contact him back. Within 10mins my husband got a call back and was advised his amount will be refunded back to his credit card. Negatives • No safe in the room to keep valuables • No bar fridge. I say this is a negative cause when we travel we use bar fridge to store and keep water we purchase outside of hotel cool • Buffet breakfast was only available on weekends which were useless to us as we checked in Sunday night and checked out Thursday morning. Surprised this hotel would not offer this service every day • Cost of internet connection was $35 per 24hrs which was pretty steep and connection was not even that fast Observations • Lobby lacks character, seemed very gloomy and dark • Seemed like hotel was empty. Hardly anyone was staying when we were and staff never seem to be at the front desk when we would walk out of the lobby. Nothing stands out nor does the hotel offer anything for me to want to stay at Renaissance. Maybe I was expecting it (the rooms the hotel itself) to be a bit more glamorous cause it was in Hollywood. It felt like a nice hotel with nice rooms – a very expensive nice room. The location of this hotel is great but there are other hotels within the vicinity as well. If you are looking for a clean hotel at the heart of Hollywood to just sleep at I guess Renaissance would suffice.

Reviews.Title: “It Worked For Us!”
Reviews.Author: pm914
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located to everything but you probably do want to rent a car to get around beyond the immediate area. If you do, they charge for parking at the hotel. The concierge is very helpful and provided us with maps and directions to everything. We asked for a room with a great view and were given a nice room with a mediocre view of the pool. So I went back down to the front desk and spoke to another clerk and told him this was a special trip for us and it would be great if we could get a room with a nicer view. He immediately moved us to a spectacular room with a view of the Hollywood sign and downtown LA on a high floor...perfect! Be sure to tell them you want a high floor facing out the front of the hotel. The hotel is located in the Grauman's Chinese Theater complex so it is hopping with tourists and the like. There are plenty of very good restaurants and stores there and the hotel's own restaurant was quite good for breakfast although we never had dinner there and that was only because they either had a private function going on or we returned too late to the hotel and they had already closed. Overall this hotel was a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service; Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: writerguy33304
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Renaissance Hollywood. From the standpoint of the facility, everything was more than adequate. The room was spotless and the the lobby was well taken care of. The service levels, however, were horrible. I arrived at the hotel on a shared van shuttle. The driver pulled onto the driveway and jumped out. Immediately, the doorman/valet approached the driver and told him he needed to move the van because he was blocking someone. The driver began to argue with this guy. The argument developed, which drew the attention of the other valets. The driver ended up using obsenities with the doorman. While all of this was going on, I got my own bag from the van and went into the hotel. (I had pre-paid the driver.) I was rather disappointed that none of the Renaissance doormen/valets seemed to be concerned with me, their guest. I was able to check in early (which was a blessing after my 5.5 hour flight). The woman at the Front Desk, however, was horrible. She didn't welcome me (or more acurately welcome me back). Additionally, she didn't tell me anything about the hotel. The only reason I knew about the restaurant is because I walked past it. No mention of the pool, fitness center, or spa. I found this lack of information to be inexcusable in a hotel of this level. To be fair, however, things got better. Without fault, every employee I saw in the hallways stopped and said hello to me. Additionally, when I was checking out, I was asked about my stay. When I said, "it was okay", the Front Desk Manager wanted to know why. When I explained my issues, she offered me Marriott Reward Points. (My stay was a rewards stay, so her offer was a type of rate reduction.) I appreciated the offer as well as her concern. I'd still recommend the hotel. The room was great. Additionally, it seems as though I ran into an unusual hiccup with the service. If I'm back in the area, I'd most likely return to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “definite plush hollywood experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed here for three nights, loved it! Hollywood wasnt as glamourous as its made out to be, but the Hollywood Highland Centre literally next to the hotel is lovely and has resturants etc. Also right next to a metro, bus stop and hop/hop off bus route. Hotel was lovely, really helpful staff, lovely room, even ordered room service and loved it! Hotel offered to order us a cab back to the airport and a fancy black town car pulled up and we had the nicest driver. it couldnt have gone smoother, view from our 18th floor window was amazing as well! the only thing was we panicked with the 20plus people helping with our two bags 9ok i exaggerate!) but a bell boy, porter, doorman etc, but not being skilled on who to tip when we panicked and didnt tip anyone...!! terrible!! but we know for next time! :-D Loved the hotel, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: mmwwmmww
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights for a business trip. I arrived before check-in time, but was put up in a room immediately. Construction was going on in the "zen" rock garden in the lobby the entire time I was there, so that part was not so "zen." Otherwise the front lobby area was great--plenty of comfy seats to wait for friends or just decompress. First off, I would recommend when booking a room that you request to be on a high-up floor. I was on the 6th floor and my view was of a concrete roof, not of any of the beautiful Hollywood skylines you've seen in other pictures. It wasn't such a big deal to me, seeing as how I was not spending my own money to stay there, nor was I going to be in my room very much. The room was very spacious and contained a king-sized bed. The furniture style was modern, but not the most stylish. For some reason it felt like it had been decorated by someone in their 70s trying to pick out furniture that they thought was cool. The television was a big tube television, which surprised me, I thought they would have flat screen TVs by now, but not a big deal. The bathroom was nice, with a crescent shower rod and nice toiletries from Lather (The facial soap was LOVELY.), and a vanity mirror and hairdryer plugged in ready to go. Unfortunately, no bathrobes were to be found! Some local magazines were left on the table for my use, and a book of photographs of the area which was a nice touch. I was disappointed that there was no mini bar in the room, all food requests had to be made via the room service, which tacks on a 18% gratuity to your order. However, ordering room service was a pleasant experience. They greet you by your last name when they answer the phone, which is simultaneously nice and creepy at the same time. I ordered room service several times throughout my stay, and orders always came much quicker than I would have expected them to. The servers were courteous, always asking if they could enter the room before doing so. I ordered a variety of items during my time there: BBQ chicken quesadilla, berry parfait, eggs, roasted potatoes, a boxed roastbeef sandwich with chips, macaroni salad, and apple, seafood pasta (from Twist restaurant), mixed berry bowl, breakfast bento box. The food was satisfactory, but not spectacular. Portions were not huge, but not skimpy. My favorite item was probably the BBQ chicken quesadilla. A USA Today paper greeted me outside my door every morning, the wake-up call service was sufficient, as well as requests for the cleaning service to come later in the day during a specified time. The meeting rooms were fine, nothing to write home about but clean and serviceable. On the day I was scheduled to check out, my flight was not until the evening. The hotel allowed me to keep my bags in the luggage room no problem. (That night I ate at The Grill, which is in the Highline complex and is affiliated with the hotel. Ordered the chicken pesto penne, it was WAY too salty. Again, food was not spectacular.) I found the bed comforter way too warm--I actually found myself waking up in the middle of the night, back completely covered in sweat--but otherwise the bed was lovely. The pillows were a bit too soft for my liking though. The in-room internet package was great- around 13 dollars for 24 hours worth of access, complete with free local and national calls. The location was fantastic. The fact that the hotel was connected to the shopping center was fabulous for non-drivers like me, and the fact that I didn't have much time between meetings to explore. The fact that I could just step outside my hotel and be right on Hollywood Blvd was pretty spectacular. The Mann's Chinese Theater was great, and there was an adorable women's clothing store called Varga where I picked a great jacket. All in all, I found the customer service to be excellent and the rooms clean, roomy, and pleasant. Would recommend staying here if you have the cash. Not as much glamor or history as some of the other LA hotels, but a nice efficient place in the heart of Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “very nice - if you get the remodeled rooms”
Reviews.Author: anonymousLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: We went for a business conference. The top floor had a gorgeous view of the Hollywood sign and the lights were pretty at night. Wall of glass provides a great view! Bed was great, room was clean, appliances were new...coffee maker in room...parking was an additional $10 and tax $30...on top of the $209 rate...but that might have been a low rate in conjunction w/ the conference. Staff was friendly and accomodating. It's parking is in connection w/ the mall, so it's several layers down...get ready to schlep your bags. Location is great for walking to Chinese theater, El Capitan, Kodak theater...Sunset Blvd and Beverly Hills is only a short distance drive away on Sunset Blvd.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: IAMSPIN
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my family this past December. Many things make this a great hotel. First of all the location can't be beat. If you are looking for a hotel in the middle of everything ,this is the place for you. Second, but most important to me was the way I was treated when I first walked in. I have been to many hotel's and resorts . I have been through the check-in process over and over again. This time I was really amazed. I felt like I was being checked in by a close family relative. This hotel has had many celebrities stay with them and I felt I received the same VIP treatment as they do. At the front desk was Mirelle. I think management should really be happy that she is on the team. I work for a major airline in Canada so I know how important customer service is. My family was very happy with the service and care from Mirelle and this hotel. The hotel is right beside the famous Kodak Theatre and other great attractions on Hollywood Blvd. I was looking for a getaway with the family and this was perfect. We went on the Hollywood bus tour and then to Universal Studios. From there we went to Beverly Hills and ate at the Cheesecake Factory. This really was a great getaway ! All so close to the hotel. We were out day and night and I can tell you the area is safe. There were a few homeless people at the McDonald's nearby but no one bothered us at all. The LAPD had officers in the area and one officer ( badge number 35899) and her partner were just fantastic with us and other tourists. I needed to find a store near Dodger stadium and I was given hand written directions from the officer to get me there. She and her partner were real diplomats ! What else can I say , just go ! I'm sure you will love it !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ObLaDiObLaDa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here along with our three teenage kids. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The location is in the heart of Hollywood, near Beverly Hills and all of the touristy sites. The rooms are comfortable and roomy (We were given a large, corner room that looked west directly toward the Hollywood sign). The best feature of this hotel is its location which is central to so much of the great "LA scene". But in addition to that, you have a really helpful staff and a great restaurant in the hotel. The only complaint I have is that one of the concierge's was indifferent and was more interested in staring at his computer than looking up and helping me out. The second concierge was very good as were the check-in and baggage folks. Make sure and try the breakfast at Twist, the hotel restaurant. The breakfast was fairly expensive, but excellent. You've got to love that fresh squeezed OJ in southern California.

Reviews.Title: “old and tired property”
Reviews.Author: mdterp
Reviews.Content: This property in need of a major updating. The rooms have old style televisions and furniture that look like it was purchased at a yard sale. Our room had a "terrible odor of cigar smoke", they moved us to a second room directly above and it had the same odor. Finally we were moved to a room that seem to be a party room because it only had a murphy bed. This place is seriously overpriced for what you get. It's like an old Holiday Inn (1960's style) but in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location”
Reviews.Author: MaryFifi
Reviews.Content: Arrived early after long flight from Australia. Front reception staff were most accommodating and after a brief wait (coffee and walk inadjacent Highland Centre) gave us early access to our one bedroom suite. Courteous and helpful concierge staff. Room was a great size, great large bathroom with separate vanity (helpful for family groupos) and had city view. Only disappointment there was no bar fridge and safe in room. Excellent location to travel from and observe the interesting characters on Hollywood Boulevard. Hop on off and Beverly Hills tours easily accessed. California Pizza Kitchen (in Highland Centre) consistently good with large servings and very well priced for family groups. Great little supermarket on Hollywood Blvd for daily supplies.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: travelmore149362
Reviews.Content: Just got back from six nights at this hotel. This was a sightseeing trip with my family; I chose this hotel because I wanted something that was in a good location for touring around, and where we could sleep comfortably. I booked the hotel a couple of months ago, on the hotel website. At that time I requested the club level. I was willing to pay a bit extra for the convenience of the continental breakfast; I could not find a rate that included breakfast otherwise. When I got to the hotel, I learned that the lounge would not be open for 3 of the 6 days we'd be there. At my request, we were moved to a non-club level room, at a lower rate. They did not reduce the rate for our last night, however. (The rate was going to go up because of the New Year). Thankfully, however, the hotel is connected to the Hollywood and Highland Mall, and we did not need to have breakfast in the hotel. My husband brought up coffee from the Starbucks each morning, and we did not pay the outrageous prices for the hotel breakfast buffet. There was no minibar, but we did not miss that. I did notice that there was no in-room safe. We did not use room service, and housekeeping was adequate. The hotel was in a great location for sightseeing- we went all over L.A. and had a great time. There is an on-site car rental (Hertz) which was convenient. We parked in the mall for $10 a night rather than pay the $29 for the hotel's valet parking. The hotel was functional and served its purpose as a base for sightseeing, and a place to sleep and shower. It was in no way luxurious, but it met our needs. I would recommend it to a friend who was going on a similar kind of trip.

Reviews.Title: “"It's just ketchup"-???”
Reviews.Author: GinAndTonic
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights for a online travel industry conference. It's held here every other year, so this was my third time at this hotel. Things have definitely gone downhill. I'll start with the pluses: The spa was nice. The room service veggie burger was really good. The bed was comfortable. My room was relatively spacious. I requested a refrigerator and they brought it within 5 minutes. But let's talk about the bad stuff. First of all, there was no minibar. Well, actually there _was_ a minibar-- it was just empty, with a note on it that it was "being renovated" and that one should call room service for food and drinks. Not exactly what you want to see when you're arriving very late and just want a Diet Coke. I was grateful my flight hadn't been delayed-- at least I got there before room service closed for the night. Why would you leave the minibar in the room if it's empty? Room service was also hilariously bad. I'd seen some reviews that said the homemade granola was good, so I figured I'd give it a shot one morning. When the guy brought up the food, he lifted off the silver platter to reveal... 2 boxes of Kellogg's granola! I said that I thought it was homemade, and he said oh, sorry, we ran out so I just brought you this. I'm glad I didn't order an omelette-- I probably would've gotten something from McDonald's. (They did eventually bring me the real granola, and it was pretty good-- nothing to write home about, though.) But the worst thing was the housekeeping. I noticed a nasty-looking red stain on the bedskirt and left a note for housekeeping asking them to please change it. When I got back to the room that night, all the sheets had been changed, but not the bedskirt. I ran into the maid the following day, pointed out the stain, and asked her to change it. She looked at it, shrugged, and told me, "It's just ketchup." I was dumbfounded. Um, 1) it wasn't MY ketchup, 2) even if it _is_ something innocuous, I don't want to look at it! I asked her to please change it anyway and she made a big deal out of having to _call_ someone for a new bedskirt. Anyway, while it was convenient to be at the conference's official hotel, I would seriously consider staying down the street at the Roosevelt next time. There may be some urban legends running around about the cleanliness of the Roosevelt's pool (google it), but at least you can get a Diet Coke from your minibar.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel in a decent location”
Reviews.Author: NYCFrequent_traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel using Marriott points, in November 2007. The check-in was good and fast, and our room seemed to have been recently updated, with interesting decor and furnishings. The Valet parking was fast and convenient, if a little overpriced, we felt. We didn't eat in the hotel, but used the adjacent HIghland Center for several meals, which were very good, and even went bowling there. The area is very touristy in and around the Hollywood & Highland Center and on Hollywood Boulevard - but you can walk to several attractions including Grauman's Chinese Theatre and the Hollywood Museum. It is also a pretty good location for driving to other areas for sightseeing. However, get more than a few blocks away from the Hollywood & Highland Center and the area gets pretty seedy. We used the pool each morning and in November it was deserted but very warm and with a great view of the Hollywood sign. Overall a decent location for a sightseeing trip. We combined it with a few nights at a different hotel which I think made the trip better - I wouldn't have wanted to spend the whole trip at this one very touristy location. But had a good stay overall!

Reviews.Title: “Like an A-List movie”
Reviews.Author: pink_fairie_princess
Reviews.Content: Hollywood was our second stop on our twin centre holiday, and after walking through LAX to baggage claim and driving along the highway to our hotel, I have to admit my heart was in my throat slightly, but after an hours drive we arrived at the hotel, and were plesently suprised. The foyer / valet entrance was very welcoming with a mosaic and wall of water shielding guests from the dust and hustle of the main road on the other side. Check in was smooth and faultless, though we had no offer of help with our bags. On opening the door the light flooded in through the window and we immediately noticed how light and airy the room was. We had a queen bed each, and there was a desk in the room that could be tucked away to be less of an inconvenince. The bathroom was generouse, but the bath itself was the lowest bath I have ever seen, though the complimentary soaps and shampoos were worth being there alone & the overhead shower came with 6 different settings, including turbo massage which was amazing on my achy back. Out of our window we could see the Hollywood and Highland complex which our hotel was a part of, and Hollywood Boulevard, as well as a look out over LA itself. The entrance / exit of the hotel for guests to visid the H&H complex was on the second floor and as sson as we stepped out you could feel the stunning LA heat. Overlooking the lovely Hollywood sign, with pleanty of retaraunts and shops, in theory you'd never have to leave the hotel. It's smack in the middle of all the Hollywood sights including Mann's Chinese Theatre, Hollywood Boulevard, Ripley's Believe it or Not Odditorium, The Hollywood Wax museum, and Mels Drive-In Diner!! The Metro line in directly to the left of the H&H complex (providing you have Virgin to your right) and it is so simple to use that I used it twice and I hate public transport in different countries. From here you can get to Universal City and Universal Studios in one stop, and we paid $1.25 each, each way, and it really is worth the visit. You'll also have the CityTours booth inside Mann's fourcourt where you'll be able to enquire about any trips and tours that you wish to do inc. Disneyland in Anaheim and the Stars Homes Tours. Many nights the poolwas empty and we could sit looking out over the H&H complex and the LA skyline in quiet and dip ourfeet in the warm water, I genuinelly found this hotel faultless. This hotel is so close to everything in Hol Ilywood, I didn't need a map for anything. It was a perfect choice!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location and View - Great place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelFamily11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance for 6 nights. The room was lovely and we had a great view of the Hollywood sign. The room was clean and stocked well. The amenities were plentiful ~ they left us great toiletries every day. The hotel has several restaurants and a food court attached from the mall - the Kodak center. The staff was friendly and helpful. Check-in and check-out was a breeze. The Hotel is connected to the Kodak center and on the walk of stars - very easy access to I101 which will get you anywhere. The pool area is very pretty and an amazing view of the Kodak center.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: xvicx
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a twin centre trip to LA and New York. This was our first time in LA and we loved it! However we did not like the Hollywood area, at night, its scary, sleazy and not to safe and Im from a big city! however in the day its lovely to walk along the walk of fame, go the kodak and see all the famous sights! the hotel is great check in staff were most helpful and upgraded our room to a suite as I was with my family and celebrated my 21st birthday while we were there. we also got a suprise with a cake and drinks sent to the room on the day of my birthday which was lovely. The room was spacious and had a king size bed, sofa bed and we got a roll a way bed. The bathroom was great, HUGE it was like 2 rooms with a dressing area and then the bath, shower etc. we were very impressed and had a lovely time. Rooms were very clean, we had plenty of towels and the likes. I would deff stay here again however I wish it was in a better area because the Beverly Hills area is alot nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: Marvelle
Reviews.Content: This place looks great but is not as nice as it seems. The service is pretty lazy and there's all kinds of weird things wrong with it. First of all, check out is at 11 a.m. and a late checkout is 1. For $50 you can get 6 (which is actually kind of nice). But, they never cleaned our room on the late checkout day even after we called several times. Another day, the maid showed up at 6 a.m. asking if we needed towels. Their keycards work once before they don't let you in your room and you have to go down and wait in line to get them rebooted. The elevators take forever (literally, like 5 minutes to catch one). The pool area is very nice but was filled with loud drunk people when we were there. Oh, and there was absolutely nothing in the mini-bar. Not sure what that's all about but was a) inconvenient and b) seems like a stupid business model. Totally underwhelmed, go find a better boutique hotel in Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Hotel For A Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: home_ownerva
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel for a family stay. few bad things - no fridge, no microwave, paid internet connectivity, paid/inconvenient parking, paid breakfast.. Worst is that pool is very small, has no life guards/life jackets for kids, there is no sauna/hot tub. Room setup is contemporary but furniture is low quality, carpets are dirty and I did not get courtsey newspaper 3 out of 4 day stay. Some other Marriott's I have stayed have flat screen TV's, for whatever reason this hotel doesn't. Hotel is conveniently located in heart of Hollywood but very inconvenient for a family stay. I do not recommend for the price you pay for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sppw
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in October. The hotel is in a great location, easy to get to all attractions. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was on the 18th floor and had a view of the Hollywood sign. The room was of good size and clean as well as the bathroom - but agree with the comment about not having a fan in the bathroom. We had breakfast in the hotel once which was $20 per person. I would recommend Bobs Donut Stop - opposite the hotel - looks quite shabby but the breakfast was good..as well as the donuts...for less than half the price! The Crepe place in the Hollywood & Highland centre was also good. We hired a car and valet parking at the hotel was $30 per night. Overall had a great stay and would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: luggage_lass
Reviews.Content: This hotel was right in the middle of everything in downtown Los Angeles. We could see the Hollywood sign from our room. The hotel has a walk way right to the Kodak Theatre, with its surrounding shops and restaurants. (Try the Koji rest.--yum!) The staff was very friendly, and the room was good sized and very clean. Easy to get to the highway and go to other places. Be prepared for $30/day to valet park, there is not much parking in the area. If you can stay on the club lounge floor, we had delicious breakfast every morning. The gym was adequate but small.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Renaissance Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Vegas411
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive and are greeted by the valet, you know your in for a good stay. The Front desk and Concierge were very pleasant. Our room a spacious oversized Executive Suite that overlooked the famed Hollywood Hills sign. The room was a very clean, modern neo-trendy furnishings. Allergic to feathers, one call and housekeeping promptly replaced bedding. For the price paid nightly, the room lacked in a couple of items, by having a vend refrigerator that was empty and a conventional TV as opposed to a flat panel. The bathoom was well appointed with granite counters, a sitting room but no fan for the toilet area. Walking distant to the Hollywood area and Kdak Theatre a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel & Great Location, Book it.”
Reviews.Author: Bruce1962
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel and in a great location, part of the Hollywood and Highland Complex ( Lots of shops and plenty of restaurants to choose from ) the staff were so helpful, the bedroom was lovely and clean with comfortable beds good views we just cant say anything bad about our three night stay. When we arrived the Receptionist upgraded us to club level which was fantastic, free breakfast soft drinks and snacks all day. Thankyou to all at the hotel for starting our family holiday off to a great welcome to LA

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Brian_NVA
Reviews.Content: I used Marriott Rewards for a very nice, two night stay at this hotel in the middle of Hollywood. Location is a key selling point, as the hotel is part of the large Hollywood and Highland complex with restaurants, the Kodak Theatre, Grumman's Chinese Theatre, etc. There is a huge underground parking deck for the complex, which we found to be a better deal than using valet parking at the hotel. The deck, which is a short, in-door walk to the hotel, charges a max of $10 for each in and out, whereas the valet parking is $29 (plus tip) for each night. There is also a convenient bus that runs from the complex to the beautiful Pantages Theatre near Hollywood and Vine - $3.00 per person. Lots of places to eat in the area - we enjoyed the decor and comfort food at Citizen Smith on Cahuenga Blvd. For an additional $30 per night, we had a huge, oversized room (1505) with a nice view of the "mountains" and the HOLLYWOOD sign. The room has a 1950's art deco motif that is typical of this hotel. We had a "living area" with sofa, two chairs, a desk and chair... and still lots of space left over. The bathroom is big, with a door separating the toilet and shower from the vanity and mirror (good for husband-wife combos who need access at the same time). The Moen showerhead made for relaxing shower massages. The front desk and concierge were all exceptionally nice and very competent. Room service for breakfast was quite good - we had an omelet and eggs Benedict, which arrived to our room still hot - a pleasant surprise these days). I'll definitely be back. This is a great place to stay in LA for work or play.

Reviews.Title: “Book it !!”
Reviews.Author: fhm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just perfect... ideally located. Rooms were lovely, pool lovely, people lovely.. what more could you want. It's within walking distance to lots of attractions as everyone else on here says... and also the tube and bus routes are easily accessible and fairly easy to follow. You must go to Mel's Diner for breakfast, it's just fantastic. Don't deliberate anymore (like I did).. just please book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Antsuz78
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here recently and before I booked I didn't do a lot of research on where to stay - I just got a great deal through the Marriott website so I chose this one. I was SOOOO glad that I did. It is in a perfect spot for sightseeing, the location was incredible. Just a stroll around the corner to Hollywood Walk of Fame and Graumanns Chinese Theatre, loads of souvenir shops and clothes shopping. Also there is a subway station that is one stop away from Universal Studios which was fantastic. The room was on the 18th floor, no view of the Hollywood sign but we could see the El Capitan theatre. The room was clean and spacious with a big bathroom. The only little complaint was the airconditioning was pretty noisy if you turned it off, it made cluncking noises all night. But we travel with earplugs as we stay in hotels often and this eliminated the problem. Staff were really friendly and gave us a late checkout till 6pm on our final day for only $40 extra. I was so happy about this as our flight to Australia wasn't till 11pm and it would've been a long day had we had to check out at 11am. The Hollywood and Highland complex that is attached to this hotel has a lot of great dining options - we tried the Creperie and also the restaurant called The Grill which was really delicious and not too pricey. If I were to go back to LA as a tourist I would 100% stay here, we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Sparkles8198
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Exceeded my expectations - very close to everything. I recommend getting the brekfeast package - well worth the money!! Within walking distance to all of the major attractions. Very friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, attentive staff, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: GoodTravelers
Reviews.Content: I attended a 4-day conference at the Renaissance Hollywood, so the room rate was quite competitive ($175 for a double) to comparable nearby hotels. The location is ideal for walking to many quintessential Hollywood sights, as well as shopping, dining and nightlife. The moment I walked into the lobby to check in, a friendly staff member greeted me warmly and escorted me to the desk. The room was tidy and comfortably furnished in a modern yet welcoming style. Nice fluffy towels, and upscale toiletries. The bathroom floor had some stained grout, but was otherwise in good repair. Nice strong shower, with adjustable settings. Room insulation was excellent, as we could not hear anything from other rooms or the hallway, even though the hotel was at capacity. The bed was firm, the pillows ample, and the bed linens fresh and crisp. Housekeeping did an excellent job freshening the room each day. Another reviewer commented that it is more of a 4-star (vs. 5-star) hotel, and I'd have to agree. Maybe 4 1/2. Overall, it was a comfortable stay in a very nice hotel, and if you can get a great rate, it's well worth it Since the conference events were mostly in the hotel, too -- including breakfasts and lunches -- I must say that the food was OUTSTANDING and the wait staff impeccably mannered. The menu was imaginative, and the presentation magazine-worthy. Definitely NOT rubber-chicken meals, as so many conferences are.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: lucksgirl
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate online. Easy, quick early check-in, no problems. Got upgraded to a huge suite with a view of the Hollywood sign! Room service breakfast was pretty good. Nice work out area, small pool. One of the best things about this hotel is the location- you can actually go right from your room to the Hollywood&Highland mall/Chinese theater. It's perfect! The bar in the lobby stays crowded. My fave place to stay in LA!

Reviews.Title: “Missed Connections”
Reviews.Author: DWGriffith
Reviews.Content: We stay in Marriotts frequently and are usually pleased. Even moreso with the Renaissance. But not this one. We had gone via Hollywood on the way out of California to see a good friend. Said friend was left waiting in the lobby for 45 minutes while the phone in our room went to VOICE MAIL, unknown to us! By the time we went to the lobby to check on things, he had of course left. The desk clerk didn't appear to know why the phone had gone to voice mail, nor care that we had missed our connection, with rescheduling impossible. Turns out the phones turn off when a guest checks out, and ours had not reset when we checked in. Separate issue: Breakfast was not included, and the restaurant jacked up the prices on the menu so that the $20 per person buffet was the cheapest thing available. Although the location is good for the Hollywood tourist must-sees, and the room was very nice, the experience was rather like booking a hotel in Europe sans breakfast [a no-no!], in a place where nobody speaks your language at all and you forgot your phrasebook! Of course, I expect to be gigged because this review tells some truths. But hey, c'est la vie! Maybe someone else won't miss their meeting, but if you check in here, call the desk and see if the phone rings when they call you back!

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: lainey45
Reviews.Content: We have just return from a tour of California, and this hotel was by far the best. We checked in very quickly and had a large room on the 11th floor. which was very clean. The hotel is in the perfect position for all the tourist attractions. We tried the hotels room service for breakfast and everything we ordered arrived on time, fresh, hot and plenty of it. The only down side is the cost of parking at the hotel, but other than that I recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel a few problems”
Reviews.Author: Doughballs
Reviews.Content: Prior to my arrival I sent an email to the hotel with a couple of general questions. No reponse, so I resent. Still no response. A bad start...We picked this hotel for a holiday a) primarily due to the location, and b) I usually enjoy the Marriott/Renaissance chains on business trips. Location did not disappoint. It is smack in the middle of Hollywood Boulevard (Graumans, Kodak theatre) and in the middle of Hollywood and Highland complex which houses several eating options, from takeaway (one night we got a takeout from California Pizza and ate in room...) to formal. Also if you want to take any tours, many leave from Graumanns. But hotel did disappoint... Our first room, although a non smoking hotel, stank of smoke. Plus it was next to the ice machine on that floor which seemed to be leaking and smelt of gas. We asked to be moved which was not possible that night (we were in a suite, the quantities of which are limited). We were promised to be moved the next day and told just to leave our suitcases which would be automatically transferred. Next day before we left for the day I checked at reception re new room...and nobody knew anything about it. After a while they gave us a new room number. When we got back that night....no one knew anything about it.But we eventually did get the room. But communication and organisation seems to be a recurring problem. Even when we left, we had pre paid the travel agent, but the room charges were on the bill, and it took a lot of checking before this was rectified. The rooms itself, a 2 room suite was not great. It is billed as a chic boutique hotel, but in truth the (final ) room we had, while not exactly shabby, was just not great. Maybe the high rates are the privilege of being on Hollywood Boulevard, We took a 2 room suite as I was travelling with my 16 year old son, the sofa in the lounge folded down. But when folded down, it practically reached the TV, cutting the room in 2, so effectively when the bed was down half of the room was unusable. On the good side. A coffee/ tea machine, ironing board which made life easier. To be honest if I went to Hollywood again I might well stay in this hotel purely for location, but the whole experience left me a bit flat

Reviews.Title: “Four stars Hotel”
Reviews.Author: doledes
Reviews.Content: After finding a good rate on the Renaissance web site, I decided to book a 4-night stay at this hotel (180€ for a triple room). I have to say that the hotel met my expectations. This hotel is rated 5 stars but guests must be ready not to find that kind of luxury typical of a real 5 star hotel. I arrived at 8 pm but my room wasn't ready (although I informed them at the moment of my booking about my scheduled arrival time). Check-in staff told me my room would have been available in 30 min., so we went to the mezzanine bar in order to have a cup of tea (the lobby bar didn't serve hot beverages in the evening). The mezzanine bar is very big and there was a huge selection of different types of tea. The tea was very good and not pricey (about 3€ and it was served together with some complementary honey). After that we came back to the lobby at the scope of completing the check-in procedure (check-in staff asked my mobile number in order to call me once the room would have been ready). The time we waited was well worth because we had a room located on the 18th floor (one of the highest) with a beatiful view of the Hollywood sign (this was another request made when I booked the room). A bellman went with us and showed the basic features of the room. The room had two very comfortable queen beds and was quiet spacious (about 30 sq. mt)., no particularly luxurious and with no state of the art technology features (no plasma screen). The soundproof system wasn't exceptional but the BIG con I found in this hotel was the bathroom: it wasn't dirty but all the facilities looked VERY old and 1.000 miles far from what a guest can expect to find in a 4 or 5 star hotel. The location is great for people who want to stay in Hollywood or are not renting a car (two steps from the walk of fame and all the other Hollywood attractions). Finally, I colud check out directly through the TV system on the day I left the hotel; a good way to save some minutes. All in all the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel is a good option who is not renting a car and looks for a good hotel with all the services a guest can need (spa, swimming pool, etc.). You'll be disappointed only if you expect a 5 stars hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Hollywood Advetures”
Reviews.Author: SunSurferDevon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location to explore Hollywood. We stayed 6 nights in a large, quiet room overlooking the famous Hollywood sign. 2 adults and two kids in a room with 2 king sized beds. Top features are the fantastic 5th floor swimming pool, great in the early evening, location close to excellent public transport and excellent choices for food and drink all close to the hotel. A frige in my room would have made it even better. If you would rather spend your money on your holiday, park your own car, it cost $10 if you park it, about $40 if you use valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here any longer than 2 days”
Reviews.Author: Aranwen
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 days here on the way back home. Chose it purely on its location as it was fairly near many sites and we didn't have a hire car. Check-in was unsatisfactory as the young man on the desk was surly and rude. Every other member of the check in team were welcoming guests with a cheery smile and a "Welcome to the Renaissance" with the exception of him. He thought there was a problem with our booking and kept wandering off to another room to make phone calls lasting about 15 minutes. At one point we had to ask another member of staff to go and find him. He didn't once apologise for the delay which was inexcusable as we had been travelling all night and were exhausted. I asked him to explain what the problem was and he started talking whilst walking off to the other room again so I couldn't hear what he was saying. Despite this the room was adequate and clean. As other reviewers have said it was close to many amenities such as shops, restaurants, chinese theatre, walk of fame etc. We walked further on from all the razzamatazz and found a restaurant called and Musso and Benny's recommended by the guidebook. It was heaving until about 7.30 when everyone leaves to go to their shows and theatres. The food is like something your mum would make (sorry mum) so i don't know what all the fuss is about but the waiters are great. Most of them are way over 60 and a bit grumpy! I wouldn't want to spend any longer than 2 days in LA. it isn't really my sort of place. We took a bus to santa monica beach on the sunday. It is very busy but we enjoyed walking around. The hotel advised us not to take a bus there as this is the city of the car after all but it was so simple and only cost $1.25 each way. Rodeo Drive and Beverley Hills are worth a look but the restaurants nearby are a bit snooty. Took a trolley bus ride around all the stars' homes which was amusing and was very cheap (sorry can't remember how much but it was cheap) Check out was better but there is still an attitude problem from some members of staff. Made a big mistake of booking an airport shuttle to take us to LAX on the way home. Our driver took nearly 3/4 hour driving to other hotels, driving back to ours, having a cigarette until we thought we were going to miss our plane. He started an argument when we asked him to just get on with it and said he wasn't a taxi. Not a good way to leave. i wouldn't stay in this hotel again and i don't plan to return to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel for price”
Reviews.Author: seasuzie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a very touristy part of hollywood. The goodnews is if you like shopping, you are right on top of a mall. Also plenty of food court options. The first night we were interupted from our deep sleep by drunk guests trying to knock down our door. I was so tired from traveling that day that I couldn't even get to the door to tell them they were at the wrong room. Finally they went away. After that no incidents. The room wasn't cleaned 100%. Found wrapers on the floor that grossed me out! If I had to do it again I wouldn't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Smashing Insight to Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: IrishSodaBread
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 night stay at the Renaissance. I loved this hotel and would highly recommend it. While it was out of downtown LA itself, it offered us the holiday we were looking for. It can be daunting staying in a city that you don't know sometimes as you don't know where to go, but there was enough on our doorstep to keep us entertained. The hotel room was fine, nothing overly fancy but a lot better than basic. We were on the 14th floor overlooking the pool. There was no noise whatsoever to be heard from our room. Another reviewer commented on the fact that there was no extractor fan in the bathroom. We stayed in 3 hotels on our trip and none of them had a working fan, which surprised me. The bathroom in this hotel was larger than our prevous hotel (Westin, Times Square, New York). The old-fashioned TV was a bit of a surprise but we ordered a movie all the same one night and no complaints. The lobby area was nice. You could get lovely ice-cold water from a dispenser which had lemons, oranges, grapefruits etc. in it giving the water a lovely refreshing taste. There was also a m&m dispensing machine, which gave free m&m's. Handy when you're waiting around the lobby! The hotel adjoins the Hollywood + Highland Centre which was just buzzing day and night. It was full of shops, eateries, cinema, bowling alley, the Grauman Theatre, Kodak Theatre. The Walk of Fame was right outside the Centre. The Centre offers an Elephant Card at the Information Centre on the ground floor, which offers discounts on a lot of the shops and restaurants. We ate breakfast and dinner in the Centre every day. We would head off an a trip for the day after breakfast. All trips departed from the ground floor of the Centre, which was practically on our doorstep. We walked the Walk of Fame as it was on our doorstep. We took the Starline trip to the Stars Homes, which was very good as it was only a small open top bus and the driver was very interesting. We took the Starline Hop-on-Hop-off bus which we didn't enjoy as it was a pre-recorded tour and was hard to hear. We took a train to the Universal Studios as it was just handier for us. The train is only a stones throw from the hotel. It only costs 1.25 for a on-way trip which is great value. Universal Studios was a fantastic day out. I would say that was the best money spent on our whole trip (having done New York & San Francisco also). We didn't have a car so we were very happy to have all the entertainment on our doorstep. We did walk up the street looking for somewhere else to eat but couldn't find anywhere. I wasn't taken by the area just up the street, but there was enough choice in the Centre for eating in, so it didn't bother us really. The only annoying thing along the walk of fame was all the people dressed up trying to get you to take a photo and then look for a tip. There were also people giving out free cd's, then looking for a donation for the cd!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Location....but,”
Reviews.Author: LisaMcLallen
Reviews.Content: This is a Great Hotel for the location!! I recommend any families or anyone interested in being Right by most Hollywood Attractions stay here even if it is a little more expensive. However, we did have a VERY difficult time getting our room. 2 1/2 hours we waited. We checked in at 3 and finally at 5:30 after we had been to the desk every 30 minutes after 4 p.m....they said oh, its ready. We'd been offered to down grade at the same expense and they could give us another room with a rollaway. Now, check the rates of this hotel and see if you'd like to sleep on a rollaway! As soon as we arrived we were asked to shop for an hour while our room was finished. We weren't happy about that, but agreeable and asked where to go and how to get there. So at 4 we returned and it still wasn't ready, that clerk asked about the rollaway and that it takes an hour and half to clean a room not just an hour. So we were asked again to go shop....we declined and said we'd sit in the lounge area not too far away. 4:30 came and went with no word on the room. I went back to the desk because we'd become invisible to all but the bellman who kept glancing at us while everyone else checked in and headed up merrily to their rooms. The new desk clerk said Sorry, it shouldn't be much longer. 5 p.m. (really 8 p.m. at home and in our brains and stomachs) still no room and the desk clerk called housekeeping and someone would physically go check on the room and see how it was coming. She assured me she'd come get me and let me know either way how it was going.....ready or not. Apparently she leaves at 5, so left without getting me or telling me anything. She did tell us our room was an Upgrade so she wouldn't change it if it were her....so not sure how the previous clerk thought a rollaway would be a great idea. 5:30, still no one coming to tell us anything and I went back to the desk...this time getting a room or we're leaving.....and was told your room is ready. Guess they didn't feel the need to come get us and tell us. There was no exceptional service at this hotel, no out of the way things done but we also didn't ask for anything. My goal after checking in was to never talk to anyone at the front desk again since 3 of the clerks I'd already met were no help. I will say that it was a Very clean hotel, very nice and you can NOT beat the location. Our shuttle bus driver from the airport stated the same thing that we had chosen the best hotel in Hollywood for access.

Reviews.Title: “Really great BUT very pricey....”
Reviews.Author: Kerjner
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking for a hotel in L.A. that we would remember. Wow, this hotel does it. It was incredibly cool and modern. The rooms were also modern and cool. I did find the rooms very small and expensive but the views of L.A. were phenomenal. The location right on Hollywood Boulevard really is amazing. You have access one minute from the hotel to the Hollywood of Fame, Chinese Theater and Kodak Theater. I only stayed 3 days but i really enjoyed the hotel overall. The staff was good. The beds were phenomenal. I hadn't slept so well in years. If you don't mind paying the price I would whole heartedly recommend the Hollywood Renaissance to anyone. Really an experience. I hope this helps you make your decision.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Hollywood/LA Experience”
Reviews.Author: Borgata73
Reviews.Content: Renaissance Hollywood is a great spot as a base to do all your Hollywood/Los Angeles sightseeing. Stayed here for 6 nites in early July right over the 4th of July holiday with my brother as were in town to visit family and do the whole tourist thing. Asked for a room with the view of the Hollywood sign and was given a wonderful high floor room overlooking the Hollywood Hills and sign. Room was clean and comfortable but our bathroom had no fan (my only complaint of the room). We choose to self park in the underground parking garage which is attached to the hotel and paid $10 to park overnite. U can reach the hotel by taking the garage elevator to the 3rd floor and briefly walking through the outdoor mall to the hotel entrance on the same level. The costs of going in and out during the day were anywhere from the $2 to $4 dollars but we never paid more than $10 so its cheaper than $29 valet charge. We ate breakfast several times at the hotel restaurant Twist and loved the menu - tried both the breakfast buffets and menu entrees and they are worth the price. Its also the same menu for room service from the restaurant so if you looking for something low budget there is Mel's Diner and IHOP within walking distance. Tried some of the restaurants in the adjacent Mall and found them to be very good. Especially The Grill (massive steaks) and Trastevere (upscale Italian). Went to both in shorts and polo shirts and saw people in t-shirts/shorts so although they appear upscale you can go casual and don't feel out of place. It's a Mall after all ! The hotel is within driving minutes of Universal and Burbank. (Burbank Airport is closer than LAX to the hotel so think about it if u can get a flight there from your hometown). West Hollywood is just minutes away down Sunset Blvd. and has lots of trendy bars, clubs and restaurants. WH is where the nightlife scene is - there is not much going on in Hollywood at nite. Santa Monica/Malibu beaches are about 30 minutes driving from the hotel and easy to reach. Beverly Hills is also easy to get too and about 20-25 minutes from the hotel. Tried Starline Tours for the movie stars homes tour and happened to catch Dr. Phil pulling into his driveway. Yes it was that Dr. Phil and he did wave back to all of us on the tour bus, lol For any movie buffs considering doing studio tours the best are Universal, Warner Brothers or Sony/Columbia Pictures. The guides we had were first class and knew the industry and studio lots well. We got to see many sound stages and sets. Paramount Studios was okay but way too historical and really were on a golf cart the whole time. I would stay here again but if you want a Southen California beach vacation go to Santa Monica or Malibu !

Reviews.Title: “Good Short Stay at the Renaissance Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: jetsetera
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one Friday night. He was booked a room here for part of a group booking for a work event. His work event was over at Hollywood and Vine and this was pretty close. For the last several years, his company would always book the Holiday Inn because their work event would be on a Thursday night and rooms would be around $150. But this year, the event fell on a Friday night and so the room rates were pretty close at the Holiday Inn so the event manager decided to book the Renaissance instead. I am glad they did as don't really care for staying at the Holiday Inn and chains like that. We arrived Friday early afternoon and valeted the car. I believe the rates for valet is around $20-25. Check in was fairly easy. In the entrance there's a lounge and little coffee bar. We got to our room quickly and since were were used to staying at the Holiday Inn, the Renaissance was a great relief. We had a view of the city and we could also see the pool. The room was nice, clean and modern. The bathroom stocks Lather products which are great. I know its handy when the products are good quality and smell nice. We were a bit hungry and I needed a pair of shoes for the event so we walked over to the behemoth Hollywood and Highland entertainment, dining and shopping complex. We had a Japanese cream puff at Beard Papa (awesome). There's tons of your typical shops in there. There's a movie theatre as well as a bunch of restaurants, Starbucks and a bowling alley. We only stayed a night and were out for most of our stay so I can't really talk about service, etc at the hotel. It was pretty good for our short stay. My husband used the pool in the morning while I went to Runyon Canyon for a hike with friends. The pool looked great and I wished that I had tried it. There were cabanas and a bar in the pool area so I am sure it can get quite lively. I definitely would stay again. There's obviously tons of great hotels in the LA area but if you want to be close to things like Hollywood, Universal Studios, etc. This is probably a good choice. Oh the only thing that was a surprise was the tv was not a flat screen. It might matter to some, it definitely matters to my husband. Haha.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Time”
Reviews.Author: Philrdg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance for 3 nights at the beginning of June and it proved a great location and really nice hotel. We were really keen to get a room with a view of the hollywood hills and the hollywood sign and we certainly got it. We were on the 18th floor with fantastic view - well worth paying a little extra. We ate in the hotel every morning for breakfast. They had a really good selection of cold and warm food and I would say it was well worth it. Staff were really friendly, rooms were a good size (what you would expect from an American hotel) and the hotel bar was quite small but nice to have an end of evening drink. The hotel is located right next to a mall with a small selection of shops and a number of restaurants and eateries. You are also a stone's throw from the Kodak Theatre and Grauman's Chinese Theatre. As you are so close to these I would recommend doing these sights first thing in the morning. We went down at 7am and there was not another person about so we had the whole place to ourselves - fantastic. Everyone says about hiring a car but we found taxi's (and buses) worked for us. We used taxi's to get down to Rodeo Drive (about $20 each way) and then actually got the bus down to santa Monica Pier where we walked down to Venice Beach. The concierge in the hotel will be able to provide you details of how to use the bus and where to get it from. One of the highlights for us was having a tour of LA in a 1966 convertible cadillac. You get a private tour of the city and let your driver know where you want to go and he makes sure you see what you want to but then shows you some other sites that you may not have been aware of. Although this was $300 we thought it was one of the highlights of our trip. Another must is going down to Santa Monica Pier. We got the bus down here and then walked along the beach down to Venice Beach which is 'interesting' to say the least. One other think that we enjoyed was going for a early evening drink at Yamshiro's which is very close to the hotel. It is a Japanese restaurant set on a hill with great views over the city. We didn't manage to get to Griffith's Park and the observatory but you had great views of it from Yamshiro's.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED The Renaissance Hotel and Spa”
Reviews.Author: beachgoer50
Reviews.Content: We loved, loved, loved our stay at the Renaissance Hotel! The staff were all very accommodating and friendly. The room was great, clean and with a nice view. Will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood at it's best”
Reviews.Author: teri1225
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay while in Hollywood!! Check-in a breeze!! Friendly and helpful staff. Our room 1803 overlooked Hollywood sign. Really cool!! Room neat and clean. Wanted a refrigerator -- called front desk and it was there in minutes. We were there for the daytime Emmy awards. Really fun seeing all the movie stars walk the red carpet. Would return to the hotel in heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: scoot5743
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel from June 15th to June 20th and loved it. I took my wife and two boys ages 8 & 6. First of all it is in a perfect location. Really close to the nice areas of Hollywood. Also close to Universal Studios and Farmers Market which has the Grove shopping area. Actually, we had heard not to go to Disneyland because it was a distance from our hotel. We decided to go anyhow, and honestly it was only 40 minutes from the time that we left. The key is to leave early in the morning. We left around 6:30 in the morning and got there around 7:10. The park opened at 8:00 but we were able to park our car go to the tram and by the time we bought our tickets it basically opened up. I recommend this hotel for families with young kids, because it has a really nice pool. The temperature for the pool was perfect and the deepest part of the pool is no bigger then 5 feet deep. Also my kids seemed to enjoy the fact that the hotel had free m&m's for the hotel guest.. My kids everyday picked up some m&m's and loved it. I felt like the staff really treated my family great. They made us feel very special and my family really liked that. The only members of the staff we didn't feel that really went all out was the concierge area. They did what they were supposed to do, but I didn't feel that they took the extra step to make us happy. They were still very good, but after tipping them, I feel that they should take the extra step, to make us happy. For example, I asked them to recommend a restaurant. They recommended one but they didn't call the restaurant and make the reservation for us. Most concierge that I have worked with in the past, would make the phone call and reserve us a table. We stayed on the 15th floor and had a beautiful room, with a view of the hollywood sign. I just asked them if they had the ability to accomodate us with a room that viewed the hollywood sign and they said no problem. Overall the saying goes you get what you pay for. If you have the money to pay almost 300 a night, this is the right hotel for you, because you are treated like royalty. Last thing that was kinda negative. They have a valet charge of 29.00 a night or a self parking charge of 10.00 a night. We ended up paying the valet charge because we would go somewhere, come back and then go back out somewhere. If you do that for the self parking, I believe that you have to pay each time you come and go, but I could be wrong. I hope this helps you with your decision.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: yorks_nameless
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Hollywood for the final 3 nights of our honeymoon. Check in was very swift and efficient and we had a room on the 16th floor (i had requested a room with a good view) with a tremendous view of the hills and the famous 'HOLLYWOOD' sign. We would sit and admire the view in a morning and evening. The room itself was large, light and airy and very clean. Tea/coffee facilites were useful. The main attraction of the hotel is its location, right on Hollywood Boulevard with the walk of fame, chinese theatre, El Capitan theatre, Kodak theatre and other tourist sites. The centre is part of the Hollwood and Highland complex with plenty of dining and shopping available. In terms of dining, the hotel restaurant was excellent and reasonably priced and was probably our best meal whilst staying there. We happened to be there whilst the 'Love Guru' premiere was on so caught a glimpse of Mike Myers as he went in to the chinese theatre. The following evening Warren Beatty was at the Kodak Theatre so no shortage of star spotting opportunities. The hotel is also well located for public transport as it is a 2 minute walk to the top of the metro red line, one stop from Universal Studios (we spent a day there and thoroughly enjoyed it) and a simple bus ride to Beverly hills and Santa Monica/Venice (be prepared for an hours ride on the 704). With more time we would have also gone on one of the tour buses and visited some more sights.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JulesH066
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location. It was our first trip to LA, and the Renaissance was the perfect base. The hotel was modern, and the rooms very spacious and clean. Ours on the 16th floor had great views of the Hollywood sign. The hotel is part of the Hollywood and Highland Complex which has restaurants and shops, plus the Chinese theatre, Hollywood Walk of Fame and the Kodak Theatre where the Oscars tke place. It's also close to the main stop for the sightseeing buses, which are a great idea if you are only in LA for a couple of days. They take you to Rodeo Drive, Farmers Market, Melrose Ave, Universal Studios etc. Also recommended would be a day at Santa Monica/Venice Beaches, which are gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Just as I had hoped for”
Reviews.Author: goldcardluke
Reviews.Content: Like the reviewer below, I also stayed here on Memorial Day weekend. I too saw the cast of Entourage filming an episode (and grabbed a photo with one of the actors!) – you really are in the centre of Hollywood when you stay here. The prime location is especially useful if you don’t plan on driving – you are steps away from sightseeing attractions and the tours depart from here. Taxis are also readily available outside the hotel. We used one to get to the Beverly Center mall which is about 5 miles away. The room was just as I had expected. Tea/coffee making facilities were appreciated, and the room was a good size. I booked directly through the Marriott website and there is an option to request a high floor which increases your chance of seeing the Hollywood sign from your room. You can also see it from the pool which we used a couple of times. It was very pleasant. I did not eat in the hotel or use the mini bar – you don’t really need to as there is a convenience store across the street and the old- fashioned Mel’s Diner for breakfast about 5 minutes away. I paid £530 to stay from May 22nd for 4 nights. I think this is a good price, and I would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelafarToronto
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. It's located literally right on the hollywood Walk of Fame. Also close to Universal Studios (one subway stop away), Chinese Grauman Theatre, Kodak theatre etc etc....We could also see the Hollywood Sign from our hotel room . It is also connected to this minimall which has many stores such as Louis Vuitton, Sephora etc...the hotel is also located close to a tourist info booth, which was convenient because they helped to guide our stay as well as we bought our tickets to Disneyland and universal studios from there and they sell them cheaper. Our hotel staff was also quite helpful. They also have a Hertz rental on location which was convenient and they gave us a good deal. The only thing about the location of this hotel is sometimes at night there would be lots of shady people around, which for a tourist can be a little intimidating. So just be careful in the evening/night. Overall this hotel was great and a very convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED LOCATION ~ TIPS FROM OUR GREAT STAY!”
Reviews.Author: KellyinKentucky
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay during Memorial Day Weekend. Although it was a holiday weekend, the hotel NEVER felt crowded at all. The staff always met our every need and were super nice. We would definitely stay here again. TIPS from our stay: 1) LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION - you can NOT beat where it is located - Kodak Theater, Hollywood Walk of Fame, Chinese Theater are literally just right at the door! ..... 2) PARKING: Park for $10 per day vs. $29 per day valet plus tips in the lot that is connected to the hotel in the Highlands Center - the parking garage elevator will take you steps away from the entrance on the 3rd floor 4) FOOD - The Highlands Center connected to the hotel has tons of options!! 5) TOURS - you can walk out the side of the hotel to the Highlands center and book ANY tour that you want - we were amazed how CLOSE everything was 6) ROOM LOCATION - request high level with view of the Hollywood sign!!! GREAT VIEW! ........ 7) SUBWAY - If you aren't renting a car - the subway is located right at the hotel and a great option for arriving from LAX Enjoy your stay!! We sure did. Location can NOT be beat!! ........ They were also filming the HBO show "Entourage" when we arrived at the hotel on Friday night- how cool was that!! We saw the entire cast!!!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mulherin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband and thirteen year old daughter for two nights.I chose the Renaissance mainly because of it's proximity to the main Hollywood sights.We booked a suite - room 1312 - which had a great view of the city. Although not as I had requested the Hollywood sign. The bedrooms were very small and the decor strangely dated. When the sofabed was opened out it was right up against a cupboard - not what I had expected for $387 a night.Valet parking was$29 a night and was fast and efficient. At breakfast (not included in the rate) there was a large choice, all very good. My daughter particularly liked the rooftop pool, which she had all to herself. On our second night we were woken at three in the morning by what sounded like drunken people having a party in their room. The screams and crashing and banging didn't stop for hours.Unfortunately I think this is always a possibility when booking a large hotel in a lively area. For this reason I would not stay at the Renaissance again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service and Serious Security Problems”
Reviews.Author: L0nd0n1981
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice for business purposes last month and had a terrible experience both times. The check-in staff were rude and unhelpful and seemed to have no idea what was going on. They lost my reservation, gave me the wrong standard room, didn't activate my key and then 'lost' several important messages that were left for me later in my stay. The business facilities are terrible - old computers with slow 'pay as you go' internet connection that costs a fortune and repeatedly kept shutting down with credit on there which I couldn't get back once it switched back on. I lost about $40 over 5 days in this way. During my stay, a male member of staff knocked on my door at 1am saying that he'd brought me the blankets I had ordered and tried to gain access to my room. I had NOT ordered blankets, but he wouldn't go away. I got woken up the same time the following night with a different male staff member saying he needed to come into my room to fix the broken mini bar that I'd reported. I had NOT reported this. This was all very dodgy and made me feel uneasy about staying there alone in future. I was told on my 2nd morning that I couldn't eat breakfast as they'd closed the restaurant at 9am to set up for a private event. I was told that instead I could get a take-out breakfast box and eat it outside on the street, or pay for room service. Finally, on my last night, there was a party going on in the room opposite me at 4am which spilled out into the hall. With loud music, people banging on my door, prank calling my room and shouting just metres away from where I was sleeping. I called security and reception several times and they refused to do anything about this. I then noticed that several guests at the party were Renaissance staff. This went on until 6am and when I complained to reception, they hung up on me. I was quite frankly appalled by the problems and service levels of this hotel and would never stay there again. It is in a great location but is overpriced, run down, with rude staff and lapse security. Beware.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - good location in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: rosbif
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights having arrived into LAX before driving off to Scottsdale. As we'd never visited LA I read a lot of reviews of what district to stay in as well as which hotel. In the end, following reviews of this property here we booked club level rooms at the Rennaissance Hollywood. Firstly I would say Hollywood is a pretty good place to base yourself for a first time visit to LA. It pretty is what LA is all about - we did the bus tour, a limo tour of star's homes and the Madame Taussads and Guiness World of Records attractions, which are right on the doorstep of this hotel.
