So it is very well placed. Self parking was $10 a day in the big parking next door - where there were also loads of shops and a cinema. The check-in staff were very polite and helpful. Room itself was pretty good - quite small for a 'suite' - once a single fold out bed was up there wasn't a lot of room. Also the door to the bathroom opened outward which was unusual, and automatically closed which the kids didn't like. The blind which covered the window was a bit tatty but still worked well to shut out the morning sunlight. Beds were very comfortable though The club lounge was good - with good snacks in the evening and a very good breakfast. Not too busy either. There was one member of staff in there but he didn't 'interact' with anyone, just sat watching his PC screen. I was talked into booking a stretch limo by the concierge to see the 'homes of the stars'. This was a rip off however (Topline I think it was). The driver wasn't that interested - we didn't see half the houses mentioned on the blurb and we finished 30 minutes early! When you're paying that sort of money you expect better. I fed this back to the concierge who took my details and said he'd be in touch although he never has. Overall I mentioned some of the negative points but our overwhelming impression was of a lovely hotel with pleasant staff in a superb Hollywood location. Would I go back? Absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: nicros
Reviews.Content: We satyed in a Club level Room for 2 nights as part of our honeymoon. We were quite high up with a view of the hollywood sign in the far distance. Looking back, the free breakfast that came as part of the club room deal wasn't worth the extra money and we didn't use any of the other services so a normal room would probably been enough. We were only in Hollywood for 2 days so didn't spend much time in the hotel, but it is in a very good location near the Hollywood walk of fame and the Kodak theater.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Hotel with only one small problem.....”
Reviews.Author: travelingmannyc
Reviews.Content: Really stylish and high quality hotel in hollywood. Flew into Burbank airport on jet blue and was at the hotel in less than 20 minutes. we arrived early and had no problem with early check in. I was on the 18th floor with a perfect, perfect view of the hollywood sign. view was flawless. the room was big and clean. they left a bucket of candy on my bed as a nite time turndown surprise. only problem was no flat panel tv in the room - i expected one. staff friendly hotel excellent - HIGHLY Recommended. if you're going to stay here and can fly into burbank, do it - perfect combination. if you have time, there's an in and out burger in burbank right by the airport - big winner......

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bad workout facilities”
Reviews.Author: tacostuff
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance Hollywood for about a week. The location of the hotel is good, and is right next to the Kodak Theatre. The hotel, however, is not very convenient to downtown LA, or to LAX. Hotel rooms on one side of the hotel look out over the Kodak Theatre, and the other side looks out at the Hollywood sign. I particularly like the free M&M's in the lobby (clearly a very important perquisite...). On a different note, the hotel charged $5 to ship a package that was already prepaid. The workout room in this hotel is sub-par for a hotel of this class. The workout room only has a couple of machines, and what it does have, is comparable to equipment you would have in your home. The concierge lounge is decent, and is on-target with other Renaissance hotels. It has the standard fare in the morning (continental breakfast, with an additional two warming dishes of hot items, which vary), and in the afternoon it has some appetizers. Overall I would stay here again, though I did think it was a tad pricy for a Renaissance (about $300 a night).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: Bully1959Canaries
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with all the your needs catered for. Very close to local restaurants, hollywood and universal studios.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Dave_Webb
Reviews.Content: Started a three week holiday with a three night stay in Los Angeles despite many of our friends trying to put us off. We decided to stay in the Hollywood area rather than downtown and found the Renaissance to be perfectly situated for all of the tourist/sightseeing areas. We booked a room with access to the lounge on the 19th floor which meant that we could have a free breakfast each morning and also gave us free access to coffee and soft drinks throughout the day. Our initial room was on the 20th floor but when checking in we asked to change to a lower room and was given an identical room on the 6th floor with absolutely no fuss. The room was very comfortable and had a large window looking out at the Hollywood sign. The hotel was very well presented and also had a Hertz desk which meant that we could easily pick up a car for the next phase of our trip. The hotel and surrounding area far surpassed our expectations and was a great start to our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, central for Kodak Theatre,etc”
Reviews.Author: TrinnyEssex
Reviews.Content: Following other traveller reviews of this hotel, stayed for 2 nights 7/09 April 2008. Had room on 17th floor overlooking Hollywood Hills and sign. No problems checking in, friendly, helpful staff. Room big and spacious, had 2 queen beds for my husband and I and 2 children. Very clean. Restaurant good not too pricey, swimming pool outside good. Overall experience of hotel excellant. Right next to Kodak Theatre, Walk of Fame, Chinese Theatre. Ok but wouldnt want to go out at night with children, In that case better to stay in Beverley Hills. Visited Universal Studios, great place for kids, had a hire car, so drove around Sunset boulevard, sunset strip, Rodeo drive, Mulholland Drive, so can do all tours do, and cheaper, sat nav recommended

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaKylie
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights, the location is fantastic, ask for room with a view of the Hollywood sign. We had a huge room with two king size beds. Arrived at lunch time and could check in straight away. Very quite hotel obviously has great sound proofing, staff very friendly, facilities great but we never used them as we were out all day. Booking with expedia we got breakfast included for the adults, my 5 year old was free and there was a small charge for our 9 year old. The buffet breakfast was probably the best we have ever had in any hotel. A chef made fresh waffles and omlets, and the quality of the produce was first class. The location is great for shopping and so close to all the hollywood attractions. Universal Studios is one train stop away. If you have time catch a taxi approx $15 to The Grove and Farmers Market we spent the whole day there, very beautiful place to shop and eat and there are free tram rides up and down the mall.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Place!”
Reviews.Author: BeingGreen
Reviews.Content: I used Marriott Rewards points to book two nights here on a trip that took my mom, neice, her friend, and me from San Francisco to LA. I chose this hotel due to its proximity to Hollywood attractions that I thought would interest my teenage neice and her friend. The hotel did not disappoint. The Mezzanine level of the hotel connects to the adjacent entertainment/shopping complex, so we could easily access restaurants, movies, and tourist attractions like the Kodak Theater and the Graumann's Chinese theater. We took a Starline Tour and walked the Hollywood Walk of Fame from the hotel. We were also several miles away from the Warner Brothers Studio VIp tour which we also took. The only complaint I had with the hotel was that upon check-in when I inquired about the rollaway bed I had requested I was told it would be sent right up. When time passed and it was not there and we were all wanting to go out I decided to go ahead with our plans and expected the bed would be there upon return. It was not. I called and this time I was told the person who would deliver the bed was on break, but that it should be there in twenty minutes. An hour later I called again and when the person on the other line said "At your service" I told them that he needed to answer the phone differently based on my experience thus far with the hotel staff. The bed was immediately delivered. When the man who delivered the bed saw there were four of us sharing the room he left and returned not only with extra towels, but extra coffee cups, shampoo and conditioner. I very much appreciated this attention to detail! We ordered room service one night and the food was delivered within the time promised and att he right temperature. The man who delivered the food said that the hotel was very busy and that we should just leave the table outside the door and not to call for pick-up. I was disappointed to see that the table stayed outside the room overnight and was removed mid-morning of the following day. The food itself was delicious and there were no complaints from any of us about it. The only problem we had was they only gave us two flatware services--despite it clearly being four distinct meals with four beverages, etc. Luckily, we had plastic flatware in the room from an earlier take-out meal so we "made do" using a spoon when a fork might have worked better, etc. The room was clean and the pull-down window shade blocked the sun nicely so we were able to sleep well even though we were on Eastern Standard Time and a bit out of sorts with the Pacific time schedule. All in all it was a good visit. The bell staff delivered our car in a timely fashion though I was a bit annoyed when at check-out two employees chatted away while we waited with our luggage needing to leave for the airport. The driver stopped, backed up, and then stopped so that we could not get to the car. I felt the reason he did this was that the bellman were busy loading the luggage of guests ahead of us and that if he pulled up we might load the car ourselves rather than waiting for the assistance of the bellmen depriving them of their tip. I don't know that this was the case, but it was annoying to me as we were watching the clock and anxious to get on our way. It was frustrating to see our car yards a way and the driver and another employee (the person who we had given our car receipt to for picking up the car) just joking around while we waited and waited and waited...... Other than that the staff was friendly and helpful. I used the concierge's service several times for directions and they were always on the mark. The gift shop at the hotel is very tiny and cramped, but almost anything you need is within walking distance to the hotel. There is a Starbucks in the adjacent shopping center and another right down the street, as well as another take-out place with fruit bowls, pastries, breakfast sandwiches, etc.-I think it was called Fatima's. This is a very good location for seeing the area. The hotel itself was very quiet and the view of the Hollywood sign out the window of the hotel was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved our stay here!”
Reviews.Author: blondie63
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 day stay at this hotel and absolutely loved every minute of staying there. We booked the club level, something I would have never considered had I not read the reviews here, and it was worth every penny. They provided very nice breakfast in the morning with a wide selection of choices, and a light snack in the evenings. Water, soda and coffee was available all day. Definately worth the extra $$ for my family. The room itself was impecibly clean, and I loved the California decor and incredible views. We didn't deal much with the staff but the view times we did were always positive. I will definately recommend this hotel to all my friends and family, and I don't hand out recommendations lightly. It was most definately a 5 star experience for us, from start to finish.

Reviews.Title: “The best of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: xxxtraveltoday
Reviews.Content: We stayed there the night after the Oscars. So the town was still hyped up. Hollywood Blvd. was closed to cars. The hotel is in the best location-right next to the Hollywood & Highland Complex with various shops and restaurants. Reminds me of the Sony Complex in Berlin. The decor of the hotel is from the 1950's. I expected Lucy and Ricky to knock on our door. Hollywood of the fifties was Hollywood at its best. This hotel does not disappoint. It's a fun place. Great views of the Hollywood hills.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: writer_lady
Reviews.Content: If you want a great place to stay in the heart of Hollywood, the Renaissance Hollywood has the best seat in town. It's located right in the Hollywood & Highland complex which features great shopping, dining, the Kodak theater (the very same in which the Oscars are hosted) Grumman's Chinese Theater, and a perfect view of the Hollywood sign. In a very car-centric town, this hotel lets you walk (safely) to a couple of the most visited, must-see sites. You can get over to see the famous "hands in the cement "at any hour. But enough about the location, the hotel itself was extremely comfortable. Modern, stylish rooms with extremely comfortable beds, top quality linens, and again, a view of the Hollywood sign. It had a nice bar downstairs, small convenience store for late-night snacks/toothpaste. I stayed for buisness, and the wifi was reasonably priced (but not free, which is a drawback). Plus there was a buisness center for last minute printing & collating.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy!”
Reviews.Author: Jillymo
Reviews.Content: Very nice room, little smaller then expected but acceptable. Beds were very comfortable, views from any rooms were great. we overlooked kodak theater and swimming pool and loved it. Convenient location for seeing lots in a short amount of time. Was there a few days before Oscars and there were many late night parties, but wasn't bothered by noise. Would love to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaCharity
Reviews.Content: We were there for just one night but the place was spotless and modern. They were working on the spa so we couldn't use that and the pool wasn't as warm as they said... but the food in the restaraunt, though it took forever to get and there were only 3 other couples in the restaraunt, it was delicious! The downstairs bar was busy and provided a fun atmosphere to kick back in. It was steps away from all the action and the staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overall”
Reviews.Author: CornHuskerNation
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Renaissance during the Oscars weekend. The staff was terrific. The room was a double with a view to the northeast. We could see the "Hollywood" sign from the room. The room was standard size and met our needs. Maid staff was friendly. We spent some time in the hotel bar and had met quite a few people. The lobby area was quite a bustling place of activity. We did not eat in any hotel establishment so I can't comment on the food. The hotel location is perfect for those wanting a good central location in Hollywood. The area around the hotel is pretty safe. I wouldn't steer too far off the main paths however. If I came back and had to stay in Hollywood I'd make this my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “lots to do in and out of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: rockchalk07
Reviews.Content: I could not have asked for a better location. I had friends coming in from out of town and suggested that they stay there since it is in such a great location. I personally had never been in the hotel until they arrived. I spent one night there with them and was very pleased with my stay. Not only were the rooms awesomely decorated the hotel itself was so accommodating. Their restaurant Twist was delicious and their pool rocks. Now I hear they are opening a spa called Spa Luce and if you get a treatment there you can use the hotel pool for the rest of the day (even if you are not a hotel guest). That is perfect for me since I actually live in LA and do not need to stay at a hotel. I for sure give this place two thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: marek1978
Reviews.Content: Great location if you want to see Kodak theatre and star lane. Rooms are very nice with modern furniture, great views over the city, affordable valet parking ($27 if I remember correctly). Unfortunately if you make a trip by car and then want to return to the hotel in the evening you get stuck in traffic jams. So its best to stay there for one night see the oscars venue, star lane and escape :)

Reviews.Title: “The Renaissance has service issues!”
Reviews.Author: AL81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance hotel one night and we won't be going back! We had so many problems checking-in it was unbelievable! First, they lost our reservation and it took 45 minutes for them to find it (even though I had a reservation # and reciept from the internet). The lady at the desk was friendly, but made no attempt to credit us for the inconvenience. Then she wrote down the wrong room number, then our keys didn't work...etc. (All in all, it took us 1.5 hours to check-in from the time we walked into the doors at 4 p.m.) We had dinner reservations at 5:30 at Twist (in the hotel) which we were late for(food was just average). The location of the hotel is great and the room was fairly nice (except for a very strong bleach-type odor that overpowered the room). Overall, we will not stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel but noisy guests”
Reviews.Author: berkshire_nomads
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over the weekend ahead of a couple of days of business meetings the following week. When you are jet lagged and need a good night's sleep after a flight from London it's maybe a bit naive to stay in the entertainment captial of the world on a Saturday night. However I was surprised at the level of noise throughout the night. I had a room on the 13th floor overlooking the piazza of the Hollywood and Highland complex. There was no noise at all from outside, but I was regularly woken through to the early hours by noisy and lengthy conversations in the corridor outside. Then at 2.00 am there was an unbelievable amount of banging on the floor from the room above. I have no idea what was going on but so strong were the impacts that the fittings on the wall of my room started rattling. It stopped after a few minutes but by then I was awake. Being 10 am UK time my body clock kicked in and I had a tough time getting back to sleep. I certainly don't blame the hotel for this but I'd bear it in mind if I booked again. Otherwise eveything was fine. Rooms are large, clean and nicely designed and certainly from my room there was a good view. the bed was large and comformatble. I was also able to get a late checkout (6.00 pm) for a reasonable $40.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: monikasz
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel for only 2 nights. My husband and I won a Hollywood Gateaway trip for 3 days and that's the hotel they put us in. Since the hotel was all booked for regular rooms, we were put in an Executive Suite overlooking the hills. The room itself was quite big, with huge windows, pretty views. The bathroom was nice too, with seperete shower and toilet. The room wasn't the cleanest. It was just ok. But we loved the location of the hotel, right in the midst of all the attraction of the Hollywood Blvd. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance Hollywood Hotel...Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: IJai
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I stayed at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel from December 27-29, 2007. We were born and raised in California, but had never done the California "tourist thing", so we decided to go to Hollywood for a few days before a Mexican Riviera cruise and check out the scene. This hotel is fabulous! The staff was friendly and helpful. The check-in and check-out was quick and efficient, and we had a comfortable room with a wonderful view of the Hollywood sign and the Capitol Records tower. The complex that surrounds the hotel was great, you almost didn't need to leave the hotel complex if you didn't want to. There were restaurants, a movie theatre and plenty of shops to keep us busy. The Renaissance Hotel is a pick up spot for a lot of the tours of the surrounding areas. Also, there is a Metro Station on the back side of the hotel where you can catch a train that goes directly to and from Universal Studios for $2.50 round trip. We spent a day at the Universal Studios park and didn't have to worry about renting a car or taking a cab there. If you are going to take a Hollywood Stars Homes and City Tour, I would advise you NOT to take a Star Line Tour. The buses are filthy and unmaintained, they are unorganized, and the customer service is terrible. The half day tour that we took was so bad, we couldn't wait for it to be over. It was a hassle from beginning to end. At night the hotel complex comes to life with people strolling the streets viewing the stars on the Walk of Fame, taking snapshots of the Chinese Theatre, The Kodak Theatre, and watching the many street performers that come out at night to entertain and take pictures with the tourists. Our final night in the area, we went for dinner at a beautiful little Cuban restaurant called El Floridita. It was a five minute cab ride from the hotel and the food and ambiance was great. We had an excellent meal and enjoyed the live band and salsa dancing that the restaurant features on Saturday nights. All in all we had a wonderful three day stay. This hotel is close to everything, and the service is superb! I would definitely recommend it to friends, and if I ever return to do the "tourist thing" again, I know where I will be staying!

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: mfaco
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel with my family and it was just perfect. Very good location with spacious room. The concierge was very attentive and kind as the rest of the personnel. It is also clean, with a very fast room service. I recommed it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: triwinner
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. By car it is very easy to get in and out of. However, the price for parking or valet is a bit ridiculous, but I guess that is normal for LA. The hotel interior decorations are a bit modern for my taste but it is still very nice and clean. The front desk staff look and act like high school kids but they were nice and friendly and fairly efficient with the check in process. The hotel pricing is a tad expensive but you are paying for the location (and the nicest hotel in the area). The room was nice and clean with ultra-modern furnishings. The bed was very comfortable and the Internet access was easy. I did not use the bar in the lobby but it looked nice. The restaurant on the second floor had good food. Do not miss the breakfast buffet. Make sure to try the lemon pancakes. There is a fairly nice mall attached to the hotel that you can walk through to get to Hollywood Blvd. I picked this hotel because of its close proximity to the Magic Castle on Franklin. It was very easy for me and my wife to walk there for dinner and come back very late in the evening. Overall, I would stay there again because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Rennaisance”
Reviews.Author: howardjohn
Reviews.Content: My wife and i, have just returned from a west coast tour of the USA. Los Angeles was our first stop, were we stayed at the renaissance. The hotel was excellent,we encountered no problems at all during our stay. The room was very clean and spacious,on a high floor with a nice view as requested. The location is fantastic,right in the heart of hollywood. All the attractions are close by,and easy to get too! We went to universal studios on our first day,which was fantastic. The second day we had a 6 hour tour of LA,very informative and took us to all the relevant areas. The only disappointing thing, was that we only had a three night stay before going on to Las vegas. A lot of people told me not to go to LA,hence the short stay. I am sorry i listened to them,maybe they stayed downtown! The concierge was helpful, and the breakfasts were great. All in all, i would recommend LA and the Renaissance. We had a great time,and just sorry we did not stay for longer. I have not commented on pool area,as we went in the winter! It did look a little small,i think this hotel is better if you like to sight see(rather than sun bathe).

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Hollywood!”
Reviews.Author: Matcham16
Reviews.Content: This is the best location I've seen in Hollywood. It is attached to the Hollywood and Highland center and Grauman's Chinese Theater. It was wonderful to be able to walk outside and see the celebrity hand and footprints. The subway station is also very close and we used that to get around Hollywood. We visited Universal Studios without having to pay for parking and we went to Union Station and China town all by the subway and train transportation. I would recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Hollywood for the first time. Request a room with a view of the Hollywood sign on a higher floor and you won't be disappointed! Our room had huge windows with a splendid view of the city and the Hollywood sign. The hotel staff were also very friendly and happy to honor each of our requests. The hotel pool area was under construction when we went as they were adding a spa to the hotel. We didn't have any problems with noise or dust though. Wonderful hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Handy location, nice staff...celebrity spotting :-)”
Reviews.Author: marcnshirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with our 2 neices and 2 children stayed in this hotel for 6 nights as part of our family trip to California, we had been at the Disneyland Hotel for 6 nights prior to arriving in Hollywood...see seperate review. We booked an executive king and a standard room with 2 doubles and requested connecting rooms and a roll away bed. All of our requests were met. The hotel is located atop of the Highland center with an array of shops, cafes, cinemas and restaurants to explore....fabulous spot. We were checked in efficiently and with a smile and told about the concierge floor offering breakfast for a $30 charge per room extra. We thought this great value and accepted this offer. Breakfast varied each day but there was cereal, fruit and some offering of either bacon, sausage and eggs each morning. They also had a variety of juices and starbucks coffee in the lounge. There were also breads and pastries on offer. In the evening there were snacks and during the day you counld pop up and grab a softdrink or water if you wanted also some pieces of fruit. Our rooms were very nice and clean, our executive king was also handicap accessable, so we had a huge bathroom and plenty of extra space. The room with the doubles had a smaller bathroom, but both rooms had mini bar, amoir and a large closet. We found the location to be perfect and used the train system which is located right in the Highland Complex, to get down to the Staples Center one night when we went to the basketball. It is a fast, safe and inexpensive way to get about, without the hassles of parking and LA traffic to contend with. An all day ticket is only $5 per person, and can be used on the trains or buses. When we finished with our passes at the end of each day we handed them on to some less fortunate folk, (which seem to frequent the Hollywood area)...who made use of them to get to where they were going. We booked tours through starline, which are just on the street in a kiosk at the bottom of the Highland center on Sunset. They will heavily discount for a family group...just ask, smile and be patient...we saved just under $100 for a family of 6. We did tons of walking and sightseeing around Hollywood and at all times felt safe. One day we walked from the hotel to the Beverly Center....we walked down Highland, onto Melrose and all the way to La Cienega and to the Mall....it took us 3 and a half hours...with stops for shopping, drinks and icecreams along the way...what a fabulous walk that was, enjoying Hollywood by foot is really something. ....I digress...back to the Hotel...we found the staff very friendly, the rooms spotless, the food delicious...even room service was very fast and arrived hot and fresh at very reasonable prices...so we took advantage of this a lot with snacks in bed while watching tv for everyone, almost nightly. The manager told me, when we were checking out that the rooms are due for a refurbishment, and that they were going to be fabulous, with flat screen tvs, new linens (nice already) and new pillows (which need changing), carpeting etc. The refurb is due to start early 2008. The spa is being built now too. Whilst there we saw, Judith Light in the lobby, we saw Tom DeLong from Angels and Airwaves checking in, we saw Jack Nicholson and Lindsay Lohan at the basketball, we saw the guy from Supersize Me...pushing his child in a stroller along Melrose and my husband saw one of the Baldwin brothers driving down Hollywood Blvd...but wasnt sure which one it was...so if you are into celebrity spotting....they really do get out and about in Los Angeles...we saw some and were kind of excited lol. We felt this hotel offered exceptional value for money, a wonderful location and very nice, helpful staff. The congierge is very good, we had several packages delivered to the hotel that my husband ordered online and all of them arrived in one piece and on time. Overall we had a wonderful time in Hollywood at the Renaissance. I would recommend this hotel to family, friends and fellow travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: conniejo688
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel (Dec. 28th-Dec. 31st) and it was truly a wonderful experience. 1) Room: We were on the 17th floor and had an excellent view of Hollywood Blvd and beyond. (We had just a standard 2 bed room). 2) Service: We were promptly checked in no delays. Concierge service was outstanding. They took their time with us and booked our reservations whether it be a tour or a dinner. 3) Location: You can't beat it. Several eating places within walking distance as well as Hollywood Blvd and sights that the tour buses stop at - they are literally in your backyard. You are attached to an open air 5 story mall with several stores, theaters and shops. There is also a gas station right next door as well as a small strip mall across the street. 4) Parking: We came by taxi - so we did not experience the headache of the parking, but they do have valet parking and share the parking garage with the mall. 5) Cost: Yes it was expensive, but no more higher than the other hotels in this area that I checked out. You could stay for less in downtown LA, but it is truly where you want to be. I would highly recommend this hotel for your Hollywood experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but depends on what you are looking for”
Reviews.Author: alexsndiego
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to stay one night at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel. My review is very limited because we only statyed 1 night. This is a very nice hotel but there some things that I didnt like about the hotel. Let me start out with the positives: 1) Location - Cannot be beat. Adjacent to the Kodak Theater, Mann Chinese Theater, and Hollywood and Highland shopping center. 2) Cleaniless - Hotel was clean and comfortable. Bed was really nice to sleep on. 3) Public Transportation - The LA's red line light rail is located about a block away. The Red Line can take you to Universal Studios, Pantages Theater, and China Town (via transfer). 4) Great views from higher floors. Here are some of the things that I didnt like about the hotel. 1) Location - Its tough to get in and out of this hotel because the entrance to the hotel is along a small driveway that leads to the parking structure for the Hollywood and Highland shopping center. Hollywood and Highland streets are very busy and typical of Southern California gridlock. 2) Valet Service - Very busy hotel. Valet service can take up to 5 to 10 minutes especially in the mornings during check out. Be sure to call ahead. Expensive! Try and get a rate that includes valet service. 3) Bathroom - pretty small and nothing pretty about it. just a standard hotel bathroom in their standard hotel room. Sink, vanity, toilet, and shower are all located in one room. Pretty tight accomodations. You pay for location here. This hotel does not have the luxury amenities and features equal to its price. The price you pay is because of location, location, location. Just keep that in mind if you stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased 100%. Almost. Until Delighted to Assist failed...”
Reviews.Author: Badang
Reviews.Content: We wished that we booked a room in last year's Queen Mary New Year's Eve Party. And so, that's what we did at this NYE Party at Hollywood Renaissance. My sister who has a medical condition and may get tired sooner is coming with us, so I upgraded to the best room they have available at the time of my booking which was a mini suite. The room was a little bigger than a standard hotel room, immediate view was an empty land and parking lots definitely not the Hollywood sign shown in their web site but the changing room for the performers for the event was also within our immediate view that caught attention and we get a good view of the entertainment on the poolside. My sister said that she was pleased and that's good enough for me. My husband and I and our daughter didn't intend to stay after the party because we only live 30 minutes away. My sister insisted that we stay at least until early morning when it is safer to drive. The king size bed was used by my sister and her husband. Our daughter and I used the sofa bed but the extra blanket found in the closet was not thick enough plus we needed one more for my husband who's contented with two seats put together. Anne from Delighted to Assist agreed to send up two blankets and two towels. We waited and waited and nothing arrived. My husband just wrapped himself up with the bath robes. Definitely not the kind of service we expected for $420/night we paid.

Reviews.Title: “A few hits, a few misses”
Reviews.Author: NYCandworld
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 nights at this property earlier this December. The room was quite spacious, and the bed and amenities were fine. I also have to compliment the staff of Twist, which is a great restaurant. I have to agree with previous comments on here about hotel staff. From check-in and throughout the trip, many of the staff seemed uninterested and preoccupied. I felt like they were not trained at all by Marriott, as opposed to most Marriott's where there is a consistency of service. Quick tip: Parking is $10 a night at Hollywood and Highland complex. If you can walk a little bit and it is not much at all, this is well worth the savings over the valet and seemed very secure. Mel's Diner around the corner was a good meal option, as well as Vert in the Hollywood and Highland complex (which unfortunately shut down during the stay) and Trastevere for Italian food.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed all expectations”
Reviews.Author: JulesOZBrisbane
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance for three nights over the weekend of 30 November 2007 with two teenagers. I chose the Renaissance simply because of the location. We had been to LA in 2006 and stayed in West Hollywood... I decided then that our next stay would be at the Renaissance. I must admit to being a little nervous based on TA reviews but adjusted my expectations accordingly. We had a club level room on the 19th floor with access to drinks/snacks and breakfasts (with the exception of Saturday). I booked directly with the hotel and paid $199 per night. I can only describe our three-night experience as excellent. There was not one low point to our stay. The staff were fantastic, the room was surprisingly light and "roomy", the view of the Hollywood sign etc. was amazing, the Club Lounge was a god-send and the location was simply unbeatable. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood and fine .”
Reviews.Author: JamesBond0007
Reviews.Content: Hold on , it in Hollywood people. The area is a lot better then it used to be believe me. Its always busy even late at night and you will be fine. Firstly about some of the muppets who have reviewed the hotel....... why did you stay in Hollywood ? Its full of historic building and places , if you you love film and old forties film you will love it and this hotel. All you others please go to your theme parks and shut up. This hotel is of a high standard, top draw if you have to put up with the crap serviceand hotels in Engand, Have no worries on stopping here. Go buy a good Hollywood history book from Borders and enjoy the area, The Pig and Whistle is great, Bogart, Bacall, Hemmingway etc all used it in its day........ If you do not like that mixed in with the slightly tacky t shirt stands and all stay away, Santa Monica is lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you think you are paying for.”
Reviews.Author: Carltongirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights arriving on the 17th November and departing Wed 21st November 2007. We telephoned ahead from Cabo as our flight was delayed for 3.5hrs and to let the hotel know that we would be late and to ensure that we still kept our reservation. On our arrival we were told by the female checking us in that they had no king size beds, this is despite the fact that I had telephoned approx 7hr prior from Mexico to advise of our late arrival. We were offered a double room as there were no king rooms left and when my husband explained he is too tall for a double bed we were moved into the disabled persons room (with a king bed) next to the elevator. At this time I asked that my husband and I have a room change the next day to a king size room. The next day we were moved to a room with a king size bed on the same floor. Housekeeping - the room was very clean, however for 2 out of four days we arrived back in our room in the late afternoon to find that housekeeping had not been. On each occasion we called housekeeping (or delighted to assist button on the phone) and were told they would send someone up straight away. We waited and waited and no one showed. Eventually on our third phone call over a 2 hr period, housekeeping eventually showed up. A message was left on our room phone message bank from the hotel advising they hoped our room had been cleaned and they wanted to ensure that our stay was special! The next day housekeeping knocked on our door and we said we will be 10 minutes and housekeeping said that would be fine and they would clean the room in 10 minutes. We left the room and arrived back 5 hours later and housekeeping had not touched the room. We called 'delighted to assist' and explained housekeeping had not been etc, the same thing had happened yesterday, they said sorry blah blah blah and someone would be up right away. 2 hours passed again before my husband called up twice more and housekeeping finally turned up at 4.10pm explaining to my husband they were not aware the room had to be cleaned earlier. Another downside, there is no laundry for clothes washing. The only alternative is dry cleaning through the hotel which is expensive. The reception/check in staff were not friendly (perhaps a reflection on the management) however the hotel did provide us with two beverage vouchers to the value of $16 each on our last day, however the same cannot be said for the restaurant staff at The Twist Restaurant at the hotel. The Twist Restaurant staff were friendly, helpful and ensured that all guests had everything they needed. We ate in the restaurant in the morning (The chilled buffet $16 is healthy and nutritious and delicious, American Buffet is $20) and the dinner menu is superb and the food delicious and fresh. Their wine list is excellent. The staff will chat to you and show an interest in you. We really appreciated their friendliness and kindness. The bellhops were really friendly and always ready to answer any questions we had. The concierge on the day we asked the gentleman a question, Tuesday 20th November was disinterested and unfriendly. The location of the hotel is great for all the tourist attractions in the area. Shopping is limited at Hollywood and Highland although there is a great DWS shoe store nearby. At nightime the area is questionable and sleazy at night and we would not recommend hanging around the boulevard for too long. It would not be a particularly safe place. We recommend Mels Diner for dining for either Breakfast, lunch or dinner which is a 5 minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel Weak on front desk sev. Incl Mgrs”
Reviews.Author: GQue
Reviews.Content: Just came back after two nights. Hotel and room very nice. Problems: Called Marriott direct and booked the room using the properties promotion (M11) for parking included (VS $29 per night) and had Resv in hand. Told system did not show what I had and I would have to pay for parking. Asked for Mgr. who came over and told me the same thing regardless of what I had in hand. Told not familiar with the promotion (even though it was on their direct website) After about 10 minutes of going back and forth I said let me get on the computer and I would show them their promotion on their site. First told I would have to go to the 3rd fl business center even though they had 6 computers with internet access 5 feet from me and only 2 being used. Finally allowed to use the system and even when I pulled it up and showed it to them at first they did not want to honor it. Finally manager said he would take care of it. When I checked out two days later they had still charged me $29 x 2. Which I then had to start all over again with another mgr to resolve. (Another 10+ minutes) -Valet parking often did not answer the phone when calling down. Twice I had to call front desk to complain to get my car. - Minus this good location for what I had to do.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Shame About Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: LondonLegend
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hollywood as part of our Honeymoon before making our way up the coast to Cambria, San Fran & then on to Maui. I will only base my review on the hotel itself & we found the Hollywood Bvld area itself a major let down. The hotel & the complex it is situated on is superb. The room was clean & quite spacious & had everything you could really want for your stay. The view was as good as you will get in that location. Our room looked over Hollywood & the city of LA. We never had many dealings with the staff other than checking in & checking out of the hotel. We were only there 2 nights & to be honest we never encountered any problems with service. One major plus which was a surprise was the cost of onsite car parking. If I remeber correctly it was $20 a nights. Which was great value compared to the shock I got in San Fran at a rate of $50 a night. The hotel has a great location if you want to do the tourist stuff of Hollywood & surrounding area's. The hotel itself is built within an open air mall type area. You have some nice shops but the mall area contains mainly restauransts. All of this is situatated right on Hollywood Bvld & next door to the Kodak & the Chinese Theatre. The hotel swimming pool was on the small side & was empty most of the time. Not somewhere to go if you want to have a lazy holiday. We booked a city tour of LA & Hollywood via the hotel concierge. They were very helpful in pointing us in the right direction & who to avoid in booking these kind of trips. We ended up having a great day & took in some wonderful places within LA. Through this trip we came across the Santa Monica area which we loved & will hopefully vist for a longer stay in the future. If you are the type of person that wants to come to Hollywood & do all the tourist stuff then this has to be the hotel for you. It has a great location, well priced & is clean & modern. But be warned if you are from out of town like us & have no experience of Hollywood then be prepared for a big disappointment regarding the Hollywood Bvld area. We found the place to be very intimidating especially in the evening & quite sleezy & dirty. Not what we expected at all. Regards, Jason & Anne (London)

Reviews.Title: “Bad Bad Bad”
Reviews.Author: jazzalicious
Reviews.Content: I am at The Renaissance Hotel right now. 4 hours ago we came back to our room. I walked into the bathroom and the sink was filled with black sludge. Basically the sewer system had backed up into our sink and the sink was filled with human waste. I phoned down to the front desk and they said they would send up someone to fix it. I said that was fine but I would like to be moved to another room. I was put on hold for 10 minutes and then informed that there were no other rooms. I asked to speak with the manager. After waiting for another 10 minutes I was told that the manager was busy. I informed the front desk person that I found it hard to believe that a hotel this size would not have a room available. She told me that there were rooms availabe but none of them were clean. I told her that I was sure she would not want to stay in a hotel room with human waste in the sink. She put me on hold again. She then came back and said that she had found a room. She said that she would send up keys to the new room right away. I thanked her and told her I would still like to speak to the manager. 20 minutes later we were still waiting for the keys. I went downstairs and got the new keys myself. I still haven't heard from the manager. If you are looking for a hotel with good service I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel, GREAT SERVICE, Studio Suites are AWESOME, Location Location!”
Reviews.Author: sfcafox
Reviews.Content: I checked into this hotel for one night only and from the website thought I was going to be in IKEA land but was pleasantly surprised as the rooms were very comfortable, plush bedding, beyond friendly service (they actually walk from behind the front desk counter to hand you your keys....what other hotel does that I ask???) Safes in the room, really nice and clean and NEW bathrooms, LATHER bath products (SF company) in all bathrooms, restaurant was good, located next to a zillion things to do at Hollywood and Highland and very easy access off the 101, near Universal Studios and Hollywood Bowl. I'd highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a hotel for fun or business in Hollywood or LA areas.

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance again!”
Reviews.Author: weluv2vacation
Reviews.Content: I just received an email from someone who asked about parking and it reminded me that I have not yet wrote a review of my Aug. 2007 7 day stay at the Renaissance. This was our 2nd time at this hotel and it will definitely not be our last. We love this hotel and hope it does not change unless it is to become even better. You just cannot beat the location that is pretty much central to everything. Hollywood just outside your door, L.A (we love to go to the farmers market and Grove) and Beverly Hills min. away, Santa Monica- We love to just hop on Sunset Blvd. to the PCH, Universal about 15 min, etc. and there's even a metro stop just outside the door though we always use the car. Though Disneyland and Knotts were not the sole purpose of our trip, we did go one day each for those and the car ride there was not far either. In the 2 times we have stayed there, I have not encountered bad service. On the contrary, it has been quite excellent. The hotel and room are clean. We requested a roll away bed and mini fridge, extra towels and pillows and all came at no extra charge. Before your visit, if you book through them, they even email you a "request form" that includes things like early check in, fridge, extra pillows, etc. There's a pool area, at the time we were there they were adding a spa. It might be complete now. The Hollywood and Highland complex which the hotel is connected to is always fun with the shops, places to eat, bowling, and more. During this visit, one day walked out of the hotel and to our surprise Michelle Phieffer's Hollywood Walk of Fame Star ceremony was starting so we were up front and center! Actor Paul Rudd and Jeff Bridges were there as well and Jeff Bridges even took my camera and took a picture of the both of us for me! We travel to L.A. about twice a year and the Renaissance will be our choice again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Shoddy Service”
Reviews.Author: LisaJordan91264
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice but the service really was crappy. I believe if we would have had 'fame n fortune' plastered on our forehead than we would have been treated like royalty. The room was $1000.00 for 2-nights which included two $29.00 valet parking charges (and taxes) but the service was just crummy. I'm writing a letter to the NW Marriott Regional Office at 1 Marriott Drive in Washington DC & another to corporate headquarters in Omaha, Nebraska. For the rate we paid, things should have been top notch, I believe. There was no information in the rooms on local things to do & see, no one informed us of any perks (cocktails, snacks, ice machines, etc), the only fridge in the room charged you extra if you put anything in there (such as my grandsons medication) and would automatically charge if anything was removed (and not normal rate). The room service for a pint of ice cream and a slice of cake for $40.00. It blows me away that at the rate this hotel charges, the service and extras they try to get you for. And don't try to use their luggage carts because they claim that 'normal people' can't push them - "too much liability" - I think this equates to "our people really want a nice tip". : | Give me a jingle at Muneuss1@bendbroadband.com for further details if you need it. lisa

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: thasez
Reviews.Content: Great hotel right in the heart of Hollywood. It's joined onto the Chinese Manns Theatre and is round the corner from the Walk of Fame. The hotel itself is clean, modern and has all the amenities including a pool area and gym. We had the breakfast buffett included with our room rate which we were pleased about because it costs $25! It's very nice though and they cater for everyone with cereals, fruit, bagels, eggs, bacon, sauages and fresh juice. The room was a good size and looked out over the hollywood sign and it was cleaned every day.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: shelley99
Reviews.Content: We (myself and my boyfriend)stayed at the Renaissance Hollywood for 3 nights from 12th october 2007 and really enjoyed our stay. After a slight hiccup upon arrival, as in we didnt have a reservation even though i booked it 13 months ago! I work at thomas cook so i booked it myself, took about 15 mins to resolve, finally found my reservation in a totally different name!!! Anyway, got our room, really modern and spacious looking at Hollywood sign, lovely bathroom and everywhere clean and tidy. The hotel is attached to Chinese theatre and kodak so virtually on the doorstep to everything, apparantly alot of the celebs stay here on oscars night as you can walk through to hotel without having to go back outside to get mobbed!! didint see any celebs though! We did a tour through starline which was fabulous took us through beverly hills movie stars homes tour, rodeo drive, stars cemmetry and even up into the hollywood hills for a close up of the sign! after this we did a walking tour of the walk of fame, el capitan theatre and kodak/graumans, amazing day and leant alot!! next day we did universal studios which was really great too The hotel is definatly worth 4 star as it was just a fab place and the staff were really helpful too. pool was small but didnt see anybody using it, great views from there too, if you go, request a high floor as views are great and its quieter too, I would definatley recommend this hotel for its location and i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and exellent location!!”
Reviews.Author: aussieitchyfeet
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the US. Our first two nights where spent at the Hollywood Renaissance and it was exellent. I read about 6 months of reviews before deciding on the hotel and definitely made the right choice for us. We arrived at 9am after a 13hr flight and our room was ready. We had requested a high floor with a view over to the Hollywood sign this wasn't available at 9am but if we waited two hours that room was available.So off to Mels Diner for breakfast and a walk down the walk of fame and our room was ready. No problems at all. The week before the hotel had emailed and asked if we had any requests besides the view of the sign we also requestad a fridge to store drinks and some medication. It wasn't there when we returned later in the day and before I could followup the front desk rang to check if the fridge was in our room. It arrived 5 minutes later. The conceirge and porters couldn't have been more helpful with information and friendly and check in staff where great. I was travelling with my 2 children and I was a little anxious but my experience with this hotel made me feel safe and very comfortable. It is a great location ,our room was great We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LilyNewZealand
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at the Renaissance Hollywod Hotel for four days in September. Terrific location - a busy area and near all the 'touristy' things and terrific shopping. A bonus for my son was seeing Will Smith who was filming a movie in the street below. As another reviewer has said the fridge/mini bar was off putting but mainly because while we had tea/coffee making facilities we had nowhere to store milk we bought so ended up having to get extra 'whitener' which is just not the same. A small thing though really. Rooms were light, airy and clean, good shower! Staff were okay - not over friendly but did their jobs adequately.

Reviews.Title: “good location, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: carouge
Reviews.Content: Aside from the location being near Mann's Chinese Theater and the Kodak Theater, the hotel itself is just an overpriced wannabe-chic hotel. The rooms are adequately decorated, but necessarily functionally if you have to work. One tacky feature is that they prominently display a note that anything removed from the mini-bar results in an automatic charge- first time I ever saw that. One other minus- the parking lot I used every day was a 5-10 minute walk each time to/from the room.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of HollywoodO”
Reviews.Author: Escapefromthedesert
Reviews.Content: It is in a great location for the Hollywood area, it is right next to a subway stop, but to get around in Los Angeles you will need a car. The room was comfortable with a great view of Los Angeles. We were placed next to the service elevator and the walls were on the thin side. So, be sure to tell them in advance if noise bothers you. The bed was comfortable. The food was expensive in the hotel. Though, there are a significant number of places to eat within walking distance. The lobby is somewhat chic and the neighborhood is a very typical Hollywood neighbor hood. It is safe to walk except take care at night. I would recommend the hotel for first time visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oztraveller72
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 nights last week and thought the hotel was fair and worth the price. There is not much to do in Hollywood apart from the shopping and Walk of Fame etc, but if these things interest you this is a convenient location to them all. The hotel was clean, bed was comfortable and I had a view of the city on the top floor which was nice. I think compared to the other hotels around the area that this one is the best and is fairly priced.

Reviews.Title: “no need for a car”
Reviews.Author: jamesmcfadyen
Reviews.Content: came over from Scotland with family for 5 nights in Vegas and 5 nights in Hollywood. Was worried about not having a car for Hollywood, was also told it was a dodgy neighbourhood. No problems at all. The hotel is excellent location superb. One metro stop from Universal, bus tour of Hollywood, bus to Disneyland, exploring the immediate area , shopping mall, cinema. Enough there to keep us fully occupied.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: vmimartins
Reviews.Content: After arriving at LAX, is a long way to the hotel but in LA everything is far away. The location is great ... even to get a LA tour. The shopping next door gives plenty of option on eateries... and the "circus" in the walk of fame is a must see Rooms have a simple and modern decor and the pool is small but great for a swim after a day of walking around

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FunkyG
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in August with my wife and 2 boys (11 & 15). Thehotel was ok, room had a view of the Hollywood sign, and very comfortable beds. We visted universal studios for 2 days with our Southern California City Pass- excellent value if you are touring LA, Anaheim and San Diego. Universal Studios was enjoyed by all the family - the queues were not too bad, especially if you get there early. The only problem we had was that our room was not serviced one day, despit the fact that we were out from 8.00am to 6pm. We asked for a service whilst we were at dinner. We asked an employee and housekeeping. Upon our return it was not serviced as promised. We eventually got the room cleaned and new towels at 10pm. Unimpressed, I complianed to the desk manager who answered a phone call without looking at me whlist I was in mid-sentence. The hotel amanger eventually cam e over and apologised and gave us a $50 refund. This did spoil our view of the hotel, which other than this was satisfactory, if not exceptional, and a little expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for family”
Reviews.Author: Sophie6
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 days and it was en excellent choice ! The hotel is 100m away from the chinese theater and the hollywood boulevard. The shopping mall is connected with the hotel (coffes shop, restaurants, shops), the breakfast is very good, the parking valet service is very convenient. Univesal studio is 5mn away. The rooms are big, colorfull and very quiet. I would come back and I recommend it to any family ! Sophie

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for teenagers”
Reviews.Author: FamilywithTeenagers
Reviews.Content: My family ( 2 adults and a teenage boy and girl) stayed here for 4 nights in August 2007. About 2 weeks before our visit, the hotel emailed us to welcome us and to offer us an on-line valet service. What a friendly gesture! This included the possibility of up-grading to use the Club level facilities for $40 per day. We were allocated an executive room on the 18th floor with fabulous views of the the Hollywood sign. Although we had a king bed, a double sofabed plus a single rollaway bed in the room, there was a great sense of space to spare and we did not feel at all squashed. All the beds were comfortable; surprisingly small spartan bathroom (but with a "dressing room" attached.) Club facilities were great value as we had breakfast there (continental with scrambled eggs, sausages and bacon) every morning, plus soft drinks (Coke, Sprite, bottled water etc) whenever we returned to the hotel, plus small cooked snacks in the evenings (tortelini once, beef satay on another evening and spanakopita - greek spinach nibbles in filo pastry- on yet another) The location was fantastic. Great shops and restaurants so close by, as well as the obvious sights (Chinese theatre, Walk of Fame, Hollywood Bowl etc). We got a free "elephant card" from the visitor centre, for discounts at some shops, restaurants AND at the HOTEL! There was good live (free) music performed in the courtyard of the shopping complex on 2 evenings - jazz and rock. Self-parking was easy and cheap ($10 per day, incl overnight). Beyond the refined calm of the hotel, the whole area was always bustling with people and activity and we never felt threatened or uncomfortable. (Tho' we were not out beyond about 11pm). The area to the east of Highland Ave is less glitzy than the complex itself but it was no more seedy than parts of Oxford Street or Tottenham court Rd in London. All in all, an excellent hotel base to stay. (Incidentally, we visited Venice Beach, and that was seedy!)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: ladybugx87
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hollywood Renaissance for 3 nights on business in August 2007. Check in was smooth- I had a room on the 16th floor with a view of LA. The room was clean and spacious. The bathroom was nice as well and had all the amenities you would expect. My only complaint is that the TV had very limited channels. I used the valet service which was both prompt and courteous. I had room service breakfast one morning and I highly recommend the fruit smoothie. Checkout was smooth as well. I would consider staying here again- the only reason I would is because there are so many choices.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: KB1955
Reviews.Content: My 13-year old daughter and I made a mother/daughter trip to Hollywood and decided to stay at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel. We have absolutely NO complaints! Our room was fabulous. We asked for a view of the Hollywood Hills and had a perfect view. Our room was so spacious and clean and well-appointed. It was nice to have a separate bathroom and dressing room. The staff was very helpful and we enjoyed the breakfast buffet at Twist every morning - it was worth the cost for fresh food and fruit. We would DEFINTELY stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Prepare to pay a bribe”
Reviews.Author: travelfromheretother
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a beautiful property in a great location. But if you're checking in late at night, be prepared to pay a bribe. Seriously. David, who works the front desks some nights, will outright ask you for money to secure a reservation. When our group arrived, with a verbal but not confirmed reservation, he said he could only give us the room if we gave him $50 cash. We're not the first this has happened to.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Hollywood walk of fame”
Reviews.Author: crazycatwoman
Reviews.Content: My daughter and i stayed here for three nights, four days. The hotel is outstanding, nothing is too much trouble, from the bell hop being there to take our cases to our room, to the concierge telling us he could book us a table at Aston Kutchers restaurant (we declined as i don't like fish). The hotel is situated has a mezzanine, which allows you to ger directly onto the hollywood walk of fame and shopping malls. (my sister) who lives there was very worried about two English women being let loose in Los Angeles and all the bad things that happen!!!!! I can honestly say, i never felt afraid at all, the Hotel was extremely secure, i don't think i will stay at any other hotel again except this one when i visit. Absolutely Outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic all round!”
Reviews.Author: Mowzer
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this hotel exhausted after a huge flight and extra long transfer to be greeted by very friendly staff on reception who upgraded us to a suite. Room was amazing, absolutely huge, 13th floor with spectacular views across LA. Location was also spot on. You couldn't be any closer to the walk of fame and the shuttle to Universal Studios is practically on the doorstep along with loads of shops and eateries! Concierge are really helpful. Pool is small but nice and you can see the Hollywood sign whilst you sun bathe!

Reviews.Title: “Totally successful 2-night stay”
Reviews.Author: MmePoppy
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with our two rooms on the Club Level of this hotel. The Club Room offers a good free breakfast and copious snacks and goodies at happy hour, in addition to a light array of desserts later. Quite a good value, making it well worth the extra cost of these club level rooms. The room decor was fun and fresh with a sort of "Jetsons Go Hollywood" feel which we liked a lot. The hotel adjoins a shopping mall with movie theater, the Kodak Academy Awards theater (we took the tour and loved it!) and many places to eat. Our best meal of our whole California vacation was right there in the mall at Wolfgang Puck's restaurant "Vert" -- sublime food and not even all that expensive for what it was. We paid more elsewhere for much less interesting offerings. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely return to this location on a future trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheWalkersWirral
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights 23rd July 2007.We are a family of four with two children 10 and 6 years.This is a brilliant hotel.The location is excellent and the view from our room on the 15th floor was breathtaking.The Mall underneath the hotel is perfect for eating and shopping.You could not be any closer to where the stars all left their mark on the walk of fame.As for the hotel, the staff were very welcoming and polite.The swimming pool is excellent for a cooling dip in the LA heat.Also the views aren't bad!! Stay here if you are stopping in LA for any time whatsoever, whether for one night or a week.. Eat your breakfast at Johnny Rockets in the shopping mall.There is a great diner over the road from Hollywood boulevard called 'Mels Diner' eat there, fully recommended.Also do the starlines tour of the celebrity homes..Brilliant.All in all we stayed 4 nights and were able to visit Santa Monica, Rodeo Drive and we drove to the Malibu beach areas.A dream stay to start our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: sk9758
Reviews.Content: The saddest part was that I stayed here only for one night! I would love to return again and stay for a longer period. We were a family and had booked 2 rooms. Being a platinum elite card holder, I was upgraded to an executive suite with a king bed and a connecting room with 2 double beds and had access to the club lounge. Valet parking was good albeit a bit pricey at 29 bucks. Check in was like a breeze and my kids leapt with joy when they drew the blinds of the room and saw the magnificent view of Hollywood hills in front of them. You could literally spend the entire day gazing out at the view. The rooms were spacious and well decorated. For that matter the suite is not a 2 room suite as would be expected but rather its a large room with a seating area. The bathroom was huge and had a large dressing room as well. The lounge was fine but not as well equipped as I expected it - there were no constant soft drinks available as such. At 5 pm the cocktails and hot snacks were placed and in the morning a reasonable breakfast of continental fare with 1-2 hot items were placed. Location is par excellence and lots of shops and restaurants are nearby. Not to forget that you walk into the Chinese Theater and Kodak theater next door. Overall its a lovely property and very well maintained in every aspect.. The staff are great too and I would definitely return to this place again were I to visit LA.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Surprise! What a view!”
Reviews.Author: ATLTravelsALot
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in an executive suite on the 15th floor with amazing views of the Hollywood hills/sign. The room was large with expansive windows. Overall service in the hotel was exceptional as well. Don't worry about the spa renovation warning on the hotel's website. This in no way interferes with the hotel overall and noise was not a problem. Location, location, location....a walkway leads to the very nice shopping center connecting all the major Hollywood tourist sites for great pictures. This is an above-average property. One suggestion: go early if you plan to have the breakfast buffet. The line/layout of the buffet gets long due to the setup. I would stay here again without hesitation. I have stayed at numerous hotels in the area including some very expensive 5-star properties in Beverly Hills, and the Renassance Hollywood ranks at the top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: elsiekate
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance from 19th-23rd July. Check in was incredibly quick, taking literally 1 minute to complete, which was a blessing as we were meeting friends for dinner less than an hour later and were pretty stressed out after a long drive through rush hour traffic from the airport! The hotel sends an email in the week before your stay asking if you have any specific requests, and we had requested extra towels and a refridgerator in our room. The pleasant receptionist noted this and said that they would be delivered to our room promptly. They arrived less about 10 minutes later. The room was reasonably sized and very clean, the bed was very comfortable with plenty of pillows. Our view from the 14th floor was of the pool area and into the Hollywood and Highland Center was pleasant enough. The bathroom was good, if nothing special, but the water pressure was good and the bathroom amenities were nice and replenished daily. Unlike some hotels the hair dryer was also moveable, and I was able to take this into the bedroom to use the mirror there whilst my husband was using the bathroom. Housekeeping was good, but there is a notice in the bedroom that says they clean rooms between 9am and 5pm, which meant that often when we returned in the early afternoon the room had not yet been cleaned. Nevertheless, they were efficient and unobtrusive. One of my few complaints with the room was that it was not particularly well sound proofed (although I am quite particular about noise levels). I never heard a thing from outside, or from the rooms either side of us, but people in the corridors could be heard as clearly as if they were in the room itself! Not that it happened regularly or was lengthy, but I was awoken twice by such noise. The air conditioning was good although, again, too loud for me, so I did turn it off during the night. We didn't use many hotel facilities, and didn't eat there. We did eat at Wolfgang Puck's Vert in the shopping complex attached which had a lovely ambience, great service and good food. One thing we did use was valet parking. It may be $29 per day, but for the convenience, speed of service and pleasant staff it was perfect for us. We also used the minibar for bottles of water, when we ran out, and they cost around $2 per bottle, which in terms of hotel minibars, isn't that bad. The hotel always seemed busy during our stay, with many conventions or events going on. There were all sorts of different people from business men, regular tourists to women in amazing evening gowns in the lobby and as such the elevators were slow and sometimes crowded. Overall, the Renaissance Hollywood is a reasonably priced hotel with good amenities in a great location for tourists. As a tourist who was meeting friends that were staying at different hotels around Hollwood, I can honestly say it was perfectly placed and of a better standard than many of the other hotels around the area. Literally a minute's walk through the H&H complex and you are on Hollywood Boulevard and right by the Chinese theatre. A very pleasant stay indeed, and we'll probably be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a bit soulless”
Reviews.Author: Snowangel30
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, with great rooms with great views. The pool was very welcome in the heatwave that LA had while we were there. They are currently doing some bulding work around the pool so I don't think there is a much space as normal and there was quite a lot of noise from the building works during the day which meant that you didn't want to spend too much time in the pool. My only complaint about this hotel was that you felt like an anonymous guest. This hotel feels more like a large conference hotel than a holiday hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just Back - Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jmmm
Reviews.Content: Just back. We really liked the hotel. It was very convenient to all of the local attractions. The hotel was clean & well kept. We had a nice room and the staff was very friendly and accomodating. If you need directions, please ask. They were very helpful with that. If you want to stay in the middle of the action, this is the hotel for you. The Hollywood & Highland mall was very convenient for eating. We also had a breakfast and a dinner at the hotel resturant, Twist. Food was very good and so was the service. If you have children with you, I highly recommend the El Capitain theater across the street from the hotel. Overall, it was a great stay. The only downside was the traffic, it's murder. That's no reflection on the hotel of course, just something you should know. Also, I recommend checking out the Grove/Farmers Market. It's an interesting place, both high end (The Grove) and a great place to get a reasonable meal (the Farmers Market), with a lot of choices.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: laura2111
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a stay at the Hollywood Renaissance. I will get the negative point out the way first, which is i found the hotel staff quite impersonal, un-enthusiastic and non-smiley. Apart from that, our stay was super. The room was surprisingly spacious and modern. We had an amazing view of Hollywood from the huge window in our room. The room was also imacculate however, the hairdryer was broken but i didn't bother asking for another as i had my own anyway. The surrounding area of the hotel was a little intimidating, especially to walk about. However, there are many tourist attractions next to the hotel. I visited Grauman's Chinese Theatre and did the tour which was interesting and worth the $12 it cost. We also went on the tour of the star's homes, which I really enjoyed even though i mostly seen a tour of the stars gates. This cost $30 pp.

Reviews.Title: “Awaiting Urban Renewal”
Reviews.Author: GrantParish
Reviews.Content: Hotel - Yes Neighborhood - No When I walked into the lobby of the Hollywood Renaissance and looked at the curving steel staircase, the modern art, and the expanse of shiny marble, I thought it was a brand new hotel. I was not dissuaded from this view after seeing the guest rooms and meeting facilities. I was very surprised to learn that the hotel was a renovated Holiday Inn. It seemed to me that every surface had been replaced, renewed, or reworked effectively obliterating every trace of its former incarnation. My room was comfortable and attractive with all new furniture, bedding and carpet. It is a nice set up for business travelers with a large repositionable desk and comfortable desk chair. Unfortunately like many upscale hotels they charge for internet access ($9.95 per day). The bathroom was average size but had a nice marble counter and massaging showerhead. Tub, tile and all fixtures appeared to be brand new. The hotel is large - more than 600 rooms - and seems to cater to conventioneers. There are three floors of meeting rooms and most of the folks I saw around the hotel seemed to be wearing name tags. I was surprised not to see more tourists during my stay as the hotel is near the Hollywood Walk of Fame and Grumman's Chinese Theater. The attractiveness and newness of the hotel was in stark contrast to the surrounding area. As you sit in one of the Eames chairs in the sleek lobby and look out the front window, you see a run-down strip mall with a liquor store, tobacco shop and "JuJu's Brand Name Fashions for Less" as tenants. In fact, with the exception of the Highland/Hollywood shopping center next door, the area surrounding the hotel is primarily tacky souvenir shops and low rise apartments/"residence hotels" dating from the 1940s/50s. The Highland Hollywood block includes the hotel, the new Kodak Theater (home to the Academy Awards) and the attractive open-air Hollywood Highland retail/dinning complex. Unfortunately this new construction was not an impetus for any new development nearby and outside this one block, the area is very run-down. To be clear, the area is not blighted - we are not talking about abandoned buildings or broken glass - just tired, old, scruffy buildings. I did encounter homeless people sleeping on Hollywood Blvd, only a few hundred feet from the hotel. Dining options are limited. There is only one restaurant in the hotel - Twist - which is open for all meals. I had breakfast there and it was tasty but fairly expensive at $20 for the buffet or $12 for a simple quesadilla. The restaurants in the Highland/Hollywood center are primarily chains and fast food with the except of Wolfgang Puck's Vert. For a fine dining meal, you will have to travel a considerable distance. I stayed at the Hollywood Renaissance in mid-July 2007 for three nights in order to attend a business conference at the hotel. I paid $169 which was the negotiated conference rate. I thought the hotel to be a great value at this price. My interaction with the staff was minimal - check in was quick and easy, maid was pleasant, and waiter was cheerful. I was concerned that I was never notified that I had received a FedEx package. If the sender had not contacted me, prompting me to inquire with the concierge, I would have left the hotel without getting the package.

Reviews.Title: “In the Middle of All of the Action”
Reviews.Author: AustinTexan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, and our three children, spent two nights in the Renaissance Hollywood hotel (July 1st and 2nd). I booked the room on [--]for $279/night. We got a "Club Level Rate" with two double beds. Staff brought a rollaway up at our request for the fifth sleeper. The club level access allowed us to eat a hot breakfast before setting out each day, as well as, provide dinner snacks, desserts and beverages. This lounge was very nice and greatly appreciated. The room was great with a view to the south. The hotel abuts an upscale shopping venue that is right on Hollywood Blvd. and convenient to Grauman's Chinese Theatre (with the handprints of major Hollywood stars) and the wackiness of the area. We saw Live Free or Die Hard in the main theatre. This is the way movies used to be shown! The hotel was very convenient to Universal Studios. The pool area isn't the greatest but space is at a premium and my kids never complained. We enjoyed our stay and felt that I had booked the right place for my family. As with all of my bookings, I am dependent upon the TripAdvisor reviews. Thanks TripAdvisor!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience! Recieved what I asked for.”
Reviews.Author: ideniti
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel. I was looking for a place that would provide luxury, a great view, walking distance to restaurants, and convenience to other parts of LA with a decent price ($200ish). This hotel delivered on all counts. Though some people may find the room decor as "Ikea-like," I had no problems with it and found the room/hotel to be modern without being overly loud or trendy. The room/bathroom was clean and nicely arranged and the bed comfortable. I asked for a room high up with a view if possible, and the people at the front desk were more than happy to oblige.
