I received a room on the 18th floor with an awesome view facing east where I can see the Hollywood sign on one side and downtown L.A. in the distant other. Check in took 10 minutes and check out even shorter. Just downstairs is the Hollywood/Highland complex that provide some entertainment/dining within walking distance. To get back into the hotel at night, they require you to swipe your room key to open the hotel doors, a nice security touch. Overall very happy with my stay. Minor quips (and this is just being nit-picky), the "up" button on the remote wasn't working and the bed pillows were a lil' too lumpy for my taste. Doubt I would get as much value for the money in other hotels in the area. FYI - I used a AAA discount for my rate.

Reviews.Title: “Won't return”
Reviews.Author: teamom01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hollywood Renaissance in June at the end of a trip down the PCH. Maybe we were just ready to go home, but we didn't really care for this hotel. Traffic was TERRIBLE getting to the hotel. We pulled into the driveway and once my husband told the valet he would self-park we were ignored. No one even offered to help me get luggage out of the trunk. The room was nice and had a great view, but every time we had an interaction with staff we got the feeling we were bothering them. It took 3 calls to get extra pillows brought up to our room. The hotel is connected to a large mall which is convenient, although we only ate there and didn't shop. The area was pretty disappointing. Overall, the hotel is modern looking and has a cool feel, but the staff were not at all welcoming or helpful. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mole
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Renaissance at the beginning of June. We had booked via their website for $199 per night and decided to pay $30 extra per night to upgrade to the Club Level. We arrived at the hotel at 9am after a 14 hour flight. Check in was very easy and quick and fortunately we were able to go to our room immediately.The young lady at the counter was extremely well mannered and helpful. We were allocated a room on the 18th floor which unfortunately didnt have much of a view. However, the room was well maintained and the bed very comfortable. The bathroom was average and on the small side but the bath amenties (soap, gel etc) were very good. A coffee maker was in the room which was supplied daily with coffee bags. The Club Lounge was ok, but personally do not feel it is worth the $30 per day (we are used to travelling in Asia where the Club lounges are open 7 days a week and offer amazing choices of food, cocktails, internet etc ect ). Breakfast was continental with some hot choices including Bacon, french toast etc. The staff were very slow to replenish food when it ran out and coffee & tea were only available at certain times of the day. The location is what this hotel is about and it is great. We loved being so close to the Metro station and also used the Dash buses to access the Beverly Centre, The Grove etc. We were also lucky enough to be around for the Oceans 13 premiere and got some great video of Brad Pitt & Matt Damon walking past the crowds. There are some good food outlets in the Hollywood & Highland Centre and we enjoyed the burgers at Johnny Rockets, and the desserts at Beard Papa. Some good shops in the centre including a huge Sephora and a Virgin Megastore. All in all we enjoyed our stay at the Renaissance and the location was perfect for us. Would we return ? Yes but mainly for the location.

Reviews.Title: “i will stay no where else!!”
Reviews.Author: tinkabell22
Reviews.Content: I was set up there by RCA during the American Idol Finale and it was amazing. When I first arrived and saw cameras everywhere I was wondering how they were going to keep the fans away! The security were so friendly and we had NOT 1 PROBLEM!!!! The room was beautiful we stayed on the 16th floor and our view of the hollywood sign was amazing! You never need to call a cab because everything is near you. You have the walk of fame, graumans, wax museum, world records museum, all the pick ups for the tours, hollywood and highland and list goes on!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel if attending an event at the Kodak theater”
Reviews.Author: smgapp
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this hotel while we were in town to attend the Daytime Emmy awards. Prior to our stay we received an e-mail asking if we had any special requests, we asked for high floor room & a refrigerator in the room.-they gave us an 18th floor room with fridge. We took the Super shuttle from the airport at a cost of $15 per person. This hotel was a central location for all the action of the daytime emmys. Many stars were in the lobby and at the pool. We were able to go to the street and watch the stars arrive and then go back to our room,change clothes & attend the Emmys. The Kodak Theater is connected to the hotel through the outside shopping area. We picked up great snacks at the Shish kebob restaurant in the shopping area and ate them in our room. The next day we booked a tour of the Star's homes- there are two tour companies and both try to solicit your business in front of the Chinese Theater.Make sure you negotiate a price- they offered us the children's price for each adult ( a $10 per person savings with Starline tours). It was a great tour that not only covered the star's homes but also gave us a bit of time to walk around Rodeo Dr. and we got a good overall tour of the Hollywood area with scenic photo stops. The hotel has refreshing fruited ice water in the lobby- it was so good on a hot day. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great views”
Reviews.Author: Senor_Schmutzig
Reviews.Content: We're in the midst of a six night stay at the Renaissance Hollywood and couldn't be happier. Originally, we had reservations for three nights here and 3 nights at another location but after the first night, we decided that the location of this hotel couldn't be beat. As mentioned by previous posters, the hotel connects to the Kodak Theater and Grauman's Chinese Theaters as well as the Hollywood and Highland shopping/entertainment complex. Considering the length of our stay, having the convenience of a Starbucks and multiple other restaurants allows for us to make quick restaurant runs after long days "out and about". We got two joined rooms on the 14th floor with a view of the Hollywood sign and downtown L.A. Our 3-year old son liked looking out of the windows and seeing the variety of characters (literally) making their way over to Hollywood Boulevard. Apparently they park in the parking lot across the street and walk the two blocks to "work". We saw Spiderman, Charlie Chaplin, Elmo and a few others make their way over to entertain the crowds in front of Grauman's Chinese Theater. The service has been excellent and responsive. We called for more wash clothes and towels on two occasions and within 10 minutes, there was a knock on the door with delivery. The pool is heated and also has a nice view of the Hollywood sign. They are currently increasing the size of their spa and part of the pool deck is blocked off, but this didn't hinder things in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay... but iffy Concierge”
Reviews.Author: atllocal
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a night at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel - overall a great experience. Good location and not far off the 101. I did find the Concierge here to be... uh... a bit of a novice. I asked for some recommendations for nearby sushi or fushion food - he rattled off 2 places and then sighed... I then chose one and he then said... okay. I then asked if the place requires a reservation and he said yes. I had to then ask him if he could make one for me. He then called the restaurant. Then I had to also ask him for directions. It was as if he had no idea what a concierge is supposed to do. Oh well - I lived. Just don't expect the best ideas/service from the Concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; wonderful for 2nd time and getting better!”
Reviews.Author: mini
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Hollywood for the 3 day Memorial Day weekend; we had last stayed there in November. The place is getting better. They are putting in a new spa; the service is very good; and the pricing we received for a king size executive suite was an excellent price. We had a great view of Yamshiro (looked like we were in Japan) and also of the Hollywood sign; the combo made Hollywood so wonderful. We continue to be very happy with the excellent location of the hotel; great for visitors who have only a couple of days to see all the sights in Hollywood. We enjoyed being able to walk out to Hollywood and Highland Mall; taking the shuttle ($) to Griffith Observatory; the short walk to the Graumanns Manns Chinese Theater. Its easy to see the Walk of Fame and perfect to go to an event at Kodak Theater (note: if Hollywood Bowl is happening, good location for that too.). We were happy to find it a short drive to Melrose Avenue where there are several wonderful restaurants. The baths are larger size compared to other LA hotels; the room was quite large and very comfortable. The executive king we stayed in came with 2 large very comfortable king size beds - this place would be wonderful for a family stay. All in all, Renaissance continues to be a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Willsons
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel room nice, clean and spacious ask for a room on a high floor to ensure you get the best views of the hollywood sign. Check in was really quick, concierge not that great told us our taxi to Universal would be $5 turned out to be $15, no big deal, but was not really sure of what was going on where the shopping mall was or how to get there by bus....but she was not the usual concierge perhaps she was on lunch? One thing was the journey from the airport we got in our taxi at 5PM, not ideal... rush hour and fare was almost $90 with a tip, I would strongly suggest you get the shuttle. Cannot comment on the hotel food as there was too many options outside so we did not eat in!

Reviews.Title: “Ikea anyone?”
Reviews.Author: kliz15
Reviews.Content: I love the renaissance parc55 in San Francisco, so I anxiously booked get away weekend in LA. We reserved the largest suite and traveled 30 miles North to the high rated Renaissance Hollywood hotel. What a bust. The lobby was gorgeous, check in was seamless but when we walked in the room...we were disgusted. 2 positive things...the view of the hollywood hills was goregous and the room was huge. But it stops there. The bed was so old, that when my husband sat down next to me, i rolled into him. The bedding was very 80's, the sofa and chairs were Ikea quality. It was bizzare. There was tons of floor space but the design was so poorly laid out and full of wasted space. We turned on the cheesy tube tv ...took one look at each other and walked out. They courtously refunded our money with no charge and we drove back to the OC and saved our money for our next trip to the Signature Hotel at MGM in Vegas. Now that's a hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “True 4-star service, rooms, and facilites”
Reviews.Author: Travel Richly
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Hollywood Hotel is exactly what you'd expect from a Marriott-managed 4-star property -- comfortable rooms, friendly service and good facilities. Rooms are totally functional -- very comfortable beds, nominal internet charge ($9.95), a mini-bar (careful of the automated charges), floor to ceiling windows, good TV channel choices, etc. Everyone from the front desk to housekeeping are exceptionally friendly and eager to please. The fitness center is clean, bright and well-equipped. The mall next door is easily accessed direct from the hotel's 3rd floor and offers a great choice of restaurants and shopping. If you want to be in the heart of Hollywood, it would be hard to beat this hotel for choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent notel”
Reviews.Author: sureLondon
Reviews.Content: It was really hard choosing a place in LA since it is so spread out and I had limited time. This hotel was amazing and I will go back on a next visit. The decor is modern and new. Rooms are excellent, airy, bright and clean. I had full views of the Hollwood sign. The staff are very friendly. The bar and the Twist resturant are excellent. Location amazing. Can spend hours at the Kodak theatre/Graumman theatre antics on the street. The shopping centre attached has great food. Johhny rocks there has the best burgers ever. Also, the tour buses leave from the Chinese theatre- very convenient. Must do the Star homes/city/universal studio combo tour for $100- worth every cent. The only annoying part of the trip was the awful low life taxi drivers that were always a problem to deal with. If in LA- this is one of the best hotels to stay if you have a short time and want to see the most.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: LondonEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from 9th - 14th April $199 per night it was an excellent experience in the heart of Hollywood. As we are from London and extremely used to walking everywhere we under estimated just how far apart all of the sights are. Just outside/attached to the hotel you have the walk of fame/graumans chinese theatre and you can see the hollywood sign but all of those sights take 2 hours to do in total then everthing else is a long way away we walked 10 miles one day. The taxis are stupidly expensive so after spending $90 on the first day we decided to take the buses!! You get a day bus pass for $3 from the driver and can go all over the city they are clean and frequent every bus that we travelled on had a map and I found the drivers and and people friendly no problem even when we travelled at night. Universal Studios is only 1 stop by metro from this hotel but other than that the metro is pretty useless for tourist sights which is a shame I was expecting more. This hotel is very nicely done free water and room service and cleaning you could not complain about I would recomend as a foreign visitor not to expect to change money in the hotel they only allow you to change $100 a day and in a place like this money is spent fast so bring plenty. Outside the shopping centre there is a starline tour booth we did the stars home tour with beverly hills as we were deciding to do the tour the price dropped by $10 each so I recommend hesitating and seeing how much they are willing to take off. One more recommendation is Mels diner across the road turn away from the roosevelt and its your 1st right great food and not over priced unlike most places. I can not compain at all about this hotel but If I was to go again I would definantly stay in Santa Monica and travel into the sights by bus or car it is a lot cleaner safer and the restaurants are nicer too. Everywhere has somewhere to park in Los angeles/Hollywood/beverly hills so stay by the beach.

Reviews.Title: “A very bad experience at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: JSF.IN.UK
Reviews.Content: To start with, the hotel didn’t have the 3-day romance package reservation for my wife and I. We were on honeymoon. We had booked online with Expedia.com and had no problem with the other 3 hotels, flights to and from USA and the car rental sections of the itinerary. Having given a copy of our booking reference to the front desk we were allowed to check in and went straight to the pool. It was horrible – towels, half empty drink glasses and food left everywhere – no one was maintaining the pool area. I asked for a pina colada at the poll bar and the barman just laughed and said he could not make one – didn’t know how. He also had to write out a check for me to sign so I could charge the drinks to the room. There was no noticeable hotel security, no room key needed to get to the pool and most of the people by the pool seemed to live locally and were not hotel guests. The next day we returned to our room at 6pm and it had not been serviced. I called housekeeping. When we returned to our room the bathroom was not cleaned, coffee not replaced and a heap of old sheets had been left in the room. An hour later there was a bang on the door and a voice yelling “What time are you leaving!” I explained that we were booked in for 3 days. Later that evening we had a drink in the hotel lobby bar which closed at 11pm, even though there were many hotel guests still drinking. The following day being a Monday, major construction work around the pool level re-started early morning – the loud drilling noise made it impossible to sit by the pool. On checking out, the cost of breakfast (which at best was average) had been added to our account each day in error – it’s an inclusive deal as part of the romance package. Isn’t it strange how errors on the hotel account are always in the hotels favour? Overall the only advantage of this hotel is the location which is ideal for the Kodak and Grauman’s theaters and the Hollywood Walk of Fame. If you stay at this hotel, I hope you have a more enjoyable stay than we did.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms, v. easy access of US 101”
Reviews.Author: draig_cymru
Reviews.Content: The Rennaisance was an excellent hotel for the price. The room (a twin double) was large, and easily accommodated four of us. The decor was fairly stylish and the windows were floor to ceiling and we were lucky enough to get a 17th floor room from which we could see the Hollywood sign, Capitol records tower and the L.A business district skyline. A selling point for us was the fact that as Brits we were driving on the "wrong" side of the road and didn't want to do too much driving in the hustle and bustle of L.A. This hotel was 1/4 mile off US 101 (which were travelling on from the North) and was really easy to access. Valet parking was reasonable, worked out as £15 per night - but where else are you going to park?! Great shopping centre attached to the hotel, and the Manns Chinese Theatre and Kodak theatre make up part of the complex. The area itself isn't as glamorous as you'd imagine (considering it's where the Oscars are held) but it's just one of the places you must see if you're on a driving holiday of the Western USA. Be sure to check out the small eatery/deli in the Highland shopping centre owned by Ken Davitian (Azamat Bagatov in Borat). We got a taxi from the Renaissance to Universal Studios - BE AWARE- the taxis (not affiliated with the hotel) that park up outside the lobby are expensive: were charged $30 (inc tip) to go the 3 or 4 miles to Universal. We got a far more honest taxi driver on the way back which was $16.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, but not quite my cup of tea”
Reviews.Author: ladycascadia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel from April 18 through April 21. It was a "working vacation" as I was attending a songwriters conference. Yes, indeed the Renaissance is "hip" happening and abounds in just amazing modern art everywhere! The lobby bar is pretty nifty, and they have complimentary lemon water that was very refreshing on a hot day. My room overlooked the pool and shops of the nearby shopping complex. The lucky ones get a view of the Hollywood sign. The guest rooms have an brightly colored "Austin Powers-esque" decor scheme that while some may find exciting, I found it somewhat gaudy...but then I prefer my hotels on the "homier/cozy" side...and to me "mod" is simply not cozy. Because there are so many people around, I found the hotel to be somewhat noisy at times. The hotel's strength? Customer service. The staff was ready, willing and able to answer even the dumbest questions with friendliness and professionalness. I found the staff people very helpful...and despite the fact there were well known celebrity guests present, they treated everyone as a VIP. Now what I wasn't prepared for was that they add a $50 incidentals fee when they freeze your card, so plan ahead. It is removed from the bill if you don't use any incidentals, though...but still...a person ought to be warned when they book a room of that extra amount. The hotel's weakness? Housekeeping was not as meticulous as I thought it would be for a hotel of its caliber. At any given time there would be room service plates on the floors and I thought that was tacky looking for a hotel of this calibre. I had to call housekeeping to do my room on the 3rd day because they skipped it almost two days in a row and I had NOT put up any do not disturb signs, so i don't know why my room was ignored. While the hotel does have provisions for families, it is my opinion that this hotel is set up primarily for business travelers and those 20-something tourists or aspiring entertainers who want to experience the Hollywood "scene." The only reason I would return here again would be because it is geographically convenient and in a reasonably safe neighborhood compared to other parts of Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, large, self-contained and busy!”
Reviews.Author: Tynkility
Reviews.Content: Things to like - This is a beautiful property. It's right in the heart of hollywood: Chinese theatre, walk of stars, theatres, clubs, etc. It's connected to the Highlands, basically an outdoor mall with many shops and restaurants. You can actually go to Grauman's to catch a movie, because the hotel exits into the courtyard of the complex on several levels. This is a Marriott property, so the beds are great, the rooms spacious (including the bathroom), the service is good and it's clean top to bottom. There are a couple of restaurant/bars in the hotel itself, and the "scene" is pretty good. Being a large hotel, there are constantly taxis available and the valets are pretty quick retrieving the cars. Rooms facing east have a view of the Hollywood Hills/Sign. It's also about 5-10min from Universal City Things not so crazy about - Though this is a higher end Marriott property, in my opinion it is way overpriced. You're basically paying for a safe above-average place, in a prime location. I received a group discount of $100, and the price was $189. So basically the rack rate is $290. I compare this to the Hilton I stayed at in the middle of TimesSquare, which was $250. If the room included a fridge, microwave and free internet, I might be less inclined to think such, but there was only an honor bar and internet was $.30@minute - 3 minute minimum. Valet is $29@night. There are 6 elevators which seem to be in use constantly, so I found a little annoying that there was no stair option. I was only on the fourth floor, but all of the stairways were emergency exit only. I didn't see very many children or families - though I was in panels most of the day - I think it's an ideal property for couples. Overall, if you can afford it, and want to be in the thick of hollywood, I recommend this hotel. But there are less expensive alternatives nearby. One tip though, if you're leaving the hotel and heading west, get a map to get familiar with the streets, and AVOID Hollywood Blvd for a few blocks (unless that's your destination, in which case you should just walk from the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hollywood hotel”
Reviews.Author: moondust7
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Hollywood Hotel is an excellent place to stay. I was there for 4 nights last week. It is not a sparkling new hotel, but is very clean & comfortable and the art-deco touches are nice. The service was top notch. My only real gripe would be the price of valet parking ($29) - don't do it! Just park in the parking garage attached to the hotel - it's only $10. That's where the valets take your car anyways. The Hollywood & Highland complex at the hotel was great to walk around - it was nice to be so close to places to eat and shop. And it's great that it's an outdoor complex b/c you can walk around and enjoy the weather. Even more fun is the fact that you are right outside the Hollywood Walk of Fame. The best "feature" of the hotel for me though was all of the history associated with it - I have a couple friends who live in LA who filled me in on several events throughout the year that take place there (events for the Oscars, Grammy's etc.). I had room service for breakfast 2 mornings - the lemon souffle pancakes and the cinnamon roll french toast were tastey. The prices were what you would usually pay for room service - about $15 total. There is a French crepe eatery in the Highland complex that my friends and I went to the other 2 mornings, and that was great. Overall, I'd definitely recommend this hotel. It's expensive, but any nice hotel in LA is going to be pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeJCartwright
Reviews.Content: Renaissance Hollywood Hotel 14 t0 17 February A large hotel in central Hollywood. There is only one restaurant but the hotel is close to the Hollywood and Highland complex with a choice of restaurants Italian, American, Japanese and sort of French. Large well equipped bedrooms. Twin room means two double beds. Staff were friendly and helpful. The situation is walking distance to tacky, tourist Hollywood Bvd. Taxis are required for down town and the business district. Must see Getty Centre and the Grove shopping road. A limo tour of Beverley Hills, Bbelaire and Rodeo Drive starts from Hollywood Bvd. Tip choose a floor above the tenth floor for great views. Hotel breakfast buffet was good value and American.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Robjoy
Reviews.Content: We travelled to L A by Greyhound bus from Las Vegas,and stayed at the Renaissance in Hollywood.The room was not ready when we arrived at 4.30pm and were told it would be at least 2 hours before one would be ready.So we went for a walk round and a bite to eat before returning and being presented with our room key.The room was very nice with all the usual facillities and very clean too.It was also nice and quiet too.The hotel staff were nice and friendly and the concierge was particularly helpful.The location is superb with all the famous sites on the doorstep.There are a lot of street performers out on Hollywood Blvd always out to make a few dollars from the tourists and also a lot of homeless people begging but they dont cause you any trouble.There are some excellent tours to choose from,but make sure you do one of the tours of the movie stars homes,its very good.When you come out of the hotel front door and turn right there is an excellent little chinese restaurant just down on the left.Not quick service,and be prepared for a wait if its busy but the food is superb and very reasonable in price.We would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: BeachBumms419
Reviews.Content: I picked this Hotel from reading the reviews on Trip Advisor since it had been so long since we had been to Hollywood I was not sure.The Hotel is newer and very clean,the people that work there are so very nice and very helpful the view from our room was great! Nice view of the City and the Hollywood sign! I was concerned about parking as we have a very nice vehicle and my Husband is not crazy about Valet's as they are not usually very careful. The thing about this Hotel is it is hooked to a great ,secure parking garage that is only $10 a day they Valet in the same garage for $29 a day but we chose to self park and it was great, lots of stalls and nice sized for those who are paticular with your vehicle!The restaurant in the Hotel is great food and very reasonable, Lily the waitress was a great start to every day. The rooms are nicely equipped with all the necessities, room service was great too! I really can not find one negative thing to say about this place. You can walk to so many things if you choose too, we took a cab to a few so we did not even have to fight the traffic. You are right next to some very major attractions and we saw a movie at the El Capitan Theater that in itself was exciting! We plan to come back very soon as the 4 nights we stayed was not nearly enough!Oh yeah, Mel's Diner is a must try and just across the street!Oh yeah, the beds were very comfy and the shower head was a nice plus also! The mini bar IS not over priced and they give you great coffee for every morning! Stay there and you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, rooms, views and location (even for pedestrians!)”
Reviews.Author: jpl88
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicer Renaissance city hotels - located in the middle of the Hollywood action and conveniently built atop the Hollywood and Highland mall, with many dining and shopping options. We had a room at the front of the hotel with floor to ceiling windows views of the Hollywood hills (and sign), Capitol records tower and downtown LA. The decoration of the property and rooms have a certain Hollywood retro style which I found nice. Room was very clean and spacious. On the disappointing side the beds weren't the Revive type (but still OK) and the executive lounge had uninspiring breakfast and hors d'oeuvres and no free internet access. If you are visiting LA and are not renting a car this is a great place to stay as the Metro runs just under the hotel. If you are renting a car (which I cannot recommend enough) you can selfpark in the Hollywood and Highland mall for only $10 a day (no in/out). Do make sure you drop off your luggage first in front of the hotel though as it is a bit of a trek from the parking to the front desk. This hotel is in a convenient location for tourists. First time visitors will have the Hollywood attractions at their doorstep and could use the hotel as a base for the other LA attractions as you're only a 20 minute drive from Pasadena, downtown LA and the Getty. Universal Studios are only a 5 minute drive away. In summer the Hollywood bowl is only a mile away. Overall I'd recommend this hotel especially if you're doing a lot of exploring in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Marriott”
Reviews.Author: AlexNyNy
Reviews.Content: This is a great vacation location with the nicest staff I have encountered in years of staying at Marriott hotels. The staff actually enjoys being helpful and has a policy called "Delighted" to serve you where they respond with friendly good attitude service to all requests (valet parking, room service and front desk included). The in room food was a cut above regular fare. They have a signature dish for breakfast - lemon souffle pancakes with raspberries and pine nuts - that is truly special. As far as the location is concerned - it is less than one block from the Walk of Fame and the Kodak Theatre. Be wary of the night crowd on this famed walk, however, we found it to be chock full of prowling aggressive characters who really will mug you if you let your guard down - one woman wanted to get my purse - and she looked wholesome and clean enough at first sight but was way too interested in my bag. Be alert and maybe skip the after dark action at Hollywood and Vine.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: orp
Reviews.Content: The hotel features the "normal" smooth service and super clean and well kept properties of Rennaissance / Marriott. This hotel is a little bit more local in design than most chain hotels, with an emphasis on local designers like Eames and nice touches so you dont forget that you are in Hollywood. What really set this property apart is the location within the Hollywood and Highland compleks. Everything you need in Hollywood is right in front of the hotel, the open Highland mall, kodak theatre, Manns chinese, loads of restaurants, freaky activities all around you, movie look alikes and the Hollywood sign, in short everything that is Hollywood. Stayed here for one night, but the next time I am in LA I will stay here again due to location.......the rest of LA is within easy reach by car or the Metro right under the hotel, YES...the Metro in LA!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MiamiMom-7
Reviews.Content: Just got back from spending one week in LA moving our son into his new life as an aspiring movie director. I chose this hotel because of its proximity to the Hollywood sights and also its reputation. We were never disappointed. The staff is extremely polite and go out of their way to please you. We became friends with the different valets and head doorman. He would offer better routes to take on freeways, etc. The lobby is beautiful, the rooms are extremely clean and very comfortable. I can't understand some people's complaints here about the linens, bedding, etc. I found them to be heavenly, the linens felt fresh, the feather pillows were perfect as was the cushy mattress cover. The comforter was equally plump. Room service was quick, we had breakfast in daily. The prices are ridiculous, but we were too lazy to get dressed and go downstairs. The adjoining mall is fun and full of great shops and restaurants. We enjoyed having a late night crepe and french coffee press at the French Crepe place. There is something here for everyone. It was so convenient to be right in the heart of the Hollywood Boulevard. Just go downstairs and take a walk on the walk of fame, or check out the street performers in front of Grauman's Chinese theater. Sure the area is seedy and run down. But there is so much history here, just soak it up and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel in the heart of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: swelch
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel - suitable for vacationers and business travelers alike. The hotel is located in the heart of Hollywood - connected to a large mall which contains the Kodak theater where the Oscar awards are held each year. It's also steps away from the Hollywood Walk of Fame. Hotel has a modern feel, with a lrage lounge area in the lobby. Rooms are well appointed with modern decor and nice bathrooms. I must say the hotel did feel a bit soul-less. If charater is what you want, it feels very chain and you'd probably be better off in a more classic Hollywood hotel like the Roosevelt or the Chateau Marmont, but they have nice rooms, good service and fairly reasonable prices, so all in all a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK, but surrounding area disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Trekman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Renaissance Hollywood from Dec. 1-5. The hotel is a long way from LAX and will run you around a $50 taxi fare. Check in was quick and efficient. Was assigned room 623 which was much smaller than the pictures on the property web site, but still very nice and clean. View was of the Hollywood hills with some of the interesting homes perched on the cliffs. Also in view was the back alley with various homeless rummaging through dumpsters, drug deals going down, and ladies of the night parading back and forth. Ordered room service several times and while service was quick, the quality was lacking. One evening ordered a filet from their upscale Twist room service menu and what was delivered turned out to be what I would call two small "minute steaks," definitely not a filet. The near area around the hotel certainly doesn't live up the the glamor image of Hollywood that is often portrayed. The attached mall is strangely designed and difficult to find your way around in. The area in front of the Chinese theatre is jammed with tourists and people hawking tours. Walk outside this area in any direction and you will encounter boarded up shops, cracked sidewalks, cheap souvenier stands, and numerous homeless folks. Of course, this is not the hotel's fault, but rhe area definitely detracts from the otherwise fine features of this hotel property.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Style at its Finest - Excellent Location, Service & View”
Reviews.Author: mktozd
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, The Renaissance Hollywood Hotel is one of the hotest hotels in LA and captures Hollywood style at its finest. The hotel is right in the center of the Hollywood and Highland Complex. If you want to see Hollywood, this is THE place to stay. Indeed, it is the hotel where stars stay before and after the Oscars, movie premiers and the like. Indeed, we learned that the Governor's Ball for the Oscars is held at the Renaissance. OK, so on to our review. We checked in late after being caught in traffic and were able to have the car valeted very easyily and were warmly greeted at the desk. The lobby is a popular spot where the everyone feels comfortable and you might see a star or three. The desk clerk was genuinely welcoming and made us feel at ease and relaxed after our long commute. Our room (on the 19th floor) had a commanding view of LA and out to the Pacific. We could also see the roof of the Kodak Theater (reccomend the tour) and Grahmann's (highly recommend the tour), the Disney Store (also recommend). The room was modern and very comfortable. There are plenty of dining options in the area, and we really enjoyed Mel's Dinner (right down highland). If you are not familiar with the institution, it was featured in American Grafitti and many other movies. Good food, good service and the like. The rest of our stay at the Renaissance was wonderful and it was a great place to come back from sightseeing of just to hang out. I stay at dozens of hotels every year and this one is one of the best run that I have seen in a while. Rooms are hard to come by at this property for good reason. We had the chance to stay at the Four Seasons Beverly Hills are are glad that we stayed here. If you want to experience LA and Hollywood, you must stay at the the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “One square block......”
Reviews.Author: Debbiem25
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a long flight from the UK really needing a bath - unfortunately, the baths in this hotel are little more than large shower trays. I was quite pleased with the smell of bleach in the bathroom and it was very clean. It wasn't until I stepped into the shower and fell heavily that I realised - the bleach was all in the bottom of the bath! Not really a good start but it did get better. The check in staff were pleasant and polite, there seems to be a constant police presence around the hotel, which makes you feel a bit safer as one block away in any direction is a bit dodgy - battling hobos and pickpockets. Stay around the hotel and the mall and take a cab if you want to travel at night. The rooms are huge, we had a vew of the hills and Hollywood sign. The beds are very comfortable and the air con works a treat! The hotel is connected to the Kodak Theatre where the Oscars are held. You will get an 'Elephant card' on arrival which entitles you to discounts at certain places in the Mall - I recommend taking the 2 for 1 theatre tour, it's worth the $15. Also, go and see a film at Graumans. We stayed on a 'Romance Package' which entitles you to free buffet breakfast and a chilled bottle of champagne on arrival - the breakfast is excellent. The chef will make omlettes and pancakes to order and the bacon and maple syrup is fab, as is the fresh fruit salad. The staff are attentive and remove plates and cutlery almost by magic, replacing them with new! The 'champagne' was a different matter - you have to call reception and they bring it up. It's not champagne, its very bad Spanish Cava. It's undrinkable, one sip burns all the way down. We went with friends and tipped their bottle away after all agreeing it was rubbish - we carried ours to the next hotel and gave it to a hobo in Beverly Hills on Thanksgiving - we only hope he traded it and didn't drink it! On the whole, a nice hotel, excellent position to do the Hollywood thing - 15 mins cab ride from Universal Studios and a 10 minute walk from the Hollywood Bowl. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Caro_Z
Reviews.Content: We went to Renaissance for a business trip. Great service, great view - we actually had a room on the 19th floor. The Club Level VIP lounge was perfection - enjoying some wine and cheese while looking at the hollywood homes was quite an experience. The hotel was well decorated, we loved the contemporary pieces throughout the lobby. The bedroom was great, the radio was turned on when we arrived, we felt like dancing while enjoying the view for the first time. Location, location, location - great shops, cute restaurants, a lot of extravagant people. Could we have asked for more ? I don't think so.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Travel100
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights as the first part of a "road trip" around southern California last September. The drive from LAX to the hotel was interesting to say the least. It was my first time in LA (although not the States) and I couldn’t get over the time it takes to get anywhere by car. The hotel is in one of the best locations in LA if you want to be based around Hollywood. The hotel is part of a huge complex, which includes a shopping mall and restaurants and opens right out onto the Hollywood Boulevard. One exit actually takes you down onto the Chinese Theatre forecourt where you’ll find sight seeing trips and film stars handprints in concrete. There are also countless impersonators hoping for you to have your picture taken with them for a few bucks. One evening we listened to a Nirvana tribute band playing on the boulevard. Whoever they were they kept us entertained for half an hour with a good rendition of Seattle’s finest. All this is within 5 minutes walk from the hotel reception. The hotel itself is nothing special but it is a nice modern well-run hotel with comfortable rooms and a great pool area. The only criticism I would make is that the internal design seems a little bland, especially in the lobby bar area. But hey it’s no big deal. The hotel is also about 5 minutes drive from one of the freeways, which means it’s easy to get out to the sights of LA even if it takes a while to get there. We had a room looking out the side of the Hotel directly onto the hills and the Hollywood sign – fabulous! PS – If you want reasonably priced food you can’t do better than the Hollywood Grill in the Mall attached to the Hotel – try the meatloaf.

Reviews.Title: “re views!”
Reviews.Author: E&JJJ
Reviews.Content: The views from high floors at this hotel make up for its rather high price!The bedrooms are airy, roomy and beautifully decorated. The beds are comfortable and bathrooms have plenty of very pleasant smelling bath products etc. The concierge was very helpful with our excursions to Universal Studios and the tour to see the stars' homes The reception staff were friendly and efficient. Thought the car parking was too expensive and did not like the lay -out of the car park, but at least there were plenty of spaces. This is a very busy area and if you have a car the roads are jammed especially if you need a left turn along the Walk of Fame. There is plenty to do where the hotel is situated , however. We were lucky to have two rooms, one on either side of the hotel so saw both views. Always try to get a high room., the elevators are good.

Reviews.Title: “at this price service could be better!”
Reviews.Author: juviall
Reviews.Content: When you're paying almost $200 a night to stay in a hotel, you expect it to be clean, quiet, and well-appointed, which this hotel is. Our quibble has to do with the service. On Saturday night, we couldn't sleep for the noise of a very loud party. We called the front desk twice and were told security would look into it. After 45 minutes my husband went down a floor and discovered a party in the restaurant with more than 200 people in attendance and a very loud sound system. The front desk eventually moved us to another floor, but why did we have to ask three times? Second example. We got up at 5 a.m. to catch the shuttle the day of our departure. We arrived ten minutes early and sat down on the bench outside, enjoying the sunshine. The shuttle sailed right by us. I leapt up and ran over to two car jockeys who were standing around talking (not much action that time of the morning). I asked them to call the shuttle back -- one advised me they "don't do shuttles" only cars. The other told me it wasn't his fault I'd overslept. Again, we persisted, found a staff member who called the shuttle and it returned to pick us up. But again, at this price, the service could be better.

Reviews.Title: “pricey perfection”
Reviews.Author: skinnedknee
Reviews.Content: ...if you're looking for a hotel that is clean, modern, classy and right in the heart of hollywood, this is your place. It is expensive, but the location is wonderful (the corner of Highland and Hollywood Blvd), the views are all nice (you can choose from the adjoining shopping complex, the hollywood hills or the city view of hollywood.) The rooms were clean, modern and had a few nice extras...like a lighted make-up mirror and a rolling table that made it so you could have breakfast anywhere! we were on the 15th floor above Highland Ave, and although it was the Saturday before halloween (BUSY party/traffic night), the room was quiet. Check-in is 4pm, checkout is 11am, so plan your stay accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: Napoleon_Ultra
Reviews.Content: The best hotel i've ever stayed in. The overall experience was fantastic. Checkin was fast and friendly. The staff were polite and helpful. It has a nice pool & gym and the room i stayed in was fantastic too. It really is in a superb location with fabolous things to do outside your front door. You can go to the Cinema, Watch a Show, View a T.V show, Dine, Dance and much more all on your front door. It even has a metro stop as part of the complex to make getting around easier. The key to this hotel is Location, however it has the complete package in my opinion. If i ever get the chance to go back i definitely will.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Hairloos30
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent if you want to look round Hollywood and this has to one of the main features of the hotel. Check in was fine - a little business like but then it is full of business people/conference facilities. Not sure what people expect from a check in but after a 10 hour flight you just want efficiency. Room was nice - we were on the club level which was nice - had a good view of the Hollywood sign but to be honest as soon as you walk out of the hotel you can see that. The room was clean and had everything we needed/wanted (no turn down though). As for the club level - you get breakfast which was ok and hot snacks in the evening. As far as I was aware there was no alcohol available and if it was then it was not obvious. Fruit and cold drinks available throughout the day. I would say it is worth it - just but only just. Gripes of our stay:- I had asked for a fridge in our room and also a bottle of champagne to be delivered after we arrived (I received an e-mail before we arrived asking if we wanted anything upon arrival). After 2 hours neither had arrived so I called and was told that I had to request them when I checked in as they wouldn't know when I would arrive (except at the point that I checked in surely!!!!!!!!!!!!) Rubbish answer to a simple request. I called the bell boy to help with luggage but there was no reply but by the time we got to the ground floor and fell out of the lift weighed down with 6 bags we were asked if we wanted any help. That would be the help for the remaining 10 yards that didn't answer the phone and also wasn't around as I walked from my room to the lift and down. Bar was nice in the eveningbut didn't try the restaurant, gym small but well equiped and swimming pool is clean and with a great view.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: lilone
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for two nights. The location of this hotel is great, the staff all but one lady ( forgot her name)who checked us in were very friendly and helpful. This hotel is right behind, kinda connected to the Chinese theatre. You can see the hollywood sign right out the window of many of the rooms. One of the housekeepers let us in a vacant room on that side since our room faced the pool and the shopping area. Hollywood is great the walk of fame is 1/2 block away from the hotel entrance. Their are lots of places to eat in walking distance and many places to shop. If you want to go to Beverly Hills and Rodeo Drive I suggest a car. We rented a car since it is about 20 minutes away from LAX. I'm not sure if they offer shuttle service. We didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment on the food, but when we return in 2007 we will. If you will be there for more than two days get your parking ticket from the hotel is cheaper, i think it was $15 a day. If you don't you will pay $10 each time you exit the lot. The parking garage is not owned by Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “You're paying for nice and convenient...”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravellerHK
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in September 2006. We arrived late in the evening and no one offered any assistance with luggages. Check-in service was slow as they only had two person at the front desk dealing with all sorts of inquiries. Room is nice and spacious with all the amenities that one would expect from a good hotel. Booked a weekend package that came with breakfast which was excellent. The location was convenient - near the Mann's Chinese Theater and Kodak Theater complex - with lots of shops, restaurants, etc. as well as metro stop. Overall, it is a good and nice hotel but I expect that given the price.

Reviews.Title: “A bit pricey but great location”
Reviews.Author: 808traveler
Reviews.Content: If you are going to stay in Hollywood, the only other "major" hotel is the Hotel Roosevelt. Having read bad reviews of that hotel, I decided to stay at the Renaisssance Hollywood. First off, if you absolutely have to stay in Hollywood, this is the best location. It is connected to a shopping center with places to eat and shop and is right off of Hollywood Blvd. making a trip to the Kodak Theater, Hollywood Walk of Fame, and Grauman's Chinese theater a quick walk. All included, I paid almost $1000 for a three night stay. On top of that, expect to pay either $24 for valet parking, or $10 parking in the adjoining parking structure with NO in and out passes. Everytime you leave the parking structure, expect to pay $10. The hotel was very clean and the rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. The air conditioning worked flawless and we had a pretty nice view of LA from our 12th floor room. For the price, I would suggest staying somewhere else and driving to Hollywood to see the attractions (there are very few things to see and do in Hollywood itself).

Reviews.Title: “No Car? Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: HogsBreath_01
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic location for those without a car. Ideally situated in the heart of Hollywood and attached to the lively Hollywood and Highlands shopping centre and just 2 minutes walk from the Metro. We had a very large room with 2 king beds overlooking the city and the Hollywood sign (you can hardly see either as the're in the distance, but nevertheless, the view was great). The beds were fantastic and so comfortable. The bathroom was small, but nicely done and adequate. The decor in the rooms was lovely and really different and to have large chunky wooden blinds instead of curtains was another nice touch. Very nice pool area, which was never busy. The gym looked good as well, although that's not exactly my thing! Had no real contact with the staff, except when we checked in and out and both times they were very helpful and polite. There is a restaurant, but there are so many nice eating places in the shopping centre next door, we never even looked in. Hollywood was great and the 3 nights we had there from 1st to 4th September was the perfect amount of time. Go on one of the Starline Tours of the houses of the rich and famous - I never fancied it, but was really glad my other half talked me into it, as it was definitely worth it. Universal, which is only one metro stop away, is definitely worth a day at, but I suppose it depends on what floats your boat. All in all, I would definitely recommend this great hotel in a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “great hollywood hotel”
Reviews.Author: hotelwiz
Reviews.Content: great hotel in hollywood, happen to be there during magic johnson's celeb weekend saw many t.v, movie & sports stars. the hotel itself is very nice the rooms are smallish but tastefully done. we were on the club level with lounge access, very beautiful spacious lounge , lots of goodies stunning views of the hollywood hills. all the rooms have very good views, beds comfy but bathroom was disappointing, very small i've seen better inside hampton inns. bath products were very nice and help mask the disappointment of the bathroom. parking is valet only and the wait can be long but in hollywood u never know who might be waiting with u we stood next to eva.L & tony.P who were waiting 4 there vehicle. area around hotel very nice ,close to all the hollywood stuff-walk of fame,mann's,kodak . didn't try eateries in hotel because in l.a, there are so many places to go why would anyone want room service or hotel resturant food. will recommend one place the bungalow club went 4 sunday brunch is was great. staff at hotel very,very nice not snotty at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: SouthOCtraveler
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had tickets to the Foo Fighters concert at The Pantages, so we decided to stay at a nearby hotel so we wouldn't have to drive home to Orange County. After reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, we chose The Renaissance. (We paid $300 for a Thursday night.) Everything about the hotel lived up to its reputation. The valets were extremely friendly and helpful. Check-in was no problem--they had a room available for us an hour before check-in time (4:00 p.m.) and the check-in guy was perfectly friendly and helpful. The room was nothing spectacular, but it looked exactly like the photos on the website and was perfectly clean. We had a quiet room at the back of the hotel with a very nice view of the Hollywood Hills and The Magic Castle. My boyfriend and I both travel extensively all over the world for business and pleasure and this was the first time either of us had seen a toothbrush holder in a hotel! The pool area is great; it's on the fifth floor and has a great view of the city. There are plenty of lounge chairs and several private cabanas. I would say the only negative thing was that the pool bar closed at 4:00 p.m. (But the bartender made a great mai tai.) The hotel is located in a small mall that has a lot of restaurants. We had dinner at The Hollywood Grill, which was fantastic. It was pricey but had excellent service and delicious food. We had a caramel brownie ice cream dessert that was insanely good. We had breakfast at the hotel's restaurant, Twist, which had very friendly, attentive service and delicious food. We both had the buffet and especially enjoyed the fresh Belgian waffle. The buffet had a pretty good selection of both healthful and decadent foods, and it was a bargain at $18 (including beverages). We're over-the-top finicky and critical about hotels and restaurants, and we had a great experience at The Renaissance and would recommend it to anybody who wants to spend a night or more in the Hollywood area.

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars for location and service, 4 stars for room”
Reviews.Author: yogarunner
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 night stay at the Hollywood Renaissance after reading tripadvisor. Tips from previous reviews on this website allowed me to get an unbelievable rate using a promo code, and info on 'club level access'. Shortly after I booked online, I received an email from Marriott confirming my reservation and asked for any additional requests. I then requested 2 double beds, a fridge, extra pillows, a room on the highest possible floor with a view of the Hollywood sign, and club level access for an additional $30/night. We arrived on Sunday afternoon at 2pm. Upon arrival, the doormen/valets eagerly helped us with our luggage and led us to the registration desk. The desk informed us that we did get a room on the 19th floor w/ a view of the Hollywood sign, but it would not be ready for another hour. They gladly stored our luggage and gave us information on the shopping complex next door. The Hollywood&Highland complex is pure fun for first time visitors to Hollywood -- Walk of Fame, the El Capitan, street vendors, Batman/Wonder Woman/Capt Jack Sparrow and other characters all at your doorstep -- made our 1 hour wait quite entertaining. While the hotel lobby and public areas are furnished in modern leather furniture which can be found in any department store, I was truly disappointed by the room itself. The brightly upholstered furniture and bed covers screamed cheap 10-year old Ikea and the moveable desk straight out of Staples. Also, while the pictures on the website showed floor-to-ceiling windows, our 19th floor windows were large but only half the height. Also, I didn't like that the lights in the room were very bright and your only option for a 'night light' is to prop the bathroom door open. The bathroom was also quite small. This is not what I would expect for a hotel which normally charges over $250/night (even if I paid much less). However, this is only MY opinion. Our room did have a great view of the Hollywood sign, so I did not complain. My husband and 2 kids didn't mind or notice the furnishings and lighting and found them more than acceptable. The best part of our stay was the club level lounge, which happened to be 2 doors down from our room. My kids and husband found a variety of hors d'oeuvres and drinks served at the lounge shortly after 6pm that evening, and desserts and coffee served until late that night. In the morning, coffee, fresh juices, huge buffet breakfast and several newspapers (LA Times, NY Times, USA Today) were available for us to enjoy while we watched the morning news. Also, bottled water, soda and juices were available for us throughout the day. My kids were in the lounge constantly, and the staff was always friendly and accommodating. It made the hotel feel like home for only an additional $30/night, which is a fantastic deal for a family of 4 with hungry, growing children. You'll never have to wait long for an elevator at this hotel, as they are very fast. The service we experienced during our stay was stellar -- in addition to everything I already asked for, I called for extra robes and toiletries and received them promptly. There was a computer and printer designated for boarding passes at the concierge desk that we could use for no extra charge. The doormen, staff at the concierge, check-in and especially the club lounge were always very friendly and helpful. We got a great deal at this hotel, and it was great introduction to Los Angeles and Hollywood. I highly recommend the Hollywood Renaissance and look forward to staying there again soon -- especially if they decide to refurnish the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended if you are staying in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: PrestonTraveller
Reviews.Content: I previously stayed at the same spot many years ago when it was the Holiday Inn and returned again for an anniversary trip with my partner. This time the hotel has been rebuilt and is now the Renaissance with the Holiday Inn moving further up the road. As yo may know all hotel rooms in the USA have a copy of the bible. It seems the Marriott chain also carry a management book from their founder. It came as a surprise to me that of the 2000 plus hotels in the Marriott group, they actually only own about 20 or so hotels. They actually run hotels on a long lease. You can be sure that they know how to manage a hotel. The check in was a breeze and there was a genuine welcome. I was given a city view but I requested a view of the Hollywood sign and I got that without a problem. In fact my room also had a city view as well. The downside is that as it was an anniversary trip (and I am also a Marriott reward member) I got no offer of an upgrade or flowers or chocolates for my partner which was disappointing. The room was wonderful, modern and spacious. The bathroom was nice. The only strange thing was locating the safe which is located below the mini bar. The bell boy was very friendly and he not only suggested places to visit, but places to eat for breakfast as well as calling for a complimentary fridge so we could store our own food and drinks. Special mention must also go to the Concierge who was eager to help and assist. We wanted to take a bus to the Beverley Centre, and he downloaded the route and the numbered buses to take. It may not mean much to other people but just think of the amount of time where you are just given a leaflet at other hotels and told to go away. We had buffet breakfast at the hotel on several occasions. The range and quality was excellent. At $18 per head it was expensive. The restaurant service was good and attentive. As the weather was hot we used the pool everyday. I do believe it was heated because it was still warm in the evening. You can have good views of the H&H complex from the pool level and the Hollywood hills. I did think the pool's shape could be better. It could look crowded very easily with just a few people in the pool and I wished it was just had a rectangular shaped. They also needed to make sure that the towels were replenished during the late afternoons. They also had a good gym which was rather busy. The hotel tries to cover a lot of bases which it does very well. Its a family hotel for people on vacation, to a business hotel holding conferences to people having functions such as private parties and weddings. If there were negative points it was the valet parking attendants. Anyone entering the hotel forecourt were being moved on by the parking attendants rather brusquely even if they were just dropping or picking people up. The attendants are franchised to an outside company. If I have a friend picking me up (and remember I am a paying guest of the hotel) I do not one the attendant harassing my friend to move on. Remember we have visited from the UK to meet up with them. By the same token you can go to the H&H complex via the swimming pool level. There are security guards about who prevent shoppers from the complex to enter hotel premises. What I found strange that the security guard stopped me and another guest from walking the grounds just outside the hotel because he claimed it was the property of another restaurant. All we tried to do was take photographs of the view (there is a vantage point at another level but is crowded with tourists visiting the H&H complex) and we showed our key passes as proof that we were guests of the hotel. Its this type of pettiness that the hotel needs to look into and improve. Overall this is the best hotel you can stay at if you want to stay in Hollywood area. Its advantage is that it is part of the H&H complex. There is shopping nearby, food courts, bus stops, the metro station as well as lot of the other Hollywood attractions. There is a lot of hustle and bustle at Hollywood Boulevard and the area has been revitalised since our previous visit many years ago.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but can work on service”
Reviews.Author: Fati2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance for a couple of days after our trip to San Francisco. First thing we realized the location was perfect especially with no car. Our room was lovely and spacious (useful when you have four pieces of luggage). The swimming-pool area was everything we needed with these hot temperatures. The only negative point was the coldness of the employees.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay at a Cool Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michelle2013
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on trip advisor ratings. I thought it was very good. It is modern, extremely clean, and well located. The pool has a fun view of the Hollywood-Highland mall entrance with an fun arch and a huge elephant statue. We did hear some noise one night that there was a concert at the mall. But we enjoyed the Hollywood location and took a very easy one stop ride on the subway to Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Frosty53
Reviews.Content: This was the only 'bum steer' I got from this web site - all the other advice was spot on and we has a great holiday. Because it was so highly rated I decided to book it - when we arrived I was unimpressed with the foyer - the welcome was non existent and it was down hill from there - it represented really poor value for money and I would advise people with loads of cash to go upmarket and budget travellers to save their money and try the Holiday Inn up the road ( we called in and they were friendly and helpful even tho' we weren't staying there) there are lots of Comfort Inn type places. Back to the the hotel - the air con was faulty and the bathroom ended up like a sauna - to be fair the room was clean and the British concierge on day 2 was brilliant but the rest of the staff needed to learn to smile - never again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: OttawaMan
Reviews.Content: This hotel lives up to its reputation. Flawless checkin, spotless, roomy and quiet room, fantastic location, in other words - wow! I parked the car in the self park, and didn't move it so the price was an affordable $10/day. With all the traffic it was much faster to ride the subway or just walk. The complex where the hotel is located has some great restaurants. The pool is very good. The Highland/Hollywood intersection has some fascinating buskers dressed up as movie and cartoon characters (warning not to walk in the area at night with young kids who will be scared). The Diney store is nearby and serves great food/ice cream. Ten out of ten.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, need to work on service”
Reviews.Author: jsheezay
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a weekend getaway with some friends. My friend thought it would be a good idea to have my room right next to his when he checked in, so he put in the request when he checked in. The problem was that I had checked in 2 hrs before he did. This was a night out with a bunch of friends partying in hollywood, after the night out, we come back to our room around 2-3am in the morning only to discover that the staff had changed my room without my direct permission! Our room key no longer worked and when I seeked assistance from the front desk, they informed me that MY room with all of my personal belongings is showing as vacant, meaning they could have checked in someone else in that room and I would have been out of luck. I was not happy about the situation and the on shift manager did not handle the situation well at all. He did not apologize, rather he was putting me at fault of the entire situation. In addition, it look them 30 minutes to get the situation straightened out. They need more competant staff. With that said, I would still consider staying at this hotel since it does have a very good location. But don't have high expectations for their service.

Reviews.Title: “Hooray for Hollywood & Renaissance Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yellabelly
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Renaissance with my wife and teenage daughter for 5 nights. Everything was A1. We even got upgraded to the 19 floor, great views of city and sign. Staff very pleasant, everything spotlessly clean. Great location, walking distance to many sights, only one metro stop to Universal Studios. Highly recommend this hotel, hopefully we'll return some day. Loved Hollywood,surprisingly. We're from Ireland where people are friendly but Californians are every bit as pleasant. Hooray for Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: jaknix
Reviews.Content: I haven't had the best luck at Marriott's but I was so impressed by this hotel. The location is wonderful and close to everything. Park your car ($24 valet) and you won't need it again. Stayed here with my young daughter and felt very safe. Our room, king on the 18th floor overlooking the pool, mall, Kodak Theater and Hollywood skyline was huge. Internet is $10.99 per day which is high speed with the cord hanging in the closet?. Mini bar stocked with everything and computerized so if you touch it you buy it and they warn you that you can't keep your own things in there which is a drag for me as I like to keep water cold. No coke machines but I guess with the mall and more food choices then you would ever need they feel that takes care of a machine. Pool was tiny and packed with teenager crowds most of the day and evening. Hotel walks right into an outside mall and then onto Hollywood Walk of Fame. I will definetly visit again and would highly recommend. Received a great deal with the AOL promo code.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: TootsieWiggle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it was rated number 1 on trip advisor however we were not impressed at all with the hotel or its service. Rude and cold employees... Being in the customer service industry for 20 years this is about the poorest experience I have had.. Will not stay here again. We stayed at the Fairmont in Newport prior to staying at the Renaissance and that hotel to me was 100% nicer and friendlier..

Reviews.Title: “Great location, uneven service”
Reviews.Author: wrdtrvlr75
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night at this hotel. Upon arrival, the valet parking staff seemed inexperienced and unprofessional. The person who took my key did not know how to release the trunk. There was at least a 15 minute wait to pick up your car. For $24.00 (plus $2.40 more for tax) I expected more from the valet but self-parking didn't seem like much of an option in 100 degree heat. Concierge staff was quick. Upon check-in I was supposed to receive a voucher for a free breakfast for two which I didn't get even though I asked. In the hallway on the way to my room, housekeeping carts were littered all over the hallway as well as old room service trays. There were 2 trays outside my room that never got picked up my entire stay at the hotel! Once in my room (an exec suite on the 15th floor facing the Hollywood Hills) I was impressed with the size of the room and the furnishings. There was a lot of sitting space between the divan, sofa, end chairs and desk chair. The room smelled a little stale and there were oily face smudges marring the otherwise impressive windows looking out onto the Hollywood sign, Magic Castle, and Yamashiro restaurant. I called housekeeping to ask for extra towels which took at least 5 hours to be delivered! I also asked that the smudges on the windows be cleaned and they eventually were. The bathroom was really spacious with a nice vanity area and separate toilet and shower. I wish there were 2 sinks instead of one. Nice LATHER toiletries. The 2 waffle robes were a nice touch and reminded me of my stays at the JW Marriott. The king size bed was more than adequate although there was a smell (feathers) coming from the comforter. Buffet breakfast at Twist was a good deal at $18 per person but selection is limited to the basic foods: omlette bar, waffle bar, hot foods and cereals and breads. Adequate but not over the top. Overall, this hotel is in a great location and worth a try. Just don't expect premium service or amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Anywhere Else”
Reviews.Author: fiftystates
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a clean, safe hotel close to all the Hollywood action this is the ONLY choice. I had our family booked at another hotel which was within walking distance to the Walk of Fame trying to save $$ but changed our reservation to the Renaissance Hollywood and I'm so glad I did. We drove past the other one and although it was in walking distance it was in an "undesirable" location. You just can't beat the Renaissance Hollywood for safety and cleanliness. Pay the extra $$ and enjoy your stay - I'm so glad we did!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: DCbella85
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a wonderful location close to shopping and restaurants. It's right near Hollywood Blvd. It was super clean and the staff was very courteous and helpful. They have cabs right there pretty much all the time too. It was really safe too. I was a 21/f traveling alone and I never felt unsafe. Highly recommened!!!

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints .........”
Reviews.Author: joviscot
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days recently and the location was wonderful. Very central and close to the attractions. On the recommendations of someone here, we ate at Mels Diner just down the road instead of at the hotel. Its a lovely place. Prices are reasonable and the place is clean and the food is good. When we wanted directions to various places in Los Angeles, the hotel staff would look up the details on the computer and give us print outs and tell us what bus(es) to take or train to take. Nothing was too much bother for them. There is a business centre on the 3rd floor which you can access using your room card. You can use your cc to access the internet ($3 for 10 minutes or so) or buy credit from them. We had a "Hollywoood" sign view. The room was quiet. Would recommend it and if I am in LA again, I would most certainly book a room there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good position”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelFairy_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights mainly to go to Universal but when we arrived we were pleasently suprised to find fantastic facilities literally within the complex. The hotel and rooms are beautifully decorated and clean. The hollywood highland complex is great with shopping, restaurant, and fast food literally a step from the elevator. The hotel is one stop from Universal, and the metro is a lot safer than I first anticipated. The breakfast at twist is top, with a choice of hot or cold buffet there was everything you could want with pleasant staff to serve you. I would highly recommend this hotel has THE place to stay in LA if you want to be central to Hollywood. From a fussy travel agent!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hollywood Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel in the Hollywood area. It is within walking distance to all the major attractions that you'd want to see. Try the museum right down the street, has three levels of items. Its in the old Max Factor bukiding. The whole hotel is decorated in mid century modern. Its a good touch. The beds are so comfortable. Pay extra to stay on the executive level. They serve some really good nibbles. They had some scrumptous pot stickers. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: FelixStowe10
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay here for 2 nights at the end of May. Without doubt the main selling point for the hotel is its location - central Hollywood and close to the metro for accessing the rest of the city. Our room was of a good size and well furnished. I also used the outdoor pool on the 5th floor which had great views of the city and welcome cooling breezes. Valet parking is expensive at 24 dollars a night. There are lots of eating places nearby. We choose Mels Diner for our breakfasts and ate at the Pig and Whistle in the evening - both had character and served good food at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: lelewillis
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. My husband and I stayed for four nights. We were treated extremely well. The staff was very friendly and helpful at all times. We loved the location. The hotel is connected to lots of shops and restaurants. We even saw a celebrity at the hotel. If you like hotel bars, this bar looked like a lot of fun. I worked out in the gym, which was clean and nice. The pool area is great for kids and lounging. We ordered room service for breakfast and dinner. Both meals were excellent and exactly what we ordered...we also had a view of the HOLLYWOOD sign from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Families, Not for Business”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just spent 3 nights at this hotel. I picked it because it was rated #1 on Tripadvisor. This Hotel does not compare to the Park Hyatt or The Beverly Hilton, so if you can get a comparable rate, choose one of those. If you can get a great rate here, take it - the hotel feels new and the rooms have large windows and some wonderful views from the high floors (though avoid any room ending in 23 or 27). The elevators really are fast. But the hotel feels like they spent more time on making things bright and cheery than on spending money on high quality furnishings and carpeting. I am by no means saying this is a BAD hotel, but it's not truly top-quality either. The staff seems inexperienced and poorly trained. I dealt with the folks at the concierge desk regularly and the service was very uneven. NIce people who meant well, but inexperienced to the point of incompetence. The hotel is located right next to a mall and Mann's Chinese theater, but this felt more like a bad location and less like a nice hotel to me. I would stay here again, certainly before staying at the Westin downtown, but this hotel is not in my top 5 for LA.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel - nothing special though”
Reviews.Author: GerrardFamily
Reviews.Content: it's a 5* hotel, so it's going to be good. when we arrived it was chaos out at the front, no one around to take our bags, so we ended up putting them onto the trolley so they could valet park the car to get it out of the way! rooms were large, clean, lots of wardrobe space, and we had a view of the hollywood sign check-in was a breeze, location was great, nice friendly staff close to metro line, 1 stop to universal studios for $1.25 each way great corporate, impersonal hotel, if that's what you like.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We staid at the Renaissance for 4 nights during our familly trip to the USA last year and it has been a great experience. Very nice room, nice view over the city, great location, nice restaurant, helpful employees... everything positive except maybe the swimming-pool that was a bit "sad looking" compared to the general impression given by the hotel. Worth the stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Renaissance!”
Reviews.Author: rmartens711
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Renaissance the end of March. It was a great stay. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We arrived to the hotel around noon and we had no problems checking in early. The elevators in the hotel are amazingly fast, never had to wait more than a minute for the elevator. The room was unbelievable, the view was great, especially at night. There was always a lot going on in the hotel but it was quiet at the same time. I kept my eyes open for any celebrities, but I didn't see any. The shopping center that is attached to the hotel is great, lots of places to eat that are cheaper than eating in the hotel, especially Johnny Rockets. We were able to see the Chinese Theater, the walk of fame, the rock walk and go on a tour. We took the bus to Santa Monica and then rented a tandem bike and rode to Venice Beach and we did that all in 2 days!!! I would definitely stay at this hotel again, I have no complaints at all!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hollywood Renaissance Hotel”
Reviews.Author: owings
