Reviews.Content: We loved our 2 night stay at the hotel. We were able to check in early & had a great view of the city & the Hollywood Hills from our room. The room was clean & very comfortable. All of the hotel staff were great. The valet service was excellent & worth the price. The hotel is very convenient to Universal Studios & Hollywood sightseeing. We would definitely stay here again & recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: poppy_popster
Reviews.Content: PROS: Fast and easy check-in. Clean and nicely decorated rooms. Clean bathroom/good water pressure Comfy beds. Friendly and responsive staff Fast elevators Great centrally located location Quiet room Powerful air conditoning In room safe. Great view (Hollywood sign!!!) CONS: Maid service didn't replace little bottle of mouthwash until it was empty. (some "con", huh?) COMMENTS: We stayed for 4 nights. Quickly checked in around 11:30 PM and confirmed an earlier requested non-smoking king bed w/rollaway bed. We were given a room on the 16th floor, but it did not have the extra bed. When the bell desk brought up our luggage a few minutes later, I mentioned the rollaway bed and the polite young man said he would take care of that for us. I also mentioned that we had requested a refrigerator online. He said he would take care of that too. Within a few minutes both the extra bed and refrigerator were delivered to our room! The next morning the room darkening blinds and shades were lifted to reveal a perfect view of the famous Hollywood sign! I didn't want to pay a zillion bucks for a hotel breakfast, and we hadn't yet signed up for the "Club Level access" (more on that later) so we ate at "Mel's Diner" around the corner. Great food and very reasonable prices at Mel's! In fact, we ate there two more times for lunch and dinner during our stay. We poked around the immediate area and saw Grauman's Chinese Theatre with all the hand/footprints of the stars, saw the Hollywood walk of fame, went into a few souvenir shops, and explored the multi-level shopping complex attached to the hotel. We ate at Johnny Rockets for lunch (also decent food and reasonably priced for a touristy area). Back at the hotel I inquired at the front desk about the "Club Level" access. For $30 more per day, you can get a continental breakfast in the morning...hors douvres in the late afternoon/early evening...and desserts around 7:30pm. Only guests with "Club Level" privleges can access the 19th floor (via a card slot in the elevator) and the associated "Club Level room. The hotel upgraded my room key and we went upstairs to check it out. It was too early for "free eats" but the "Club Level" room (also acessed via a card slot) has a larger TV, newspapers, magazines, sitting area, and a fridge full of various sodas and bottled water. I went back down to the front desk to sign up for a day of hi-speed internet access at $10 per 24 hours (noon to noon). You can sign up online or in room for internet access for your entire visit, but I only wanted one day's access. They also have some type of Intenet keyboard access via the TV for those without a laptop. After a jet-lag induced nap for me, we went back to the club level for the hors douvres. They had chicken skewers, coconut shrimp, fruits/veggies/dips/nuts and cheeses. Not bad! Later that evening they had assorted pastries for dessert. The room was darkened and lit with candles for effect. The next morning we had the club level breakfast which consisted of bagels/breads/english muffins, fruits, yogurt, assorted cereals, tea, coffee, danish. muffind, etc. They also had a hot dish which was normally some type of scrambled egg ( rotated each day to including western omelet, egg quesadilla, soggy omelet "mcmuffins") All in all, I felt the "Club Level" access was well worth the $30 daily room charge (especially for a family) considering the decent breakfast selection and other food and beverage choices. Afther breakfast we were kind of in a hurry to get to Universal Studios. We had booked the Universal Studios Hollywood VIP Experience and our reservation was for 10:45. For some reason, I couldn't open the safe in our room, so I called guest services and they sent security to our room within a minutes or two ( I told them we were running late)! The security guy was very pleasant and helpful! The LA Metro is right next door to the hotel and Universal Studios is only one stop away. Very convenient! When we got back from Universal Studios around 8:45pm, we went to the Club Level for dessert. Unfortunately, all the dessert was gone and there were just a few people there watching the end of American Idol on the TV in the room. One of the people watching happened to be one of the America Idol contestants. It was Chris Daughtry! He was very nice and posed for a pic with us! The next day we did the "Movie Star's Home Tour" with Starline Tours. I was less than impressed, but my wife seemed to like it. I can't compare the tour to other tour companies, but our tour guide, Brian was fun and informative. Don't pay full price, though. When we were solicited to take the tour, the price dropped by $5 per person while we "thought" about taking the tour. All in all a fun vacation and a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hollywood Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kiara1620
Reviews.Content: Great view, great location, great restaurant, great decor, I loved everything about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for one night”
Reviews.Author: Hotel_SnobinSeattle
Reviews.Content: I had a short stay to the hotel (one night) on business. Nice rooms, with great views of the city - full wall windows with shutters (which I liked). Friendly, helpful staff (future entertainment celeb's, very attentive, well mannered and well groomed). Fantastic location if you're wanting to be in Hollywood -- near to downtown, West Hollywood, and probably one of the best locations near (but not in) the SF Valley. I didn't try the wireless (understanding that was not available?). It would be a big drawback if not available. Best thing: Starbucks right next door, a nice casual bar. Worst: I didn't care for the room lighting - cold, stark and too bright (no understatement, or decent recessed lighting). Simply my preference -- I'm a huge hotel snob, so this will stop me from staying here again if it's my choice, but other than this, absolutely no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jlnjz
Reviews.Content: I had very mixed feelings about the hotel. The hotel itself is nice -- I liked the modern decor, but there were too many issues to give it an "excellent". I felt that the service and the on site amenities were average, but because of the location and decor I decided to go with "above average" We spent 8 nights at the Renaissance. We booked a 1 bedroom suite with an adjoining double for our family of 5. The layout worked out well for us. We had a view that overlooked the mechanical stuff on the roof and then beyond that the adjacent mall area. It was fine for us -- we really weren't planning on much of a view at this location. We arrived at the hotel about a 1/2 an hour after their check in time. We were told that our double room was ready but that the adjoining suite was occupied and that they had given the person in the suite a late check out time of 6 pm. I was furious. I had called during a layover on our flight, confirmed our room, confirmed the adjoining room and confirmed that we would be arriving right on time and really wanted to be sure our room was ready. Don't know what happened. After asking to speak to a supervisor we were "moved" to a different room. Why they couldn't have put us in that one at first, I don't know. I did not request a specific floor or view. It was a frustration that I could've done without after a long travel-day. I was surprised to find that there was no wireless capabilities in the room. We had to connect to the internet using an ethernet cable and it was a bit inconvenient just because we're used to wireless. They have wireless in the lobby, I believe. We used our laptop a lot, though, for planning our days. They do have a business center, but you have to pay for use of the computer. One of our phones would not work (of course, the main one on the desk in the suite). I never did get that fixed -- you'd think that in a week they could've figured that out. One of our tv's was fuzzy and no one could figure that out. The friendliest people in the hotel are the valets. Overall they did a great job. The did "lose" my rental car one time, but cut my valet charges in half for the inconvenience. They were obviously embarrassed and offered to drive us where we were going. The housekeeping staff was marginal. It seemed like every day they forgot to replenish items and I'd have to call. No coffee for the coffee pot, only one wash cloth, what happened to that extra blanket, etc? Since we were there for a week, we really lived out of the room and it was a pain to always have to call for glasses, or refills for the mini-bar. It was the weirdest thing. We used the mini-bar quite a bit and I had to ask several times to have it replenished. I would have thought that they would have been thrilled to keep stocking it. I read a report from someone else about a dark mark on his clean sheets and that a hotel like this should not have that happen -- we had it happen too. Ours looked like a coffee stain. The location is very good. It was a central location for our itinerary and getting around was easy. There is always something to see at Hollywood & Highland. We really enjoyed just walking around and people-watching. It was not great weather while we were there, but the kids wanted to swim anyway and I think that in good weather, the pool would be awesome. Definitely a plus of the hotel. The adjacent mall was just so-so for us. Our opinion could be because we have 3 boys. A mall doesn't work for them if it doesn't have a Foot Locker, some type of hat store, and/or a sporting goods store. The stores that it did have didn't really appeal to them, so they were really interested in spending time walking around the mall. But, it did have some great food selections and a Starbucks. I would recommend the Grill restaurant. Very good. If we return to this area again, I would probably not stay here again. It was not that it was that bad, but it just wasn't that good that it would warrant a second visit for a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tomtom333
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a weekend, looking for a good location to explore Hollywood, Universal Studios and on from there to other parts of LA. I looked at Trip Advisor comments for this Hotel and glad that I did. The Hotel indeed has a great location. As advised I requested a high room and was given a room on the 18th floor overlooking the Hollywood sign. The service was good and friendly. The concierge is always happy to give knowledgeable information on trips and restaurants. The rooms and bathrooms seemed recently refurbished and were very comfortable. The beds were great. The bar area is a bit soleless and the restaurant was good for breakfast, but there are better options in the attached shopping centre for evening food. Overall a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely nice hotel. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: alturner007
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel for several nights while working a conference, which was held at the hotel. The hotel is exceptional. Room service is reasonably price compared to other similar hotels. The staff was very nice and helpful. I used valet parking and had no problems. The several valet attendants were always available to get your car at anytime and provided fast service. The hotel's location is amazing. Many restaurants and shopping are close. The Hollywood Walk of Fame and Grauman's Theatre are one block away. You can't beat the location! The conference facilities were great. The conference staff were always present. The conference setup crew provide everything my coworker and I needed (my company had a booth at the conference). The food provided by Wolfgang Puck's restaurant was amazing! For me, it was the highlight of the conference. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Again, but left with lower expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance Hollywood for the third time in March 2006. I enjoyed my stay, but for the first time at this hotel, I had several disappointments. I was there for 5 nights for both business and leisure. I stayed in a one bedroom suite on the thirteenth floor facing "southish" so I had a view of the city instead of the Hollywood Hills this time. The view was okay (the roof of the Kodak Theatre was right in front of me, though) and I missed seeing the Hollywood sign from my room, so I asked immediately if I could move. Even though the hotel was quite empty (compared to my prior two visits) they could not accomodate my request. That isn't that big of a deal, but I don't think the staff really tried. Also, I requested a refrigerator in my room online two days before I arrived and it wasn't there upon my arrival (another reason I felt like asking for another room). It took me three calls to the front desk to get one in my room after that! I also had to make more than one request for extra soap and towels. Immediately upon my arrival I noticed a light bulb out in my bathroom. It was quickly replaced, but you think whoever prepped the room for arrival would have noticed it. Also there was gum stuck in the bedroom carpet, which was also quickly cleaned up after I reported it. Also, the housekeeping staff varies in capability at this hotel. I tipped the same everyday, so I know that wasn't it. But on my last day the housekeeper took off the extra blanket I had put on the bed and left the heavy comforter wadded up on the floor. That night I also noticed gray marks on the edges of my bed sheets. I was too tired to report it and wait for the bed to be remaid, so I just went to sleep. I don't think the sheets were dirty, but worn sheets like that should not be put on a bed in a hotel like the Renaissance Hollywood. The housekeeper had to have noticed the marks. I valet parked everyday, which is the most convienient thing to do here. However, I ended up being charged $24 dollars a day instead of the $22 quoted. Not a big deal, but I hate suprises. The valet staff and bell-hops are extremely friendly at this hotel, unlike some of the staff at front desk. Not that anybody at the front desk was rude, just less friendly. And the concierge staff is even less friendly than they are. I think if they just think you are a tourist, they treat you a little less nice. Also, the food at the hotel is average. Whoever raves about the room service at this place must work for the hotel. It is simply ok. If you want to eat closeby you will fare better in the Hollywood and Highland Courtyard. There are good restaurants there both expensive and moderately priced. And lots of fast food choices out there also. I will stay here again because the location is EXCELLENT. However, I have lower expectations now.

Reviews.Title: “i felt like a star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i recently stayed at the rennaissance hollywood for the first time and was absolutely delighted! the rooms were very spacious and airy. the view was excellent- i was on the 13th floor with a view of hollywood blvd. all the way to santa monica! the service was great from the moment i pulled up. valet handled my car while i checked in and then the bellhop was ready with my luggage as soon as i was checked in. the staff was very helpful. i couldnt figure out how to work the tv internet, and a tech arrived to my room in minutes to explain everything. the selection in the mini bar was great, the food on the room service menu was excellent. the bed was very comfortable! as were the chairs and other furniture. this hotel is conveniently located next to a huge shopping center with everything i could want or need. it is also right next to the subway entrance as well as several major attrations. i have already booked a suite for this month, and i'm sure i will continue to stay at this hotel in the future! price was reasonable for the degree of service. $259.00 per night

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and slick hotel”
Reviews.Author: Martin68
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights with a colleague in Jan 2006, primarily on business. Tripadvisor was the main reason for choosing this hotel and it did not disappoint. First of all, by the official rates it is not a cheap place to stay but you will probably be able to do what we did and get a really good deal. Marriott have a "look no further" price guarantee where they will beat any other room rate assuming you've already made the booking direct on the Marriott website. It is not too difficult to find a far better rate at one of the travel sites and this is what I did. You have to send a screenshot as proof but I ended up getting a 60% discount on the published rate which I was very happy with. However there was a mixup, when they applied our discount they also erased all the requests on the room type/beds/smoking etc. Luckily I spotted this a few days before departing and I must say that Marriott customer services were really excellent in getting the problem sorted out. Just be aware... So we arrived at the hotel and I'm glad that I read someone else's review because you definitely should just park at the front, check in, drop your bags off and then move the car. The car park is a little inconvenient from the hotel but we got used to it and it is absolutely HUGE with spaces always available. The 17th floor room was superb, just as expected. We were on the north side of the hotel which overlooks the hills and the Hollywood sign and it is quite a sight to wake up to. The decor and bedding were in excellent condition. We used the high speed internet access which worked great. Beds are REALLY comfortable and big which gave me a great night's sleep. Bathroom is just the same as you'd find in any hotel of this class, nothing more, nothing less. We went to breakfast in the hotel for 2 or 3 times just out of convenience. It is expensive but good. Service was not very attentive though. One morning the waiter admitted that he couldn't find our bill and kinda shrugged his shoulders! Of course when I checked the bill at the end of our stay, he had managed to find it after all. Funny that! In the adjoining mall there are several restaurants (Burgers, Italian, Pizza) which we went to in the evenings, these were fine for what they are. As you'd expect the area is touristy which isn't really my thing, at night outside the mall there isn't really that much to do so you'd probably want to drive to another part of town. So to sum up, a very slick and comfortable hotel. I would stay there again but will probably try something a little smaller and intimate next time I'm in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the Renaissance, the entire place was great. The rooms were beautiful, service was excellent, parking was not a problem. Very easy access to all attractions. We stayed in Feb. with two kids...couldnt ask for a nicer place, the attached mall area had anything and everything you could possibly need. I would HIGHLY recommend the Renaissance to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “great great great”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler3
Reviews.Content: no problems for me very quite room, clean exceptionally clean very good location. parking is reasonable close to the excitement in hollywood really nice mall adjacent to hotel which offers alot of eateries. nothing bad to say.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but some staff issues”
Reviews.Author: HappyHiker88
Reviews.Content: My reservations were made last November or December, so keep that in mind when I tell you about my check-in experience. When checking in, the person who checked me in flat out lied to me. I asked her twice to confirm that it had two beds. Each time she said yes. When the bellhop opened the door to the room, it had one king bed. The bellhop called down to the front desk for me and they said I should check back in an hour or two. Unfortunately, when I did check back, I was told that the hotel was oversold and that there was no way I would get the room that had been reserved for me two to three months ago. I was there for three nights and staying with a friend, so we were both not happy. They said they could put a rollaway in the room, which didn't thrill either of us, but we accepted it. The person coordinating our trip then had the hotel give us access to the members floor, so we would be able to get free breakfasts, evening appetizers and evening desserts. When my friend and I arrived back from dinner. I saw housekeepers cleaning an empty room and asked them if any rooms with two beds were available. They said yes. I rushed to my room and called the front desk to ask for another room. They asked if I needed assistance, and I said yes. About 15 minutes later, someone knocked on our door with the keys, but he didn't seem thrilled about helping us move our luggage to the other room, so we did it ourselves. The reservation mix-up and lying about it was the worst part of my experience at the hotel. However, when I went back to the front desk in the morning to turn in the old keys and to have the member service added to the new keys, the same front desk person from the day before was back at the front desk and seemed shocked that I had the member service on my room keys. (I explained that it was added because of the room reservation fiasco. I'm guessing that she is either new or inadequately trained.) I brought out my Marriott member card at that point because I was irritated by her lying and lack of professionalism. On to the better parts of the hotel stay. The room itself was small, but nice. It's very modern in design and fresh looking. It features wooden blinds, and a pull down shade, which is a nice departure from heavy curtains. It was very clean, and I never saw any stains, other than on our shower liner. The sheets were nice. The comforter was very heavy though, making it difficult to turn over in the middle of the night without waking. About the minibar...don't even lift a snack or you'll be charged! This was a new technique I've not seen before. Some others in my group in other rooms were afraid to even open the fridge for being charged. I was charged $1 to make a local call, so use your cell if you have one. The bathroom was light, bright and spacious. The shower curtain rod is curved, giving more shower room, which was nice. The bathroom toiletries are nice, very fresh and modern. The towels were thick, plush and clean. There's a large vanity top in the bathroom, which is nice for laying out toiletries. The housekeeping staff is friendly and excellent. The room itself is very, quiet, which was wonderful. I didn't swim, but I did check out the pool area, and it's very nice. It even features private cabanas. The workout room looked very nice, too. They are next to each other. The hotel location is fabulous. The hotel is connected to a huge complex of shopping and eating areas. It's also very close to Grauman's, the Kodak Theater, the Hollywood walk of stars, etc. I didn't take the Metro, but there's a Metro stop very near, too. It's centrally located to a lot of things. It took about 30-45 minutes to take Sunset Blvd. to the Getty Center during the morning. Parking is reasonably prices, but it's a bit of a hassle unless you do valet parking. The concierge staff is very nice and helpful, but they weren't always accurate on the directions. One of them told us wrong, and it cost us 10 very important minutes. Oh, about the member rewards room, the breakfasts are the best part. The evening appetizers are so-so, as are the desserts. However, the concierge staff there is extremely helpful and nice. Would I stay there again? Yes, depending on the price I could get. The location is great, and the room is very nice and QUIET. My room rate was $166 before taxes for a Monday through Thursday stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: ClareZ24
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and two boys aged 10 & 8 and our friends from New Jersey stayed at the HR. We loved it found the staff helpful, fantastic location, beautiful rooms, fantastic pool, couldn't speak highly enough of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but horrible parking”
Reviews.Author: Lorrie2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located conveniently next to the Kodak Theater and Grauman Chinese Theater as well as a shopping mall (on the corner of Highland Ave and Hollywood Blvd.) The rooms are very spacious with interesting decor but had a strange smell of pipe smoke (nonsmoking room) that never went away. Negative aspect: The parking situation is horrible. First, when you get into the garage you must find the elevators up. Upon reaching the third floor, you find you are in a shopping mall and must take your luggage through the mall to the side entrance of the hotel. You then must find and enter the elevator in the hotel(M level) and go down one floor to the lobby to register. You can then access your room via the same elevator you just left. Parking costs are as follows: $10 per day for no re-entry, $15 per day for unlimited re-entry, and $22 per day for valet (tips additional). I would recommend the valet service to save yourself A LOT of exercise (and don't forget something in your car or you will spend 15 minutes getting it). The pool, although we did not use it, was beautiful. Noise was not a problem except for the three gunshots we heard from a nearby nightclub shooting at 2:30 AM. Yes, the neighborhood is a bit risky. Tours: We made the mistake of taking the Starline tour of the Hollywood homes. First, the van seats 13 tourists plus driver. The windows are very low so you must slouch to see out. The person on the aisle seat sees next to nothing. Second, the stars want their privacy (understandable) so almost all homes are obscured by high gates and shrubs. This was a very long and back breaking 2 hours. My husband nicknamed it the front gate tour. Consider a limo tour before spending $35 pp on this one. Great breakfast spot: located on Highland Ave. between Hollywood Blvd and Hawthorn Ave is Mel's Diner. Reasonable and good and only a block walk from the hotel. Don't miss the Cold Stone in the mall for ice-cream. I also recommend the Warner Brothers VIP Studio Tour. The cost is $39 pp ($3 discount pp with AAA). Very interesting. We even had the pleasure of a conversation and pictures with Martin Sheen, a very gracious and entertaining man. Information Center: In the mall, next to the entrance to the Kodak Theater on the second floor is the information center. Great for maps and brochures. Pick up a map of the stars located on the Hollywood Walk-of-Fame for ease in finding your favorites if interested. This hotel is certainly one of the better ones in LA. I would stay here again regardless of the parking inconvenience because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood at it's BEST”
Reviews.Author: peachberry7
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were in Hollywood for Labor Day Weekend and decided (after countless hours of hotel research) to splurge and stay at the Renaissance. Needless to say, we loved the hotel! It was in a fantastic location, we had an incredible view of the LA skyline/Hollywood Hills and the rooms were very clean and comfortable. We ended up booking the Universal Studios 2-night package which basically consisted of everything we needed: accommodations, park tickets, hotel parking, and breakfast all for $469. My ONE AND ONLY complaint is that when we got the bill, the hotel had charged us DOUBLE so our bill was over $1000!! Talk about having a heart attack! The front desk lady was not too knowledgeable about the package deal, so we dealt with the issue when we returned home. I made one phone call to explain the situation, and LUCKILY there was absolutely no problem getting the money refunded. Everyone has their own hotel experience though... whether it be good or bad! So, aside from being overcharged, we had a wonderful stay at the Renaissance. I give it an A+!

Reviews.Title: “great weather shame about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: UkBilko
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed at the Renaissance for 7 nights but will never use it again.we booked 13 months in advance and asked for a non-smoking room,and when we got there no rooms where free.so we waited for them to stort it out and when they did we wheree given a smoking room and told we can stay there for 3nights and they move us to another room for 4 nights,in the end we got a non somking room the following day.we contacted our holiday rep[Virgin Holidays]and where told to stort out the problem ourselves.if possible refuse rooms 430 up to 440 ,the reason...they are under the gym...and UK travllers...never use Virgin they dont want to know

Reviews.Title: “Hooray for Hollywood ... Renaissance!!!”
Reviews.Author: NYCFrank
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! From the early check-in, to the clean, stylish and QUIET room. Great city and Hollywood Hills views and the best location ever. The room rate included a full breakfast at their restaurant Twist and free admission to Universal Studios. Also the restaurants in the complex (Vert and Trastevere) were excellant.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel stay ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Being a hotel employee myself, I know how a hotel should be operated, and this hotel has missed the boat. Other than the pool and the great location (the hotel is connected to the Kodak Theater) I cannot think of one good thing about it. Firstly the staff were not friendly and gave off a very pretentious attitude, I guess that goes with the Hollywood surroundings. Secondly when asking a young female concierge for some directions to Staples Center she was very snappy and simply exclaimed that it would take me 25 minutes to get there. Now I am not an LA expert, but I do know that getting anywhere in LA when there is a movie premiere on the same block and 50,000 people trying to get to the same arena is not going to take me 25 minutes. Luckily I followed my insitinct and left early, as it took me 50 minutes to get there. Thirdly there was no hot water in my shower, and 30 minutes later when it finally got luke warm i realised there was no fan in the bathroom and the door to the bathroom does not stay open! Its shuts automatically. So I was totally unimpressed witht the bathroom. Finally after attending the event at Staples Center, my guest and I were a bit hungry and decided to order room service, it was 11.56pm. We were answered by a recording that says that room service closes at 12pm! What sort of a hotel in downtown Hollywood closes food service at 12pm! So I called the front desk and was told to order a pizza. So would I recommend this hotel no. Unless you want pretentious people and bad service, dont take the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Hooray for Hollywood!”
Reviews.Author: rockchick
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay Oct 19-22nd. Location can't be beat...Walk of Fame, Guitar Centre, Hollywood Bowl all walking distance, and Universal Studios a quick drive, bus,shuttle or cab. I've been to Hollywood before and stayed at one of the less expensive hotels on Highland before. But found great rate here for $135/nite gov't/military rate this time. The hotel is beautiful and very clean. Check-in was excellent, and had a room with a view of the Capitol Records building and the HOLLYWOOD sign, when we could see through the smog. Room was excellent, tho near the elevators, but noise was not a factor. Comfy bed, good internet (for fee) ample towels, robes, iron, coffee maker, blow dryer, mini-bar etc. Pre-ordered room service one day. A little pricy, but service and quality were wonderful. Best meal I had in L.A. (I had little faith that it would be delivered on time nor did I expect them to get the orders correct, but they did everything right.) We had other meals at the adjacent Hollywood and Highland Complex, and Mel's. Service was almost perfect. I'm picky, so this is why I rate the place above average rather than excellent. I don't expect perfection, nor do I expect or want to be catered to by overbearing staff. But I do expect competence, effort and courtesy. As a whole, they aren't overbearing like some other more upscale hotels which is fine with me. But I should't have walked into my room to find the maid sitting and watching her stories on the tv, no matter how brief it was. Also, bellmen and valets had us running late for an important event because when we needed a cab and there was a huge crowd of people waiting outside, they told us everyone was waiting for a cab. After waiting around 10-15 minutes we realized there was an available cab waiting in line, and that the others were not waiting. Otherwise, I would highly recommend this place, and if it is in my budget, would love to stay here again should I need/want to be in Hollywood again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, there were a lot of things happening within walking distance during our stay, (2 movie premiers, an actor getting his Star, autograph sessions, and some other happenings that we drove by returning to the hotel). The rooms were clean and comfortable with a great view (on the upper floors). Our first room was on the 3rd floor, we asked the bellhop if we could get a higher floor, he made a call and then took us to the 14th floor, went down to the desk to get our new keys and bring them up to us as we unpacked. The valet parking is the way to go, we called down for our car just before leaving our room and our car was waiting for us when we reached the door, the attendents always wished us a good time, drive safely, and welcomed us back and asked how our day was. Driving to the CBS or NBC studios was only and 15 to 20 minutes, getting to the Sony studios took about 30 minutes, (leaving the hotel at around 2-3pm for show tapings). On our last night we had some noisy people in the room next to ours, the staff handle this situation to our satisfaction. We would stay here again on another visit to Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable experience”
Reviews.Author: velvetcrush
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to LA and we chose this hotel based on the rave reviews posted on Tripadvisor. Fantastic choice indeed. The check-in was quirky and friendly, as we played a "Magic Ball" game and got upgraded to an executive room on the 17th floor for a 3-night stay. We were overwhelmed by the size of the room (with a separate shower and dressing area). The view of the city from the room was lovely in the day and at night-time. The bed was so comfortable that we found it really difficult to wake up in the mornings. The bonus was the direct link to the Hollywood & Highland shopping mall with the requisite stores and restaurants, the walk of fame, Kodak Theatre and the underground Metro train (1 stop from Universal Studios), which made travelling without a car more convenient (although a car is still much recommended). We managed to take a direct bus to The Grove and Farmer's Market at a stop just outside the Gap store. Overall, this is definitely the hotel to stay for the out-of-this-world room and location. I definitely hope for a return visit soon.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Single Complaint!”
Reviews.Author: mkhollis1
Reviews.Content: This was one my favorite hotel stays by far, and I am a very picky traveler! I would recommend this hotel to everyone and would even stay here again (not something I tend to do). I went to LA on business and did a few "touristy" things in the evening. I was very pleased with the hotel and their service -- be SURE to request the fabulous turn-down service. The whimsical carpet and funky flair to the traditional furniture was a treat. Hotel is in a great location with tourist stuff in walking distance (Chinese Theatre, museums, etc.), but also several restaurants right outside door. Nice being able to go to my room after dinner, and then run downstairs to have an ice cream and stop by the oxygen bar for a pick-me-up :-) Self-parking was fine, but it is a bit of a walk to hotel if you are in a real hurry. The view from my room was also nice. Fitness center was small, but I didn't use so not sure what equipment they have. Of course, free internet is alway great to have. Thanks to the staff for making my stay so wonder!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just 1 night, but it was THE best place we could have stayed! We mainly wanted to see the Chinese Theather and then go to Universal Studios the next day. (We did the 1 day Universal Package through their website.) The hotel is beautiful, and it was so conveniently located! Our hotel was connected to a really nice outdoor shopping area w/restaurants and shops where we spent our evening. It's also right next door to the Chinese Theather, where we explored all the famous handprints. It's also right on Hollywood Boulevard with all of the stars along the sidewalk, which is pretty cool to see for the first time firsthand. Hollywood Boulevard, besides these attractions, is kind of sketchy at night, so we mostly just stayed in in the outdoor shopping area, which was just fine! Our room was very nice, so we were quite pleased with that. We also had brunch in Twist - very nice atmosphere, great service..food was ok, but it did the trick. Regarding parking - if you choose to self park, it's easy to do but BE SURE to FIRST CHECK IN so that they can give you the pass to park in their section of the garage!!! We made the mistake of trying to self-park first before checking in and were thoroughly confused as to why we couldn't get into the Renaissance gated-off parking section until we decided to check in and that's when they gave us the parking pass. When we were there also, a pipe burst and they had people using the service elevators. While they did an excellent job managing this very challenging situation (which was out of their control...), I wish that they had informed the guests that if they needed to take the elevator, that they needed to locate a service elevator. We only found out because a fellow guest, who had been out in the hotel before us, told us of the situation and led us to the service elevator he'd found. But like I said, they did manage the situation rather well and were very nice and helpful in redirecting guests. I loved this hotel - one of my favorites on our 9 day CA trip - and would absolutely recommend it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Bowl package!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a nice hotel to stay for a show we were driving down to see at the Hollywood Bowl. Reviews here led us to the Highland & Hollywood Hotel. We discovered that they offer a great package with deluxe room, valet parking, shuttle tix to the bowl, and breakfast the next morning. Everything was done just right. The megaplex that the hotel is a part of is pretty interesting, but it is not something that we really needed. Regardless, we had an awesome trip to the bowl and this hotel made it extra special.

Reviews.Title: “Tough to beat!!”
Reviews.Author: martdm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Hollywood on 9/5/05 as an overnight stop between San Diego and Las Vegas. Our goal was to get a quick taste of Hollywood and this location perfectly suited our needs! As many have noted, the hotel is located within extremely close proximity to all Hollywood Boulevard attractions. Located in the Hollywood & Highland complex, it was well kept and felt extremely safe, with the open air mall, funky bowling facility, and plenty of restaurants to occupy your time in the evening when the world outside the complex gets a bit sketchy. Valet service was lightening fast and pretty reasonable at $22, which was surprisingly cheap considering what we've paid in other metropolitan tourist areas. Front desk check in was quick and pleasant. The room itself was a typical king hotel room setup with bath, bed, tv/armoire, and desk. We had a view of the city which was very nice both at night and during the day. The decor is sort of retro, reminiscent of 50s contemporary styling. The bathroom was roomy with plenty of towels and bath products available. Everything was very clean and in good shape with the exception of the bedspread and pillow shams, which seemed a bit worn (not a big deal as we just throw it all off the bed when we sleep anyway). All the public areas are clean and have wonderful artwork on display. We had the breakfast buffet at Twist, the onsite restaurant and found it to have a good selection of quality hot & cold items, including cooked to order eggs and waffles. The service was top notch and we thought it was a pretty good value for $16 or so, even though we didn't eat a lot. All in all, this was a great hotel providing us the perfect home base for our one day visit to Hollywood. It is a great option for anyone looking to stay in or tour the Hollywood Boulevard attractions, as well as other attractions reachable by Metro as the station is extremely close by.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay as long as..”
Reviews.Author: Purpleguardog
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay in Los Angeles, really convenient location, lovely decor, great valet service etc.etc. as long as you can deal with the unbelievably offhand reception staff. My children and I were put in a smoking room when we'd asked for no smoking and they couldn't change us, nor could they change travellers cheques and were generally pretty rude. If you can get over that (which we did) it's a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It Lived Up To It's Reputation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Everything about my stay at the Renaissance was pleasant. This place really lived up to it's rep. I had read all the good reviews and thought "Why not give it a try!". The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location couldn't have been better. All the brand name shops were adjacent to the hotel. It is was within walking distance to Mann's Chinese Theater, The Kodak Theater, Disney Soda Shop, Hollywood Walk of Fame, and many other popular attractions were all just steps away from the hotel. This place was worth every penny of my two nights stay. Oh yeah...I forgot to mention that heavenly bed. It was soooo comfortable I could have just stayed in bed all day watching movies. Our view was of the city skyline and believe you me it was something to see at night. The room decor was very modern contemporary-they did a fantastic job. I just made my reservations at the Renaissance for 4 nights- I was so impressed I plan on doing it again for my birthday in October. Happy travels.

Reviews.Title: “Very very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sniffles
Reviews.Content: After 8 days in DL and SD with a 2yr old, it was our time to relax. And relax we did! Valet was pricy ($22/day) but well worth it with a trunk load of luggage and an un-cooperating child. Stayed in a suite (all 650 sq ft of it) overlooking the pool and HW blvd and haze. Ordered room service, dinner from Twist (NY (?) steak and salad - excellent , pasta - so-so). Reminded the SO not to touch the snack machine, opening/closing the "beverage" bar did not cause mystery charges. Overall a very enjoyable experience, definitely the place to stay in HW.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place To Stay If You Want To Be In Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: fedexflyer
Reviews.Content: I had a day to kill at the end of a recent business trip to LA, so I elected to stay at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel. First word of warning--try to arrive outside of rush hour, as traffic on North Highland Avenue approaching the hotel moved VERY slowly at 5:30 p.m. Upon arrival, I handed my car over to the valet ($22 a day with in & out privileges) and was immediately greeted by the front desk clerk. She quickly checked me in to my room on the club floor, but it was only after I walked away that I realized that she did not give me any information on the club floor lounge (open 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.). The room had a nice view of the LA smog--downtown was barely visible, although the Hollywood sign could be seen off to the side. The room itself was clean and decorated in a style that is intended to be modern and hip. To me, however, it came across as austere and cold (although the room does include a fish in a small bowl so as to ensure that you have a friend away from home). The room and bathroom also seemed a tad smaller than typical, although they were certainly big enough, and the all-important bed was comfortable. Room service was fine, although the hallways were lined with dirty trays--one stayed outside my room the whole time I was there. As for the hotel's location, it can't be beat--the Kodak Center is just steps away, and virtually all of the sites of interest along Hollywood Blvd. are within a convenient walk. While Hollywood is not the nicest part of LA, the Renaissance is definitely the place to stay if you want to be close to the Hollywood attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, incredible location”
Reviews.Author: SteveBazakas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took our 14 and 10 year old on vacation in Hollywood, and I don't know how you could have a better location. You are right next to the Oscar theatre, Grauman's Chinese Theatre, and right on the walk of fame. Restaurants are nearby. From our room, facing the mountains, you looked right at the Hollywood sign. The rooms are large and nice, and the staff is extremely helpful and friendly. Beautiful pool, great workout room. We actually switched to this hotel after one night somewhere else, and we were very glad we moved. You are on Hollywood BL, one block from Sunset, and a subway ride from Universal. Valet parking is very expensive ($24?). A great Hollywood experience!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute perfect location”
Reviews.Author: nvelardi66
Reviews.Content: Hotel: - 1st class - excellent customer service - decor is beautiful but a little too modern for me (and i love contemporary decor!) -- everything is crisp and fine lined...just felt a little cold and not homey at all - very large spacious room (i was in an average room) - very very clean Location: - wonderful location - centrally located to everything you need! Metro train is right next door - LA is surprisingly easy to get around - Metro train only $1.50 (and that's on the honor system!!) and you can take that all the way down to Long Beach!! 1 1/2 hour lovely ride - subway system is incredibly clean and safe (i'm from NYC!) - no problems at all and everyone was very helpful --- one stop to Universal. Walk to all hollywood sites - warning: DO NOT visit the Hollywood Wax Museum! HUGE disappointment and WASTE of $14 per person - the "wax" figures look more like my 10 year old was experimenting with playdoh! horrible! - Definetely take the Starline Tours - Johnny Rockets for eats, Mels Diner, lots of free TV show tix available from street vendors right on Hollywood Blvd. FUN FUN FUN!

Reviews.Title: “Could not be better”
Reviews.Author: jimmyb01
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in a fantastic location, it has a great swimming pool (you can see the Hollywood sign from the pool) The rooms are large and very very comfortable. This is an ultra modern Hotel next to all the tourist areas and has the most polite staff members I have ever come across in LA. The valet parking is $22 a day. I really could not find fault with this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!! ***Reommended*** ”
Reviews.Author: sammie66
Reviews.Content: Superb Hotel!!!!!!!! We had an absolutely fantastic time in Hollywood and the Renaissance hotel was the perfect place as it was right in the centre of all things Hollywood. The rooms were very good in size, clean and air conditioned which is great after a long day in the sun. The staff were friendly, the pool not huge but never busy and the view of LA form our room was fantastic!! As for positioning you walk out of the fifth floor straight into the Hollywood and highland shopping complex which is linked to the Kodak theatre (where the oscars are held) and near Manns chinese theatre. If you go down to the ground floor level of this complex you can walk straight out onto hollywood boulevard. You are literally 3mins from all the action particularly all the premieres which are great for star spotting. You may even see a star or two in the hotel!!!!! We saw Penny Johnson Jerald, who played Sherry, President David Palmer’s ex-wife in 24 on the same floor as us and Raven-Symone who played Olivia on the Cosby show and now has her own show in the states in the lobby. Plus while we were there they were running the BET music awards from the hotel - the lobby was absoultely packed with people of which some were stars although American holiday makers were recognising them but we weren't!!!. What is also nice is the majority of visitors there are American so you don't feel like part of the UK has just been moved with you on your holiday!!!! As for going out at night yes you do need to be weary in LA but this is exactly the same as if you were in London or probably any other city only difference being more gun crime but I felt safe in the vicinity of the hotel. The actual part of Hollywood boulevard outisde the Kodak and Mann's theatre I felt very safe in, even at night. One evening my boyfriend was ill and I went out on my own around 10pm to get some food and I felt completely safe!!!!! This part was quite packed with tourists every night til around midnight. All in all recommend to all!!

Reviews.Title: “Dream Hotel”
Reviews.Author: francais8900
Reviews.Content: All I can say is that our experience at the Renaissance Hollywood has made me look for Renaissance hotels in every city I visit. My husband and I spent 3 nights there in March and we booked our trip through American Airlines Vacations. Our huge picture window gave us a great view of the Hollywood sign as well as downtown LA. The beds were extremely comfortable and the room was decorated in a really modern and colorful style. The lobby bar was amazing and the hotel staff were the friendliest I've encountered in the Los Angeles area. We saw several TV and film stars in and around the hotel, and the Kodak theatre is connected to the back of the Renaissance. There are shops and restaurants just outside the hotel and of course, the famous Walk of Fame. The Renaissance brings back the glamour of the golden days of Hollywood and I can't wait to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Renaissance Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grammy5
Reviews.Content: We just returned from attending my husband's conference which was based at the Hollywood Renaissance Hotel at Hollywood and Highland Avenues. The hotel itself was phenomenal ... the most comfortable beds and pillows we've ever had at a hotel!! The staff was excellent and any time we talked to them about places to go and how to get there, we were given complete verbal instructions and also printed instructions! Our conference food was catered by Wolfgang Puck and it was the best ... not sure how they serve hundreds of people with piping hot food but it was perfect every time. If you have a chance to eat at one of his restaurants, do it! The food is great! The hotel is directly connected to a mall which has some high end restaurants and also some more moderate eateries. You can also walk down the famous Kodak Theater stairway and to Grauman's Chinese Theater to see the hand and foot prints of the big stars! The stars with the names on are all along the sidewalks. Having said all that, you have to realize the location you are at. The streets seem to be tourist friendly during the day, but I would be careful at night. We didn't venture too far after dark. One morning we took the bus (very reasonable!) to The Farmer's Market/The Grove for breakfast and a little shopping. We also took the bus one afternoon out to Warner Bros. studio for the VIP tour. There was some walking from where the bus left us off but it wasn't bad. (that is a great tour!) I think you just have to be prepared for the expense and also the time it takes to get to places from this location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I drove up from Palm Springs for a weekend here, and it was absolutely wonderful. The best part about it is location...the hotel is attached to an outdoor mall, and within walking distance of all the hollywood tourist sights!! There are a ton of restaurants and bars to choose from, as well as places to grab a drink. The hotel itself was also superb. The beds were comfortable, and the room had every ammenity we could have needed. The staff is very friendly, and I appreciated their enthusiasm to assist. Room service was great, took no time at all and they called a little later to check on the quality!! Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for the hollywood experience in a posh environment!!

Reviews.Title: “Teriffic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately the start to our 5 night stay in Hollywood was awful. My fiance and I had driven to Hollywood from Las Vegas and en route stopped off in a random town half way in between Hollywood and Las Vegas called Victorville for something to eat. What I didn't found out until we had reached the Renaissance in Hollywood was that my fiance had left our passports, tickets and money on a seat in the restaurant!!!! As you can imagine I wasn't best pleased and we both started to panic. The staff on receiption at the hotel were SUPBERB and located the telephone number of this restaurant and rang around a few places and eventually located our passports. They arranged for a courier to collect our vaulables and 4 hours later we were reunited with our things. As we didn't have our room voucher the reception desk were under no obligation to check us into our room. However, i think they took pity on us and checked us in very quickly. Rooms are very modern and contemporary with a lovely comfortable bed and plenty of space. Mini bar was also a nice touch and the bathroom was also very big with very modern fixtures and fittings. The hotel restaurant "twist" is very nice and definitely worth a visit. Overall i loved this hotel and its location (right on Hollywood Boulevard) and would definitely recommend this to anyone!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood ! ! ! ! ! ! !”
Reviews.Author: smb0903
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at this hotel after a long ride from the airport by one of the shuttle buses which I would not recommend by the way, I was very impressed by the sheer style of this hotel. Our room was available right away and we were more than pleased with our room which we paid £115 ROOM ONLY. I can highly recommend the breakfast buffet which was an additional $12 per person. It is ideally situated in the Hollywood & Highland shopping complex as well as the usual tourist sights of Hollywood. A $3 a day bus ride will take you to Santa Monica & Beverly Hills which were great to see and a lot nicer than Hollywood which we found to be a little bit risky if venturing out on a night out of the touristy areas. I would recommend this hotel without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: carcar_06
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the renaissance Hollywood for a short family vacation and to go to Universal Studios. I had checked a ton of different hotels, but it turned out that the Renaissance was the best pick. We got a rate of $135.00 per night with the military discount. The hotel was great! it was very clean, nice size bathrooms, great views and in a great location of the top hollywood sights! The metro is also located right outside te hotel and that is what we took to universal studios. It only took 3 min to get there, and it was only $3.00 for the entire day. The Hotel was great I could not have asked for anything else!

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood lights-camera-action”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: No complaints at all for the ealry check in around 10:00 am to the time we left 4 days later. Stayed on high floor overlooking the hollywood blvd. Front desk, conseriage, bellman as well as the valet service was great. I highly recomend this hotel to families that want to be in the middle of the Hollywood scene. Do not and I repeat do not venture far from this location. My wife's sister lives only a few blocks away and the bums, prostitutes as well as drug delaers are all very close by. On our last day we experienced only 50' from us a drug dealer having 2 cops jump out of their car and as the dealer went for something in his pocket, both cops pulled there guns...whew. The location of the hotel is close for those who want to take taxies to Beverly hills, Rodeo Drive area as well as some of the great hotels and night life. The weather was great no humidity and averaged in the 60's being from Florida we enjoyed the weather especially this time of year. Also found for those who rent a car the Venice Beach and Malibu areas are fairly close by but the traffic ---- getting there. Went to Santa Monica pier and the 3rd st. Promonade.....beautiful area and a must vist...just watch out for the bums they are everywhere...had to keep an eye on both my daughters ages 14 and 15 since the homeless men were quite agressive....all in all nice place to visit but I will stay in Fort Lauderdale to live...must admit give me the summer so. cal weather and I would be hard pressed to go anywhere

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service and great room!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm 18 years old, and was able to experience the city of LA for 2 days, i read many reviews about many different hotels, but the R.Hollywood stood out. And i'm so happy i got to stay in such a eautiful hotel. Stayed on the 18th floor and had a beautiful view, and the room was very spacious. Great service! Stayed there for two days to do a bit a shopping in LA and the first day i shopped right nextdoor at the Hollywood + Highland centre, and also got to stroll along the hollywood walk of fame whilst shopping!! It was a fabulous location! Loved the decor. Comfy bed, especially after a long flight, and brilliant facilities. Gym, pool, internet service, and lots more! Recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone! I may be only 18, but i know style! lol. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place for Tourists”
Reviews.Author: GrandOhioTraveler
Reviews.Content: You'll have a hard time finding a better hotel to stay at if you are a tourist with children. Just don't let your kids venture outside of the hotel complex after dark; it doesn't feel like the safest area. Still, the Renaissance Hollywood is a great place to stay with its direct connection to the Kodak Theatre, Chinese Mandarin Theatre, Hollywood Walk of Fame, and an expanding shopping mall. The room size was just right and comfortable; the bathroom was clean, too. They're experimenting with providing a Dell home pc with Internet access, which we did not have time to use. I think I saw a Sony Play Station, too, next to the television. Again, if you are doing the Los Angeles tour thing and you have kids, then this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, more business guests than tourists”
Reviews.Author: caliwanabee
Reviews.Content: the renaissance is perfectly situated on hollywood blvd on the hollywood walk of fame. There is a metro station outside which is only one stop away from the Universal studios theme park, and the complex is right in the hub of the tourist area of hollywood. Rooms are very comfortable, and view of the hollywood sign from the pool area leaves you in no doubt of where you are. Would have loved to be able to open our window onto a balcony, to enjoy the street atmosphere from on high! (Although perhaps we wouldnt have enjoyed letting the smog in!) Taxis and food seemed to work out quite expensive, although we ate many times in Johnny Rockets 50s diner, and would thoroughly recommend them for service and value. Overall the hotel cleanliness was excellent, but we didnt use the twisters restaurant in the hotel as it looked a little above our budget. Also, if you want to email whilst away, try the internet cafe immediately across the road from the hotel entrance, we found it very cheap and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: PamDNorthamptom
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from an 8 day stay at the Renaissance. I could not fault it. Having stayed at the Renaissance Mayflower in Washington previously we expected good standards and were not disappointed. There was even a film being made in the foyer to add to the excitement. One bit of advice though. If you are staying here without a car don't be tempted to pay lots of money for the tours on offer. Most of the locations offered can easily be reached by metro bus. This costs $3 per day, all day. It's amazing ! We went to Santa Monica for $6 ! My advice is to go to the Tourist Information office in Hollywood and Highland mall where they will give you a list of all destinations and bus numbers. It couldn't be easier.Hotel staff were fantastic especially Lilli in the restaurant.We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Base when in LA...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of only two properties you should consider in the central Hollywood area, should a good standard of accommodation be important to you, as well as a very central location (the other being the Roosevelt, reviewed elsewhere) I have stayed at both hotels on several occasions and each time I have visited my stay has been excellent. The Renaissance is a new-build property, visible from several miles away, just up from the junction of Hollywood and Highland. It is actually part of the Hollywood & Highland complex, which is a 4-floor collection of small stores and restaurants. This is where the only negative comment I have about the location comes in - the parking. Parking your vehicle involves using the cavernous car park serving the shopping complex. You have to drive underground 3-4 levels and park up then make your way to the elevators or the escalators and make your way up again (with your luggage, of course) to the third level of the complex, then cross through the stores and enter the hotel (still at the third level) then take a hotel elevator down to the lobby, check-in, then back up in the elevator to your room...quite a trek! Seriously consider the valet, as I do now. Once you have recovered from the parking ordeal, you will quickly concede that the hotel is amazing. The views are spectacular. Either you get the Hollywood sign or the City of Los Angeles, either view is a winner. As several other people have commented here, the windows in the rooms are floor to ceiling and several nights I went to sleep with the curtains open so I could see the city spread out below. Beautiful. Bathrooms are large and have all the amenities you would expect. There is always plenty of closet space and the beds are wonderfully comfortable. Be careful of the mini-bar though - removing an item to even look at it seems to automatically charge it to your room! The pool area at this hotel is underrated also, a good sized swimming area, plenty sun loungers and several cabanas for those really hot days. The restaurant in the hotel I have not tried in the evening however the buffet breakfast is more than adequate - plenty choice of meats/ eggs served to order, cereals, pastries and fruit and currently $16 which is not so bad for the quality of the food and surroundings. As for surroundings, the immediate vicinity can be rather seedy at night although not unsafe. And the location is terrific - you could walk uphill to the Hollywood Bowl, the Hollywood Walk of Fame runs along the front of the shopping complex, the Kodak Theatre is actually part of the complex itself, Mann's Chinese Theatre is next door to the Kodak and the Hollywood Sign looks down on the hotel from the rear. Any negative points to this property? Just the parking - if you have trouble walking, it may be an issue. However bear in mind the hotel offers a rate of $15 a day with in-and-out privileges, whereas the carpark itself only offers $10 rate per entry with no in-and-out so book with the hotel, it should work out better for you. If you are expecting class from Hollywood, do not be too disappointed. If you are expecting class from the Renaissance Hollywood, you are in luck.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Star!”
Reviews.Author: Criticaltraveller
Reviews.Content: Ceiling to floor windows ensured that the view from our room was the best it could be. The Hollywood sign and downtown LA was what we saw. It was stunning. The Venetian blinds on the windows are a different touch - nice. Everything that you would need to see in Hollywood is at this hotel's doorstep. Very convenient! The bathroom is very small, however, and that's really the only "complaint" that I would have. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff was great! Food was great! I can't wait to return to this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad thing to say about this place!!!...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend have just returned from our first trip to L.A and we absolutely loved it. We stayed 3 nights in Hollywood at the Renaissance and then 4 nights in Bev. Hills at the Crowne Plaza (a dive compared to the Renaissance). We'd only decided to spread our time between the 2 areas because people kept saying we'd be too far away just in Hollywood. But unless you're loaded, theres not a whole lot to do in Bev Hills in the day or eveing. We went to Bel Air and Rodeo Drive etc but we left from L.A City Tours on Hollywood Boulevard, so there wasn't any need to go and stay there. On arrival, after a long flight, the staff were immediately lovely to us and were like that everyday we saw them. It was just so nice to be greeted by smiles and they gave you so much help - like when we wanted directions somewhere. Even the bell man were fantastic and they aren'ty edging for tips, which is nice considering Americas reputation for that! Our room was on the 10th floor (half way up) with stunning views of the city and the famous Hollywood sign. The beds were big and comfy and the room was modern and spotlessly clean. The bathroom was lovely as well - a lot bigger than the norm at hotels. The maids changed the sheets every day and even left the T.V guide open at the right date each day. The breakfast buffet was fab, costing just $35 for two (about £17) and you could eat as much as you liked. There was toast, muffins, bagels, croissants, cereals, omletts made to suit you (lots of different fillings), fresh fruit, salmon, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage and complimentary tea/ coffee and juice. It was nice weather but a bit too chilly for the pool - however, it was a nice area and would be great for the summer. The hotel connects to the Highland mall, which if you walk through, brings you right into the middle of Hollywood Boulevard and next to Graumanns Chinese Theatre. The mall itself is great, with a mixture of shops (picked up some great clothes there). Theres also loads of restaurants (we loved the Italian on the top floor) and jewellery stalls in the middle. We had Sandra Bullocks premiere of Miss Congeniality and watched her get her star on the walk of fame the next day - it was a great experience. The hotel really does have a fabulous location. L.A itself is an amazing city which has so much to offer. It's so cheap compared to the UK. I'd recommend a visit to Universal Studios where on the tour you get to see movie sets and T.V sets like Desperate Housewives. The Warner Bro's tour was also fab - got to see F.R.I.E.N.D.S set and watched Joey being filmed live (must book tickets in advance over Internet but they're free!). Venice Beach was beautiful and when we go back, we'll def, spend more time there. The people are some of the friendliest I've met and even though they see hundreds of tourists a day, they're just as happy to chat to you and give you as much enthusiasm as they did to people before you. That helps when you get as homesick as me. The hotel was 100% and we'll certainly be booking there again asap! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CincinnatiTravelgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Renaissance Hotel Hollywood Feb. 19, 2005. This hotel is fabulous! The staff was very friendly with speedy checkin. The location is great, right next to the Kodak Theatre. We had the breakfast buffet, which was superb. The hotel has self parking which is reasonable. The rooms were very nice and beds very comfortable. We even had a view of the Hollywood sign. Being a travel agent, I look for any kind of flaw a hotel might have, whether it be the hotel itself or their staff. I must say, if this hotel had one, I didn't see it. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kwalsh79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hollywood Renassance 3/6-3/8/05. The rooms were clean and pleasant. Check in and out was fast. The location was excellent. It was right at a mall, the Kodak theater and the famous Hollywood Blvd. The parking was easy and relatively inexpensive, you could go in and out all day long. I would definately stay at this hotel again if I were in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: kingpap
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel during the Academy Awards. Overall the hotel was excellent, the room was very good with a great view. Even though the hotel was completely full, and very busy due to the special event, the service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ryanoles
Reviews.Content: If you are going to stay in Hollywood, this is the place you have to be. While it does have it's drawbacks (obviously), it is easily the best hotel in the best location in Hollywood. All the other hotels I seen looked like they had seen better days and the neighbourhoods were sketchy. The staff was extremely friendly at the hotel, and offered assistance anytime they could. Upon first entering my room, it had an overwhelming smell of make-up for some reason, but the room was beautiful and the view of the Hollywood sign was unreal at first look. The TV was great and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom had a good shower for a hotel in Los Angeles (all the other hotels in LA I had stayed in had subpar showerheads). The pool was rather small and didn't even have a deep end! I was rather disappointed by that aspect, but the pool deck was a nice area. The location is impeccable in Hollywood as you are close to everything worth seeing and in walking distance. However, you have to risk your life crossing a parking lot entrance everytime you leave the hotel from the front doors so beware!

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Renaissance Review”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Pool area was large and looked nice but unable to use due to weather. Gym is standard i.e. 4 treadmills, 2 elliptical & 3 cycles, minimal nautilus low end hand weights. No continental breakfast. Radio in room has cd player. Rooms really small in floor space and in height. My husband 5'11 hit the ceiling w/ his hands while putting on his shirt. A bit claustrophobic. No ventilation. Had a smoking room and couldn't stand it. Went outside to smoke. Internet $9.00/day. DO NOT even touch the mini bar. If you even pick up an item to look at it, your electronically billed for the item. If you use the item and replace, you will be billed 2x. Area is major tourist and safe during the day. A homeless guy works the corner by the hotel everyday. Very awkward to pass him daily. You will be asked for money buy vendors and homeless. Area is extremely expensive. Went to a little grocery to buy cokes and a 6 pack of coke was $5.99. Went to lunch at average place got 2 hamburgers, 1 iced tea, 1 appetizer and bill total $39.00 plus tip. A $45.00 lunch. So be prepared to spend. Lots of tattoo places, erotic clothing, sex shops for s&m, porn clothing/shoes, leather clothing and drug/smoking paraphanelia . If that's your thing, you'll have a great time. In summary, hotel was average and area was rated R.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: MrTed
Reviews.Content: We just spent a long weekend at this hotel and really enjoyed our time there. The hotel's location is wonderful -- near all of the Hollywood sights, but with easy access to the rest of the city. Being adjacent to the Hollywood and Highland complex is a huge advantage as there are a number of wonderful restaurants and shops connected to the hotel. The rooms are large and some have great views of the Hollywood sign. The decor is minimalist/modern, but still comfortable. Our room had a separate dressing room and bathroom and a small seating area. The bath towels are very soft and the bed was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: gigibebek
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a 1 day meeting and it was perfect. I checked in early on a holiday(8 AM) and they had a great room available. Corner room with nice decor, clean and quiet! it would be great for a vacation to sightsee in LA or business.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: ritahyde
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Renaissance this weekend. We enjoyed a great room with a nice view of the pool and the Kodak theatre. The staff there was very accomodating. The mall across the street was handy for shopping, Starbucks, people watching. Great location if you want to stay in the heart of Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Renaissance Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Priceline for $75.00 a night over Thanksgiving, thus we paid half of the lowest price we could find ($149) anywhere online. We were a bit unsure of how we'd be treated since we had gotten our room for such a bargain, but we were treated by the most courteous of staff from the valet to the receptionist, to the maid, and were given a very nice room with a beautiful view. Our room overlooked Hollywood Hills and it was breathtaking at night and by day you could view the Hollywood sign. When we arrived a film crew from DreamWorks was filming a scene for an upcoming movie. It was incredibly cool to be able to watch it all. The movie crew and hotel staff were very open to let us watch as long as we wanted. My son even got an autograph from the film director, Wes Craven. As far as ammenities, the workout gym is nice, however we wish there had been a sauna and jacuzzi. If there was one, we couldn't find it. The pool was outdoors, so it was too cool to enjoy that. The room was extremely nice, with beautiful furnishings. The hotel is connected to a shopping mall, which is connected to the Kodak Theater (Academy Awards) and is right in the middle of the Hollywood Walk of Fame. We had one problem, with a bar bill for liquor we never used from the in-room vending machine, but the hotel took it off our bill without any questions when we told them we had never used the vending machine, and had kept it locked. They really could not have been nicer to us. I would go back to this hotel again. I was not crazy about Hollywood itself, but since we were visiting relatives in the area, it was not the city we were there to enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great”
Reviews.Author: mdvip
Reviews.Content: What this hotel does well, it does really well - quick and friendly check-in, and a beautiful, large, airy and nicely decorated room. Good bathroom and dressing room, large TV, quiet and effective aircon and 'same day' laundry service that really was same day. The restaurant was also good for breakfast, if a little pricey. Location was fine - handy for Universal Studios - but be aware that Hollywood is pretty seedy. Downsides? Well the maid cleaned the room OK, ie. she dusted, vacuumed and changed the towels, but someone really ought to teach her that making a bed involves more than just ensuring the top cover looks straight. Empty mineral water bottles seemed to offend her as well, as these were left to build into quite a considerable collection by the time we left. The bar was fine, but really would have benefited from staff with a slightly better grasp of English who knew how to smile from time to time. Think we'd try something around Beverly Hills next time.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am stunned by the positive reactions about this hotel. The rooms were very basic and everything that could be broken in my room, was. The phone, the TV, Internet access, and no hot water. The hotel management had every engineer in my room at one time or another and when they TWICE offered to move me to another room, I packed up and then they told me the other room had already been taken. Appallingly horrific experience, they comped my entire stay, and I will *never* stay there again. Ever.

Reviews.Title: “A good functional hotel”
Reviews.Author: ProfMagellan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a second time. A good functional hotel with friendly and professional staff. Minor gripes: beakfast 20 minutes late on one occasion, faxes are not delivered to the room but are collected from reception, laundry not returned same day (as requested), energy-saving lighting in room too subdued making it hard to read. Major gripe: a nasty fridge kept me awake with its whirring mechanics. Am I the only one who hates the whole idea of the hotel mini-bar? Once cigarettes were freely available; is it not time that alcohol was made more difficult to obtain? The bed was comfortable, the bathroom nice and modern (though steamed up too easily) and the view of the Hollywood Hills brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: bilti
Reviews.Content: Brilliant loved the place, myself, my wife and 14 year old son arrived at about 9.00PM after a long drive having spent the previous night on a ranch in Arizona and looking like the Beverly hillbillies we were welcomed and shown to our room which was great, in the morning looked out of the window and there was the Hollywood sign up on the hill couldn't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Business travelers look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is an exciting property. Fashionable, vibrant, interesting. Right down to the goldfish in the rooms. But location is not good and traffic is miserable. If you are a foreign tourist and want to see all the Hollywood sights, you will enjoy this hotel. If you are a family on a California vacation, you may be put off by the location. Stay somewhere where it's easier to park. If you are a business traveler (not in the movie industry), avoid at all costs. Too much hassle getting in and out. Self parking is a confusing hike through a big, bloated mall. I've stayed at the Manhattan Beach Marriott and recommend it as a home base. Close to LAX, too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Inside, Wild Outside”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
