Reviews.Content: In short - great hotel but a difficult location. Location: Hollywood & Highland complex was a little TOO central for my taste. The action - especially on the weekend I was there - was nonstop. This could be invigorating if you're in your mid-20s and seeking adventure. For me, the constant noise and traffic was a real disincentive to leave the hotel. Trying to get back into the hotel at 10 p.m. Saturday night was an exercise in futility - it took 75 minutes just to get through two blocks around the hotel due to the pedestrian & auto traffic!!! Couldn't get back out once I got in - so the location really adversely affected my flexibility in using it as a home base. Hotel: GREAT. Staff was super friendly, the TWIST brunch was one of the best ever - selection and quality - and the room itself was well appointed. Blinds and black out shades are a nice touch to keep the room appropriately lighted. Be careful of the silly snack bar mechanism - it will charge you for simply moving or adjusting the items on it. Also - at this level of hotel, high speed internet and/or wi-fi should be included in the rate, rather than an add-on charge. Overall - great place to stay if you don't plan on seeing much else of the city or its nightclubs. The clubbing crowd is at your hotel!

Reviews.Title: “"Absolutely the best"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I were having a hard time choosing which hotel to stay in during our trip to L.A. We wanted to get the best for our money and with all the hotels in this city it is difficult knowing which one can deliver exactly what you are looking for. I have stayed in Los Angeles many times and have never recieved such a warm welcome and stay as I did at the Renaissance. The rooms are spotless clean, larger than average and all offer wonderful views of either Hollywood Blvd or the hills. The concierge went out of their way to give us excellent information on any question we could come up with. The hotel is connected to the Highland shopping center which is great when you just want to hang around the hotel. It offers a number of eateries and great shops. The architecture of the hotel and shopping center is beautiful. If you are going to a show at the Kodak this hotel is essential! We just can't say enough nice things about this place and will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: writerguyfl
Reviews.Content: I did quite a bit of research and finally decided on the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel. It is located in the Hollywood & Highland complex, which makes it a great spot. The complex includes many restaurants, shops, as well as the Kodak Theatre and the studios for Ryan Seacrest On-Air. There are many positives about the hotel. The staff was very professional. I especially appreciated that the Housekeeping staff all said hello in the hallways. That is always a plus in my book. The rooms are good sized. I was in a king bed room with a view towards Downtown LA on the 10th floor. The design of the hotel is modern, but not to the extent where anything is too weird. The windows have wooden blinds and nice blackout shades. The linens on the bed could be softer, but the bed had 7 pillows. Since the hotel is relatively new, I expected more from the bathroom. It is nothing special. I had hoped for a separate water closet or even a separate bath/shower. Also, it is odd that the bathroom has no active fan so the mirror instantly fogs. The one vent in the shower doesn't do enough to exhaust the steam. It is important to note that the hotel and Hollywood & Highland in general are NOT in the best area. I've lived in Downtown and urban areas most of my life. The run-down buildings that surround the complex didn't bother me. However, I walked about seven blocks to the Pantages Theatre and saw my share of homeless, hookers, and many boarded up storefronts. Not everyone will fell comfortable walking off the complex. If you are used to suburbia, you may want to consider another area in town and make a day trip to Hollywood Blvd. All in all, I will stay at the Renaissance Hotel Hollywood again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: chemicalsuk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and it is a fantastic hotel. We had a room on the 23rd floor, state of the art, with a view of the "Hollywood" sign and also downtown LA, visible thru a huge window at one side of the room. The service was excellent, if a little mechanical and LA- manicure style (and thats just the guys!). Great location next to the Kodak theatre (home of the Oscars) and Manns Chinese Theatre, walk of fame etc, and the historic Musso & Frank's grill is just up the street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but not worth the cost”
Reviews.Author: wanderer
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Hollywood is a pretty hotel in a trendy, glitzy sort of way (a friend of mine found it pretentious). Because it's the tallest building in Hollywood and sits at the base of the hills, you can get tremendous views--my room overlooked the city as well as some enormous movie billboards. No complaints about the service, though staff's apparently been told to say they're "delighted" to do things, which comes out sounding mechanical and silly, as any formula would. My room size was adequate, not tiny, not huge. I came for a conference and the room rate averaged $180 per night (+14% tax). Unless you're routinely in the luxe bracket that's too much to spend--there are better bargains in LA. The location is interesting and unusual, especially for LA. Hollywood Boulevard is very walkable, block after block of storefronts, even if a fair number are tatoo and lingerie shops. In many cities, you'd take that walkability for granted, but not in LA. The neighborhood is a remarkable mix of culture and sleaze. The percentage of "regular people" on the street is much higher than it used to be, but you are likely to encounter some street people. It's probably the leading entertainment location in LA now--plays, movies, clubs. The nearest substantial grocery store is about 3/4 mile away, a real drawback. As some previous posts have mentioned, public transit is excellent. There's not only the subway which goes Downtown, but a slew of nearby buses to take you along Sunset Blvd., over to the Farmers Market and County Museum, and into interesting nearby neighborhoods. You may still want a car or you could save money by renting a car part of the time.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a great time there. We were at the hotel for the big Star Trek Tribute and Farewell for James Doohan and the rest of the original Star Trek cast. Great hotel, great surroundings. Excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: angie90210
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the beginning of September for 3 nights and is a lovely hotel, large rooms, helpful staff and very clean and modern. Unfortunately we got a room on the 4th floor with barely a view to speak of, but thats minor really. The best bit was breakfast in the Twist bar. Pancakes, waffles, danish , toast, fruit, cereals, all the fried stuff and a complimentary smoothie. Fantastic. OK, so the hotel is great but the location if you dont have a car is not good at all. Do not go to LA if you dont have wheels because its so large and spread out and the public transport is pointless. Although you have the chinese theatre outside, thats it. I wouldnt walk about in this area alone, especially at night and to get anywhere else is an expensive cab ride away. If you can afford it, stay in Beverly Hills. Much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in every way!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow... what an experience. We all commented that we have NEVER been treated so well by a hotel staff anywhere! Everyone was so helpful and friendly, the rooms were clean and fully supplied (with a whole extra basket of towels... oh, the luxury!), the valet parking attendants retrieved the car instantly and even handed us cold bottles of water every time we headed out... it was wonderful. The location couldn't be better, especially if you're going to an event at the Kodak Theatre, which you can access without even going out on the street. The AAA package included our valet parking AND the "continental breakfast" buffet, which had everything you could possibly want! The ONLY negative thing I could possibly say is that there were no refridgerators in the rooms for keeping our own drinks and doggie bags (fortunately with the small portions the L.A. restaurants serve, that was rarely a problem!). The fridges in the rooms are completely stocked with drinks and snacks for sale, but be sure to read the fine print: If you take something out to look at it, you get billed for it! Otherwise, an awesome place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and rooms, but don't request a cot!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want to be near all the tourist sites, this is the hotel for you. It's connected to the Hollywood & Highland shopping complex, so Starbucks, Johnny Rockets and a Sephora are a stone's throw away. The hotel has very nice rooms and a decent swimming pool which we never used because we were too busy exploring LA. The only downside to this hotel is that while guests can request a cot when making reservations, they do not guarantee a cot. My 19-year-old son had to sleep on the floor the first night because they failed to locate a cot after promising us one at check-in.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: pentacle
Reviews.Content: After staying at The Fairmont Miramar in Santa Monica for 5 nites in a small ocean tower room we moved to The Renaissance Hotel in Hollywood at Hollywood and Highland--We were upgraded for free on our package of 2 nites-- to an executive room on the 19th floor with a killer view of all LA and the Hollywood and Highland complex. The room was huge and the windows were enormous and had beautiful wood blinds and at turn down service they put down white shades as well--the view alone was awesome--and at night the lights are incredible. We also had a wonderful King Bed--and we had the CLUB LEVEL service which meant we could eat a nice breakfast in the private lounge, have snacks at cocktail time, and dessert at night--all included. The bathroom was all white, clean, and new, and very large--shower and tub combo, and included a separate dressing room with the sink. The pool is on level 5 and has a view of the hollywood sign--its not that big--but very nice pool deck serviced by the wolfgang puck restaurant. The location is wonderful here as the Hollywood and Highland complex features many many places to eat both expensive and cheap. The complex has 5 floors with movie theatres as well--wonderful place..We ate at The Grill and liked that, and also at the classy Italian place overlooking the courtyard of the complex--and the shopping is good too....Hollywood Blvd, Graumanns, and the Walk of Fame are also steps away from the hotel--it is wonderful that this complex has been built--it made the area SO MUCH better and this hotel is beautiful, and the service is also excellent--the TWIST restaurant is very attractive--we had breakfast there once too. You dont even need a car as there is much to do around the Hollywood and Highland complex. Everyone should stay here once to really explore what Hollywood is all about. Be sure to take a tour of the movie star homes and the double decker bus. LA is much more attractive than I ever thought.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Absolutely Wonderful.. I stayed there as part of a trade show, and it was perfect. Service was great, view was great..

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: SusanCoh
Reviews.Content: My husband, two teenage sons and I just spent 2 nights of our California vacation at the Hollywood Renaissance. What a beautiful hotel...an awesome location...and a great experience. Our two room suite was perfect. Plenty of room for all of us to spread out. The location of the hotel in the Hollywood and Highland complex was wonderful with plenty of places to shop and eat. The accesibility of tourist attractions was also a plus...you're right in the middle of everything. The hotel staff were all very helpful and friendly, we were made to feel very comfortable in every way. The pool area was also very nice. One afternoon my husband and I were enjoying the pool and as I relaxed in one of the chaise lounges sipping my Wolfgang Puck Mai Tai I turned my head to the right and I was looking right at the famous Hollywood sign. All I can say is, "WOW"!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Judee512
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hollywood Renaissance Hotel for three nights during July 2004. I can't say enough about this great hotel and the exceptional staff. The valet service was the best. Our view of the Hollywood Hills was breathtaking. The rooms were very spacious and extra clean. Everything about it was wonderful. I'm so happy that we chose this hotel, and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Snedders
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 4 nights at the Renaissance and we have had a fantastic time. The room was good, location is excellent as were the hotel facilties. We used the swimming pool and the gym both of which were quiet and allowed us to do our own thing. The tube station is 2 min walk away where we got the $1.25 tube ride to Universal Studios - well worth it. Great shopping and food at Hollywood & Highland complex. Most nights we got a cab to Sunset Strip to eat and drink although the hotel bar is really nice and all staff are very friendly and helpful. This was our last stop on our holiday and probably the best value - Vegas and San Fransisco were a lot more expensive to eat and drink.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: North_Wales_Lass
Reviews.Content: If you're visiting LA, this has to be the place to stay! The hotel is gorgeous, spacious rooms, a fabulous view of the Hollywood sign, comfy beds and well air-conditioned rooms. The staff were helpful and friendly (apart from the lady in the shop, she tried to short-change me in the shop, and she wouldn't listen to me. Took my mum to persuade her otherwise!), especially in the restaurant. Lovely food there, but a bit pricey and the menu isn't exactly varied. Although, there are lovely places in the Hollywood and Highland complex, which you can get into through a short walkway in the hotel. Some evenings there are VERY LOUD bands playing different music, and there is a very relaxed and safe atmosphere there at night unlike Hollyowwd 3 years ago when we never ventured out of the hotel after 8pm! The metro is about a 5 minute walk away from the hotel, and it's extremely cheap to get a train to Universal Studios, then it's just a short walk to a shuttle stop to get to the park. If you do decide to visit Universal, it may be worthwhile buying a queue-jumping ticket which allows you to get in the front of the line of every ride and show, and gives you reserved seats at all shows, although it may be worthwhile getting to shows a little while before it says to get there on the ticket, especially if it's a busy day. Although it's $50 more than a standard ticket, it's definately worth the money!!! Chinese Mann's Theatre is a short walk away, as is the Walk of Fame and the Kodak theatre. If you wish to visit the latter, visit the leaflet stand at the hotel, as there is a discount voucher there. When we went, it was a quite day so we got to sit in the chairs that celebrities sat in, and we also got to stand on the stage! This hotel is definately worth a visit once!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood at its Best”
Reviews.Author: Saysum
Reviews.Content: I spent the weekend there in June for my wife's birthday. We have lived in California all of our lives but never did the "Hollywood Thing". So I found a great deal on their website that included two nights and two day access to Universal studios. It also included breakfast each mornging and parking. It was a great deal. We got to the hotel late and I asked if there was any room upgrade. They were able to bump us up to the deluxe room which was great. We didn't have a great view but that was ok. The room was big and had a nice sitting area. I loved the decor. IT was modern and very unique. The room was very clean and looked very new. The bed was really really comfortable with more than enough pillows. I could have slept all day. I loved "Twist", breakfast was really good. You must try the smoothies. The enviornment is great for a weekend getaway. Lots of good places to eat nearby. My only complaint was that I wanted to take advantage of the free shoe shine. I called multiple times and they kept promising someone would pick up my shoes but then never came. I complained about this and got free drinks instead. Otherwise a great/hip hotel to spend the weekend at. Danny

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance was great”
Reviews.Author: Nell23
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance was great - fun décor, great view, great toiletries. Everyone at the hotel was very helpful with information. The location is wonderful just because you have easy access to everything. From what I saw of LA, it's not a walking town anyway so you may as well be close to the things you want to do. There are lots of food choices at Hollywood and Highland, Ryan Seacrest is right there (although we didn't get in as it was Ashley Simpson day). The pool area is great and we were able to see Ryan Seacrest filming promotional stuff in the courtyard from the 5th floor pool. Graumann's is right next door. Great view of the Hollywood sign. Loved the Warner Brothers tour (15 min. drive). Great hotel but glad to leave Hollywood after 2 days (traffic is a nightmare).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights 15th and 16th July. Got a very good deal booking directly with hotel over internet - the Universal 2 night package which included 2 two day passes to Universal, and breakfast for 2 in their restaurant - which was very good. Very modern hotel with large clean rooms. There was plenty of room for 2 adults and 2 kids. Large spotlessly clean bathroom, great view from 16th floor of the Hollywood sign. Good location next to Hollywood and Highland shopping and restaurant complex, we had a great meal at a restaurant called The Grill (I think). Easy access to Kodak theatre and Universal Studios. Metro is within a 2 minute walk and costs $1.25 each (please note that the machines only accept $1 and $5 bills). It takes about 5 minutes on the train. Shuttle bus at the other end takes another few minutes to Universal City Walk. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Funky at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! Modern fun and funky decor. The entire Hollywood and Highland complex is a great edition to the Hollywood area. As a return visitor to LA what a change this area has undergone. Whilst it is an area clearly catering for tourists its a good location for a first timer to base themselves in spreadout LA. The rooms were huge and I had a great view of downtown LA and the Hollywood sign from the 19th floor. I nearly drowned in bath towels - so many were supplied in my bath room. My only complaint I couldnt store anything in the hotel fridge, if you took anything out of the mini bar you were charged. I like to have real milk in my coffee not the powdered stuff. So that was a bit of a pain. If you are into American Idol this is the place to be. The 12 days I was staying coincided with the American Idol finals and whilst I am not a fan of the show (wrong age bracket) if you are a fan you would have seen many of the Idol contestants and the judges coming in and out of the hotel. In fact if you are into doing the whole "Hollywood" thing celebrity spotting etc this is the hotel for you. The premiere of Raising Helen with Kate Hudson was across the road at the beautiful El Capitan theatre while I was staying. Transport has improved tenfold since my last visit with the Metro being built. There is a stop at Hollywood and Highland. Its one stop away from Universal Studios. I found it was a clean safe and easy way to get around. Apart from the non existent personality of the guy at check in, I found the staff to be friendly and helpful. (Maybe he was having a bad day or was rehearsing his starring role as Marcel Marceau!) A great place to stay in a good location. I note the comments of others about the area being seedy after dark I cant say I noticed anything unusual when I was out and about in the area at night.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest hotel in area”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 nights at this hotel. Room was exceptionally nice; amenities, bedding & furnishings first class. Several movie stars were in the hotel along with us! It is adjacent to the Kodak Theatre and a mall. Although a high touristy area, it is rough at night. Stay in after dark.

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This property should be listed as a flagship of Renaissance properties. As a Marriott Rewards member..I look forward to staying at all their brands because of the consistancy. This property is a shining example of what a hotel should be. Location, friendly staff, great design (loved the tashen lamps in "twist". Parking is a nightmare and I suggest self parking at the ramp the connects the Renaissance, Manns Chineese, and the mall. It's 12.00 a day with in/out priv. versus the valet parking at 28.00 plus tip! The food is gteat at "Twist" and is worth the cost. There is, hoever a huge mall connected to the hotel and provised fine dining and fast food fare for those of us who are on a budget. FYI the pool area is cool but is NOT owned by the hotel. Wolfgang Puck owns it and rents it out for parties. While I was there the noise was so loud into the wee hours of the morning due to a HOOTERS convention. I was assured that this is not a regulat occurance and adfter a call to the front desk, it quieted down. Views of the city are great, vast, and plentyful with help of the panoramic windows in every roon..but beware they do not open so one is forced to breather dry, recycled air :) Guess thats a positive considering it LA! DO STAY at this hotel, you'll love it! Oh the subway stops right below the hotel so getting places like Universal are easier than ever and cheaper considering that parking at Universal is 12.00! The subway is 1.25 one way and brings you right to the Universal City stop where a shuttle brings you to the theme park. Well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect tourist hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After spending hours on line trying to find the perfect place to stay we stumbled upon this hotel and immediately made reservations. We just got back and I have to say all the reviews were right on. Room wise, they were spacious and very well decorated and very clean. We even had a pet fish in our room. Service was outstanding and the staff was very friendly and "Delighted" to help at all times. We had requested a view of the hills and ended up with a view of the city. I decided to call and see what could be done and they immediately showed up with keys to 3 different rooms that we could choose from. Once we did she went to get us new keys and had them sent up. When we got them she had upgraded us to a room on the Club Level which was even more beautiful than the other room. They really made us feel great in every way. Above all this you are right where they film 'On Air with Ryan Seacrest' & 'Jimmy Kimmle Live' plus Grauman Chineese Theater and Walk of Fame are steps away. I just cannot say enough about this place. I miss it already! I recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay while your away in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want a chance to see stars, stay in a location that allows you to take inexpensive (public) transportation and don't mind small shop food, this is the perfect location. Check out what previews are happing at either the Kodak or Mann Theaters. Take the train to Universal Studios for the day. Rent a car for 1 day and go to Warner Bros. Studio (A MUST SEE). The small food shops in the Mall had good mexican food and pizza and the coffee shop on the second floor was excellent. They also offer a great fruit salad. You can take a bus to the Farmers Market and Rodeo Drive and the LeBrea Tar Pits/ Art Museum. All in all - Burger King and McD's were short walks for Breakfast and the many unique characters at night made for a most entertaining stay. We were also in a filming of JAG (in the Mall) and we were almost run over by the many stars from "The Rock"'s Walking Tall movie premier, including Michael Clarke Duncan & Natasha Henstridge. WOW. If we go back - my wife and 2 teenage daughters, we would certainly stay at the Renaissance. Did I mention that the view from the hotel of Hollywood Hill was incredible and the the room was clean and service exceptional - everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful - pros outnumber cons”
Reviews.Author: Foxpro
Reviews.Content: We (my girlfriend and I) stayed at this hotel from 4/6/04 to 4/9/04. I booked online through swa vactions so basically, it was about $200.00 cheaper than booking the flight/hotel separately. When we got there, I asked about upgrading to the executive suite since it has an "oversized" bathroom. They upgraded me for free (even after I said I would pay the difference). Our room was on the Hollywood Hills side (where you can see the Hollywood sign from your room). The reception group (bellmen, concierge, the entire staff) could not have been nicer. We are not rich by any means, and I'm sure the staff at the hotel could tell that, but they never looked down upon us. Some people have said some things about the service, but I can't complain at all. We tipped housekeeping $4.00 a night (I don't know how much you're supposed to tip - I usually just do $2.00, but since we had a bigger room...) Even then, I don't know if that's high, low, good enough??? We planned on going to Universal Studios, seeing Ryan Seacrest On-Air, and hoping to catch a glimpse of stars (The Whole Ten Yards premiere was at the Graumann's Chinese Theatre while we were there). If you go to see Ryan, get there by 7:30. We went 2 days and barely got in the first day (7:30 arrival in line). The next day, I got in line at 7:00 and was 6th in line (sat front row-make a creative sign and they'll sit you up front). Ok, back to the hotel. The bathroom in the executive suite is oversized, but basically, they just added a table along the opposite wall from the sink. The problem is this: I was hoping for 2 sinks - there was plenty of room for 2. Plus, I was hoping for a separate shower. Once again, there was plenty of room for this. This suite was definitely bigger than a regular room, but no big deal. In order to watch TV, you basically had to move the couch to be in front of it; otherwise, you had to watch it from an angle (from the bed or the couch). They had a chair that faced the TV, but if more than 1 person wants to watch TV, then this layout is useless. Still though, it was great, and in the end, the 2 sink thing and separate shower thing didn't bother me. This hotel is in an absolutely perfect location. We did not rent a car since we didn't need to go sightseeing outside of the area. Some people say you should rent a car, others say no need. If you don't mind spending $20.00 a day to park your car at the hotel plus the rental fees for the car, plus paying for parking many other places you go, then go ahead and rent a car. We ended up spending $100.00 total for a cab. The subway ($1.25 per person per trip or $3.50 per person all day) is 1 stop (5 minutes) away from Universal Studios - and it's not "scary" to ride. All in all, the money spent on this hotel was well worth it. We planned this trip perfectly. The Whole Ten Yards premiere was on 4/7/04 at the Graumann's Chinese Theatre (right by the hotel). We saw Bruce Willis, Matthew Perry, Natasha Henstridge, Amanda Peet, and many others. Matthew Perry even gave us his autograph. We also saw John Travolta and Uma Thurman shooting on the set of Be Cool (they were shooting in front of the Graumann's Theatre). Like I said before - PERFECT LOCATION.Pros: Many things are very very close by: The walk of fame Graumann's Chinese Theatre (where premieres are held) Kodak Theatre Numerous shops and restaurants (best eatery is Fresh Fire Kabobs - don't miss it!!!! Johnny Rocket's wasn't all that good. Metro Railway (subway) - goes to downtown LA, Universal, many other places - even within free shuttle distance of LAX (we used it for Universal only) Ryan Seacrest On-Air Cons: 1. Twist Restaurant at breakfast. We ate there on our last day - $16.00 each for the buffet (including drinks). Unfortunately, our waiter never came back to refill my OJ - he actually didn't show up again until he brought the check. He didn't care that we were there. We should have gone across the street to get donuts. 2. $40-$50 for the cab ride to/from the airport (LAX). This is true, of course, for anything since LA is 30 miles away from LAX. Burbank Airport is closer, so you might want to look into that airport.All in all, I give this 5 stars - You can't beat it. It is absolutely the best hotel I've stayed in (of course, it costs more than any other hotel I've been in). We don't stay in $60 hotels any more - they suck. I find hotels that cost $90 or more. This one is $200 a night. Well worth it. When I go back to Hollywood, I have no doubt where I'll stay. Make sure and tip the guys (bellmen, housekeeping, etc.) - It's not that much money, and they remember you! The receptionist (Gerald) that checked us in even remembered my name 3 days later - awesome job!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal and location”
Reviews.Author: canadianvacationer
Reviews.Content: Wow, We were upgraded to a suite (due to a pre booking expense charged in error) and were quite happy to find us in a large 1000 sq foot suite overlooking the pool and kodak theatre. We found the location superb you are really only 10 minutes from Universal Studios / Warner Brothers etc. Grohmans Theatre with it's movie stars hand imprinted concrete displays along hollywood blvd. is attached to the hotel via a hugh shopping complex. Great place to shop and eat. The 2 day Universal package was a great deal and you can upgrade it at Universal for a slightly higher fee. The hotel staff were friendly and responsive. The only thing I did not like is all the bell hops and car staff are always looking for tips. By the time we got to our room 4 different people handled our luggage and each expected a tip. I didn't tip them all. Watch if you wander around Hollywood blvd after dark as the strip turns seedy. During the day no problems. I will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Area, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took my step daughter and niece and their boyfriends to L.A. for a graduation gift in March, and I couldn't have selected a more perfect place to stay. Very centrally located, as well as being right in the middle of an excellent shopping area. I felt very secure, even on Hollywood Blvd. I have two young children also, and this is a place I would have felt comfortable with them as well. We didn't even make it to the hotel restaurant, there were so many good ones in the area. Rooms were very clean, service was excellent, we even saw the filming of a Britney Spears video and they got pictures with all the American Idol contestants (who were staying at the hotel.) Ryan Sechrest Live tapes here each weekday as well, and we lucked out with a movie premiere at the El Capitan theatre on Hollywood Blvd. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I really hate staying at hotels, because, I'll admit it, I'm a germophobe. Hotels always give me the creeps, because they're never REALLY clean. But this is the CLEANEST, most bright and sparkling hotel I have ever been to. The beds are very comfortable, the bathrooms are new, everything was perfect. I will definitely stay there any time I go to Hollywood. I am so glad that I came here and read all the reviews, becuse now I have found a gem.

HotelInfo.Name: Renaissance Hollywood Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1755 N Highland Ave, Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90028
